Summary Heading: Not worth the money and headache
Summary: Front desk was horrible, bad attitude, rooms are way over priced, everything is ancient, make sure you check the prices before you reserve this place. Seems they haven't changed the towels and beds here since they opened, seriously üòê!!!¬°!!!!
Room tip: Only book if it's the last resort

Summary: If you need a place to sleep by Disney this is a great spot ! 5 minute drive to the park, two beds, microwave and refrigerator to keep your stuff in while you stay and they‚Äôre very friendly during check in !

They did not have any services available.  The lobby was not even open. They used Covid as the reason the lobby and breakfast service was not available.  I inquired about this when I made the reservation but they did not give that information. Their attitude when I said something upon check in was you can cancel your room.

I don't see how this place can get more than 1 star. Without saying too much here is a summary. -No Room service (Excuse is COVID) -No Breakfast   (Excuse is COVID) -Old and faulty door lock and other equipment. -Reception service is ok.

Staff and service was horrible. The outdoor trashes were overflowing the entire weekend. Advertised breakfast, but they are no longer serving breakfast. 3 employees sat inside talking while we waited (standing outside in the rain) to check in.

Summary Heading: Hard to beat the Location for the price
Summary: If you are looking for a simple, but very close to Disney hotel that won't break the bank then look no further. This hotel was a no frills stay, but was exactly what I was looking for. It was a cheap uber ride to the park and honestly a short walk to down town Disney if you are in decent shape. All in all I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: The worst service I've ever experienced at any stay!
Summary: Check in was a mess due to multiple reservations made during differed times due to prior plans falling through.  Because I reserved off of Expedia, I was told there was nothing they could do but fill out multiple paperworks and keep coming back to re activate our room keys.    Once we checked in, our King sized bed had 2 flat pillows.  I immediately went to the office to request pillows but were told that they had none available but would leave a note requesting more pillows.  After the first night we needed an extra blanket, again, we were told they had no blankets either, but a "note will be left".  Our stay was for 6 nights, every day we were told the exact same thing, no matter how many people checked out while we were there.  They clearly had no intention on helping us.

I recently booked a three night stay at this property. Shortly after booking, they sent me a detailed email listing ALL of the services which they do not provide, even though they say they do on all of the third party booking sites! They do not offer a continental breakfast, they do not offer daily housekeeping, they do not maintain an open lobby, etc. They are continuing to use Covid as an excuse to not provide basic hospitality services. This property has no interest in providing an acceptable level of customer service, and do not deserve your patronage! Spend your hard earned dollars at another hotel that will treat you right. These guys are running a con and need to be called out as often as possible on it until they either change their ways or go out of business!

The beginning of the vacation was horrible due to the staff‚Äôs aggressive and disrespectful behavior. I would not recommend this franchise to anyone or anyone with a pet stay at this location or any Super 8 location.

I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The room was very spacious. I like that they‚Äôve gotten rid of carpet. It seemed mostly clean minus one pillow with several strands of hair. The room has a fridge and microwave. It had a coffee maker but it was broken.  It was a great location for getting to Disneyland. It took us about 20 minutes to walk to downtown Disney, 30 minutes to the Disney gates. It was a fairly easy walk with our stroller.  Bummer that they haven‚Äôt resumed breakfast.  The pool and hot tub are small. We didn‚Äôt use them but we saw lots of people doing so.  The hotel has an amazing view of the fireworks! We were on the 3rd floor and could see them from our bed with the door open. Parking was easy. We were there midweek so maybe it‚Äôs worse on weekends.

Hotel was not as expected. NO breakfast,of any kind(even though website says it's included).No restaurant on site.  No maid service. Really tired & dirty outside,but our room was clean. Microwave and fridge were nice. Parking was very close and our little car got scraped in the back.

Summary Heading: No parking, No cleaning, thinnest towels, actually rags provided
Summary: Last minute trip and stumbled upon the hotel.  Despite my hesitation, booked it anyway as we were really just going to sleep in the room.  They provide NO service to the room - we stayed four nights and had to go the office everyday to pick up more towels, toiletries and coffee supplies.  If you know a guest is going to be there four nights and no service is provided, prepare the room for the four nights!  There was no process to have dirty towels picked up.  I understand no service with a 1 or 2 night stay but with a 4 night stay, I'd expect at last one day of service.  Additionally the parking situation is not optimal - most spots are tandem and they make you tell them what time you are leaving the next days to assign you spots.  We don't decide our departure time until the

Summary Heading: Nice place and close to Disney
Summary: Nice place for the money just minutes away from Disney and not too far from Angels Stadium.   They do have a pool and a nice little hot tub (which I always seek out)   Due to Covid, they are still not serving a free breakfast‚Ä¶. But that‚Äôs ok‚Ä¶ McDonalds and Carls Jr are not too far.

Summary Heading: After 10 years was not happy with current visit
Summary: Breakfast listed on website was not provided, Guests were smoking during whole stay. The whole hotel is non smoking. Rooms were dirtier then I have ever seen. I have always sung this hotels praises for being clean. Blood on towels in bathroom. Had broken AC which was reported within Minutes of check-in while other rooms were still being cleaned prepared. Should have been moved instead was told it would be fixed it was not fixed for whole stay. Water pressure was weaker then I have ever had here and hot water took a very long time to heat up.  I stay here 2- 4 times a year for the last 10 years and have always enjoyed my stay and had any issues resolved quickly. Very disappointed in this stay which is the most expensive stay I've ever had here.

We saved literally thousands by staying here compared to the other hotels near Disneyland. It wasn‚Äôt the best, but it wasn‚Äôt the worst hotel. It‚Äôs a pretty straight forward walk to get to an entrance to the parks and took about 20 mins. The staff was very friendly. We ordered a scooter for the parks and they held onto the scooter inside their check-in area for pick up and did the same when we dropped it off when we were headed home. I would stay here again if I wanted to take another vacation to Disneyland on a tighter budget.

By far the most updated rooms I have seen in a Super 8. So close to Disneyland and the pool and hot tub were open late, which was fantastic after 13 hours at the happiest place on earth. The lobby was closed due to covid, which made some things like getting extra towels a little tedious, but overall we enjoyed our stay.

Hotel was pricey for what it has to offer. Bathroom sometimes smelled like sewer, sometimes it was cigarette smell. Fridge and microwave were pretty old. Parking was okay and no breakfast when most hotels offer that. Walking distance to gas station and ART stop.

Summary Heading: Our frequent stop when we visit Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I had another excellent experience at this hotel. Convenient to Disneyland and a nearby convention we attended this trip. Always excellent customer service! Staff are very friendly, and the rooms are just what you need for a vacation. We‚Äôre already planning our next stay.

The room was average, the pillows were a little bit dirty, poor internet connection but besides that everything was fine. Something bad, was that I payed for this stay to have breakfast but they have in the Lobby a big message, NO BREAKFAST and they didn't give me another option or anything.

Our room was infested by bed bugs, they gave us another room and luckily it was cleaned and no bed bugs?? I recommend checking the beds before sleeping on it. But other than that it was a good stay just for 1 night

The staff seemed friendly enough, but the lobby was closed. The continental breakfast wasn't being served. Some of the amenities were missing and downgraded the experience. I know some of it could be covid leftovers but other businesses weren't doing this stuff.

I booked two rooms just a few days before our scheduled arrival so, jit was kind of last minute and I was a little worried about what this property was really going to be like.. I have never left a review for a hotel/motel before, but, I think I'm a pretty average person with no axe to grind who can give you some honest insight if you're considering staying at this property.  ‚Ä¢  I was very pleased to find the rooms were very, very clean and neat.   ‚Ä¢  The furnishings were adequate; furniture was fairly modern and  I liked that there isn't any carpet and that there were no bedspreads as those things get so dirty and seem to be rarely cleaned in most hotels ‚Ä¢  I found the staff friendly, courteous and efficient.  There was a hiccup with the payment in which they charged my

Summary Heading: Avoid at All Cost - The Most Unfriendly Place in the World
Summary: You are driving and looking for a convenient motel near Disneyland.  There are many options.  Do not make this motel your option.  They advertise on their main website as well as many hotel bookings sites various amenities - some basic amenities - that they simply do not provide.  After you book, you receive an e-mail from the hotel with various fine print 1) No breakfast, 2) no in-room coffee, 3) lobby is closed, 4) must wear masks, etc.  You have the option to cancel provided you can get through to the booking site (I tried multiple times unsuccessfully) but the booking site needs confirmation from the hotel before you can be assured of cancellation and getting your money back and various booking websites have their own policies - BEWARE.  I asked mngmt why after 2 years, had

Summary Heading: It's a Motel - Not a Fancy Hotel
Summary: If you're wanting a fancy hotel, don't stay here. If you're wanting a comfortable place to sleep and unwind in preparation for your Disney park days (or Knotts Berry Farm, I won't judge you), this is an excellent place. Conveniently located and comfortable beds. Has a mini fridge and microwave in the room which have been missing in many of the fancier locations I've been staying in recently. That was a huge plus! Staff were friendly and helpful.

This motel was absolutely disgusting. Our room was infested with cockroaches and we were unable to sleep as a result of this. There is also no breakfast and no housekeeping. This place was a joke. Would‚Äôve rather slept in the car.

Summary Heading: I would‚Äôve been better sleeping in my car
Summary: I just wanted to take a trip with my family to Disneyland. And this was the most disgusting room I‚Äôve ever said eyes on. You should really evaluate reevaluate your staff! And to think that I book this through Wyndham and they said this was the only thing that was available. I hold all of you guys accountable for the property that you placed me and my kids at!

I‚Äôm a single mother who traveled with teen daughters and very happy with our stay at this property. I felt safe, the property was clean, affordable and conveniently close to Disneyland. Only thing I wished they had a continental breakfast in to go bags, but was closed due to COVID. Overall experience was great and will definitely return. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Two Day Stay for Disney Trip
Summary: The lovlcation was close to Disneyland, our destination. The hotel was easonably priced, not gouging; the room was clean and sizable, plenty of walking space. The employees were very helpful and accommodating with a pleasant attitude.

Rooms were large, with ac units and none carpeted floors. Other gusts were respectful and quiet at night. Perfect place to crash with kids for theme park visits. Close to Disney, with easy access to parking garage.

Such a fantastic location, rooms were clean, great area. Would stay here again next time I come for Disneyland! The beds were very comfortable, I slept fantastic each night. Great water pressure in the showers. Nice safe walk to the park.

Was a great place and would recommend. Good people. Pool was open. Sadly, chose this place based on them having a comp breakfast, but when we got there was told it was not being served. Not good when all documentation says is it being served and you choose the location over others because of the offered amenity. Otherwise 5/5.

We booked this hotel for four nights. The room was nice and clean, and we thought it would be a great trip. However, the next day, we went to Disneyland. When we came back, we noticed that the room had not been serviced. When I called the front desk to inquire, I was told that they do not offer maid service on stay overs. WTH? We had to get sheets due to a sick child and when I told them that it was a little messed up not to offer maid service for stay overs and the reception clerk told me, "Well, we tell you that in the email so you need to just read your email again." I did not appreciate the sarcasm especially since I was not sent an email. We had to take our own trash out (we had a baby with us) and we had to get fresh towels each night. I would not recommend this hotel if

If your going to Disneyland...take an "ice chest" filled with unopened & sealed: water & snacks...Food & beverages at Disneyland is ridiculously expensive and their food app SUCKS big time. Staff is friendly, helpful & professional...

Summary Heading: Decent value,  with some small issues
Summary: For the price, it's fine, especially near Disney. The room is big, and its location is great. Bed was comfy.   The hardwood floors is filthy, though you can't see it. Do not do pushups!  The other issue is the street noise, though it's probably inescapable for most of these motels in town.

Summary Heading: Worst experience ever (Tv didn‚Äôt work and had to ask for new one and pillows were awful)
Summary: I would NOT recommend this place to my own worst enemy, we had a tv that didn‚Äôt work and we had to ask for a whole new tv and our pillows were flat as all get out. It was not very good at all. Will not be staying here ever again.

Summary Heading: Best place to rest after parks
Summary: Slept here after the days at the park. Good value and good location. Always been a solid place, been staying here while visiting Disneyland for about 8 years.   The rest of this is just to fill in the "200 characters"

Cleanliness and distancing are very important during these times and super 8 employees did a very good job at that.  We‚Äôve stayed at this site for many years so that‚Äôs why we choose super 8 for our stay during the pandemic..  they have your family in mind

Great lil hotel clean comfy rooms beds n pillows new! Short 20 minute walk to Disneyland/California adventure parks downtown Disney! Pool n jacuzzi clean n up to standards! Great view of nightly fireworks! Easy access on and off I-5 am-pm gas station 1/2 a block walk

Difficult to access. Only simple access in coming from the North off of Interstate 5. Was under construction. Noisy,  walls are paper thin, construction is shotty (POOR). Parking is awful. Pool is a joke.

...but bring your own pillow, mattress pad, blanket and full size toiletries. You can ask for extra but why should you have to?  Pillow was accent size and mattress felt like Sleeping on cardboard but only endured four hours  before getting up and heading to the park.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: I decided to stay here since the hotel is not too far from Disneyland. The staff is very warm and welcoming, although it was quite late at night when I checked-in at the hotel. What surprised me is, even though the hotel looks a bit old, they have an elevator which is very helpful for me. Overall, it was a pleasant one night stay.

We stayed over Christmas for two nights.  Nothing over the top, but clean and comfortable.  The staff was very courteous and helpful and the location is great, very close to Disney and the price makes it even better.  We would definitely stay here and recommend other to.

Room was average. Seemed to be doing some construction to a room next to us. We had to call at 9pm to ask when they would be finished for the night. Front desk seemed unaware they were still there. Don't think we will stay here again!

Stayed here for our Disneyland trip in December. Excellent location! Literally right outside of the Disney parking garage. It is not a fancy hotel, but it is clean & felt safe. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean. It does need some upgrades & you can hear the traffic at night. Breakfast is basically cereal. But if you just want an affordable place to sleep for your Disney trip, this is a great choice. It was half the cost of other hotels & we are happy we saved money & stayed here.

Great clean room.  Easy access.  Easy checking in.    Easy checking out.  Nice pool.  Fabulous breakfast.    Easy to use points for room.  Great contact information and maps.  It‚Äôs very close to Disneyland.   Fabulous stay.

This was to date the worst hotel experience I have every had. Long story short we saw a bed bug crawl from the side of the bed around midnight near my infant daughter. We were awake bed sheets turned down and pillows on either side of her. When I noticed some quick movement as the lights were on. I took the entire pillow to the front desk. They offered another room and I viewed it but it did not have a tub so we passed as we have small children. We took the time to pack up making sure to quickly  shake everything as the thought of a hitchhiking bug would ruin the holidays. We went in to process the refund. A women was checking in and my sister told her that we were checking out same night because of bed bugs and to make sure to check the beds. We were in the parking lot looking

We had a great time staying at the Super 8. I would only warn that if you are at the hotel during the fireworks, prepare yourself. It get's loud. Room was comfy and clean though, so I would definitely stay again.

Super 8, a 20-minute walk to Disney. Clean rooms, decent breakfast. As economy hotels go, this one is nice. Breakfast service needs help, but room was comfortable and quiet. Felt safe being there and walking to property at night.

It s located in an awesome location near Disneyland we walked to Disneyland it was a fun walk walking through the beautiful garden the hotel was nice just wish there was a sofa bed in it and wish there were eggs and yogurt on menu and some bananas

We did a short Disney visor after a cruise.   The hotel was vert close to Disneyland about 20 minutes walk. Fireworks were visible from the hotel. Nice view. No need to go back to Disneyland to view fireworks.

The rooms were adequate, but bare minimum. 2 lumpy pillows, no extra blankets, thin bathroom towels, no hand towel, etc.  The reason we picked this hotel was because of its proximity to Disneyland.  However, unlike other hotels in the area, this one did not allow us to leave our vehicle parked at the hotel while we were at Disneyland.  The car had to be gone from the lot before noon, so we still had to drive and park at Disneyland.  Next time I will be choosing a nicer hotel a few miles away... especially if I have to pay to park either way.

Very close to Disneyland entry. 15 minute nice walk up to the Multi Story Car Parks where a shuttle train takes you up to the entry points. Comfortable rooms nice breakfast room and beware the Coffee in the USA is terrible

This was a good experience. The room was spotless and had been recently remodeled, beds and pillows were comfortable. This is an older hotel and it shows somewhat on the outside but our room was delightful. The only complaints were that dining nearby is not available, there is no shuttle service, Disneyland is technically very close by but the entrance is quite a walk back and forth, and the breakfast is seriously lacking from any other Super 8 I have stayed at in the last few years.  One last thing, parking is free here but there are not nearly enough spaces, just something to be aware of.  Location is something that cannot be corrected by the hotel but the lack of a shuttle and the breakfast is something they can address should they choose but if you are looking for an

We had a good experience with this hotel. The price was good and close to Disneyland. Beds were much softer than I expected which was a relief because I can not sleep on a hard bed. Will stay here again next time we visit Disneyland.

Very clean, within walking distance to the Disneyland parks, and very reasonably priced. We didn‚Äôt try the breakfast but I was very pleased with our rooms overall. Check in and check out was breeze. We will definitely be staying here again in the near future.

This seemed like a nice property on the internet.  Don't be fooled.  Old, tired, run down.  It is not close to Disneyland in reality - needed an Uber to get there.  Breakfast is a joke. The clerk who checked us in was about as helpful as a rock.

Summary Heading: Very affordable place for Disneyland visitors
Summary: In spite of being next to I-5 and Disneyland Drive we didn't experience noise of traffic. The staff in the reception very helpful, informative. They helped us with local services, with facilities on site, no matter how late it was. It is a very affordable place for Disneyland visitors, you can get there the tickets, you can walk to the park. Room cleaning service - very efficient. Coffee maker in the room. It can be stressful to get there as Google maps is showing wrong directions. Breakfast contents - only very sweet items. Pool is between car park and motorway - not very inviting location.

This place is a good place stay because it's just down the street from Disney, that's the only reason. The beds were hard, towels were scratchy and hard too, they only provide shampoo, no conditioner.Pool was decent, but not very clean. If you're just popping in and out and not staying a long time inside the room then it's okay I guess. Staff was nice they just need to update the rooms and all that.

My stay was good except breakfast. Breakfast needs to be worked on for better quality. There was no protein just bread/porridge.   Also they need to list that an extra sofa/bed is not part of the hotel booking.

Clean updated rooms. Nice staff. Quiet with the exception of when Disneyland was doing the fireworks. Comfortable beds. Convenient location the Disneyland Mickey & Friends parking structure. Quick check in and check out.

We recently stayed at your location. We‚Äôve stayed numerous times before. This is the first time we‚Äôve had a terrible experience. First we asked for more towels and we had to walk to get them. This is the only hotel location that has made us do this. (We come to Disneyland a lot being that we‚Äôre passholders). Second, our keys(both of them) didn‚Äôt work when we returned on Saturday night just after midnite. (Of course, the office is closed with a sign on the door because the hotel was sold out. We had to wake our daughter to let us in. Lastly, and the worst part of all, we had cockroaches in our room. My husband caught one and took it to show them in the lobby. Where they told him it would be noted and we were supposed to get a call back from management. But as of today we have

i found a roach in my room gross right.door was broken from bathroom family member kept having to open from the other side, Don't ask the room cleaners for anything they are so rude and not willing to help i happen to drop some sodas on floor on accident ask the room cleaner for mop which i was gonna clean up the mess not her  she stated hotel policy doesn't allow them to have mops which i found odd being that the room was wooden floor ask her how does she mop floor stated she doesn't she just sweeps which is disgusting. then tells me im off clock not suppose to be working all i can give you is towels , towels are small ask for more got mad had to go buy mop myself. walk to Disney was really far. you can catch bus though which drops you off by gas station. called management for

This motel was a decent price with a decent  walking distance to Disneyland.  There is a small pool outside. The included breakfast consisted of mostly donuts and a few breakfast drinks. This was acceptable. The glass door shower leaked water a bit. The shower floor was not cleaned properly. When  I crouched down and my leg touched the floor I got dirtier than when I went it. I had black streak marks on my leg from the shower floor.

just minutes from disneyland for affordable price is something could not be bad. the hotel itself classified as budget but maintained pretty good. the breakfast is sufficient but the area is too small and crowded.

Clean rooms, pretty well maintained. It is important to note that although it is said and even presented as if it is within walking distance to Disneyland, it is not quite so. If you are with children, consider that walking from the hotel to the park is long and quite tiring, in addition to the exhausting day in Disneyland. So I wouldn't recommend planning it as a hotel within walking distance. One of the things that bothers me and annoys me is the weak internet - why? What makes it so difficult for guests to have a working Internet in 2019? Any hotel that doesn't provide it will be downgraded, at least mine.

Summary Heading: Good room, dated property, breakfast is poor.
Summary: The uncarpeted room was good. The location to Disneyland was a pleasant 20 minute city walk. The property on the whole is older and needs to be freshened up. The breakfast selection and staff attention to stocking the menu is very poor.

I had issues when I booked the hotel so I had to call and get some answers. Well, the guy picking up the phone was giving me a lot of attitude. I had to keep calling never getting a straight answer. Anyway, I'm giving 3 stars because when I got there the guy had no attitude, the stay was nothing special. There was a roach in the room, it's a 20 mnt walk from disneyland, breakfast was just all kinds of breads and the parking was bad. Also, guest being super loud and you can hear everything as if you are in the same room or outside. Room was clean, and had no funky smell.

Overall it was all a very nice experience. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, housekeeping was very nice. Didn't have breakfast, so I can't comment on that. I would most definitely stay here again. The only Complain I have is the parking. It's horrible. On top of that, We had two cars and they only allow 1 car per reservation, so we had to figure it out ourselves and ended up parking one of the cars in a neighborhood and then walked all the way back to the hotel.

Although the rooms are average, the service is exceptional. Wonderful place today stay near Disneyland. Disney fireworks every night around 9:30pm. Handy location near Target new grcery store for last minute needs.

Needs better cleaning of the rooms! Continental breakfast was not great!  Closeness to Disneyland is good..right behind parking garage..not too bad of a walk although we drove and parked. There is a am/pm mart close for snacks!

Great staff, great room, super close to Disneyland, very comfortable beds and pillows, it was just a really wonderful place to stay.  Great value as well, could not beat the room rates and the room was really nice.  Could walk to Disneyland, though might want to take a bus or park in the Disney garage just down the street if you little ones or think you might not like the 15 min walk after all day on your feet at the park.  I will definitely stay here next time I go to Disneyland. :)

While this is an inexpensive Disneyland area hotel, do NOT stay here if you have more than one vehicle, want more than one pillow, or have any expectation at being treated decently by the staff. We were told by the front desk staff that they did not have time to worry about our problems, as they had other more important things to worry about. There was not handicap accessible parking available, due to the hotel allowing multiple passenger vans to park there. The breakfast options were instant oatmeal, donuts, or cereal. The room itself was fine, although be careful of the beds, they move with the slightest bump.

Summary Heading: Great property, but no breakfast options and limited parking
Summary: 1st off, only one car is allowed to park per reservation which can be inconvenient. I am allergic to dairy and gluten, so there wasn't much for me to eat at breakfast. The only thing I had was a bowl of dry frosted flakes that I hoped were okay to eat. Other than those two things, checking in and checking out was very easy, my room was very clean, and its about a 20 minute walk to downtown disney.

Tucked back right down behind the mega parking garage of Disneyland is the old school, Super 8.  On paper it seems really close but it‚Äôs quite a haul to the resort.  Very limited parking and very loud. Freeway is right behind a fence and Disneyland Drive in front.  It‚Äôs loud and cramped.  The great takeaways are the extreme friendliness of every staff member I met and the complimentary breakfast was good too. The breakfast area is very cramped for all the people that squeeze in.  It‚Äôs a get in, eat and get out proposition.  The room itself was run down.  Bed, pillows, towels, furniture; all of it.  This is what you expect from the name but not even for $90 discount rate.  I‚Äôd have much rather paid another $50 or so and be on Harbor and get a good nights sleep and a nice shower.

We have stayed at this super 8 many times. The entire staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. The rooms are very clean and have everything you need for your stay. The staff continually updates and cleans the property.

Summary Heading: Our stay at super eight was really really great
Summary: Our stay at super eight was really really great!   We stayed for an incredible three weeks. I was fortunate to get a wheelchair accessible room that accommodated my power chair. I was given a shower stall and shower chair. The room had new ‚Äúwood‚Äù flooring.  The air-conditioner was loud but effective in keeping the room at a comfortable temperature and blocking out the sounds of outside. The microwave was small that did the trick. The refrigerator was large and was able to keep our water bottles frozen. The beds were typical hotel beds. The pillows definitely were lacking but I was able to get two extra pillows which helped. We brought her own towels because we saw that the hotel towels were small and scratchy. Boy were they ever.   The staff was incredibly helpful and kind. We

Family with 4 year old had a pleasant stay. Service was great. Early check-in helped us with child. It's 20 minutes walk to Disneyland. Wonderful trip to Disneyland was supported with such a relaxing place

Summary Heading: Not as close as you think
Summary: Disneyland wasnt as close as led to believe its abt a 15-20 minute walk. Not enough parking. Clean room. Right along side of freeway off ramp so can be noisy. But reasonably priced. Would stay again..

Summary Heading: Dried Blood on the Sheets and Black Mold in the Shower
Summary: We've been staying at the Days Inn, a touch closer to Disneyland than the Super 8.  When I remembered I had a points card with the Wyndham I decided to book with the Super 8.  When we came back to the room in the evening after the day at Disneyland we got ready for bed and when we went to sleep I kept seeing dark spots all over my bed, when I turned on the lights there was BLOOD SPOTS all over the sheets and my daughter's bed had BLACK HAIR on her sheets and she's a blonde.  I called the night manager and he just brought me clean sheets and blankets and had us make our own beds.  No even an apology!  What happen to the old customer service? I surely wouldn't let a guest remake beds due to my staff's shortcomings!  The shower was full of BLACK MOLD which just added to the

This hotel is listed as a "2 Star" hotel. But, behaves and feels inside the rooms more like a 3.5-star hotel. Prices are competitive.  The ONLY thing we didn't like (and there have been many other reviewers say the same thing) were the thin, scratchy towels and the flat, lumpy pillows. Believe those reviews about the towels and pillows! They are true! But, overall, especially for the money, this is a great place to stay!

I was disappointed by the high noise outside of our room. Ye, I know, most people staying at this hotel are here to visit Disneyland, and there are many families with children, and they get up early to go to Disney, and they are excited. But other guests may want to sleep in and go to Disney later. Too noisy early in the morning. Continental Breakfast had few items, and some items, when gone, they were not replaced.

Summary Heading: Clean appearance, but odor we could not take
Summary: The property was ok. The odor in the room upon entry was unbearable. We immediately returned to the front desk and checked out. The representative was mildly apologetic, but did not hesitate to process the refund. The property seemed promising.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for 115 a night after taxes
Summary: 2 queen beds, a smal fridge and a microwave, this hotel is like 1 minute from Disneyland on car and like 20 minutes walking, and I think it‚Äôs the cheapest you can find, at least was the cheapest that I found.

OK for a quick Disney trip.  Rooms have recently been been remodeled and are looking a little bit better than they used to. Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt say the same for the towels: they are small,thin and scratchy (basically very cheap towels). The breakfast could use some work as well (both in options of food provided and the time breakfast is served).

Summary Heading: Don‚Äôt stay here! Fraud charges on your card!
Summary: Check in was no good, the front desk personnel was not helpful and he took my credit card and put it on a flat machine that was use 20 years ago and made a copy of my credit card! I told him that form of taking payment causes fraud and I do not like that and I ask him if they have computer machines with a chip or to slide my card for taking payments and he said no! He then said; this is the way we take payments and later we take the paper and throw it away per the manager. I told him I was very worry that someone will steal my credit card that way! Today, January 15th,2019 my Chase Bank called me to notify that my credit card has been used 6 times from an IP address that matches the address of the Super 8 hotel and they will investigate that and they blocked all transactions

Overall, I am very satisfied with my stay. Everything went as planned. Check in and check out process went smoothly, staff was nice and helpful. Breakfast was decent. Turns out we ended up staying for an extra day. I would def√≠netely come back.

Its a 15 mins walk to Disneyland.   It's fine but i wish a shuttle is provided especially going back to the hotel...also its just too bad that i cant leave my car in the parking lot when i checked out and have one more day ar Disneyland..

The combination of physical plant, professional staff, location (Disneyland across the street), amenities, and the price make for an excellent value!  Each and every time I visit this area, I stay here.

A great place to stay. Great staff. Very  friendly and accommodative. Well maintained and clean property inside and out. Quiet. Parking gets a little congested when they are very busy but overall a great place to stay.

If I could give no stars I would! AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST! The customer service by their management is AWFUL! I made reservations 1 week prior to our visit on hotels.com was suppose to pay at the hotel at check in. Instead I was charged 2 days before check in unauthorized! I mentioned this when we went to check in and was rudely cut off and told by a Manager (EE) that we were gonna pay anyways I then talking with my hands like normal stuck my finger towards the ceiling saying hold on (politely) and rudely got lashed out ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt stick your finger in my face and point at me‚Äù I corrected him that I indeed did not point at him and basically was called a liar he asked if we were staying or going. I‚Äôm dumbfounded by this point and look down at his name badge. I was reading reviews

This is the 2nd time  I have stayed here. The location is great,but if you have street level room on Disneyland Dr it can affect your sleep. Rooms are clean. Breakfast could have more variety but for $80 a night within walking distance to Disney, I just grab a muffin at corner gas station.I'll stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice, clean and close to Disneyland!
Summary: I am a local resident of Disneyland, and when I want to take a quick getaway/staycation at Mickey's House, this is my usual spot.  Its always clean, rooms don't smell and the room is nice and simply decorated.

Our stay here was very pleasant. Nice and clean hotel that I would stay at again. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to others. Rooms were very spacious. Breakfast was okay, better than some other hotels I've stayed at.

This place is a perfect location to Disneyland. The price and value are perfect! Friendly staff and CLEAN! The look is very modern in the rooms and wood floors keep the feel newer and clean. The complimentary breakfast is held in a nice big room and parking is monitored 24/7

Family stayed for our trip to Disneyland. I was very impressed with the room and friendly staff. Breakfast was the only lacking piece, but other than that perfect for the price and a family of four....

Summary Heading: Basic, comfortable and a great location
Summary: Great location for Disneyland guests. This is a very basic hotel but it was clean and quiet. Breakfast was not as good as many other hotels in the area. Very Carb heavy and cheap feeling but its better than nothing.

The room had cockroaches. The plumbing was exposed and we had to close a broken vent with the ironing board. Everything was unplugged so when we entered the room at night it was pitch black. Not a very safe thing for two young women

Summary Heading: Clean and pleasant, friendly and professional staff, great value.
Summary: I recently drove from Oakland, CA to Anaheim for a family wedding event. That's a long drive through some traffic, and I arrived in LA tired and hurried to get to the event. I was facing the daunting task of a return-drive the following morning. The front desk staff at Super8 were professional, kind, and helpful. They did all they could to accommodate my needs, and they made a tough travel day significantly easier. This motel is not fancy; it's an affordable (for Anaheim) base camp where you can get a few hours' sleep and a bagel before heading to Disneyland (or, in my case, a wedding). It's not luxurious. But it's clean, convenient, and hospitable. Most important, the staff are humane and efficient. I'm grateful for their kind assistance to me.

Wonderful friendly helpful staff.  Clean rooms, comfy beds, spacious.  Microwave & Mini Fridge, no coffee maker, free WIFI, Free Parking, Free breakfast.  Get to breakfast early for better options and less people.  Ice Machines and Soda Machines and snack vending machines on property

This is a convenient location to stay at for a Disneyland trip. Is near and is comfortable. We arrived a day before and we saw the fireworks from here! The pool was a nice temperature, it's small but since pretty much everyone was out it wasn't crowded.

Good value for money.  A budget priced yet comfortable and convenient base to visit Disneyland from in LA.  Would stay there again but also pick a hotel in Hollywood for touring that end of LA due to transport issues in LA.

Summary Heading: A hidden gem in walking distance to the happiest place on earth!
Summary: Everything about our stay at Super 8 was perfect. It's a beautiful oasis off I-5 with the friendliest staff, the rooms were immaculate and well thought out, and there is a convenience store 1 minute walking distance away with anything you might have forgot at home. Parking can be a matter of timing but they have a system that gets everyone situated when the crowds come back from Disneyland. The staff were very accommodating, even letting us use the breakfast room for my daughter's 2nd birthday party! At the end of each day there, coming

Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Decent Breakfast. Great coffee. Close to Disneyland Micky and Friends parking. Freeway access=fair. Personnel are friendly and accommodating. Would stay again if we are in the area.

Summary Heading: Decent Place for a Disney stay
Summary: The hotel was clean and had recently been updated. Parking was free, which is a highlight for the Disneyland area. Wifi was also free and I had no issues with it being slow. Breakfast was included but was a bit lacking, not too many choices.  The walk to Disneyland is pretty long unless you take a tram from the Mickey parking structure.   If you don't mind taking an uber this is a very affordable option for a Disneyland stay.

Summary Heading: 2nd best bed EVER (no hotel bed is ever as good as home!)!
Summary: Great location, nice continental breakfast, SUPER comfy beds and pillows, extra bonus of seeing Disneyland fireworks without have to pay for it!  We booked through Priceline and got a great price.  If you're planning to visit Disneyland on vacation, THIS hotel is close and comfy.

OK this is not some random 4 star hotel that you expect to be perfect--and this type of place usually is not . But this one had a great staff 6-21-18 on duty.  That bathroom was absolutely spotless.  And this didn't appear to be anything brand new . It had lots of cleanings behind it.They even take the drain plug out and put the old fashioned paper seal on the toilet. No bad smells.  NO BUGS.  No built up grime in the corners.  It had a Pinesol smell which kind of made me laugh but that went away quickly.We encountered four different people who work there and everyone was friendly and helpful.  There is a little noise here due to location but we did not have trouble sleeping .  Tired from Disney!

My friends and I stay at Super 8 for a 4 day trip to Disneyland. The Breakfast is donuts, cereal, frozen waffles, fruit, toast, coffee, juice or tea. I have stayed at this hotel a few time and every time the staff has been very nice and helpful. Bring your own pillow, the pillows are not the best. The people who gave bad reviews about the breakfast, should go pay for breakfast. For a free breakfast, it was not that bad.

Summary Heading: GREAT LOCATION AND GREAT UPDATED ACCOMMODATIONS
Summary: From location to the updated accommodations, from great check-in staff to level of helpfulness of staff to reasonable prices, choose this Super 8.  This can best be summed up as a great value.  You will not be disappointed.

Location was decent. We walked to the parking structure and hopped on the tram to Disneyland. It took us about 15 minutes to get to the tram.  Breakfast was alright, but no protien options at all. They also only serve breakfast from. 7-9 which isn't great if you're trying to make rope drop at Disneyland. The cleanliness was alright. Not disgusting, but not White glove clean. If you're looking for value and a good location, this is the place. I would stay here again.

If you dont want  to eat breakfast before your visit to Disney and you dont need to use the internet and dont mind winging up with lizards in your room you'll be ok. If you need a refund because of  a death it wont happen

Summary Heading: Repeat Super 8 Guest- at both Disneyland locations
Summary: Bed was very comfy, room was spacious. Neighbors in next room were noisy, but hotel staff responded to my call. Parking is tight, so get there early or walk to the parks. They are strict about the one vehicle per reservation rule, and you see the parking lot so you know why. No luxury in bathroom as far as towels/conveniences, but they do the job- it's not a spa hotel. For the price and proximity to the park, one can not complain. Staff at check in was very friendly, and check out was done in 45 seconds.

Summary Heading: Good place to sleep, close to parking
Summary: I've stayed here a couple of times and it is clean and relatively quiet.  They have redone the rooms and the bathrooms and they are very nice.  There is a microwave and fridge in each room.  The parking lot gets full at night but they have someone who helps to stack the cars so you don't have an issue leaving when you want. When you exit, you can go straight into the Mickey and Friends parking structure.  Breakfast is mostly cereal, donuts, and Eggo waffles, but at least it is something to start your day.  Staff is very friendly too.

I pretty much got what I was expecting. The room was clean, the staff was polite, and the bed was comfortable. Taking an Uber from the hotel to Disneyland was relatively easy.   I've stayed at some terrible hotels in Anaheim near the park, but this was one of the nice ones.

Room price was most affordable in the area, was only about a 20-30 minute walk to Disneyland parks, They were very accommodating with parking, Room was fine and free breakfast was a bonus (Just basic stuff, but hey, free is free!)

The room was very nice! We had no issues at all. The bed was a little on the  hard side and that made it difficult to sleep. There was always parking. The price was great and the distance to Disneyland was awesome. We‚Äôd absolutely stay here again.

The room we had was quiet and the beds were comfortable. Nothing spectacular about the room but there is a fridge, microwave, and window unit air conditioning. We stayed when it wasn‚Äôt hot, turned the air down to 60 degrees and the room probably felt like 72 degrees. The shower curtain was frayed and the plugs are few plus are the type that your chargers fall out of the wall. Never had an issue with WiFi.   Breakfast only consists of Eggo Waffles, donuts, sometimes apple juice and orange juice, cereal, apples, oatmeal, sometimes yogurt, and bread. There are only 2 toasters and they are worn and need to be replaced.  Yes you can walk to Disneyland from the hotel. It takes about 20 minutes. You can catch the tram at Mickey and friends to cut off some of the walk.  Free parking  I

When we reserved our rooms for this property, we thought this was a Wyndham rewards property. However we were told by front desk personnel that this hotel does not honor quotes or reservations made by Wyndham rewards. The only nights that were honored were the free nights that were earned through Wyndham rewards. When it came to any extra nights Wyndham rewards had quoted as one price and the management charged us a higher rate. They stated that they could not honor wyndham's quotes because they were not part of their chain.

Price was pretty good for one night. Staff was friendly. Only issues I had was there was this certain stench in the room when we first walked in. I had to air it out for an hour and it still smelled. And the breakfast options is quick and easy but lacking.

The hotel is not fancy at all. The rooms and bathroom are old. The cleaning is not the best but is very close to Disneyland. The price is good and to spend one night is ok. Is very close to all Disneyland area and Disney town.

We checked into the room we walked into the room and got a funny smell. Upon inspecting the room I found a rotten grape, candy, and grey hairs behind my bed. I contacted the front desk regarding this issue and they said they can‚Äôt do anything since the Manager doesn‚Äôt work weekends.

Found this hotel again! I stayed here 33 years ago! Still a great a great family place to stay clean quiet comfortable and excellent view for watching the fireworks from Disneyland! Thank you look forward to staying again! Updating heaters and air conditioners during our stay! Met the owner a very pleasant man!

Summary Heading: I thought it was a great value given it is under $100 per...
Summary: I thought it was a great value given it is under $100 per night. However, I would love to see improvement in the bathroom area specifically. I don't think thr bathtub is appropriate and instead would like to have showers with glass walls.
Ugly from the outside but nice from the inside, not comfy beds. Coffe and donuts kind of breakfast. But great for the price. Can‚Äôt have all.

Summary Heading: Super 8 lived up to its name. Everything about our...
Summary: Super 8 lived up to its name. Everything about our experience was super and exceeded an 8 rating. I would stay here again and again!

This hotel is not for someone looking for awesome amenities or a place that goes above and beyond, but it is a place that provides you with exactly what you need and at a price and location you can‚Äôt complain about. The front office staff was helpful and I do not have anything negative to say.

Summary Heading: A couple doors down they were smoking pot and you would get...
Summary: A couple doors down they were smoking pot and you would get a contact high just walking out the door. Frint desk said there was nothing they could do. It is California...still will not stay there again

I booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 2 nights, they were clean and have confy beds. The staff was helpful and friendly. We had an issue with our key, but they solved it quickly. Over all it was good. The only complaint I have is that the room does't have carpet, which makes sense for cleaning (It was really clean), but at 2 in the morning I was able to hear steps from the room above us. The carpet would solve that problem, but other than that is is good. it is close to Disneyland, which was very important for us.

Summary Heading: Overall very pleased with the value. Room was nice. No...
Summary: Overall very pleased with the value. Room was nice. No carpet, which felt cleaner but we did have to request to have our room mopped as our feet were already black after five minutes. After that it was fine but I think the lack of carpet also made it so that the people in rooms above were verrrry noisy. Really close fireworks at night during our stay, not sure if this is all the time but it was pretty frustrating with little kids trying to sleep. Good breakfast but no protein options.

This is located right up the street from Disneyland and is ready to walk to and from when visiting. It's not fancy, the rooms are set up so that you enter each room from the outside (not set up to enter a building and access from there). There is an elevator if you are on the second story. It comes with a daily breakfast but the choices are slim and not regularly refilled. The breakfast room is small and hard to get what you want without bumping into others. Rooms are good, my only complaint is that the floors (which are laminate wood) are swept but never mopped. I highly recommend wearing slippers or shoes as your feet will be black walking around barefoot. I'd ask for it to be mopped.

This motel was fine for my purposes. It was basic and relatively close to Disneyland. The room was clean and the towels and linens were fine. The staff was friendly and attentive. The breakfast was the typical coffee, cereal, fruit, and rolls. No hot food. I would recommend this property.

Summary Heading: Well it is close to Disneyland
Summary: We picked this hotel just for location and price.  We had family staying there and we requested a room by theirs.  Had we known the room given to us would not have a working fridge, a broken toilet roll holder that would fall off and make a loud noise, it would be smaller and out dated and be on the noisy street we would have just let them pick a room for us.  The people above us got in around 2 am and we heard every movement they made.  Making it very hard to sleep.  We had stayed here before, maybe it was because we saw the other rooms, so we were aware that our room had not made the re-furbished list.  Maybe it's not even a room they rent out, but they did place us by our family, which we did ask for.  Has we known the condition I am sure another room would have been better.

Very nice hotel.  Very good value.  Within a 20 - 25 minute walk of Disneyland.  Would have liked to have had the option of a shuttle to be able to access especially at night when you are tired and would just like a ride back.  No shuttle service offered or available.  Beds were comfy and room very clean.  Breakfast was definitely a continental breakfast and no special extras.

From the moment we arrived the check in was smooth and flawless. Staff service for room location and parking was great. Room services was spot on. Highly recommend this for you Disneyland stay. The price was unbeatable.

Ask for extra pillows as soon as you check in, they will ‚Äúrun out‚Äù if you ask late in the day. Even if you have previously asked they will not bring them to you when they‚Äôre available. My husband and I checked the first night and were told they had none. Then we asked the next day and they told us they‚Äôd been given out to others even though we had already asked. The staff was not very helpful at the front desk. But the cleaning crew was kind and gave us extra pillows on our very last day. This place was nice other than the lack of willingness to help me get some damn pillows. Also they took nearly 2 weeks to refund my credit card when I had been double charged. So that was another headache.
Clean, inexpensive. But dont count on much of a breakfast. Ran out of milk, apples were old, toaster waffles with tiny plates they barely fit on, no peanut butter!

I was a little nervous booking at a super 8, but I was pleasantly surprised. The beds were very comfy, the bathrooms were nice, and it was nice to be so close to the Disneyland parks. 2 min drive, and 20 min walk. I will stay here next time I come. The breakfast was not great. Just cereal, toast, juice, and milk. We had fun swimming in the pool, but it was too cold.

The rooms look clean at first glance but the floors were filthy. When we noticed all of our feet were black from the floors we wiped the ground with a wet paper towel it turned black also. Very gross. The donuts at breakfast were good though. The walk to disneyland was a little further than anticipated, about 30 minutes.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, for Disney on a budget!
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights a few days ago. I was a little leery,  because of some of the reviews, and I am a little bit of a hotel snob. I was pleasantly surprised! It was clean, beds were very comfortable, great pillows. Bring conditioner, they only had shampoo and soap. Breakfast was good if you like donuts! They were from a bakery. I am not a huge breakfast eater, so this did not bother me. It is under a mile walk to Disney‚Äôs CA Adventure. We took the monorail into Disneyland, which cut off a huge chunk of walking. It‚Äôs probably .6 mile if you take the monorail, and avoid walking through Downtown Disney. There are lots of restaurants a few blocks away, and an ampm on the corner. You can no longer take the mickey and friends tram, so you have to pay for parking at Disney, take a

Cheap rooms for a cheap price. Not the best hotel I have ever stayed in but for the price it was what I expected. The room was your standard set up. The decor was really dated. The TV in my room was broken. Great location if for Disneyland. Overall it was a decent place to stay for the night.
we where two people travelling for business, everything was very well managed. Good services and welcoming, very nice walk from there to the convention center. We'll book again in the future.

The room was okay- lamps were not plugged in- which was frustrating.  As well as there was cleaner on the toilet seat- not just a little bit; the entire seat had cleaner on it- my husband had to clean the seat before being able to use the restroom. Also the breakfast was not kept up- there as no coffee at the time were visited, and the only thing left was cereal and donuts.

The hotel was in a great location at a good price.  The parking lot was extremely small and hard to park in when it was full.  The bathroom area was nice with a counter outside of the shower/toilet area.  Our first night there we were woken up by a rodent in the wall or ceiling.  We were on the top floor, but something was scratching and chewing for a long time.  We did not sleep much at all.  It would stop when we knocked on the wall and then start again when we stopped.

Summary Heading: We were given a room on the 3rd floor. AVOID THIS FLOOR...
Summary: We were given a room on the 3rd floor. AVOID THIS FLOOR! the entire floor has a horrible mold issue! The cleaning staff definitely is aware as they open all the windows as they clean the rooms and leave them open. I have extreme allergies to mold and was very congested and found it extremely hard to breath. If you book through a third party, such as booking.com or Travelocity this is where you will be put. Location is fantastic but not worth the risk of your health and comfort.

Summary Heading: bad customer service with night shift
Summary: During check in I asked how to get to Disneyland and he responded with ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you know we are on Disneyland drive‚Äù I asked again he said follow the road. I used maps app and that took me all the way around walking with a 4 year old needed to pay taxi to get back. Also I called front desk to get WiFi password and I clearly disrupted him and again he responded with a bad attitude. I asked again in the morning with different staff and she was very nice gave me a map showing me exactly how to get to Disneyland and told me there was free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Probably the worst hotel/motel I've ever stayed at.
Summary: I was extremely disappointed with this motel. Where do I start? The place looks extremely run down. There was a LARGE (~1") open air gap between the bottom of the door and the floor, leading straight outside (how do you think that affects humidity in the room? Or noise?) The KING size bed had only two pillows included. I called for additional pillows and the new pillows stunk (literally, they had a bad smell). The heater unit in the room smelled like dead animals when it was run, so I had to shut it off. The shower head was on a hose and could not be mounted above stomach level. Free Wifi was advertised but no password was provided. It was a disaster overall. Front desk staff was adequate, but not friendly.

Summary Heading: ~ Large clean / comfortable room with refrigerator ...
Summary: ~ Large clean / comfortable room with refrigerator & microwave   ~ 15 minute walk to front gate of Disneyland / California adventure   ~ breakfast consisted of donuts ~ a couple cereals ~ coffee/tea/juice & toast   ~ NO parking or internet fee which is unheard of at most hotels near Disneyland   ~ if you are looking for no frills yet a clean comfortable stay this is definitely your choice !! I live local and have had many stay cations near Disneyland and this will definitely be my go to from now on  ~

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: It is close to the park and reasonably priced. The rooms are hard wood floors. My family and I always stay here when visiting Disneyland. You drive right out of their parking lot and enter the Disneyland parking structure a block later.

We were coming from San Francisco to Los Angeles thru road number one Pacific road But at one point the road was closed so we had to improvise and change plan.   We decided to check the Los Angeles Hotels which will have availability for the same night  And contacted this hotel who inmediatly made our reservations  We were relieved and drove to the hotel It is renew. Very clean. Not expensive at all. The mattresses very comfortable and tv and Wifi service.  The check in and out was very fast  This area is very near to Disneyland and had a lot of restaurants around.  Thank you Super 8 for your help.  Will recommend to friends.

Summary Heading: Terrible experience and staff was very rude! Never staying at a Super 8 again!
Summary: Where do I start? I wanted to take my girlfriend to Disneyland so i chose this hotel. I was informed that the first night had to be charged to my card on the night before my stay and that I would have to pay the rest when I checked in. I said ok and they charged it. I don't make a ton of money so i had just enough money for the trip. Then, when I woke up the next day, I found an extra charge from Super 8 on my card that was made at 3am. i thought it was weird so I brought it up when I got there. The staff was very indifferent and said that they would talk to the manager when he got in. I told them that I would've had enough to pay for the rest of the stay if they hadn't charged the extra $107 on my card. They said they would take care of it. I went to the park and when we got

Summary Heading: My room was well maintained, clean and decorated nicely...
Summary: My room was well maintained, clean and decorated nicely. Check in was quick and he gave me a magazine with information about the area and discounts.
The doors needed to be shoved open and slammed closed. We heard our neighbors slamming doors, using the restroom, and getting on the very loud elevator right outside our door.

Parking is limited, and extremely loud guests at all hours of the night. The elevator is older and can be heard from every room. Shower leaks water all over bathroom floor. Front door has large crack at the bottom where light comes in and insects can easily crawl through. Terrible lighting inside rooms. Only 3 channels came in on the TV.

When I visited Anaheim this was the best place by far to stay at, great price, clean, friendly personal, my family and my self enjoyed our stay there. Close to any place you need to visit, some with in walking distance.
We use this location as it is close to Disneyland and convenient for to get in and out of easily.
The hotel was perfect. Front desk was perfect too! The only downside?...we should have walked to Disneyland as it took longer to drive there. Still a great experience!

First off I was very excited from reading the introduction and what the hotel offers. I was drawn in by the free 7 item breakfast bonanza since I have four kids. Wrong  answer it was a continental breakfast that was unsatisfactory! If the information said continental breakfast I wouldn‚Äôt of booked this hotel. Also we need towels well the front office has only two towels. Long story short I will never book at a Super 8 again this is my second bad experience.
The room was very nice. The distance to Disneyland was great...a nice walk. Easy on, off to freeway.

Our room was clean and beds were comfortable. The front desk was kind and helpful. Breakfast was limited to mainly cereal, toast, orange and milk. Enjoyed our stay to spend our days at Disney. Will be staying here again:)

Summary Heading: Excellent location!! Staff could have been a little...
Summary: Excellent location!! Staff could have been a little friendlier! But the room was great!! Thank you
Great Disney Trip!  Good location, great staff, clean & comfortable rooms, and they had parking down to a science!

We stayed here while we went to Disneyland for a family vacation. It is close to the park and you can walk there in 18min, however after a day in the park you may not have the energy to walk back. The service was great, and the rooms were clean. The bed wasn‚Äôt that comfortable and we only got one pillow each. However for the cost it was on par.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive alternative when visiting Disney parks
Summary: While it's definitely a no-frills hotel that is beginning to show it age, the room was clean, everything worked, and the price was great.

Summary Heading: We‚Äôve stayed here before , hotel room is nothing to rant...
Summary: We‚Äôve stayed here before , hotel room is nothing to rant and rave about it serves your basic need ,, if your looking for something comfortable and nice this ain‚Äôt it.  Definitely not enough blankets and check in was as if the clerk hated being there. No expresssion and not very friendly.

Summary Heading: Nice location but in need of deep cleaning and repair.
Summary: Location was awesome easy walk to the parks.  Could see Disney fireworks from room front door perfectly. That was a bonus. Price was decent. The breakfast was donuts, cereal, apples, juice and coffee. Its complimentary so is what it is but some places have real breakfast so would have been nice to know ahead. The front door key was tricky and sometimes worked sometimes didnt when i mentioned it  "that happens sometimes" At least they were in office 24/7 i guess. Also chain lock was bent (like kicked in) Which doesn't make you feel super comfortable (easy fix!) neighborhood wasn't horrible.  The floors need a deep cleaning. My sons feet were black after a short time with who knows what. I brought to their attention. It was mopped and i saw the housekeepers mop the floors in other

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, great rooms.
Summary: Always my go to location for quick trips to Disneyland. Easy 60 second drive down the street to parking garage. Rooms are much nicer than I expect for a Super 8 and cost.

Summary Heading: This place is awesome!! Loved the location!! Most...
Summary: This place is awesome!! Loved the location!! Most definitely staying here every time we come to Disneyland
After spending a full day at Disneyland it was a good place to put our feet up & relax. No problem with late check in,  we just needed a place to stay overnight, we did not use many of the services.

Stayed here 5 nights.Room was cleaned every day perfect spot for Disneyland.Very clean.Very enjoyable time we had there.Staff wasvery professional kind and friendly.Only hiccup not very healthy breakfast.Donuts and cereal :( but other than that great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Great price for the location.  Small parking lot.
Summary: You definitely get your money‚Äôs worth at this hotel. The room and bathroom was clean. It‚Äôs only a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and theme parks.  The donuts at breakfast are fresh and super soft. Only complaint is that they only allow one parking permit per reservation so plan ahead if you‚Äôre booking a multi-family room (it is strictly enforced since the parking lot is so small).

Summary Heading: Tables in breakfast area we all dirty and many things had...
Summary: Tables in breakfast area we all dirty and many things had ran out. It was a busy morning however.

Walking distance to the parks (15-20 minutes; when we got lazy we called an Uber or lyft). Thin comforter, wish I‚Äôd had extra blankets but I kept forgetting to ask for one. Complimentary breakfast was a pleasant surprise but wish there had been more protein options instead of so many carbs.

There were roaches all over our first room and the door lock was broken - we moved to a different room, only to find more roaches (and another door lock that randomly stopped working repeatedly throughout our stay). The hotel regularly ran out of parking even for guests.  We would've moved to a different hotel but it was a holiday weekend and everywhere was booked.  Don't stay here, seriously - it's not worth the savings.  Unless you like roaches that are several inches long crawling on you while you try to sleep.

We were really only looking for an inexpensive bed to sleep in and place to shower in between days at Disneyland, so that is exactly what we got. The room was the bare minimum, as was the breakfast. There was two types of cereal, sliced bread, and some donuts and that is all. The bed was hard and there were only two thin pillows. We asked the front desk the night we arrived for a couple more, she said she would have housekeeping bring us some more when they cleaned the next day, but they did not. The room was clean, but i did notice some hairs on the bed that weren‚Äôt mine the night we arrived. The hotel is walking distance to Disney (about 15 minute walk, depending on how motivated you are) which is nice. Overall, we got what we expected. I would recommend if you‚Äôre looking for

Summary Heading: Checked in on a extremely hot day in Oct. 103 degrees to be...
Summary: Checked in on a extremely hot day in Oct. 103 degrees to be exact. The air conditioner was off and the sliding screened window was open in our room upon checkin. The room was unbearably hot. We turned ac on high and left for dinner. It had only slightly cooled upon returning. Who knows how many days the ac had been off and it was third floor. Took quite a while to cool it down. Left a note for housekeeping not to turn it off or open windows. Lock on window was subpar. Breakfast was mediocre. Possibly hardest hotel bed I‚Äôve ever slept on.  It was actually a longer walk to Disneyland than expected based on others reviews. One way road gave Uber and Lyft conflicting directions. Overall cheap stay though. Room was clean. Front desk was pleasant.  Would def stay somewhere closer to

This hotel was a great place to stay for our Disneyland trip. It was a little walk to Disneyland but nit bad and well worth the savings on parking. We also visited the beach that was not to far and Knott's Berry farm that was only a short drive. It was nice to have a place to grab breakfast before our adventures too. The staff were helpful and friendly. We enjoyed watching fireworks at Disneyland while soaking in the hot tub. My kids loved playing in the pool. Very nice stay.
This model is independently owned, I'm sure the parent company does not look in on this property, as it was well below par.

The motel was way more than I expected. Last time we stayed at motel 4 Disney way and it was nice but this was much nicer and a better breakfast. The lady in the breakfast room kept everything clean and kept putting food out for us. I was pleasantly surprised by the breakfast and what was served. I paid a little more here than Motel 6 but much worth it! This is where we will stay every time we visit Disneyland.

I flew to Anaheim (Disney) to celebrate my engagement. I called the night before I left and found out that the hotel lost my reservation (after they had failed to tell me this and claimed that my confirmation number was false) so I had to rebook it the night before my trip. I ended up paying $115 more than I should have. When I told the staff what happened, they told me that it wasn't their problem since the booking was done through a different website than their own, and didn't offer any kind of a solution or even apologize. I'm very frustrated with the lack of customer service and helpfulness I should have received and don't plan on staying here again. The very least they could have done was apologize, but all the girl at the front desk did was stare at me and blink. I know

Wonderful person at the check in desk; we came at a bad time, but he was very nice and helped us. Our hotel room was very clean and spacious. Price was very reasonable. The distance to disneyland is only 2 minutes away by car.  I would love to stay here again! Highly recommended.

The property was nice and the hotel room was in great condition. The quality of the towels were a little poor. The overall experience wasn‚Äôt too bad. We had the alarm go off at midnight which scared us a bit, but then attempted to turn the alarm off and nothing was working until we unplugged it. Staff was very helpful as well.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive but does the job if you are looking for a place to shower and sleep.
Summary: If you want to spend your days playing at the parks or beach and then clean up and sleep for the night, this is a great place!

For the amount of time spent in the room, it was great.  Small parking lot with not enough spaces.  GREAT view of fireworks from Disney.  Not convenient to ART transportation, and when asked 2 different staff where to get bus, told 2 completely different places...bus never came to either spot. UBER was best mode of transportation.  Not a great breakfast, but the donuts were sooo good!

If this $125 room wasn't on Disney's doorstep, it would be an average well worn $50 a night room. The breakfast was great if you thrive on Frosted Flakes & frozen waffles.  They did manage to keep it clean.  Traffic noise is LOUD!  Internet was slow-unless you pay $10/day for the fast service.  Limited larger parking spaces.

Summary Heading: Very expensive for a cheap hotel
Summary: The outward appearance is atrocious but the rooms are decent, we had to cough up $20 for a roll away crib for my baby that was not appreciated and our keys were locked out at 10am on sun before check out, not worth the price by far and location isn‚Äôt convenient for the parks unless u park in the structure each time

Summary Heading: The room is really nice compared to the last time I stayed...
Summary: The room is really nice compared to the last time I stayed. Beds are comfortable,  bathroom and room was nicely clean when we arrived. No stains anywhere,  the fridge and microwave was unplug due to electricity so that was understandable. But the fridge wasent all that cold after having it plugged for 2days..   That was a dislike for me,  and also the upstairs was really noisy hearing easy sounds of footsteps.  But staff we're very helpful when I arrived and when I was checking out.  They're breakfast are good,  not to fancy but good enough. And the parking was really compact.
Basically used hotel to shower and sleep, which is exactly what we wanted. Refrigerators are great for keeping cold drinks and snacks.  Air conditioner kept us cool. Will definitely come here again!

It is a hike from Disney so don't let the "closeness" fool you. We are pretty active so it was not a big deal for us but was still a hike (especially after a full day at Disney) The staff was nice/average. One did let us check in a tad early for Disney but every other encounter was very average, no smiles, excitement, just blah. Food was decent. Room could have been a little cleaner as we did have one bug but it was right by the door so maybe a better door seal. I am not too fussy as we were there for the 7 hours of sleeping and 1 hour grooming time. The rest was at Disney and that is all we needed.

We got to the hotel at about 19:30 where we checked in.   The check in went smoothly and were we given our room key. I noticed that we had been given a room on the ground floor and when booking through Expedia, I requested a room on the top floor.   I was given a strange look and advised that this type of room is only available on the ground floor and that the hotel was full, so they wouldn‚Äôt be able to change it.   I took the key and entered the room and was a little surprised to see that I had been allocated an accessible room, which consists of one big bedroom on the ground floor and the biggest walk in shower room I think I have ever seen  It transpired that this was a mistake made by Expedia. We offered to swap rooms in the event of someone needing it, but was advised that

Summary Heading: Super 8 Anaheim -got less than I expected
Summary: The room was about what you would expect from a Super 8, so not that great. The bathroom was dingy and the bedding was super cheap. We requested extra pillows from the front desk within 15 minutes of arrival and never received any follow up on our request. Overall it was an underwhelming experience. The only plus was how close it was to the parks.

Summary Heading: Great value, great location!!!! Clean rooms, breakfast provided and great views of Disneyland‚Äôs fireworks show!!
Summary: Great value, great location!! Clean rooms, friendly staff, free breakfast and great views of Disneyland‚Äôs fireworks show!! Highly recommend!
Parking was the big issue. Both nights we had to park either behind someone or next to the pool where there is lots of people walking back and forth.

Summary Heading: Poor quality for the price. Terrible breakfast.
Summary: The first room they put us in had bugs all over the walls growling from the bathroom in. The back of the room all the way to the front door over the bed and smelled really bad like cigarette smoke. The second room was clean but also smelled really bad of cigarette smoke

Summary Heading: The bed was super comfortable, it felt like memory foam. .. but the Internet kept kicking us off. Very close to Disneyl
Summary: The bed was super comfortable, it felt like memory foam. .. but the Internet kept kicking us off. Very close to Disneyl

Summary Heading: Not a bad hotel, but not sure if we‚Äôll be back.
Summary: My husband and I were there to celebrate our anniversary with a trip to Disneyland. We arrived at the hotel early and when I asked if it was possible to check in early, I feel the Guest Services Agent had a little bit of attitude when she told me check-in is at 3p and they don‚Äôt have rooms available. So, we left and went to the park. We returned later that evening and picked up our key. We get to the room, it‚Äôs nice. Very neat and clean. However, not nearly enough outlet for chargers (we ended up unplugging lamps to charge our phones and watches overnight) and no where to sit besides and office chair and a lone chair by the door. Upon check-out, I waited nearly 20 minutes for a Guest Services Agent to come to the front desk. He was tending the the breakfast area. Refilling the

There‚Äôs not enough parking for the guest at the hotel. People had to park in the fire lanes. Then they made people park behind other people and ask when you would need your car Incase it was blocked in.
Easy check in, air conditioning, and 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Park gets really full at the motel.
Super 8 was a great choice for my family and I during our stay in Anaheim. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to guest for future visits. Overall, I give this hotel a 10.

Summary Heading: Please take tram service off of your website! We had to walk to Disneyland or pay, not as advertised.
Summary: We booked here because we thought we would be able to take the tram, as advertised from the parking garage. You can only take the tram if you pay for parking. No tram service available!

The location is excellent. You can see the Disney fireworks from the the rooms. The street goes straight into the Disney parking lot. The price was reasonable. The towels were stained and scratchy, and there was hair here and there. Other than that, the rooms were fairly clean. Breakfast is minimal, but sufficient.

When we first arrived I was worried that we would not be able to check in for it was around 12PM. I was very happy to hear that our rooms were ready and requested upon check in if our rooms could be next to each other, To our surprise we were giving connecting rooms that made it so much easier for our group to communicate and enjoy both rooms.
