Beds were extremely comfortable and everything was good, The only negative was our room was not completely stocked and that the water in the tub seemed to stay in the tub for awhile with a foul smell. Breakfast was really hectic and their weren't many sugar free options. Overall it was a great experience for our first time staying here.

Summary Heading: The hotel location is awesome, right down the street from...
Summary: The hotel location is awesome, right down the street from parking. Overall it was a pretty decent hotel but we did encounter 2 roaches in our bathroom along with some other little bugs crawling around in there. The parking is very inconvenient and I've never seen something like it before. Other than that, the hotel was Good! If it weren't for location for this price, I probably wouldn't stay here again.

My family and I had a good stay, but we did see a couple pests in our room the first night we stayed. We did not want to keep any food in our room. We spent minimal time in the room so we did not make a huge fuss over it but we most likely won't be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Everything that you need for a budget Disney visit
Summary: Free breakfast, hot tub and pool, laundry (with a microwave in that room), a fridge in the room... what else do you need? The hotel is also close enough to the park that you can even watch the fireworks if you're too tired to stay at Disney for the whole day (which was our case). Staff is great and very helpful.  Also, the city bus stops right outside the hotel, which is great for going to the park, but on the way back it takes such a detour that you might as well walk back to the hotel...

So to start, I booked this hotel because of the location to Disneyland. (Keep in mind we are pass-holders and go often) we arrived really early and went to the desk and asked for an early check-in since we would be at the park all day. The guy at the front, very rudely, told us no. Even though the parking lot was completely empty.  All we were asking was that we park our cars, since we would be staying there a couple nights.  So then we got to the room which the only good thing about it was it was a nice size.  Everything else was pretty disappointing, considering this is a Wyndham hotel you think they would put a little more into it.  The security has changed with Disney so you now would have to walk even further from this hotel.  We will never be staying here again.

Next to Castle Inn (S Harbor Blvd), this motel is very convenient when it comes to visiting Disneyland Resort. The Disneyland theme park parking Building is only less than 2 minutes away from here. Otherwise, you can enjoy walking to the resort in just about 30 minutes. So to guests that have been regulars to Castle Inn, please give this motel at Disneyland Drive a try!
Double booked the room we were in but problem was quickly resolved. Plan to have breakfast somewhere else. Overall it was a good room for a good price. I would stay there again.
Close to Disneyland, can walk to the tram if you want (about 1/2 mile).  Only downside is limited parking, but they've always been able to work it out.

This is our third time staying at this location. We like the walking distance to Disneyland. We can easily walk there and avoid the driving crowd, plus save on gas. Park the car and walk. And it's close enough if we needed to come back for a nap or to cool off in the pool, we can do that too. Usual continental breakfast. Fridge and microwave in the room if you care for other fare.

Summary Heading: Floors were dirty.  Hair all over our socks.   Location is...
Summary: Floors were dirty.  Hair all over our socks.   Location is close to Disney however somewhat difficult to access because it's on a one way frontage road

Summary Heading: The hotel was close to Disneyland and other Anaheim...
Summary: The hotel was close to Disneyland and other Anaheim activities.  Staff was helpful and resolved minor problems that arose.  Breakfast was not very substantial or to my liking.

Summary Heading: Got the job done for less than the other hotels in the area
Summary: I knew what to expect with this level and price of hotel. I knew it was cheaper for a reason. If it was just the thin walls and weird smells and lacking breakfast that bothered me then I would have left it at 4-5 stars. But walking into my room, it looked as if someone had recently done some work/remodeling on it and never finished. The TV wasn't plugged in and set up and the room wasn't cleaned all the way when I arrived. It still got the job done though. I had somewhere to sleep and it was close to where I started my race at Downtown Disney (Under 1 mile).

Clean but older; simple breakfast but handy; super great location to Disneyland - make a right turn to go straight to the parking garage. Friendly staff and accommodating.  Has a pool but is in the parking lot - not my thing, but we didn't need it this trip. Great value and would stay there again.

Being close to Disneyland was nice. However, the room we stayed in was anything but nice. It had a bad oder to, that the cleaners felt over bleaching the room would help. Instead it lead to a room that we had to air out, in 100+ degree temp. and then oder came back. The door would not close unless you really slamed it, which woke everyone up in the room. We asked for 1 extra pillow, and was told they would send one up. We finally got the pillow after the third day and sevral times asking. There will have to be such a great deal, like free, before I will stay here again.
The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful in the booking process as I had made some errors on line. The family thoroughly enjoyed the stay, location, amenities.  Thank you.

This hotel stay was my 3rd stay here. This time I got a king bed instead of the usual 2 queen. I have to admit, I was very disappointed this time around. I was shoved in a room that made me feel claustrophobic and it was just not clean. A/C did not work properly. There was a foul odor in the air. The lamps did not work and there were tons of leftover cheerios/crumbs behind the bed. I never expected much from this hotel but at least be clean. It served its purpose for the night and I would probably stay again but only out of necessity and only if the price is right. Next time I will get a two queen room since they seemed bigger and cleaner. I never had an issue with staff though. They were always helpful. Cleaning crew needs to up their ante big time!

Summary Heading: Quick sleep & go for Disneyland Fun!
Summary: Very close to Disneyland across the steeet from the parking structure . It is best to have a car as it's a long nit easy access walk as u can't walk across the street to the parking structure . Easy check in & out .

This hotel is in a nice location to Disneyland and California Adventure Parks. Staying here allows us easy access to the parks daily. The continental breakfast is a nice addition, but has changed over time and is now a lot less choices for the guests. We will still continue to stay here but will bring some of our own breakfast choices just in case.

Summary Heading: Checked in to the room. When we got to the room it we...
Summary: Checked in to the room. When we got to the room it we noticed the bathroom was dirty. The mirror had something brown all over. The counters hadn't been wiped down. Went downstairs to let them know and was told they'd clean it in the morning. That never happened. The next morning we picked up the blanket off the floor and found food under the bed. When I went to check out and talk tit the manager, he wasn't there. Left my information and never heard back from them.

We stayed here for our first time to Disneyland, it's a great location only taking about 15 minutes to walk to Downtown Disney which saves $20 a day parking fees. The motel is very clean, the beds comfy. If you want luxury this isn't the place for you but if you want clean, comfortable and convenient then this is ideal for you.  The pool area is clean. You can see the nightly fireworks from the car park/pool area. Breakfast is a bit limited, ok if you like doughnuts and frozen waffles! But we had a fridge so we stocked up on yogurt and milk for cereal. I will definitely stay here again when in the area.

Hotel was okay not a luxury hotel so if you are looking for fine amminities this is not the hotel you want.  If you were just looking for a place to stay for your Disneyland adventure and don't mind a 20 minute walk then this hotel will serve its purpose.

This is a clean comfortable place to stay. Only a couple things missing , since I have stayed here a few times I know what  the rooms should have in it . This time our table was missing the space where it belongs was empty, so we missed having a table to eat at. The breakfast there just isn't impressive I just wish they had at least some waffles  fresh fruit and yogurt . It's just coffee , cereal and donuts.  When driving back from the park it's a rather inconvenient location to get back too

The room was decent though much too dark. Too many dark colors, floors, walls, etc. and not enough lights. Room was clean and well kept. Wireless internet was good. Not even close to passable for the television. No movie channel, no ESPN only foxsports. Just 25 basic channels. Breakfast was not even worth looking at. Just the minimal basics; toast, frozen waffles, donuts, dry cereal, crappy fruit, etc. No accommodations for any basic food allergies. Why have it if you're going to muck it up this bad.   Location for Disneyland was good though it was not walkable to the shuttle stop due to the change in security which the literature did not mention, still said one could walk to shuttle. Price was decent for area.

Don't be fooled by the fact that this is a Super 8.  Great customer service and nice rooms.  You could even see the fireworks at Disneyland from the room.  The first day we were there, a water leak happened in the breakfast area.  The employees worked very hard to get the water that covered nearly the whole floor cleaned up in the quickest way possible, apologizing the whole time.  I give them credit for working so diligently (one was even covered in water himself).  If you are looking for a nice place to stay this is definately one option.

Summary Heading: Super 8 Anaheim changing ownership in September
Summary: Our stay was fine for an overnight trip to see an Angels game nearby. The sink is very small but the room was very clean. The walls were thin as we could hear the room next door watching a Disney movie in the middle of the night. Overall it was nice. Of note the Super 8 will be changing ownership in September. It is being purchased by the Petersen Family who also owns the Kings Inn on Hotel Circle in San Diego. The Kings Inn in San Diego is a great hotel so hopefully it will be the same in Anaheim

Room smelled so bad. Realized it was the fridge. They had turned it off and left it open to air out the stink? Found long brown hairs on the first rag, hand towel, and bath towel, like they were planted by a maid? Looked like the same hairs on all of them. Through out the week more hairs found on other towels and pillows too! Walked around in brand new slippers and bottoms turned black within 1 hour even with it being hard floor. Beds were so hard, we had to go buy a mattress topper just so I could sleep! That barely helped!! Maids would take apart the drain in tub and leave it in the middle of the bathtub. Shower curtain had this odor and weird black stuff  it when we checked in and it was still there when we left! Toilet back didn't fit toilet. Maids left 1 wash clothes for

If I could give it zero stars I would. My husband and family were denied parking for a second vehical when we have 2 cars with wheelchairs and threatened with removal when we said we would be reviewing the property. Had to beg to stay because it was already 10 at night and the only reason we got the hotel was because I was in the hospital, so im on the phone trying to resolve it while I stuck in a hospital bed. When they finally got into the room, it smelled of urine in several places and one of the beds did as well. Would not recommend this place to my worst enemy! Oh and their breakfast sucks, just 2 cereals and stale donuts!

Myself, family and friends have been staying here for about 15 years. Its so so close to Disneyland garage,, maybe a block and love the personal. Always go above and beyond to make sure we are taken care of and our safety is of the up most. Its my home while visiting the area and will continue to be .

We have stayed at this Super 8 many times while visiting Disneyland.  The location cannot be beat; you even see the fireworks from the balconies or pool at night!  Rooms have been updated and are clean and functional.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  The breakfast is basic, at best; donuts (a family favorite) are usually stale and visually unappealing.  Cereal is ok, and bread/frozen waffles fill you up. Parking is limited.  Still, if visiting Disneyland you have to stretch your budget; this Super 8 will definitely help you do that!
No shuttle to Disney. No early check-in. No leaving the car after check-out. All features that are available at nearby hotels. You can do better for less at Motel 6.

I have stayed at this hotel before is not my first time staying there. I was actually happy when I got a room because all the times that I have stayed there. I have good experience and good memories. My self and my partnervboth had separate cars and the person that help me out. Did not satisfied or try to accommodate both cars. When there was plenty of parking spots available. I tried telling him my situation and he did not let both cars park there. I paid for my stay so I don't understand why it was not possible when there was parking spaces available. Bad service. Will not stay there again.

Clean, well kept hotel. Parking was tight but we did have a spot. Older hotel but seemed to be ran nicely. It was about a 15 to 20 min walk to Disneyland, I was pushing a stroller. Breakfast ran out fast, donuts, cereal and frozen waffles. For the price it was a good stay.

Summary Heading: Super 8 was great! My nephew enjoyed the pool while my...
Summary: Super 8 was great! My nephew enjoyed the pool while my sister and I enjoyed the hot tub. It was a 2 minute drive to the Disneyland parking which made it very convenient!

This hotel is high quality and we've always been able to stay here for a good price. The only thing that I wish was better is the continental breakfast. They serve doughnuts, eggo waffles, toast, and some fruit. It would be much better if they had more substantial foods with protein.
when going to disneyland, why spend all that money on hotel, when your at park the whole time. hotel is clean, easy to get to, & a good value

The rooms were recently remodeled and look great. For the price you can't beat it and it's a 20 minute walk or $5 Uber ride to Disney. Breakfast left a little to be desired and is the only reason this got 4 stars instead of 5. It was eggo waffles, cereal, donuts, toast and oatmeal.

Summary Heading: The Hotel was affordable and in a good location...
Summary: The Hotel was affordable and in a good location.  Recommended it to my sister for her business trips.

Got a super good rate for this hotel during a holiday weekend. Booked it having no idea what it would be like and it was amazing! Staff was wonderful, room was clean, breakfast was perfect before our trip to Disney. Thank you Super 8! You made our family trip a breeze
Good location to Disney, but priced high because of that.  Room smelled like chemicals.  Sugar foods for breakfast.

We usually stay at the GRAND Californian hotel which is on the Disney property. But it's also about 5-6 hundred a night. So for this spur of the moment trip we decided to do something different. It was hard to find places available ... the super 8 looked nice in photos so we went for it. When we got there we were shocked how big the room was and how nicely decorated. The service was great and everyone was so nice. The only thing I wasn't super happy about was the towels and bedding... something softer and less scratchy would have been nice... but nothing crazy.  I don't know if we will ever go back because you can't beat staying on the Disney resort property... but this was a very surprising change. üòä

Would never stay at a Super 8 again get there toilet doesnt flush leaks for 2 days cockroach in room no parking noone helps u not even a manager and u CANT walk to Disney from this hotel way too far and u dont get any sleep at this hotel

Summary Heading: Check in was at 3pm but we arrived at 8am and they were...
Summary: Check in was at 3pm but we arrived at 8am and they were able to accomodate early parking for us. I really liked that.

This is an older hotel style, but rooms were nicely updated, everything was very clean.  You can see fireworks from Disneyland from your room and easy accesss to park & downtown Disney.   The wifi was sketchy, & the breakfast was not for me, but probably fine for kids & teens.  I would say this is probably a great choice for families & everyone seemed to really enjoy the pool.

Summary Heading: We had a pleasant stay. We didn't want to spend a lot of...
Summary: We had a pleasant stay. We didn't want to spend a lot of money so it wasn't a top notch hotel. Older place but well kept.

Summary Heading: They never came to the room to clean,  take out the trash,  or bring us new towels
Summary: Seems like they forgot about our room the whole day, it wasn't cleaned, the Wi-Fi was bad, still had trash, and we needed towels

Summary Heading: Great money saver for a Disney trip
Summary: The rooms are clean and updated. The free breakfast was fine, nothing elaborate but it gave you enough to hold you over until lunch. Great location for walking distance to the parks. I highly suggest it for families who are doing a trip on a budget.

The hotel was okay for the most part.  When I was checking for a place to stay I was told this hotel was an 11 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  That number is way off, it's at least 30-40 minutes depending on how fast you walk.  The breakfast was very poor, they don't replenish as more guest show up so unless your there when it starts, don't bother going.

I liked the room, it wasn't too bad. Just a couple issues: The hard floors were dirty, sticky. My sons socks were black on the bottom from walking around. And the shower head didn't adjust, so I hated the flow of the water. I didn't even want to go eat their breakfast. Apples, toast, cereal and egos, nothing I wanted to eat.

Front desk staff was rude and there was never a manager there to talk to. Room cleaning was poor, maid left her dirty rags all over our stuff, not enough towels, threw all our stuff in the tub,  ever cleaned the floor. There was no parking, it was not a 10 min walk and you get the tram. Front desk said they closed the tram in May and in there website it still states you can take it.

This I s fantastic place for children and adults  The place is not overcrowded and so many hotels and food places  That you may be spoilt for choice  The Thai food is awesome  The theme park is very well laid out , lots of rides though some not  Fit for under 3. The parade is just fantastic, a child will have a memory left for a long long time  I was amazed at the friendly staff all around and more then willing to assist you in the direction.  The bus transportation is good but  Make sure where to meet on the return trip Lots of platforms  All I can say . Disney has planned this to the highest level

The staff were very friendly and helpful but our room needed more cleaning. The floor felt like it was coated in something and turned our feet black from walking on it. They left a window cleaning spray can in our room which made us question if they had finished cleaning. The beds appeared to have clean sheets and were freshly made but were not very comfortable. The air conditioning was freezing and did not change with adjustments. It was a 20 minute walk to Disney with no shuttle which we saw they had on the website. The breakfast was okay with donuts, cereal, and toast. While it was okay I would recommend spending more and staying somewhere else.

The room smelled dirty, we suspected that they were not changing the mop water between rooms. Only the center of the floor appeared to be being cleaned at all. There was a bottle cap on the floor against the wall the 3 days we were there. The shower head was crusty with mineral build up and mold. We would have checked out and stayed somewhere else, but we had pre-paid for the room and it was non-refundable. The only positive is that they did put fresh sheets on the bed daily.

Lovely and clean, the room was a bit smaller than expected but we were only in the room to sleep. The bed was comfortable and the pool was clean too. The hot tub was a lovely bonus after a long day at Disney! The aircon was a little bit too loud but there's not a lot that can be done about that! Extremely good value.

Summary Heading: Not bad for the price, but no shuttle to Disney
Summary: All in all the motel was great for the price, just about expected for the price.  My only qualm is that because of where it is located it isn't on the Disney shuttle route and they have nothing to compensate for it.  We ended up walking to the park, which was about a 25 minute walk each way so not terrible, but keep in mind that there is no free or easy way to get to Disneyland from this place.

Room was dirty.. sheets was blood on them, lots of hair - on the clean towels, on the floor.  "remodeled room" was rundown!  Tub was pealing, paint wad dripped over the trim in several spots, terrible water pressure in the shower. Breakfast was basically donuts and juice or coffee.   Not as advertised.  Website stated it was a 1/2 mile walk to Disney.  There is no way.. its 1/2 mile by car, to walk you can not go down Disneyland drive.  Luckily it was a brief and inexpensive Uber ride away. I recommend skipping this place on a previous trip we stayed at the Ramada Maingate on Harbor Blvd... was so much cleaner and less expensive than this place.

The room rate was good for the distance to Disneyland, but the quality was definitely lacking.  The towels when we got them, we're the roughest we've ever felt.  Next time we'll just stay farther out and drive to the parks.
Great stay!  Room was great, clean, and quiet.  Pool and spa were great!  Nice breakfast with many choices.

Summary Heading: Nice folks, decent room, paper thin blankets
Summary: The hotel is nice enough and the rooms are surprisingly large.  The decor is decent for a budget priced hotel.  The staff is outstanding and everyone was very nice.  However,  a couple of things will keep me from staying here again. 1. The hotel is not a close to Disneyland as a map would make it appear.   You can not walk down Disneyland Way, so you must walk down Ball to Katella.  It is a solid 45 minute walk.  However,  ir is only a $6 Uber.  2. The breakfast is substandard,  even for a budget hotel.  Donuts and soggy frozen waffles.  Get there early or both will be long gone.  3. Finally the blankets on the beds should be retired and burned.  Blood spots on the sheet, and a blanket so small and thin I considered finding a Walmart to buy a blanket for the remaining nights.

Our family of 6 stayed 3 days in 3 rooms for vacation. The rooms were surprisingly spacious ! The bathroom is separated from the beds which is very nice ! Bare flooring is a plus - you don't feel the millions of people that were there before you. Ample parking right in front of the rooms. The breakfast was decent, but you better get there early because it goes fast and the staff apparently doesn't refill it.  Very close to Disneyland- $7 taxi, $5 uber  Everyone noted the beds were very comfortable, front desk friendly and helpful and maid service was excellent!

When arriving at the property I was told that my husband could not Park his car on the property. He had to work the very next day and we needed to bring both cars. They then told us that my husband should park down the street, that was extremely far for us. After complaining to the manager he said there was nothing we could do about that. We did not stay at the property and decided to leave. The property did not even want to reimburse me the fee for not staying in I just left the property. They were extremely rude to me as well.
Neat and clean. Customer friendly staff. Very good breakfast. If I go to Disneyland again, I will definitely stay here.

I've stayed at this hotel before and will definitely stay again. It is the perfect location if you're going to Disneyland. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable! The best part was the staff. They were very friendly,  courteous and accommodating.  It's a must stay if you're looking for a nice affordable hotel close to Disneyland!
I got bug bites at Super 8 and I told the manager but did not do anything about it. The pillow cases and bed sheets had Yellow stains. YUK!!!!! I don't think Super 8 clean and change anything.

The tile floors were filthy. There was sewage in the tub. The exterior door had no weather stripping allowing you to see the light from outside all around it. Even the deadbolt lock left us feeling unsecured. They moved us to another room after finding the sewage in the tub, we checked the tub & it was clean. We went out for several hours, & returned to find sewage in the tub. Subsequently, we were not able to shower. As it was late, we went to sleep, but checked out 3 days early To move to another hotel.
It's about a 15 minute walk to downtown Disney. You cannot get into the Mickey & Friends tram anymore unless you park there.

Got to the hotel, checked in with no issue. Went to park and there was no available parking but there was 20 spaces blocked off. Got to the room and it smelled like mold. There was a 3 inch gap at the bottom of the door and hair all over the bathroom floor. Other an these issues we would go back to this hotel.

Everything was clean and in order as expected,I was even able to get a room at 1pm before 3pm check in time. My only qualm was that I didn't realize we had to walk over two overpasses to get to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Parking is a struggle. Walking distance is 25 min max. Not...
Summary: Parking is a struggle. Walking distance is 25 min max. Not too bad since you will be walking a day in Disneyland. The breakfast needs improvements

The curbside appeal is great however, the rooms are very out dated with a mix of old wall paper and newer artwork that doesn't match. There was dust in the vents and corners. This place could use a overhaul. The staff was excellant and very accomodating to our needs.

My trip was extended by a day and I had to find a one night reservation at the almost last minute. I booked this room for a Friday evening via booking.com on my phone at 3pm. The location is good,  easy to find. The check in took longer than expected as he kept typing away at something in his computer and he took a photo copy of my credit card which I was uncomfortable with. The Super 8 near by that I stayed at the evening before did not do that. There was plenty of parking, room was very nice. It was spacious and very clean, especially the bathroom which is huge for me. Only complaint would be that my room happened to be right above the the maid's station/ laundry facility and there was loud talking very early in the morning as all their windows and doors were open, but I guess

Remodeled room with hardwood laminate floors.  Very clean, better than carpet.   When we walked in the room the entertainment console was moved out from the wall and the micro/fridge were unplugged.   I plugged then in and the micro came on but the fridge never worked.   Walking distance to Downtown Disney.   Parking is interesting.  If you arrive later then they park you three deep.  Hope you never have to leave in a hurry.  Breakfast was one of the better Super 8 breakfasts I've had.  Still though absolutely no protein options so you're not going to stay full for long with just the carb options they offer.
So easy to get from the hotel to Disney parking and back. Love the hardwood floors and plenty of counter space.

Summary Heading: great family friendly place to stay
Summary: I LOVE that this is so close to Disneyland and extremely reasonable for its location. The cute little breakfast area doesn't have a huge variety but my kids wouldn't miss it for the world. The staff is very nice and the rooms are always clean and comfortable.

30 minute walk to Disneyland entrance through Downtown Disney. Can get to tram at parking structure but the new parking setup makes it a pain to get to the park entrances from pretty much anywhere in the area. Rooms were clean and they had us set up with adjoining rooms. Staff was very good. Probably best deal in the area.

Summary Heading: The hotel was fine. Rooms clean. Not too much noise...
Summary: The hotel was fine. Rooms clean. Not too much noise. Breakfast offerings were average. Staff was friendly and helpful. My main complaint was in regards to the distance to Disneyland from the hotel. The walk to Disneyland is longer than stated. You have to go through a VERY busy intersection and there is a portion that is uphill (on an overpass), then (if you know your way around and take the shortest route) you come through security check at Downtown Disney on the end furthest from the Park entrances and walk all the way through Downtown Disney. We had 3 strollers and the walk was a challenge especially by the end of the day.

I made a reservation at least 3 months in advance and I realized that I was going to fly in later than one of my friends staying with me who they allowed to check in. We also ran a half marathon that morning and while check out was originally 11:00am they allowed us an extra hour to finish up to check out. Walking distance to Disneyland and very comfortable rooms.
The staff was very helpful, room was clean and a good place to rest at night. Breakfast was okay, they could use more fruit.

The room was very clean and updated. It had a refrigerator and microwave. The bed was very comfortable. The only reason I gave four stars is the walls and ceiling are thin so you hear the people in the room above walking around and everyone walking by outside. This could be an issue if you are a light sleeper. I did not have an opportunity to eat the breakfast so I can't comment on it. I would stay here again. The staff was also very polite.
yes they wash there sheets but not the blankets,very disappointed we paid 135.00 a night,and the blankets smelled like dirty feet.
The hotel is not close to restaurants.  If you need to walk to the convention center, its a bit of a hike.  Its older so if you stay on the ground floor, its noisy.
This hotel was clean and at a reasonable price. Just a 3 min walk to the city bus stop or about a 20 min walk to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Comfortable, Cheap, Walking Distance to Disney, But Needs an Update
Summary: I stayed for four nights during the Disneyland Tinkerbell half marathon weekend. This hotel is within walking distance of Disney, about three quarters of a mile to the Downtown Disney entrance with sidewalks the whole way.   The staff was friendly at check-in. My room was immediately available on the ground floor. The overall first impression was good. The room appeared clean on first glance. The sheets are always the first thing I check, and they were clean. The A/C was turned off, the microwave and fridge were unplugged. Both were for energy saving reasons, which I thought was responsible considering California's energy issues. The room was out of date and showing age, it could use a facelift, but that is more of a visual critique than of the function of the room.   As I moved

Location next to Disneyland in walking distance. Good for runDisney events. Comfortable room and quiet despite being so close to the resort. Good breakfast and free parking make this a great location for a Disney trip!

this is my first time staying at this hotel and i don't recommend it. When i opened the door to my room it had a very bad smell, The beds were hard and when i looked at the bathroom it was dirty and so was the towels, i don't recommend using there towels because it was dirty. The breakfast was ok. During the middle of the night you could hear people talking, and above you could hear people walking and it was very loud.

Rooms are nice and meet expectations.  You can see the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel.  Pool was dirty--hadn't been cleaned in awhile.  This isn't the hotels fault, but I booked thinking I could walk with my family to Disneyland (we had done so on our last trip about two years ago), but DL had closed their nearest entrance so now you have to walk all the way through Downtown Disney to go through a security checkpoint.  Now it is about a 40 minute walk when it used to be about 20.  We ended up paying for parking because it was just too far with two little kids.  If I would have known I would have probably booked a cheaper hotel a little farther away since we had to drive anyway.  But if you drive it is just a couple of minutes to parking.

The room was clean, & the bed was comfortable.  We would stay here again for sure.  However, it's not an easy walk to the parks.  There's a long hill.   We were told it was easy to walk to the tram, but we never found the tram until we got to the parks.  Anyone planning to stay here probably needs to drive & park at Disney unless you're in good shape & like a hike.  The hotel is very conveniently located.  Just remember to make a left turn when coming down the hill BEFORE the hotel & go around the block to come back to the entrance.

Summary Heading: People were up running around each morning at like 6:00...
Summary: People were up running around each morning at like 6:00 AM.  People were talking loudly and kids were jumping up and down just pounding on their floor which was our ceiling! That also happened around  midnight or so.   The beds are really uncomfortable and so are the pillows it made my lower back hurt.   Good luck getting any sleep there.   The pool was dirty every day.   The key card for the room took like five or more times to slide in and out before it actually opened the door.  The first night we were there they had a huge bus they Let park  in their parking lot that was causing problems with parking anywhere close.   We mentioned to the staff that there were a lot of noisy people quite early in the morning and they acted like well that's how it is.   I stayed here about 4

The staff were great we had a big top floor room that had been upgraded. Comfortable beds, rough towels. We never tried the continental breakfast that was included, we did hop in the pool/hot tub a couple of times which is located in the parking.it's a fifteen minute walk to the park or you can tack bus 11 of the ART line which was very inconsistent.Best bang for our buck, and though the staff were great I think we'd stay closer next time.

We like staying at this hotel when we plan to go to Disneyland because it is easy and close. Parking lot is always crowded and not the best design but other than that it is a great stay for a reasonable cost.

The front desk staff were sooo rude!! Our keys didn't work and we had to go to the front office multiple times to try to get them to work. The 3rd time at the front desk the guy working snidely said to his co-worker "you're going to have to show her". I was taken back by his rudeness and obviously he felt that I wasn't smart enough to operate their key card. The front desk woman could not get the keys to work either. Surprise! There was no complimentary shampoo or conditioner in the room. At 6:15A we called to the front desk to ask for some, and the rude guy answered that we could come down to the front desk to get some. The parking lot was so small that they only allowed 1 spot per reservation and we had 2 cars. They told us one of the cars would need to park behind the hotel

We booked a room here for the 1 night we did not have a reservation at Disney‚Äôs Grand Californian.  The room was comfortable and clean and we did not have a problem parking (as had been my concern).  There is an elevator.  Vending machines and ice were available and there is a convenience store a short walk away.  Breakfast was basic, which did not matter to us since we had plans to eat elsewhere.  Although we were given directions by the polite man at the front desk, we could not figure out how to get to the tram station in the nearby parking garage to get to the Disney attractions.  We walked all the way to Downtown Disney in about 15 minutes, which was fine with us since we enjoy walking.  A walk to either of the parks would have been about 20; I don‚Äôt know if I could have
From all the hotel around the area super 8 was the best offer I could have gotten every other place was about 500 for two night this one was 348 for two nights.
The only issues I had were that the pool was not heated and was very cold. The breakfast was not very good and the options very limited.

Summary Heading: Disappointing ... not up to Super 8 Standards
Summary: Our room was very dated.  All appliances, lamps, microwaves etc were unplugged and we needed to crawl on the floor to locate plug ins.  Breakfast ended at 9 am and at 8:40 AM when we arrived there was barely any food left to chose from.  3 or 4 crusts of bread, a few donuts, 1 lone waffle and milk was almost empty, and juices were empty.  No yogurt, no fruit.  No spoons available to eat cereal.  Promptly at 9 am, while still eating, the staff came in and quickly cleared EVERYTHING within 2 - 3 minutes.   Area was small and all tables were dirty on arrival.  I did not see any staff to ask for assistance until 9 am - and the answer given to me at that time was, No sorry, all is finished.  Sad.  I expected more.

I booked online with booking.com. What made my decision in choosing Super 9 was the  " Just across the street from Disneyland "   We were not just hahah, the room was nice a bog, However,there is a creepy door in the room, I'm guessing that can lead to the room next door.   Cleanliness: I gave a Average due to the bath room.  Tub was molded..   Also, there was only 8 channels, parking was poor.  Check-in was quick and easy..
If you are looking for a reasonably priced place to sleep while you are at Disney, this is a good choice. My biggest problem was that the hair dryer shorted out as I was using it.

We have been staying here for over 10 years and it has become our second home. The staff is by far the most helpful, and personable we have ever encountered at any facility we have stayed. Its really difficult to have to stay somewhere else when we travel because we are so used to being treated as wonderful as we are by the entire staff here. So for that very reason we will continue to stay here. IT also is sooo close to Disneyland parking garage it  makes it very easy to get there without any trouble at all....

Summary Heading: Perfect room with walking distance to Disneyland park
Summary: The room was clean and no carpets which was awesome! the place was clean and looked like it has just been upgraded. Had all the amenities you would need. The pool is not heated so it was freezing cold in March however it was kept clean and the hot tub was still usable. The hotel has a complimentary breakfast that is your usual cereal, yogurt and muffins. Nothing to complain about. We walked to the park every day as it was close and easy to get to. You will need to cross the highway and if you cut through the package you can hop on the shuttle that takes you right to the park. If you don't do this the walk is a bit long. Only downfall to this place is that there is no shuttle to the park you have to find your own way. I would defiantly stay here again.

Second time staying here when we arrived we needed another room they were very busy but it wasn't to much trouble. The rooms are dated but very clean and comfortable. They organized tours for us and Disney is only a 10 min walk. Close to a couple supermarkets and a few dining options as well

Room smelled bad, shower pressure poor.  Otherwise, everything else worked.  Air condition solid, nice to have a fridge & microwave in room.  Beds could be more comfortable, but we slept well.  Nice to be able to park here and walk to the tram.  Didn't bother with the pool or breakfast, strictly a place to crash and spend all our time at Disneyland & California Adventure.

Summary Heading: The walk to Disneyland parking was farther then stated.
Summary: The walk to Disneyland parking was farther then stated. The air conditioner went out during my stay. I did not like the floors, there was no carpet and the breakfast was not good at all. Doughnuts, cold cereal and oatmeal that I had to throw out because they only had Styrofoam bowls and they melt in the microwave.  The staff was nice and they let me check in early. This was the only plus.

The room was as advertised and clean.  We were told that access to Disneyland was available nearby but were unable to locate it.  We ended up taking the 25 minute walk both ways, which can be a long time when with children.  As others mentioned, the staff were often unable to keep the breakfast food items in stock.  Staff were helpful when correcting a reservation that I had made through Wyndham but was later cancelled by Wyndham, for some unknown reason.

The room was not cleaned well at all. The bathtub still had stains inside.Our bath mat had black mold on it so I complained to the hotel clerk at the desk and he told me he would take care of the problem and the room will be cleaned once I return back. Well, when I got back they did "clean" the room again but the same bath mat was still there with the mold! Apparently, my concern was not handled correctly. I also did not like the towels, they felt really rough, they had stains on them and they were tiny towels! The only good thing about this hotel was it's location, otherwise the pictures from the website did not to this hotel justice. I'm very disappointed, I will not be returning here.

The staff were so helpful and good about putting me in a nice room for the night. The room was clean and the A/C worked good. I felt secure. For a lower budget room, it was a quality stay for me.  The only draw back was getting into the property depending on the direction you are coming from. Still, it wasn't a big issue at all.
I had a wonderful stay at Super 8 me and my family are very satisfied with everything I'll definitely be back for a next Family Vacation

Summary Heading: Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable...
Summary: Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable. People at front desk were very polite and helpful. I will be going back!!

We decided to stay at this hotel because of how close it is to Disneyland but regret it to the fullest. The place itself was decent but the service made the stay a horrible experience. A complete disregard for their guest needs. I felt as if I were an inconvenience/ bother to the front desk employees.
The location is within walking distance to Downtown Disney and is a good value. The room and amenities were more than adequate.

If you are looking for crisp white sheets & fluffy Towels this is not the place for you!  This is an older style motel but it IS clean and if you get to the dining room early enough there is a complimentary breakfast to start your day.  This motel was booked by accident by my travel agent and it was ok but keep in mind it is a 30 min walk to Disneyland with children and there is really nothing around that area to buy food ect from other than a petrol station.  The web site states the tram is next door, this is not really correct it is the same distance to walk to the tram as it is to walk to Disneyland and at the end of a long day it was to much for the kids to walk back the result being over $100 in Uber fares for the 9 days we were there, my advise would be to stay closer to
The Super 8 has always been one of our preferred hotels.  We are frequent Disneyland visitors and have never had a single complaint about this property!

I love staying at this hotel since it is extremely affordable and super close to Disney Land. Unfortunately the bathroom/toilet was pretty dirty and the floors had not been cleaned in quite some time because when I walked in my socks, they turned black.  The crack under the door is huge so you can hear everything going on outside.
We stayed for 2 nights. Overall it was good. Had breakfast, Internet, TV, and it was quiet. Perfectly located by Disneyland

Stayed here for a week while visiting Disneyland. About 20min walk to the tram or faster if you find the cast parking lot shortcut.  The room was clean and comfortable. The pool entertained the kids during our breaks from seeing Mickey. Breakfast was ok. I have had better and more nutritious breakfasts at other hotels. My only complaint would be to ensure you get to breakfast early as the restocking was sometimes very slow or nonexistent.

Overall nice facility, well kept, very nice staff. If you are OK with a longer walk to Disney, it can be a good value. It's a bit further walk than advertised due to changes in security checkpoints at Downtown Disney. Taking the parking lot tram is no real advantage. Breakfast is basic and hours are short (7am-9am), but we made the best of it. Only two guest washer/dryers and one was broken, so we went to a laundromat instead. Biggest complaint: dryest, scratchiest towels we've ever experienced at a hotel. Despite the negatives, if the price was right we would probably stay there again.

Plenty of elbow room. Clean, beds were slightly firmer than I prefer, however comfortable. The bathroom vanity area is very spacious and well designed. Friendly and helpful staff. Very accommodating. You need to have transportation, there is only a small store in walking distance. I highly recommend you use Uber for moving about. This made life wonderful in and out if Disney. A bit disappointed about the breakfast being removed promptly at 9:00. Too early. Footsteps can be heard above your head, so be courteous for those below you or ask for the top floor. Parents, Disney is exciting, however your little one's up at 4:30AM and bouncing around on the outside walkways is really rude.
Easy to get to Disney, reasonable priced, clean, you spend all your time at parks so as long as clean & comfortable it works, been staying here for 8 plus years
20 min Walking distance to Disneyland for older kids. Clean, friendly staff. Disneyland passes were cheaper at the front desk than online.

Although the room rate was reasonable,and our rooms were clean, they all (4) smelled very musty. The location is great if you are going to Disneyland (12-15 min walk). The breakfast was very disappointing. There was no protein, just carbs, carbs & more carbs (Donuts, toast, eggo waffles).

Very convenient to Disneyland...within walking distance. Rooms have always been clean and tidy. Nothing fancy but beds are comfortable, especially after a long day! Only issue is with parking at the motel. My friend had to park her car on the street in the back and got a parking ticket!

Typical budget hotel.  Hardwood floors were nice.  Bed was comfortable. Bathroom is showing wear but was clean.  Included a microwave and small fridge.  Wifi was slow and unsecure so best not to use it.  I used my phone as a hotspot.    If going to disneyland the number 11 bus is about a 3-5 minute walk across ball street.  about a 20 minute trip if you time the bus right.  closer to 30 minutes on the way back as you have to go all the way to walnut and turn around because there isn't a stop on the other side of the street.   Breakfast is free but you get what you pay for.  cold cereal, instant oatmeal if some other family didn't steal the entire bowl for their personal use.  juice and milk, donuts, toaster waffles.  The only fruit on my stay was apples.    Closest restaurant to

The room we received was very clean and the front desk was very helpful and friendly. The location is about a 12 minute walk to Disneyland me and my family will return for sure and the rates are great
My reservation was cancelled. Was charged more. They claim my card didn't work.charged my card double

This is the second time my family has stayed here. It has great easy access to Disneyland. Rooms were very comfortable, staff friendly, and helpful. This trip I had more of my children with us so we had adjoining rooms, my son accidentally closed the a adjoining room with the security lock on. Staff was so understanding and helpful. I will absolutely return here on my next Disney trip.
Our room was very clean, the staff was great and the food was fresh. Other than doing a quick check for hair on the towels it was very clean.
First room was a handicap room with the elevator on the back wall, very noisy. Second night the room was good. Had to ask the breakfast staff to refill the items each morning.
Rooms were very nice. Breakfast was ok for grab and go not a full breakfast. No transportation to Disney. 12 min walk from Downtown Disney.

This hotel was clean and comfortable and within walking distance to the Disneyland parks which saved us $36/day on parking. The only complaint was the continental breakfast which had only doughnuts, Frosted Flakes and sugary instant oatmeal - no protein or fruit. But it was worth it being so close to the theme park.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, close to Disneyland,  will definitely stay there again
Summary: This was a great place to stay,  the room was clean, they came and changed the towels and face towels everyday, the breakfast was good and they had a good variety. The location was very close to Disneyland. The price was great,  and I definitely will stay here again.

This Super 8 is close to Disney but if you happen to come in from the south a u-turn is necessary to get to the motel.  It is close to traffic but not that noisy.  A GPS will get you there with no problem.

Staying at the Super 8 Anaheim/Disney Drive gives a consistent ambience, provisions & accomodations. Prices are always great. Easy access to the 5 story Mickey & Friends parking structure 1 block south.

Summary Heading: Solid Value, but room for improvement
Summary: Only a mile walk from the Disneyland gates so we didn't have to rent a car which was huge. Rooms appear to be recently renovated. The inside is much more appealing than the outside would have you believe. The beds aren't luxurious but they're comfy enough. TV channels were disappointing (no ESPN? are you kidding?). The internet is free but is horribly slow and cuts in and out. Breakfast was crazy short (2 hours) especially when it is all packaged food (doughnuts, cereal, toast). My BIGGEST complaint is the towels. I'm pretty sure they're kid-sized towels that have been washed a million times because they were thin and pathetic and unreasonably small. Went during the winter so the pool wasn't an appeal but I can see it being way too small and crowded during the hotter months.

I requested bottom floor way in advance and was given a handicap room when I did not need this. I was then moved to the noisiest room facing traffic I was finally moved to the 2nd level   The hairdryer fell apart in my hand exposing all electrical wires and stayed turned on  Hair on towels not belonging to us  The air conditioner leaked water in the 2nd night and I had to be moved again.  Roger the manager offered 30% off my bill after I asked since there were so many problems   But at checkout he changed his offer to 30% off only 1 night   Very disappointing stay
Hotel was a great location. It's was only 5 minutes walk to Disneyland. The rooms were clean but staff wasn't too friendly. The breakfast isn't worth it. It's not hot or freshly made..
Put in room that faced Disneyland Dr so street traffic loud making it hard to sleep. Loved new flooring. Unfortunately housekeeping didn't make a return to make beds 1st day

A great price for the location (literally in the shadow of Disneyland) and for newly renovated rooms, would recommend to everyone as price is half of what you would pay for same room in nearly every other hotel in the area.
It is a very basic motel, but the room was quiet and clean, and the staff was considerate and helpful

staff was wonderful, beds were very comfortable, room large .Airconditioner was new and updated. The towels, sheets were very old and worn and shower curtain were a bit tattered. they could use replacing.

Summary Heading: No follow through P.S. I am a GM too!!!
Summary: My first night the floors were dirty. I made the staff aware of the issue & insured me it would be addressed. Once I checked out and made it home. I realized I had left a personal sentimental valued item in my room. I called and spoke with Xavier. He "checked" to see if my item had been turned in and he confirmed it hadn't. I brought the floor issue up again and he assured that the Gm would follow up with me and here we are a week later and I have yet to hear back.

Summary Heading: Worst place to stay!! DO NIT STAY HERE!
Summary: First of all, they ARE NOT NEAR DISNEYLAND AT ALL!! they say they're 0.2 miles to Disneyland on their ad when in reality they are near the farthest Disneyland parking lot. We walked it from the hotel to Disney entrance for almost 30 minutes nonstop, with my 2 kids which was horrible and at night when your walking back to your from disney it's such a lonely Avenue to walk by it's so scary.     We got to the room the first night and as soln as you walked in it stunk like sewer all over. I called the staff to see if they can change us rooms and they said they were all booked that night in a very rude way, not willing to helpful at all. The beds were so uncomfortable and disgusting. I don't know how my family and I ended up there. SO DISAPPOINTED OF LOCATION, RUDE STAFF, DISGUSTING

We have stayed at this Super 8 motel for at least half a dozen times in January so we can go to The NAMM Show at the Anaheim Convention Center. I was a little displeased that the rates went up this year compared to the last couple years.

There were 2 front desk staff when we checked in which were very unpleasant.  My husband I were asking a lot of questions about our method of payment, nearby restaurants, shuttle services, etc. and he was very short acting as if were bothering him with our questions. The breakfast room was a disaster, there were several unoccupied tables and were dirty, they were out of a lot of stuff and the breakfast ladies were no where to be found.  Thankfully the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Nice motel for a reasonable price!
Summary: This motel was perfect for our needs. It wasn't super fancy, but we were in town for a convention and Disneyland so we were only in our room to sleep and bathe. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. We arrived very early, way before check-in time and our room was already cleaned and ready for us. It is only a $5 uber ride to Disneyland or the Anaheim Convention center. Disneyland is within walking distance via Disneyland drive, especially if you walk to the mickey and friends parking structure then take the tram. The staff was friendly as well. The view of the fireworks nightly was awesome as well!

The location and beds are great. The breakfast options were carbs on carbs. There wasn't any fruit, the only options were toast, eggo waffles, cereal, or donuts. Usually there is at least some fruit available. We ended up eating breakfast out the rest of our stay. Given the proximity to Disneyland I understand that the price is going to be inflated, but I still feel it's overpriced for what you get.

Room was over priced, Internet was lousy at best, Microwave didn't work, Hair dryer didn't work. Specifically asked for a 1st floor room because myself and spouse are disabled when booked this hotel back in July 2016. We were given a second floor room far from the elevator also had to park behind the hotel because of lack of parking in front of rooms, (FYI during our visit Anaheim received 4" of rain and we had to maneuver through it to get to our room)
The location was hard to find and map quest sends you in the back of the hotel and on a dead end residential.
Property has been nicely updated since last stay.  Friendly, courteous staff, couldn't have been nicer.  Breakfast for me just so-so.  Weak coffee. Would absolutely stay again. Good value.

Summary Heading: ROACHES!!!!! 150 dollars a night for ROACHES!!!!
Summary: Yuck we checked in room spelled like an old mop.We were running a little late for business event so we put bags in room opened window and left . Well we got back really late and it was pouring raining so I told my husband I'll complain n the am. Well  took my jewelry off placed it on night stand and disturb the locals.... The roaches scattered baby roaches Omg.... We slept in our clothes on top of the cover. Told the girl at front desk and all she could say was sorry I'll tell the owner but I can't take$$$off the bill well I hadn't even asked for a refund But I should have I j wanted to leave we were going to stay two nights but I can't... Roaches Lord I hope I didn't bring home no strays.

Hi me and my wife needed a cheap for for 3 nights 4 days. And we found this super 8, the location is great especially for the price. It's a mile walk to Disneyland or a 5 dollar Uber ride. But over all the room was clean bathroom was a bit small and they had coffee and donuts in the morning so all in all a good room for the price
Was a nice place.  It was very quiet and the room was very nice.  Very comfortable bed.  Water pressure was not the best, but I blame that on the drought.

This place is good, convenient location, clean, with small parking lot only for residents. The only thing I don't like was the breakfast is very poor and when you get there has to ask and ask and ask for the few things they care in the continental breakfast.

Our stay was enjoyable. The room was clean and beds were comfortable. Check in was easy and staff was friendly. Downsides were the breakfast bar was far from great. More options would have been better. Also the distance of the hotel is a little further than what was explained to me when I booked the hotel. And lastly...our room was room 130. I had some work that needed to be done while on this trip. It was nearly impossible for me to get a good connection. I even called the front desk for some help, (enabling cookies, and pop ups) but it still didn't help. I had to do my work elsewhere was I felt was really inconvenient. Other than that, our stay was pleasant.

Summary Heading: Good, clean and perfect location for disney
Summary: Rooms are very large and clean. Staff were very kind. Location is perfect for  disneyland at walk!!! Only the breakfast was not so good. Price ok

Summary Heading: My stay at the super 8 motel
Summary: My stay at the super 8 motel was not worth the money paid. Our room was in a corner on the bottom floor that was located across from a utility room of some sort. The machinery in that room was noisy a few times every hour. There was a constant knock on the wall throughout the entire stay, the room was not well lit and the wallpaper was peeling. We only had 2 pillows for a king sized bed which were standard sized pillows instead of King sized pillows. The breakfast was simple which was fine but the doughnuts provided were stale and tasted old. The parking was also very tight in a full sized truck.
I've stayed here before and didn't have a problem. This time around though we reserved 3 rooms. All have hairs in bathrooms and bed. Disappointing.

Summary Heading: Super Place to stay, great rooms.
Summary: We love staying here! I just would like them to have the Disney channel, so the kids have something to watch at night! The rooms are great!
Had s great time at Disneyland. The hotel was right by everything. The room was comfortable slept great no issues

It was my 5th stay at Super 8, Disneyland drive. The rooms are always very clean. I liked the new laminate floors instead of carpets, although I think a mat in front of the door would be nice. Staff is (mostly) always friendly and helpful. Breakfast is basic Super 8, what you can expect. But we were happy and got some breakfast before heading to Disney.  Pretty good location, 15-20 minutes walk to Downtown Disney/Disney parks. You can also walk to the Mickey & Friends parking lot and take the tram, which is nice after a long day at the parks.   I do have one complaint, a thing that was a big issue for us - wifi! The connection was very very poor. One night I couldn't get connected at all. The other days it had just been a really slow connection (wasn't able to send or upload

Had a good overall experience here at Super 8 @ Disney drive. Everything was close and didn't have to go further than 2 freeway exits to get what I needed. Did have a lot of Internet issues. It kept disconnecting until eventually we gave up on it.

Booked online, arrived in the evening, wasn't given instructions for breakfast no internet aces given, when asked the next day since we got back late, they said oh sorry by that time we were checking out and when we arrived at night there was no parking even though we were told they had a space for us we had to park blocking the exit and we're asked what time we could move the car...it was weird and we got up extra early to move our car so others could leave the property
Big beds, but not super comfortable at all. Rooms not sound proof at all, neighbors up very late, wind howling through room made for some sleepless nights.
stayed overnight, clean and nice hotel room with everything necessary for a nice night stay. I plan on staying here again whenever i visit disneyland again.
Always go to Super 8, locations and staff are the best....redecorated the room and its lovely...My home when in Disneyland

Summary Heading: Very surprised and a great deal
Summary: Unsure about booking this Super 8 after reading some of the reviews but we found it to be a good deal for the area.  Room is very clean - asked for top floor (3rd) overlooking pool.  Yes the road is noisy but location on Disneyland Drive convenient.  Especially as we took the local buses from Long Beach airport which has to be the bargain of the year.  Breakfast consisted of oatmeal, raisin bran, waffles, toast with jam or syrup.  Bakery style donuts and prepackaged super 8 cinammon rolls!  Apples.  Get there when they open the door at 0700 and we felt it was more than adequate.  Good shower pressure - wifi signal ok.  Slept well - bed comfortable - they could probably replace pillows but were adequate.

I was hesitant thinking a hotel right by Disneyland and affordable?  What a pleasant surprise when we  got there.  The staff is fabulous and the rooms are clean and comfortable.  Short walk to Disney tram.  I would recommend to anyone with a Disney destination!  We will definitely use again and recommend to friends and family...plus you can't beat the price.

Summary Heading: Good but there can be some improvements
Summary: The hotel location is perfect , the rooms clean and spacious HOWEVER they only provide ONE pillow per guess. When I call the front desk to ask for more pillows they have an attitude about it and said WE DON'T HAVE ANY EXTRA PILLOWS.  The continental breakfast is very poor only donuts and cereal.

Staff should alert guests to the fact the Disney fireworks show is very close and loud. It was fabulous to be able to see them, but when you don't know what the noise is when they start, it can be quite startling.

Rooms were not ready at check in . No shower curtain or towels in room . Was accidentally charged double for two rooms resulting on a hold on my bank account for a large amount of funds . Due to glitch my family and I were unable to proceed with our family vacation . Never Again .. !!!!

It's very close to Disneyland. However, for the money I paid. The bed was extremely uncomfortable.. internet was lacking.. and they had no extra pillows.  The room was clean however and I felt safe having my kid there with me.  Nice place. Just a bit over priced for what they offer.

We were only spending 3 nights in Anaheim right before for Christmas, so hotel rates were quite inflated.  The Super 8 was reasonably priced and within walking distance of Disneyland so we gave it a try.  It was clean, staff was very pleasant and we enjoyed our stay.

We stayed 9 days. Parking was tight, so we parked around back, but on the 3rd day of our stay, they closed off that parking and we were forces to park quite a distance from our room. We were told breakfast would be available 7-9am, but on 2 different mornings we were disappointed to find absolutely nothing available, even though it was only 8:30am. When I asked the young lady at the front desk about it, she wouldn't even look up from her computer keyboard and simply shrugged her shoulders. She didn't even mumble "sorry" or anything. On our last day, we asked if we could have a document faxed to the office from our daughter's doctor. They were kind enough to say yes, but when we went to pick it up, we were informed that they had received it, but couldn't print it because they

Summary Heading: It waa fine for the night, but the breakfast was only...
Summary: It waa fine for the night, but the breakfast was only toast,, a few donuts and that was it, and we went early

We were visiting California Adventure so the hotel was within pleasant walking distance.The rooms are basic, clean and comfortable and good value. Breakfast is included in the rate with cereals, toast, pastries, fruit etc. Good laundry area with washers and driers that operate at quick speed - no waiting around for ages for clothes to dry! Erwin at Reception was always helpful. Probably the only downside is the air con in the room was a bit noisy and there are no eating options close by (although a few places will deliver)

Check in was pleasant, nice guy working desk.  BUT maybe workers in the lot were scary.  They watched us arrive, watched us walk in, walked us park, watched unload our car, and watched us walking to our room.  My spouse actually wanted to go get something to eat but he would not leave me alone at the hotel due to the men outside, we were not sure if they were staying there but we think they were working there.  We actually put a chair and a table against our door when we went to sleep.  Bed was clean.  I removed the huge hair ball from behind the bathroom door before my spouse saw it.  And I removed the long black hairs from the shower after I was in it.  We were going to leave the car in the lot and walk back and forth to the park, but due to the guys being in the lot at check

On the weekends, when it is busy, there is not enough parking for all of the occupants. The rooms were okay, but thin walls and lack of parking are a problem for a resort area. Oh, and if you want that free breakfast of donuts, make sure you get there right when they open it up, otherwise you're stuck with toast and coffee.

My sister and I are annual pass holders At Disneyland and go at least once a month. I have stayed multiple times at the Super 8 and convinced my sister to stay here because of the value and general cleanliness. We checked into Our room about 11 pm, and within 10 minutes a fight broke out in the room next door. We could hear women calling each other names, and the sound of fist connecting with person. We also heard Someone getting tased, and a woman screaming "he raped me!"  My sister immediately called the police. We were both so distraught that we couldn't even sleep. We checked out the next morning, and when I asked the manager to be reimbursed for the previous night..he only gave me half back and didn't Even apologize! I work in customer service and give full refunds for far

we have stayed at this facility in the past, many years ago. We visit the area often, and in the past we have been fortunate that we have been able to stay in other locations, only due to proximity of the other locations to Disney.  Due to late plans we decide and had no choice due to other locations being fully booked. When we entered the property we were pleasantly surprised that this property was still looking good, and had been renovated and painted on the outside of the buildings.  When we entered our room, the room we were staying in, looked great, fresh, and smelled clean.  We were surprised it had been updated and looked great.  The mattresses felt wonderful, we all slept very.  I would like to say, though we had not stayed in this property in the last 10 years, only due

Summary Heading: Don't always get what you pay for...
Summary: Although you could tell the management was trying to present a nice room (newer floors, nice counter) the room itself smelled like bug spray, the linen and pillows also smelled of a strong unpleasant  odor, there was even a giant roach in the bathtub. We were only provided with 3 bath towels even though we were a family of 4. The pillows were small and and useless and there were only 2 per bed. For the price I was not impressed and will not be returning.

Summary Heading: Always our go to for Disneyland
Summary: This super 8 is nothing like you would expect from a super 8 in other locations. Hardwood floors, Samsung flat screen, great water pressure, great space, and much more.

Summary Heading: Excellent walking distance to Disneyland Park Nice Breakfast
Summary: This motel is the perfect place to stay if wanting to avoid traffic and fees to park at Disneyland. The continental breakfast could use a little more options for warm food i.e.: eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits gravy. I would stay again rooms big and it is surprisingly quiet next to a major highway.

Summary Heading: Clean with a Small Parking Lot
Summary: Our extended family booked Super 8 for a quick visit to California Adventure.  Part of our group arrived late Saturday and the rest of us early Sunday morning.  We had no problems checking in and the front desk clerks were very helpful.  We asked for rooms to be near each other and that is what we received.  The rooms were large and clean with a microwave and refrigerator in the rooms.  Our rooms had laminate flooring vs carpeting.  The parking lot only has room for 1 car for each reservation.  Only one way in/out and secure.    The front door to the lobby opened at 7 am when breakfast started.  No sausage or eggs, but enough choices to fill you up.  Donuts, toaster waffles, fruit, juice, cereal, oatmeal, hot chocolate mix, coffee, and bread.  If you are walking to

Can't beat the location if you are going to Disneyland but that said, this place is only good for a room and a shower. The breakfast was totally gone by the time we went (close to closing) and the WIFI didn't reach our room.
Convenient location with a very clean and up-to-date room.  Being a Wyndham member made reservations easy and allowed us a good value.

We stayed at Super 8 Anaheim and found it very average for the price we paid. Amenities were basic. The hotel is old. Fixtures, bathroom were old. Breakfast facility was clean. But the choices of items at breakfast was very poor. (No eggs; Only strudels, sugar spiked baked goods; There was some cereal, milk, bread and yogurt; But overall poor choices ). No shuttle to get to Disneyland. Not an easy walk when you have kids. Bed was good.

This motel was not as nice as the Holiday Inn Express in Garden Grove and was just as expensive. It was clean and basic. The bed was not as firm and there was only a continental breakfast. That means there were pastries, toast, juice, cereal, and coffee. But super close to Disneyland. You can take a tram into Disneyland which is 6 mins away. Ask the front desk for directions. The staff was pretty nice and accommodated us as much as possible. Note: Even though I selected this motel as "budget", it was the same price as a Holiday Inn. But on the grand scheme of budget vs. expensive it was more on the less expensive side.

We've stayed here numerous times.  Price is always competitive, and if you are going to Disneyland it is possible to walk and save on parking.  Rooms are always clean and have both a fridge & microwave.  Only downside is the parking situation if you are there on a full night, they have to double park cars to get everyone parked.  But they do coordinate when people expect to leave so we've never been impacted by it.
We had a group of 10 and this place accomodated us nicely.  Connecting rooms, extra pillows for the expecting mom, plenty of towels.  Breakfast was very basic but good.

Summary Heading: Great location---easy walk to the Disneyland Resort
Summary: We just stayed here for 5 nights as we participated in a Disney Half Marathon.  The location was excellent. The rooms were comfortable, spacious & very clean.  Breakfast was adequate not great. Would stay here again.
I Took my family to Disneyland for the weekend and had a very good experience with my Stay at Super 8,  quick check-in, came back every night to clean rooms, pretty good overall experience.

We stayed at the super 8 so we would be close to the park. We were running in the Super Heroes 10K and half marathon. We just needed some where to sleep, and it offered free parking, wi-fi, and breakfast. Breakfast closes at 9am- something that was not explained to us at check in. The lady with the brown hair and glasses who checked us in was not very friendly. The rest of the staff was great. The AC is our room did not seen to work properly, our room was very humid despite the AC being set at 69.
It was very dirty! Hair in beds and in bathroom sink! I would not recommend this dump to anyone!

The price is very reasonable. Walking distance to the park. The rooms were clean. The bed was very hard and I found it extremely uncomfortable and had a hard time sleeping. Noisy in the morning; thin walls and you can hear people walking above you pretty loudly.  The breakfast is 7-9am. They have a variety of doughnuts, cereal, eggo waffles, coffee & juice.

Summary Heading: If you're looking for a clean room for a night, this is a good place to stay.
Summary: The check in process was quick and easy. The rooms met our needs. I actually like the wood floors in the room. The rooms had a fridge and microwave. It is a good place to stay if you don't want the "resort" experience and just want to be close to Disneyland. The walk was quick and easy to Downtown Disney. I'd definitely stay again. The only negative was the sound of the trucks picking up the garbage outside. That was a bit disturbing.
Speedy service, great customer care, and amazing rates (for being so close to Disneyland). We'll definitely book again when were back in the area.
Always treated with kindness and fast and easy check in and service. Had to cancel our reservation and was accommodated with fast placement for a different date with no hassles.

We've stayed here twice now and both times have had a nice stay. The pricing is very affordable compared to other hotels. It's a bit of a walk to the trams at the parking structure, but for us, it is well worth it for the price savings. The only negative we can give the hotel is the breakfast options - very basic without a lot of variety. Simple toast, toaster waffles, two cold cereal options, instant oatmeal and donuts.

Summary Heading: Closest Hotel to Disneyland Resort for a budget traveler
Summary: I stayed here during my recent travel to the Disneyland Park. This is actually conveniently located and is exactly a 18 minutes walk from the park. The room has basic amenities just enough to spend a night or two while visiting this part of LA. The breakfast options could have been better.

Summary Heading: what to expect with the price.
Summary: Beds clean, walls paper thin. Heard everything in the rooms next to us. Was up most of the night to the crying little one or someone blowing their nose. Breakfast was high in carbs.  I will not stay here again.

It was a very good experienced, the hotel room was nice and clean no smells of any kind in the room, the only critic I have is that the elevator is carpeted top to bottom and it does stick pretty bad other that that my experience was very good especially for what you pay.
I really like how they refurbished the rooms. Love the lenolium and the walk in showers. The room was really clean and breakfast was nice!

Summary Heading: Dark and drab and smelled bad
Summary: Took my family to Disneyland for a  vacation and decided to give the Super 8 on Disneyland Drive a try.  Check in was great, fast and curtious but that was the only good part about this place!  The room smelled horrible and the window only opened a tiny bit.  There was no fresh air which made us feel like we were in a porto potty!.  It rained while we were there and there was a leak in the ceiling that dripped on us during the night while we tried to sleep.  The breakfast was awful with very limited options.  The bedding felt old and dirty and was even stained! I asked at the front desk for a clean set of sheets and no one ever brought them up!  Ugh! I wish I spent a little more for a cleaner hotel!

The first room I was in, with in an hour of checking in I smelt a sewer smell. water and stuff was coming up from the tub. My room was changed and it also happened in that room. The first room smelt like a heavy pine cleaner.
We stayed at the Super 8 Anaheim/Disneyland drive..  It was great..  I wasn't impressed with the breakfast bar.  But overall the room was great.

We love this super8. It's close to Disneyland, so close you actually get a better view of the parks fireworks than if you were actually in the park! My only complaint is the parking. There isn't enough spots for the amount of rooms. Not sure how they can improve that and it won't keep me away. I will always stylay at this location

Front counter staff always helpful and personable. Room wasnt ready for early check in but that is ok because they allowed us to park our vehicle there and check in after we were done with the Disneyland for the day. Very informative on breakfast times and other restaurants in area. Not so bad of a walk for the price. This is our go to place to stay for our last minute Disney trips throughout the year. Staying here allows us to save $ and use it for character dining and souvenirs.

Hotel is run down. Rooms are run down. Breakfast is frozen waffles. Staff was friendly. If all you need is a room by disney this place is just that. However you would think a place next to disney charging these rates would be nicer.

This Super 8 had been our go to hotel for our Disneyland trips when we have planned to stay the night.  I lost count the number of times my family and I have stayed here.  Some of the reasons we chose to stay here was it close proximity to the Disneyland Resort, comfort and being able to leave our vehicles parked at the hotel the following day while we went to the park.  During our most recent stay, upon check in, I was informed that there was only one vehicle allowed per reservation and that vehicles had to be off property by 11am the day of check out.  Again, my family and I had stayed here numerous times before and never had a problem being able to park 2 vehicles overnight as often times our adult daughter will drive down before my wife and I are able to.  When I asked about
