The room was nice and mostly clean, the bathroom had a few hairs in the shower but other than that it felt pretty clean. The bathroom was a bit outdated but the rest of the room had the updated look and feel. The location was great we were able to walk to the parking structure for Disney, which was about half mile away, and hop on the tram that took us to the entrance of the park. We were also able to watch Disney's fireworks from the hotel on the nights we weren't at Disney and that was fun. The breakfast was really slim pickings and it opened at 7 and we were there at 7:20 so I wasn't really impressed with breakfast so we ate out for breakfast most mornings. I would stay here again.

The food menu in there is a joke.  Check out the yelp reviews before you order and don't use their guide.  Their continental breakfast was all carbs.    The room cleaning was excellent and so was the front desk help.
Had a great stay over the weekend. Parking was tight, but room was comfortable and clean. Would definitely stay again.

The hotel is across the street from Disneyland, it's convenient if you're visiting Downtown Disney, California Adventure or Disneyland. The rooms were decent and came with a TV, A/C, small fridge and microwave. The rooms have window A/C units, I thought they were a bit dated. There's a pool but it's non-heated, so it was a bit cold for a swim in October but there's also a Jacuzzi, that was nice. The hotel offers one parking spot per room, free wifi and continental breakfast. Overall it was a decent hotel for one night.

Summary Heading: Location to disney not as advertised
Summary: The place was nice for the price, being remodeled. Nothing special, breakfast ok. Real close to disney, but not close to entry, still have to walk about 3/4 mile to entry and no shuttle. Advertised as just outside gates which was wrong.

Our visit at the Super 8 was good we were close to everything we needed and wanted. The room itself was okay. there are definitely not enough power outlets, we had to use extension cords and look for outlets. Getting sign into the internet wasn't the easiest it did not allow you to stay on without resigning in. We also had to ask the front desk to send in the serves for cleaning our room at 4:30 in the afternoon because they hadn't done it and were getting ready to go home. We had to wait in Hotel lobby/breakfast room while they cleaned it which we know was quick , easy and probably not done to the standards it would have been if they had cleaned it doing working hours. The staff was good and friendly and location was good.
This was the second time we stayed at this Super8. The location is great, the staff is very accommodating and we will be back again.

The breakfast was free but not exciting. Donuts(that were obviously old) eggo waffles two kinds of cereal and oatmeal. Not even yogurt on most days. I like the other Motel 8 in relation to getting to Disney better. Can just walk not have to take a tram

Summary Heading: The place was great, I would stay there again! The...
Summary: The place was great, I would stay there again! The housekeeper that I saw was not friendly and the lady that was at the breakfast place was not curteous at all

needed a place to stay for the night came in town earlier then expected and found a good deal for the night every other hotel near by i found online wanted almost $200 for the night and i wasnt going to pay that much unless i was there longer, its right at the disneyland gate so easy to get to and if your there for the whole weekend can uber right to the main gate saves time parking and getting to the tram, customer service was great the, the room was perfect for a couple, breakfast is breakfast like most places, and checkout was one and done no hidden fees or charges, got to see a firework show so turned out to be and amazing stay

I have staid here several times over the last few years.  The location is great for Disneyland and the prices are great.  The units are being remodeled and the carpets are being replaced with hardwood.  We like this.

The rooms were great, everything was clean and comfortable. As we were there, they were renovating some of the other rooms, and the one we had gotten was just finished. Wood floors in the main room, heated tile for the bathroom and sink area. Walk-in tile shower was very nice as well.  1 star taken off for the lack of a decent breakfast (frozen waffles and packaged cereal), and the fact that housekeeping almost barged in at 8:30 am. 1 more star taken off by our biggest complaint; CONSTRUCTION. Of the 3 nights we stayed there, we were awoken at 8am by the construction crews working in the rooms RIGHT above us. Talked to the front desk about it the first time, said it would be passed to management. The next morning it happened again, and we were told management hadn't gotten back

This hotel is a great option if you're going to Disneyland. It is located right near the entrance to the main parking structure and takes about 2 min to drive in to the parking lot. It's about a 15 min walk to the  tram if you prefer to walk. The rooms have all been remodeled and the pool is decent. Basically, great for the price especially if you aren't planning on spending a lot of time in the hotel anyway. Parking is also free!

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  I just wish that they put a little more effort into their rooms than what was there. I walked in and none of the appliances were plugged in, and it wasn't very clean from the start.

Clean, safe, and a very short walk to Disney. Beds were comfortable and so were the pillows. An older hotel that has been kept clean and had some updates. Wireless internet worked well. We would stay here again.

Upon check in we were told to give our Credit or debit  card to be held for incidentals and then they immediately ran it for all of the charges in full.  Then 10 minutes later asked to se the card and walked off into a back room with it to make copies.  The girl at the front desk talked about how customers might dispute charges and they needed proof that the customers were in the hotel. But upon check out they refused to tear up the copies and to give them to us so we would now they were destroyed.  We worried all night about how they acted with  the money  and possible identity theft and then they acted very strangely upon check out.  My wife insisted we get to speak to the manager and they said he would be in in a minute and we would wait.  And we asked exactly what time he
My stay was great, the staff were very helpful, I did not have any problems, the room,  facilities and pool were clean everyday. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again
Other hotels in this region literally have some of he worst standards I've seen in American hotels. Super 8 has running water and maids that actually tidy up.
Room was comfortable.  Parking was a problem; we returned at 2 a.m. and it took 20 minutes to be directed to an available parking space.

Summary Heading: Good Location but a little costly for this facility. Great Staff.
Summary: This is a good location but a bit high in cost for the location. Elevator needed a HEAVY DUTY cleaning to remove a VERY BAD smell

Summary Heading: Should have shut down hotel during repaving
Summary: The first room we got one bed was bad. It sunk down. They did not have another room at the time unless we went to 3 floor. I have 2 people who are handicap.  They finally took a room out of Mantance. When we came back to the hotel at night all the parking was blocked. Husband had to move comes for us to park. And it was the same the 2nd night. Our lick on the door was not working right had to get them to clean it. I did complain to corp. office and got a response from hotel with a 15% off future visit.

After leaving la early - horrid villa! We wanted something cheap and near Disney and we found the super 8. From the moment we arrived the staff were fab! We bookin in at 7:30 we couldn't access the room till 3:30 but could leave the car there all day. The car park is monitored by security camera in reception all day so I wasn't worried at all about leaving all the bags!  The pool was small but perfectly adequate- love,y temp and the spa bath was fab too!  Our room was a queen accessible it was lovely and spacious it was very clean. It had a microwave and fridge, a desk and 2 chairs. The only issue we had was our key wouldn't unlock our room - there was an issue with the lock so reception let us in our room that evening after a day at Disney and maintenance fixed it the next
Unfortunatly breakfast is poor crowded noisy and is closed at  9 pm It is incredible in a plac√© were people come on holidays

My wife and I planned for an evening at Disneyland on Saturday and then spend the day in Laguna beach on Sunday. So I booked ahead of time and got the discount price for a Saturday of $89.00. That is a deal beyond anything near Disneyland. Plus the check in was easy,the staff was very nice. The parking is a little tight but if your going to Disneyland don't walk there. Do as the locals do and park in the Disneyland parking lot. Enjoy the full experience of the tram. Don't risk walking across a busy intersection. For the price and locations out can't go wrong. The bed was comfortable and the shower was surprisingly nice as well. Use the motel as it was intended.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, Gets the job done.
Summary: This place is right off the freeway, literally 1 minute away from Disneyland. Bonus was being able to get a great view of Disneyland fireworks at night. This place was cheap and they offer AAA discount on top of that. Breakfast was mediocre (eggo type of waffles you put in toaster, cereal, donuts) and the rooms were fairly clean. Only real room complaint was the tub/bathroom was dirty. The guys in front were very friendly. I would stay here again if on a budget.

We have stayed here in years past and have been very satisfied. This trip was the same if not better. The room had been updated and the gentlemen at the front desk were great! They were polite and efficient with any request we had. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is safe and decently maintained.   We stay here because we can leave our car at the hotel, save on parking, and walk to the Disneyland parking lot tram that takes us to the park (about a 15 minute walk). We plan ahead for meals because besides a gas station there is nothing within walking distance to get some food. They do provide a continental breakfast. We‚Äôve read concerns about parking and it is tight, but not a problem. They constantly monitor the parking with parking permits they issue. They do have a
The rooms were fairly comfortable. Not a bad selection of cable channels. Breakfast not bad for small hotel had waffles,donuts,cereal,toast,apples,and danish.milk,coffee, orange and apple juice.

We stayed here two nights for a short family trip to Disneyland. The hotel was clean. The staff was nice. The room was large and comfortable. I was quiet most of the time we were there. The beds were a bit stiff but that is the only thing that I felt could be improved. Closeness to the parks is a real plus!

The hotel itself was a little overpriced but clean. Pool is tiny, online pics very deceiving the walk to Disneyland is about 15 to 20 minutes but you have to cross over a dangerous bridge to get there. The hotel did let us leave our car there before check-in and after check out without additional fees so we could go back into Disneyland which was nice. If you are looking for a safe close walk to Disneyland this is not the hotel to choose however. You can find closer hotels for the same price range that have a safer walk to Disneyland.
Unannounced day without water when making reservation. COLD shower at 9 pm. Water supposed to be back on and hot at 6pm.

We really Loved this place the staff are really friendly rooms are really clean even the tiny laundry and pool area not a bad breakfast mmmm donuts üòÄ a 10-15min walk to Disney you can still see the fireworks every night we felt really relaxed and at home here

Summary Heading: We have stayed more than once at this spot and it's always good.  Will use again.  The staff is great and location.
Summary: I am always happy to return to this great value hotel. Location is great and the price you can't beat.  Parking is limited but free.  Staff will be sure to help with that so it's never a big issue. Rooms are clean and good for the price. We will use again.

Summary Heading: Good Service but dirty and run down rooms
Summary: The service was good at the front desk and the housekeeper we met when we had to call because we didn't have a shower curtain, but I'm glad we brought our own sheets and pillows...and towels.  It was just very dirty and old.

Had a great time at super 8, accommodating for me my kids aunt and my handicap uncle. Got the extra towels for the pool, and the extra pillows were perfect  the beds were like clouds...don't care what others places are near by this is my hotel for sure we'll be back for the great customer service.had all my questions answered and every employee were so nice  Only wish they had more breakfast options, for special diets but over all great experience the guy that works the breakfast was so nice and accommodating he handled breakfast with a perfect pace nothing was ever empty and we were able to check out with ease I forgot his name but he was awesome

Summary: This Hotel is great for so many reasons. It's perfectly in walking distance of Disneyland, there's an ARCO at the corner on your way back in case you want to pick up snacks or drinks for the hotel room - there's a fridge and microwave in the hotel, and the hotel is very clean.   The only reason it doesn't get a full 5 star review is because there were sections that could use a little handyman love, and the Customer Service wasn't great. It wasn't complaint-worthy-bad, but there's just some intrinsic issues with the service people that could use attention.   For Instance: the tables in the Breakfast room were always a disaster, and the woman who was servicing the Breakfast room was more interested in snacking than stocking the food or cleaning the tables.   Additionally, there
The location is perfect to walk to disneyland. Staff was friendly and helpful. Good prices. All you need for yor stay. Beds are cozy.

Summary Heading: Great Location for a Disneyland Vacation
Summary: This is a great location for a Disneyland vacation. It is within walking distance not only to the Mickey and Friends parking structure and tram, but also the main plaza. The room was spacious and very clean. The Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is cereal and doughnuts which leaves something to be desired, but it is not bad for the price.

Summary: The room was not bad.  It was a little dated and in need of some updating but it was clean and a decent size.  What I did not like was the smell when you first walked in.  Not sure what the hotel uses for deodorizing the room but it was VERY strong and did not go away.  We cancelled our maid service for the duration of our stay to avoid more of whatever it was they used being used again.  The parking was not ample.  If you arrived back at your room too late then you had to double park and move in the morning.  I feel there should be one parking space per room. Breakfast was very scarce and ended too early.  it was not horrible however just wish there were more choices that Eggo Waffles and cereal.  Overall the hotel filled our needs, it was very close to Disney which is what we

The limited parking is very inconvenient. My experience with the staff was hit or miss; sometimes I received great service other times the staff was very short with me almost rude. The towels were awful, I felt like I was drying off with sand paper, but the soft water made up for it. I found trash under the bed from previous residence. The first night I stayed they didn't have any extra pillows and the pillow provided were mediocre at best. Breakfast was limited, but expect for what I paid.

Stayed at this Super 8 for 3 nights. It is comparatively inexpensive and for the little we were in the room it served its purpose just fine. It's a bit of a walk to the Mickey and Friends tram (7 minutes, about a half mile) but I think that is about as close to walking to Disneyland from the other side of the park if not closer. It is nice that the rooms have a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee pot.

Summary Heading: Not bad for the price and proximity
Summary: It wasn't in the best of repair but it was okay. The lady who took care of the breakfast in the morning seemed to be more interested in eating herself than in replenishing the items and we cleaned our own table both before we ate.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, close to (easy 20 min walk) from...
Summary: Great hotel, close to (easy 20 min walk) from Disneyland/California Park/Downtown Disney. Great pool to throw the kids in after a hot day out and about. Nice large room so we could spread out after a day (14 hours) at Disneyland. Easy access from I5, and local roads too. Not many restaurants/food places within walking distance, but plenty of low priced takeout/delivery in the area, of course.

Summary: This place was very close to Disneyland, easy to find, but not clean and very poorly run, very loud all night and doors slamming.   Beds were hard and wood floors,

We took our little ones to Disney. The hotel is located behind Disneyland not right across from it like we originally thought but it was within walking distance from one of the Disneyland parking garages so we took the tram from there to Disneyland. Breakfast bar wasn't the best but it was ok for the price. I would stay at this hotel again.
The room was nice and clean and the staff was extremely nice.  Wish the continental breakfast lasted until 10:00.  My kids missed breakfast because they got there at 9:15.

We have stayed here multiple times and will always go back when we plan our trips to Disneyland. The staff is friendly and very helpful to make accommodations when parking is full. Great service can't wait to go back!

Summary Heading: Perfect to save a little cash on Disneyland
Summary: If you're going to Disneyland, this is the place for you. We got the room for $99 per night which we feel is about what you have to pay anymore for a decent place. It's a 12 minute walk to the front gates of Disney (uphill) but downhill on the way back. They serve donuts, eggos juice cereal and fruit for breakfast which is perfect for families. Spacious nice clean rooms, huge bathroom counters. We did not try the hot tub and pool but many people used. They have laundry facilities and an ice machine, fridge and freezer and microwave in the room. If you're taking small kids to Disneyland and you want something super close where you don't have to pay $36 per day to park at Disneyland this place is for you. Friendly staff, they even let us keep our car in their lot even though it's

Summary: This hotel was perfect for the price!  My family of 4 and I were going to be at Disney most of the time so we didn't spend much time there.  Although the rooms were clean and the shower drained properly (both things I look for in a hotel) the beds were a little too soft.  My husband kept sinking in and he's not a big man.  I slept in the other bed with my daughter and I had no problem with the bed sinking in (I do weigh 110 lbs).  The breakfast wasn't that great.  I was expecting waffles we could make ourselves; instead, the waffles were like the frozen Eggo waffles you put in a toaster.  They also had two kinds of cereal and donuts.  I was hoping for a little more hardy breakfast but at least it somewhat helped us hold off until we ate lunch (again, I really can't complain

Summary: I booked this hotel because it was inexpensive and close to Disneyland, and I was very pleased with the experience overall. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were clean, and while there was a little noise it wasn't anything unreasonable. The staff were very helpful from the beginning, when I called before our trip to get suggestions on airport shuttles and transportation to Universal. They let us keep our bags in a locked closet (no charge) on our last day after we checked out, so we could spend the day at Disneyland before our flight out. If you are planning to go to Disneyland and you have little kids with you, or you don't want to make the hike from the hotel to the parking lot tram for whatever reason, I highly recommend setting yourself up with the Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Convenient location, dated decor, carb-heavy breakfast
Summary: Title pretty much sums it up.    The pluses - an easy, safe walk to Disney that takes you through Downtown Disney - 15 minutes or so.  The front desk staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and the room had a frig and microwave.    The minuses: There is very little else near the hotel in the way of restaurants or amenities.  The decor was dated (think nature print wallpaper).  They also should upgrade the locks to deadbolts, the chain did not feel very secure.  Walls were thin.  The breakfast offerings were extremely sugary, except for a bowl of apples, which I appreciated.  In short, you get what you pay for.  It is decent value for the price and the location is convenient.

Everything was OK, room very clean and the beds very big and comfy.  Quite loud at night as walls are thin.  Super close to Disney! Ignore what people have said its a 10 minute walk max to the tram to Disney! Sidewalks the whole way as close as you would want to be! Staff were so friendly and helpful.  You get what you pay for and avoid the breakfast.
The hotel is great location , great price , only problem is the breakfast and bathroom weren't up to par.
Had a wonderful stay,  originally was only gonna stay 2 days ended up staying 4 days.. Very pleased !!!!

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable room.  Close walk to Disneyland.
Summary: The room was clean and comfortable.  It was a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland tram and you can see the Disney fireworks from our room.  I was surprised there was no conditioner in the bathroom and the hair dryer broke. Overall it was a nice three-day stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Summary Heading: Make it more comfort to the guests.
Summary: I enjoyed spent a night at the hotel, but the breakfast time was not comfort. It was between 7-9 AM. We had to wake up early about 8 AM or earlier, I think it should be at least till 10 Am. I went to that hotel many times before. At every time I mentioned that to the staff. Nothing changed, even it is something little, but more comfort to the guests. That was also what I heard from many other guests. Thanks.

Summary Heading: Not as bad as the reviews say!
Summary: I'd read the reviews for the hotel and was very worried.... However there was no reason to be. Cleanish room, 2 big beds and very helpful reception. It's a 10 minute walk to the tram station and is very easy to find.   It's a basic hotel but you will be at Disney until late. This is a place a sleep and it does the job!

First, they charged three nights room and tax prior to our arrival without authorization.  The managers explanation was the computer did it automatically.  Booking.com states in their written policy that charges would not be charged untill arrival. Immediately walking into the room it reeked of mold.  There was black mold around the tub ( I have pictures) and roaches crawling up bathroom wall.  I could go on for hours but so not worth my time. Was told by booking.com and hotel manager I would receive a refund and two weeks later they are saying NO!  That's fine with me! I will choose NOT to use booking.com or Super 8 ever again..

Summary Heading: Wonderful Caring Staff! Managment is professional & All around good stay.
Summary: My Room was full of amenities, Coffee, soaps, cold refrigerator and fast Internet! comfy beds Clean and beautiful pool. Also most importantly and why I'm leaving a review to just say I had an incident during my stay that involved the Anaheim police department, which was unfortunate but the staff was so caring to me and compassionate also when I needed cameras and video footage the Management was so helpful and understanding, able to connect with police giving them all the direct information to police to help my entire case at the property. This hotel is completely protected with security camera which I'm so thankful for and without such kind and helpful management my unfortunate event could have been 1000000 times worse. So thank you guys here at Motel 8 and God bless!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Your comments and suggestions are very important to us to make a better experience to our returning and future guests. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: The maid walked in our room not just once but both nights we stayed with put knocking & using her key to her advantage was very disappointed & embarrassed and felt violated as she walked in while me & my husband were changing. :(
Does not offer shuttle to park like it was told to us when we booked room. Check in person was rude. Not worth the it. Pay a little more for a better hotel with shuttle and friendlier people.

I've stayed at this Super 8 before and knew not to set my expectations high, but this stay was way below even my lowest expectations. When we arrived the room smelled like overly used chemical air fresheners. When I inspected the towels, there was always hair (no my own) in the new towels. That was disturbing. The property claims to have free WiFi, but the same WiFi kicked me off every three minutes. It wasn't worth attempting to connect to the very poor connection. The worst part was when I arrived to my room one day and discovered there was no running water. I called the front desk and only then did they notify me that they turned off our water because they found a leak. They couldn't give me an estimated time of completion because no one knew where the manager was. I called

There was no internet, not enough towels to swim and take a shower for the whole family, no channel guide, parking sucks, asked for a bottom room when I tried to check in at 0900 but was never informed until I arrived that check in was at 3 p.m.. I mentioned to the front desk I have a handicap and can not climb stairs that well and just I case of a fire I could hurt myself, but they gave me a second floor room. Which was not what I asked and I asked if the could save one from the bottom when someone checked out because I already paid 2 days before coming but still got second floor not happy
Room was clean and was great for someone who needs wheelchair access to shower.Bed was somewhat hard in some rooms. Parking was a little crowded.

Summary Heading: Reads closer to park extrance but great value
Summary: Staff were very accommodating and friendly.  Parking was easy and free!  Along with continental breakfast and Wi-Fi.  Upon reserving, it reads as though it is located at the entrance of the park and it is not.  But!  we were able to watch the fireworks as they could easily be seen from the parking lot.  Clean, comfortable affordable rooms.  Cant really complain as it is an upgraded Super 8.  We just wanted someplace to lay our head so we could go the Disney.  It did the job.
It was great just stayed a night. The staff was friendly the room was very reasonable. I slept very well. I'd come back again.

Summary Heading: I bought it was right across the street from Disneyland , my bad
Summary: Ok one thing , there was noise. The firework dispenser for Disneyland must be within 100 feet of back of hotel ? This is ok when you are at the park late, but the first night in we were trying to go to sleep early. There were some other bothersome noises the first night, like a family unable to comfort a screaming baby. The staff was very friendly. Personally I just thought the hotel was closer to the front entrance. It's in an odd location to walk to the park, as you get caught up in the weird overpass maze near Disneyland. It was about a half mile walk around the freeway, and we had to use a closed sidewalk. I won't be returning. I thought the price was high for the inconvenience.

Summary: Its a really good hotel for being what it is. The guy who checked us in was really nice, and our room was cleaned nicely everyday. They didn't have much for breakfast,the pool was kinda small and the parking was kinda annoying because there wasn't enough parking for anyone. I don't think it's as close to Disneyland as people think, it's like a 15-20 min walk. Would definitely stay here again!

Summary: My brother works for a Wyndham timeshare and he gets a discount at wyndham hotels. He and I decided to stay somewhere close to Disneyland. So I booked the room and let them know he was going to be there with me so that they knew the price of the room would then need to be discounted. They said that it was okay and that he just needed to bring his voucher. We then get there and they tell us they can't give us the discount because my brother should have been the one to book the room instead. Even though I had already told them over the phone it should be discounted. The two men at the counter really couldn't do anything about it and didn't really seem to care. It seemed like they didn't even know what they were doing. Customer service was horrible. I won't be staying here again.
Manager Response: Employee rates should be booked in advance via myportal access. This particular reservation was never booked with an SED rate. Hotel cannot adjust rates per Wyndham Policy. Wyndham managers and employees should know about the policies and should not take advantage of this benefit. It is very self explanatory.

Summary: When I arrived there was no parking I was told where to park.I woke up in time because they were about to tow my car.they knew my room number and I was told to park there because there was no parking. Breakfast was also horrible. I will not be returning to this location.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: I was looking for something low price and close to Disneyland to stay the night, this place looked decent on their website so I booked at $100 for the night . The hotel is a bit old but the rooms were decorated with a modern feel , I always take bleach wipes and wipe down all door knobs, counter tops & remote control for the most part it was clean except the countertops after a wipe down the towlettes were a little  black but what really bothered me was the room smell, they must use extra stronge chemicals because the room smelled like a quarantine nursing home , the smell was so overwhelming I was nauseous the entire time I was inside the room, I honestly was willing to check out early and make my hour drive back home just to rid myself of the smell it's pretty pungent. I won't
Its a very good hotel, My family and I went on our first family vacation and it was definitely a hotel we would like to stay in again. Very big and spacious.

Summary: Security on door was bad!  You can just open the bedroom door without even turning the knob. It wont lock from inside unless you use the chain lock. The window was open the whole day and we had no idea since the Christy's were shut. You can hear every single door that closes or opens near your room. The positive was it was clean and the free breakfast. But it wasn't the best so we went out and ate the remainder of the mornings!  Internet was the worse!
We wanted an inexpensive place to stay we didn't have to drive in traffic up to go to Disney.  This was close and price was decent.
The location is excellent and the counter staff are very pleasant and understanding of our needs. We have been staying here for many years.

Summary: It wasn't a horrible place to stay. It was a last minute booking and they had rooms available. The only thing I can say is that by the end of the night there wasn't any parking left. Other than that it was chill.
Horrible experience.  Roaches crawling on the walls, uncomfortable beds, rude staff, and poor parking. We reported roaches to staff and told that manager, Rodger, would call us but he didn't.

Overall this hotel provided easy access to the Disneyland parking lot, it was clean, great customer service and very easy check-in.  On the down side no shuttle service to Disneyland, if you are looking for a quiet place this doesn't provide enough of a sound proof room you can hear everything around you above and next to your room.  Rooms did provide a microwave, fridge and free wifi plus a continental breakfast in the morning.  Parking spaces are very close and crowded, pool and jacuzzi were clean and in use quite a bit.  If you are just looking for a place to shower and sleep than this would be the best place but not to enjoy some peace a quiet to relax and read a book.

This hotel was clean, easy check in and the staff was helpful when we asked questions. It said they served breakfast but there wasn't much there. Coffee, juice, cereal but not much else. I wouldn't plan on eating breakfast there.

Summary: We stayed for 1 night and got the worst case of bed bugs. Management denies this - attempted to blame the airline!  They claim to have an independent pest inspection done on the room, but that is very unlikely - just look at the photos of my experience. After spending nine days at another, fabulous Super 8, where the staff were great, the service friendly, and the beds free of bugs, it was extremely upsetting to stay here. Staff were unhelpful. Don't go there!
the hotel was very close to Disneyland we were able to walk  missed breakfast  the parking was excellent the clerk who checked us in was EXCELLENT  the hotel itself was average terrible internet
was a nice stay every thing went well got there early they checked me in but room was not ready let me park my car so I would not have to pay for parking at disney
parking was a mess and I was offered a discount to open and use a wyndham credit card--- which I did not get

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Basic breakfast, no fruit included in breakfast, no hot water for tea (or none that was blatantly obvious) 2 urns of coffee. Wifi dropped out constantly.   However, friendly & helpful staff, bed was comfy and room was very spacious. It catered to our needs, we only needed a bed and a shower as we were at Disneyland during the day and night.

Summary Heading: Pay a little more to go elsewhere
Summary: Old motel, room smells bad. Parking sucks. Noisy. If you don't care about those things because it's close to Disneyland then stay here.     Nice staff, a little difficult to find the motel, it's in a strange place. You can see the fireworks from Disney from the parking lot at night. The bathroom is really dark....and no handle in the shower at all. Nothing to hold onto. They don't give you any conditioner for your hair!  When I fly I don't pack that stuff because every other motel I've stayed at gives you conditioner and lotion. Nope just shampoo. I wish I would have paid more for a nicer place. Every other motel has shuttles to Disneyland not this one. Just pay more and stay at a nicer place.

Clean and fairly quiet. Free breakfast is only between the hours of 7-9 a.m. so if you want to go to the park early you are probably out of luck. No hot prepared foods like bacon and eggs, but they had a toaster and microwave for heating up bagels and oatmeal. Adequate selection including fresh fruit. Parking is a bit sparse. They had half the parking lot blocked off for 3 tour buses. There is no free shuttle to Disneyland from this property. Taxi to the park is between $8-10 each way, not including tip. It's fairly easy to walk, but make sure you know where you're going before you leave because there is no signage on the roads indicating the path. Wi-Fi was not even mentioned at checkin, but another guest gave me the password. It wasn't very fast and required me to login

Location is perfect if Disneyland is your goal. Easy 10-minute walk to the tram at the park's parking lot. No need to pay Mickey $18. And the view of the Disneyland fireworks at day's end is super: find yourself a spot on the third-floor walk way looking southeast and you can see (and hear) the entire aerial show.

Summary Heading: Very close to Disneyland and affordable
Summary: About 20 mins walk from this hotel to Disneyland entrance. The breakfast choice was poor but not completely bad.
Room was basic, but clean and staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Only downside is that it is uphill to Disney!

Decent enough place.  Great location to Disney.  Only a few block walk to get to trams.  Decent breakfast every morning.  Saw a few small cock roaches in the bathroom one morning when taking a shower.  Clean, comfortable beds.

We had two rooms one had a cockroach in it and are room was dirty tables had sticky and dirty surface ,door jams,nite switch plates dirty , microwave , hair dryer , bedding had hairs , stains on upholstery ,

Very simple, bed was comfortable.the room smell so bad had to open the window and turn on the AC.   You can hear the fireworks so loud from Disney land. And can hear every move outside the room. So pretty noisy place. The pool and Jacuzzi are in awkward place facing the main street.
Not enough parking Was not allowed to pay with another credit card at check out; not good for business Observed insect activity at breakfast area restroom
Amazing size of room I recommend others to stay here and its near from disneyland for a good price.

Clean rooms. They were serviced everyday of our stay. Breakfast was simple. Location was great. Literally one minute to get to Disneyland parking structure. Can hear the fireworks from Disneyland at night. But overall i enjoyed my stay. Guest baths were a little outdated but it did what it needed to do. Excellent value.

Everything worked, the location is very convenient, a 15 min walk to the parks. Breakfast is basic, but greatly appreciated. Clean rooms, noise under control, helpful personnel. Will definitely come back.

I stayed here during spring break (3/21-2/25). The room was very nice and clean. Has a fridge and microwave. Walking distance to disneyland/downtown disney, about 10-15 min walk. Right off freeway. I would defiantly come back again.

Summary Heading: Not up to standard Super 8 property.
Summary: Since we flew to California, we did not bring all of the amenities that we would normally bring with a car trip.  There was no body lotion supplies by the motel.  The parking was not very good as some of the parking was in back of the motel.  The best thing about it was its distance from Disneyland.

This place was a nightmare. Before we checked in my bank called me with question as far as my stay and blocked the hotel from withdrawing funds from my account. We checked in and went to our room to find the door open. We called the front desk and they said the wind could have pushed the door open. The next day we got up breakfast had super limited anything mostly fruit. We went to Disneyland and when we got back at about 1130pm our door was found open again. We called the front desk and we were told that they had nothing to do with it. Our stuff was in the room the entire time and the last people in the room were housekeeping. We let it go and went for our 2nd day in Disneyland again we came back late to find our room open AGAIN. At this point we were furious and demanded to
Loved the rooms! The breakfast however was kind of a joke. There was no attendant to refill or keep clean. They really did not seen to care if they ran out of anything.

We stayed one night to enjoy Disneyland two days in a row.  It is a bit of a walk to the park, but it is doable.  The room was very basic and didn't feel very clean.  I wouldn't let my kids sleep on that floor, so we squished into the beds.  The shower and bathroom area was icky.  We survived one night, but I would never be able to stay there for an entire week.  The breakfast was below expectations.  Most food was gone well before breakfast time was over (7-9am).  We had donuts and some juice.  The orange juice was really Sunny D.  The cereals were empty and the lady only refilled the fruit bowl once and it disappeared immediately.  The "waffle station" was eggos and a toaster.  I expected the homemade waffles you can make and was very disappointed there.  The helper didn't

The room was clean and nice. The carpet was kinda gross. Parking is very limited, we left our car there and walked to Disney which was fine in the morning but after walking all day at Disney we were exhausted walking back to the hotel as it is quite a hike to and from. Continental breakfast was gone fast and people were stingy, filling up their backpacks with the muffins...
Breakfast choices were lacking but room was clean and property was decent.  Good room for price.

It's in a nice area about 10 minute walking distance. The room was okay the only thing was that we got back late from Disneyland and the noise at 7:30am woke us up we had room 106 next to housekeeping and the ladies were so loud seems like they were having a party do not recommend that room specially if you want to sleep in.

The hotel is extremely close (10 minute walk).  You can even see the fireworks from the hotel balcony.  The room was very clean and the hotel staff are very courteous.  The only complaint I have is that only one of the washers was working during our stay.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting Disneyland.  The prices was amazing!  There are numerous eateries around the area but it does require some limited driving.

Staff is rude and lies. Parking sucks... Breakfast is nasty with stale doughnuts. Roaches in the dining room and our room... Nasty... Don't get fooled by the price with this place you get less than you pay for.
Love the property and those there and the wonderful caring staff. Have been going there for 15 years and feels like home.

-Thread bare bedding and in room toiletries low quality soap barely lathered, coffe maker ok however had no sugar/creamer pack; + iron was excellent as well as microwave and fridge was clean and very cold, wifi was strong; side note although this is not a Disney hotel they should try to incorporate a little more Disney Magic into each room being that it is located on Disneyland Drive and most customers staying are going to Disneyland
The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet.  The location was very convenient for our visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: What you expect, paying for location
Summary: Overall this hotel was exactly as we expected.  Very dated, however clean.  Close to Disneyland and the free parking was a bonus.

The price was great, the location was great, room was big, discount tickets to Disneyland were helpful, staff were friendly. My only complaint is that the carpets were VERY dirty. I don't think they have been cleaned recently. They are a dark color so they don't look dirty, but, wearing socks in the room for more than a few minutes turned the bottom of my socks black.
That was not very polite breakfast was gross and there was no parking in the parking lot I paid for a room and could not park in the parking lot unacceptable

For a discount motel it's not bad. Plus you get a fridge and microwave. Wasn't fond of the parking. The walk to the parks is not bad but seems long after a day on your feet coming back. Staff was great.

Summary Heading: Very Loud, Staff Not Particularly Friendly, But Fairly Clean Room
Summary: I stayed here for one night while visiting friends in the area.l, and that was enough.  I would not expect to get much sleep staying here.  The hotel is located near a busy street, and the noise from traffic kept me up all night.  On top of that, this seems to be a popular place for people with small children (due to the price and proximity to Disneyland, I imagine), so early in the morning I could hear screaming children from my room.  A free continental breakfast is included, although I can't speak to the quality because it was over by the time I got there at around 9:30am.    The outside place looks pretty old and rundown in my opinion, but the inside of the room seemed reasonably clean. I didn't see a note that they sanitize the tv remote control, which is my litmus test for
I was surprise that it was a very nice hotel.  Very clean, front desk was really helpful, and loved the fireworks from Disneyland.

This was a last minute trip & rates were a little overpriced for a basic hotel-we paid $150 night. All hotels in the area cost more than usual; so we took a chance here. Disneyland was super busy due to events in the area. I also overheard someone say the weekend was unblocked for annual  passholders? Very Basic room, but we didn't require anything fancy. Clean, Older hotel right off i-5. Parking is very tight, and  is run by an attendant. We didn't eat the free continental breakfast, but noticed the breakfast area was busy. No shuttle service. However around the corner at West & Ball is pedestrian access and walkway to the Disney garage that leads to free trams that drop off at Downtown Disney & park entrances. Maybe a 10 minute walk? 15 if your strolling. Overall happy with
Location was perfect. Room was nice and clean. Will definitely stay there next time we go to Disneyland.
There were ants in the room. When I called in to speak to the manager the girl the answered acted like it was no big deal, it must be common.

Summary Heading: It was a good trip the room was very good clean
Summary: The only thing we getting care for was the breakfast it wasn't well maintained, by 8 o'clock everything was gone

This hotel was a backup plan from my original plan. And I had to get two rooms. One room wasn't ready when we got there, no big deal. So we waited got the room a little after 4 pm. But we didn't go into the room til 8:45. When we did, the room hadn't been cleaned and there were beer cans everywhere & the door to the other room wouldn't open. Then when we called down to the front desk they wanted to say the messy beds and beer cans I put them there, ya not!!! The only thing they did right was move us to 2 different ajointing rooms. This is a hotel very close to Disneyland you would think they would have the Disney Chanel for kids. But no.Not a happy time at the happiest place on earth

The hotel is super close to Disneyland. I was able to walk to Disney. It is right off the highway, so it made it easy to get to. The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The only down side was I wish the pool was heated.  The pool was cold like lice water.  We still enjoyed it.

We've stayed here twice now. We really like the property. Close enough to walk to Disneyland. Clean and modern rooms. Only complaint is the breakfast hours aren't long enough and the staff starts breaking it down before 9am, could use some more options too. The super 8 in San Diego has eggs and sausage and fresh waffles, this property would be that much better if it had those items for breakfast!! Overall we really enjoy this property!!

This was a good stay. Very clean room. Relatively quiet. Only complaint would be the parking near the rooms was over crowded and forced to park in the back where it was dark and empty. I was worried about this however nothing happened to my vehicle.

Well my first visit to here and couldn't find a fault impressed by friendly staff that were ever so helpful the location was great for all activities the rooms were always clean the water was always hot the atmosphere was very relaxing could not ask for more

Summary Heading: the room was ok. The chemicals that were used made the room...
Summary: the room was ok. The chemicals that were used made the room smell pretty strongly. It gave me a headache. Otherwise the room seemed to be clean. The parking is pretty crazy as well. If you come in late it's very difficult to find a spot.

This motel was very family friendly.  They provided breakfast which was a nice feature. It was cold cereal, sweet rolls, juice, coffee etc.  The service was great and so was the staff.  The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable.  The only problems we had were that there was not a shuttle to Disneyland and no place to eat within walking distance. I decided not to rent a car and save the additional. That was a mistake. We ate some meals at Disneyland but all our dinners we had to have delivered.  We will not stay at this location again.

I stayed here for a week and absolutely loved it. The minute I stepped into the reception office I felt welcomed.  The staff are so accommodating and helpful. Rooms are extremely comfortable and very clean. Also include fridge and microwave.  Disneyland is an easy walk from here. Breakfast was included in the price which was a great bonus.  I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and can not recommend it highly enough. The price of accommodation is totally reasonable also.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Your comments and suggestions are very important to us to make a better

Summary: It's an ok hotel with a 2 minute walk to the mickey and friends parking lot tram that'll drop you right off in downtown disney. It's got the basics, not dirty and perfect if you're on a budget or not really going to be in the hotel much anyways. Free parking and breakfast too
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Summary: We stayed 8-days and realised how wonderful this hotel is!!  Particularly, the staff were amazing!   Special thanks to Erwin Exequiel (Front desk supervisor) for making us feel so welcome!  This is what you need when you travel with children.  Our favourite moment was to watch the (Disney's) fireworks when relaxing in hotel's hot-tub  Handan
Manager Response: In behalf of all the staff of Super 8 Disneyland Drive, Thank you for your wonderful comment. Please see us again, and we will definitely make your stay better than the last one! :)

Summary: Nice comfortable stay. Breakfast was good. Parking spots are really tight.The place is atleast a 20 min walk to the Mickey Train stop in the parking lot. The train ride is hardly 5 mins. If the weather is good it may just be easier and shorter to walk to the park and not go to the parking lot.   Overall a comfortable stay

Summary: Staff were fantastic and extremely helpful and obliging. Room was very clean and kept that way over our 5 night stay. Beds extremely comfortable. Our only "negative" would be the breakfast. Maybe a fresh fruit salad rather than fruit as people were filling their pockets with fruit for the day.

Summary: It was a great choice since we planned a last minute vacation to Disneyland. The price was right and if you don't mind the walk, the theme park entrance is only a 15 minute walk. There is also free parking for guest which is a plus. Not the nicest looking but the rooms are decent and the front desk is pretty helpful.

Summary: We weren't expecting much going into it since we paid so little for such a cheap motel, but It was surprisingly excellent! The rooms were clean and looked new, front desk was helpful, and it was very close to disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Summary Heading: Shabby Hotel with an OK Staff and a Good Location.
Summary: Pro: 1- Walking distance from Disney 2- They did have Discounted Disney tickets but then again all hotels in the area will have them. 3- Staff was generally nice 4- Seemed safe  Cons: 1- Found two cockroaches on the first day.  2- Room was poorly designed and looked shabby. A/C / Heating and fan in the bathroom were super loud.  3- Being in front of the parking garage, car alarms going off were disturbing. We could hear the people above waling.  4- Breakfast area was too tight and way too busy.  Overall, this was over priced for what it actually offered. We expected more from a Super 8.   Personally, I will NOT be staying here again! And my advise is to pay a little more and get a better place to stay.

Summary Heading: Clean, walking distance to Disney, but minimal parking and a bit aged.
Summary: If all you are looking for is an affordable bed close to Disney then this works. But it is afterall just a motel and does not really have much in the way of amenities. Also, there were long black hairs on the towels, but at least they were clean.  ;-)
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Your comments and suggestions are very important to us to make a better experience to our returning and future guests. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: the only thing that really needs attention is the parking. If each guest is allowed a parking space perhaps they should be numbered and assigned at check in so when you get back late at night there is a place you know you will park.

The breakfast choices were horrible, the donuts were frozen and hard not fresh at all. No hot breakfast like oatmeal, no waffle maker. They gave you frozen waffles that you put in the toaster. I definitely would not recommend this hotel. The woman at the front desk was rude as well acted like she was doing you a favor
It's a decent place for the price that we paid for. The room is clean and it's close enough to Disneyland. It's about a 15 mins walk from the hotel to the park.

Rooms were very simple but clean the beds were comfortable and the pillows were the best I've had at a hotel even better than the expensive places I would love to know where they get them so I can have one for home will be back next time I'm in Anaheim
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Summary: Every time I stay at the Super 8 on S. Disneyland Drive, I never have to worry about the rooms or the staff.  I've always had a great experience here.  Keep up the great work guys.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I will forward these wonderful comments to the head of the department for further improvement. Summary: The hotel was clean and served it's purpose.  I only wish there was a shuttle offered to take you to the Disney Parks rather than having to drive or walk.  Although the walk is only about 10 - 15 minutes, at the end of the day it feels MUCH longer! : (

Summary: First off if you get there late at night the employees aren't very nice. They didn't have us in the computer so they made me show my conformation email just to give us the room. The rooms are ok looking but after walking around my room for 5 min I started to notice my feet feeling a bit sticky. I looked at the bottom of my feet and they were literally black from the filth covering the carpets. The bathroom was huge with so much unused space, which the only reason I mention that is because the shower was tiny and the shower curtain was gross. The water from the shower splashes all over the tile floor which makes everything so slippery! Even after putting the towel down to catch the water it soaked thru and again the tiles were soaked from the terrible shower design. The
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing the issues regarding your stay to our attention. I sincerely apologize for the dissatisfaction that you have had and cannot stress enough the importance of your comment. Summary: The beds were so uncomfortable. I felt like I was sleeping on the floor. The pillows had poor cushion. The blankets were supper thin. Parking is tight. Teo outlets in my room did not work.  My neighbor was smoking marijuana. The only positive thing about this hotel was the distant to the park. I will never stay here again.

Let me just start the list of nastiness with the fact that this hotel has no fitted sheets! I read about the dirty carpet (this is no joke, pack socks or flip flops to wear to and from the shower if you'd like to keep your feet from turning black!) But the fact that the first night I slept under the covers on top of the non-fitted sheet and ended up on a bare mattress completely disgusts me! After that I froze to death sleeping on top of the comforter as to not end up on the same mattress every other guest has probably ended up on too. Besides the floor and lack of proper bedding, the fan in the bathroom was on the wall inside the shower where I could see wiring and made me not want to shower. We found bugs inside the refrigerator and in the room (not cockroaches, but still

Summary: If you are like us and you just need a clean comfortable place to stay close to Disneyland, than this property is perfect!  To be honest all we did was sleep.  The rest of the time we were in the parks.  Only complaint would be parking.

We have always been very happy with the Super 8 on Disneyland Dr. It is always clean, and the people at the desk are very helpful. They were super accommodating this time. I asked for a bottom room and they were able to give that to me. We also love the location, it is very close to Disneyland and we were able to walk one day. The prices are great too, and I love that the rooms have microwaves and fridgerators in them. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Don't judge this book by its cover!
Summary: We have been staying at the super eight for several years now when we travel to Southern California and we love it!  Easy walk to downtown Disney.  It may not look like much from the outside but the rooms are beautiful and updated and the beds are comfortable everything is clean and the staff is wonderful too. Highly recommend this excellent economical hotel !

Summary: This was our second time staying here and once again the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We had checked in around 11pm Saturday night and realized our room was a shower room, no tub. My daughter went to the office to ask if we could change rooms the next day, the gentleman behind the counter ran out checked a room, and switched us immediately. Great service! Very close to tram stop for Disney. We'll definitely stay here again!

Summary: The room was excellent, to bad you can't assign parking spaces. We left for half an hour to get something to eat, and never got close to our room again. Matbe more handicapped space next to handicapped rooms? Continental breakfast was not as good as remember. The only fruit put out in the 4 days we stayed were apples. How about oranges or bananas? As a diabetic the cereals sugar frosted flakes and raisin bran are high in sugar. Coffee was good. Pool was really dirty, jacuzzi was good.

Summary: Very clean and the staff was  extrembly friendly and helpful. Convenient location with any easy walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. The only negative would be too much chlorine in the spa and it needed a good vacuuming.

Summary: I had a good stay overall. Housecleaning was done every day, I"m in second level.  The heater was quiet and automatically sets to the temp you want, the fridgerator is quiet, and the microwave is actually a good one versus the cheap ones that cheap hotels usually give. I actualy like how they set it up in a cabinet that hides the fridgerator.  No issues with the hotel at all.  Free wifi is provided for the minimal speed, if you're going to play games and need speed, you'll need to pay extra.  It's so near Disney that the fireworks are booming loud and depending on where you are at in the hotel, you can get a great view.  Parking is better in the back then in front of the rooms where it's narrow.  I find it funny that they say compact but people with SUVs/Vans park there.  My

Summary: We stayed here for three nights primarily for a vacation to Disneyland.  The room was clean and offered a refrigerator  and microwave.  The room was surprisingly spacious!  Disneyland was only a few miles down the road-much closer than we expected, which was great.  I'm glad we rented a car as the taxi rides/bus rides would definitely have added up.  Parking was available at the hotel, but it did fill up quickly and the spots were pretty tight.  On the last days of our stay, two large buses were there and took up most of the spots.  Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff were extremely helpful.  The lady was wonderful with assisting us with directions to local restaurants.  The WIFI was a bit spotty which was a bit frustrating.  An added bonus was we could see the

Summary: This hotel met all ours needs a location close enough to walk and a place to shower and sleep. The rooms were clean with newer modern furniture clean liens however the carpets seemed a little old and dated but noting a pair of cheap flip flops wouldn't fix if you don't want to walk barefoot on them( I never go on a trip without them). The breakfast was fair noting over the top but more then enough to get your fill to start your day in the parks. Had no issues with parking like I had read on pervious reviews. the staff noting to write about as we didn't interact with them much other then checking in and checking out. the lady the maintained the breakfast area was alway checking the area to make sure it was clean and well stocked.Overall I would recommend this hotel if your

Summary: We stayed here specifically for the location as it was a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. I stayed here with two friends and the double room was large with enough space for all of our luggage around the room. The shower had good pressure and the room was always cleaned efficiently. It is a budget hotel, but included was a continental breakfast including fresh donuts each morning. Only thing that I can fault is breakfast finished at 9 which is a bit early and the towels are very small. I would recommend this hotel to others as it did the job well

This resort was definitely on the cheaper side of things, however there are still some things I'd like to have in a room. The hot water never worked, the room smelled musty, and we saw at least 2 roaches a night during our 5 night stay.  Free wifi didn't exist and the breakfast bar was only filed at 7am and never restocked or well kept. This place is only good for what's in the title.

Myself and three friends used this hotel for a trip to Disneyland. The hotel says to catch a tram from the Mickey and Friends parking garage but it's just as quick to walk into downtown disney. It's a "cheap motel" but it's clean and the staff is very nice. Honestly you're going to stay there to go to Disney, you're not spending a lot of time in the room. Got a good night's sleep on the beds and the TV worked well. Bonus: The fridge is mid sized and there is a microwave. You can save a bunch of money by stocking it up and having a meal a day there. The free breakfast is mostly carbs so make sure you bring protein and veggies :)

So have stayed here before and will again but just had two issues. First off awesome that our room was ready by 1130 am. Downside, found a cockroach in the bathroom, and the shower had no water pressure and never got hot so literally took a five min cold shower. But sink had hot water! Overall stay was fine and will stay again! üòÄ

Summary Heading: Great location for a good price
Summary: This is a great low cost hotel to stay in if you are visiting Disneyland. It was just fine and good value for the price. Breakfast was basic with a choice of things like waffles, doughnuts, yogurt and cereal. It was only a few minutes walk to Disneyland which saved us a lot on taking our car to there. We checked in at about 8pm one evening and about an hour later had a marvellous view of the nightly fireworks at Disneyland. In fact, having seen them in the park the next night, obscured by tress and crowds we both thought we'd have a better overall view of the fireworks from the Super 8. Would definitely stay here again as when visiting Disneyland all you need is a clean, comfortable room to sleep in and this did the job just right.Good free wifi and nice small pool/jacuzzi area.

The lights were all very dim and required each of their own outlets (leaving very few for myself to use). The floors all appeared clean, but 5 minutes after a shower, the bottoms of my feet were black from all the dirt. The property was quiet despite the nearby highway and close proximity to Disneyland, though nobody warned us about the incredibly loud fireworks at night from Disneyland. Overall, I'd stay here again, but hopefully it would be a bit cleaner and brighter.

Summary: We have stayed here twice now, once in 2014 and once in 2015. WE LOVE THIS PLACE. It is perfect for trips to Disneyland on a budget. The Super 8 offers everything you could want, and you don't feel like you have a "spending hangover" once you get home. The rooms are large and clean, with swamp coolers that keep the room very nice and cool. (Hint: keep them on all day long and keep the curtains closed. Your room will be a dream to return to at the end of a hot day at Disneyland). The turnover service is fantastic. The breakfast is as follows: Orange juice, milk, coffee, hot chocolate, cereal (we had raisin bran and frosted flakes), doughnuts (a very nice variety), oatmeal, toast (several different types of bread) with butter/jam, there is also a microwave and a nice seating area

Summary Heading: The carpet was so dirty that I had to wear socks just so my...
Summary: The carpet was so dirty that I had to wear socks just so my feet would not get dirty.  The motel was poorly painted on the inside.  they just left paint on the side of the toilet and running down the tile baseboards.
Comfortable beds, great staff, clean rooms, and a decent breakfast and very close to disneyland.

The staff at the hotel are very helpful and courteous , and the rooms are very large and comfortable. Erwin Was very professional and made our stay that much more enjoyable. Thank You All at the Super 8 on Disneyland DR. Anaheim .üíïüéâ‚ù§Ô∏èüéàüéäüíéüëè

This place was well worth the money! Only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland or you could walk to the parking garage and take the tram (saves you about a half mile of walking). Breakfast was good enough and was able to take it on the go to eat on the way to the park. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable of the area which is good when you have no idea where you are or where you're going. I would definitely stay here again! Oh you also can watch the fireworks from the motel as well, which is always fun :)

Summary Heading: A good location to visit Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is located close to the Disneyland (a 15 min walk). The hotel room was clean and spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was ok. The downside(s) were that the poolside was extremely noisy even at 11.00 pm. There was no elevator. Parking lot was full most of the time.

Summary Heading: Clean, good location. Walking distance to disneyland...
Summary: Clean, good location. Walking distance to disneyland. Continental breakfast- donuts, toast,cereal. Helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, but annoying WIFI and disappointing breakfast
Summary: It was a fine place to stay for good proximety to Disneyland.  The rooms were adequate although not nearly as bright as pictured.  Also, the lobby is not at all as shown and the pool is much smaller than it appears in the picture.  The wifi was frustrating because we had to repeatedly logon to it.  The speed was good with the premium and worth the $10 for that.  Also, the breakfast was much less than anticipated - minimal choices and items ran out well before the end of breakfast.  We picked up our own items from a local grocery store instead.  I'd stay again, but with much lower expectations.  Big highlight is seeing the Disney fireworks every night!
It was ok. close to the park. Breakfast could have been more like create your own Waffles, hard boiled eggs, yogurt. Needing of protein would have been great.

This was the third time at this property. And each time the floors seem dirtier! We felt like Huck Fin with the bottom of our feet or socks turning black just walking around. Staff was very nice and you can't complain about the price. I just wish it was cleaner. The TV and furniture was nice but there was a 1970's style uncomfortable chair to sit and watch TV in. Parking can be an issue at times. Otherwise you deal with it for the price.

I do not recommend this motel...not even to my worst enemy!  There were a few incidents that occurred during our stay.  When we came to our room after returning back from Disneyland, my daughter discovered a huge roach in the bathtub.  It was the biggest roach that I've seen.  We called the front desk, but my husband killed the roach before the motel maintenance worker came to our room with the roach spray.  He said it was a big roach, scraped it out of the bath tub and carried it out.  We asked to be moved to another room, but that was not an option at that time.  So we slept with one eye open, all the lights on including the T.V.  It was a horrible rest.  The next day my husband spoke with the manager and said they would move us because they needed to fumigate the room.  It

Summary Heading: ok for what we paid for. Better not to offer breakfast...
Summary: ok for what we paid for. Better not to offer breakfast. Coffee should be made more available, parking was ok

our overall experience was very poor. The room was very dated, The carpet was beyond dirty, it was slimy and greasy under foot. I wet a wash cloth and rubbed it on the carpet and it came up black. The breakfast offering was very limited. The offering consisted of day old donuts, bread and 2 varieties of kids cereal, and was only offered between 7:00 am and 9:00 am. I realize that Super 8 hotels are budget minded hotels. I also realize that you really don't depend on repeat customers but on new customers who don't know any better.
Other than the quality of the continental breakfast the hotel was very good. The rooms were clean, the property was well maintained and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

We had stayed at this motel 10 years ago on our last trip to Disneyland.  The rooms were okay.  The beds were good.  With 5 people we needed a roll-a-way bed.  When we registered on the phone we were told is was $10 a night, when we asked at the desk it was $20 a night.  Our credit card was charged before we could tell them we were paying cash.  Got there on Wednesday, charge didn't clear until Monday.Also cost me an overdraft fee!  Staff was helpful and the continential breakfast was good.

Summary Heading: Good location to the park and off the beaten path.
Summary: This is the first time we have stayed at this location in the Disney area. Its located in the N.W corner of the park property line. It a easy walk to the Disney Parking parking lot, and from there you can take to tram to downtown Disney then enter into the park from there. There's a AMPM store just 1/2 block from the hotel. But no restaurants are located on this side of the park at all so make sure you ether eat at the park, down town Disney, or across the street of the main entrance. Parking is limited to one car per room, and there's not much of that. Rooms were always clean and ready in the afternoon when we returned. They seam to keep their pool open kind of late though, lots of screaming children if that doesn't bother you, we were good with it all. It was a good value for

Summary Heading: Nice hotel within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: We selected Super 8 for our recent Disneyland trip for the price and proximity to Disneyland. The website said a short walk to the Mickey and Friends tram to Disneyland, free breakfast and the price was in budget.  First of all, we arrived at 8am and they let us check-in and get the parking pass (parking is limited, but we were warned about this ahead of time) and park there all day so we didn't have to pay at Disneyland, which saved us $17/day. We headed over to the tram, but the wait was very long, so we decided to walk. The walk to and from Disneyland was not bad and we did not use the tram the whole weekend due to the lines always being very long and we could walk faster. Once in the room, the size was bigger than I thought it would be, so that was nice. We had room to keep

The employees are nice and helpful, but  the place is starting to show its age.   They need to put some money in back into the place    The carpet is old and very worn   You can use a paint job and new sheets and bedspreads    I understand that this will cost a little and maybe they might have to charge a little bit more but that would be OK if we get some of the riffraff out of the place I am   Talking about a lady that I saw taking 2 1/2 dozens for her her husband and her daughter putting them into backpacks  that was lined with plastic bags when I said something about it she smiled and said yeah

We stayed here for one night on as we were visiting Disney for a day. The property itself didn't have enough to parking for its guests. The room smelled like sewage and the walls/ceilings are very thin and we had some extremely noisy neighbors making tons of noise at 2 am! Looking back, I wish I would've spent a bit more money and stayed closer to the park.

We have stayed at the Super 8 on Disneyland Drive twice now. Both times our room was clean, updated,  and breakfast was included. Breakfast is a typical continental style with donuts, cereal, toast, juice, and coffee. It is a decent walk to Disneyland's main gate, but not too far if you take the tram in. We will definitely stay here again!
As a customer with children I was not happy at all! The room had bugs, the AC didn't work and the staff was rude!

Summary Heading: Ok hotel for a quick Disneyland visit
Summary: This hotel was convenient for our quick visit to Disneyland hotel.  Takes about 20 minutes to walk to Disneyland's main entrance.  However the hotel is low budget. Bring your own shampoo and soap as the items they offer are poor quality. Also bring shoes to Walk in your room. The carpets were dirty and dirt was visible on underside of bare feet. Too many bums hang in the immediate area at most times of the day. Parking is limited to one car.  Room lighting is dark. Low voltage light bulbs. Made it difficult to see in room if you have poor vision. Check in was at 3pm. We were made to wait until then to get a room even if rooms were already cleaned and ready for assignment.
Have been staying at this location for all of my visits to Disneyland.  Roger and his Team are excellent.  I will continue to stay here.

General manager roger was so rude and disrespectful I've never had such bad service in my life I will not be returning to this hotel ever and I will advise others never to go here either if I could rate 0 I would
Rooms were clean and breakfast was great. However, very disappointed with lack of parking spaces.

The room that we stayed in was well set up and very clean, however there is not enough parking when the hotel is full. We were told to park in a handicap spot by the hotel clerk because they had people parking in every place imaginable.  There was also a guest who stays at the hotel frequently who choose to yell at us for parking where we were told by the hotel clerk.  When we spoke to the hotel about the other guest, we were told he was a veteran and was always like that so they just ignore him. Very unprofessional and I will never stay here again because of the parking issue. Also, the continental breakfast did not start until 7am so we were unable to use it because we left for Disneyland before it started.

The parking was terrible. There was a trailer parked in the space nearest to our room for the three days of our stay. It was difficult and hazardous to walk around. People were allowed to park next to the pool and in other areas where there is no marked parking. We parked legally under a tree that leaked sappy brown stuff all over our new car. Turned on the light in our bathroom and was met by roaches. Caught one and took it to the office and was told by the staff that he would note it in his report. That does not make me feel better about the possibilities of transporting these creatures to my home. My husband went in for breakfast and when he told staff the juice machine was not working she shook her head and walked away. We stay in the area about once a month and have stayed
I stay at the super 8 on Disneyland drive often.  The service and cleanliness keep me coming back.  It is older but it is a great find.

We pulled into the parking lot to check in we could hear a large mariachi band playing in an area behind the hotel when we got our room key and went into the room you can still hear the music in the room. There was hair in the tub and on the walls the towels were so thin and rough it was like drying off with a loofah scrubber, the befscwere so hard I think the floor would have been softer and when we went to go sit in the jacuzzi it was very foamy and when you lifted your arm up there was a green gray foamy slime on the underside of our arms that was disgusting. I read in the book that if you check in with multiple people with one room and have multiple cars only one car has a parking spot don't know what you're supposed to do with your second car I understand that their parking

Summary Heading: Bed sheets were not clean . Carpet was super dirty . Not...
Summary: Bed sheets were not clean . Carpet was super dirty . Not coffee maker ,not blow drier ,and closet was at the same room as toilet and bathroom. Disgusting. To higher price for the room .

While not an official Disney partner, this hotel is within walking distance to the park or the parking lot for the trams.  We were told the park entrance would be a 45 minute walk vs. 15 to the trams.  As the trams weren't working at night, we found that walking from the where the trams drop you in downtown Disney was really only about 30 minutes walk back to the hotel. Hotel had nice big rooms.  If we weren't "on the go" each morning, I would have liked more variety in the breakfast, but as we were, we grabbed donuts and left.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Disneyland Anaheim Super 8
Summary: Recent paint.  Clean.  Great Value.  One small thing...the majority of parking spaces by rooms are "compact".  I dented the door of the adjoining car, just by trying to get out of my vehicle.  I was not even able to get out.  I informed the office and the car owner that I was the one that dented their car door.  (nickel size vertical mark in Prius door)  They need to widen their spaces about 6 inches.  Otherwise, stay, staff, building, location, and experience was awesome.  Sincerely,  Kirk J Gould, Scottsdale, Arizona

Summary Heading: Perfect for what we wanted: some place to sleep, walking...
Summary: Perfect for what we wanted: some place to sleep, walking distance to Disney and breakfast, even if it was continental instead of full.

Summary Heading: No frills but close location to Disneyland
Summary: Easy, quick check in and check out. Limited free parking. They offer free continental breakfast daily. Be aware that it is always crowded.
