We had a room with 2 queen beds that appeared to be recently "renovated" with new paint, sitting chair and bedding. The beds were comfortable. Unfortunately, the towels are older and showing their wear. The shower had good water pressure but the bathroom fan doesn't work well as reflected by the mold seen in the top corner/ceiling of the bathroom. The lock on our door did not work, but was equipped with a chain latch.  In my opinion, unless you get a great deal on room rates and close proximity to Disneyland is your goal, this might be the choice for you.

Stayed four days. Was great in every way. Front desk employees were awesome and polite and helpful. Very friendly and great service. Rooms were immaculate. I own my own cleaning business and when I saw the maids taking the windows completely out to clean the tracks I was very impressed. I know clean and they do a GREAT job cleaning. Would love to give you guys a ten. You made our disneyland trip awesome!!!
We stayed one night here just to go to Disneyland.  It was a convenient walk, free parking and a light breakfast.  Very reasonably priced compared to others.

From the start front staff (plan clothed man) did not confirn my request for possible call if room became available and whole process just seemed not to have a positive vibe. Left had lunch came back at 1:30-45 to wait for a room. From that point until about 2:45 did not one of the 4 different employees bother to even say a basic hello or recognize me or my family in any way. I understood I needed to wait for the room but courtesy in its basic form makes peoples stay or delay even more tolerable.  Very sad in my opinion
Great view of fireworks and value. Bathroom &a shower bad, also terrible soap & shampoo. Nasty toothbrush left on the back of toilet!
The stay was really nice. The only thing we would like to see improved is the continental breakfast. A bit more variety like bacon or sausage would be a good addition to an already great place.

Summary Heading: Great economical way to spend time in Disneyland
Summary: Our two night stay was great - clean and quiet room, close to the parks, and very economical!  We'll stay again.

The resort located very close to Disneyland & California Adventure which is the reason why we chose it. The resort staff was very nice. I had a problem with my reservation and they tried very hard to resolve it as best possible for me.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our 5 days at this motel
Summary: This is our second time coming here. Its close to Disneyland. Takes about 2 minutes to get to the parking garage. Very convenient. The desk is friendly, and helpful. We enjoy the pool and hot tub. Would recommend this motel to a friend. We rented 3 rooms this time, for our family. Priced well.

first of all the towels were absolutely disgusting!! The noise level was worse then anywhere I've ever been. I was on the third floor and could still hear every car that passed by, every person that walked by talking (not screaming or laughing just normal talking) it felt as if the windows were just open it was HORRIBLE. So needless to say the 2 night the kids and I were there we didn't get much sleep at all. To top it all off when I told the 2 girls at the front desk they got an attitude and told me I should just check out early after trying to give me new towels that I didn't accept because the top towel on the stack was worse than the ones in my room. It was torn and had a huge stain on it. Customer service was worse than Walmart!!!

Summary Heading: Need to clean the floors once and awhile
Summary: Not a bad hotel, just need to clean on a regular basis. White socks turn black after a few steps across the room.

Overall it was a good hotel.  Close to Disneyland, though hard to return to because the street is one way - have to go past the hotel and turn around in the neighborhood to get back.  Staff was nice and accommodating.  Overall was clean.  My only complaints were the carpet was filthy.  I got out of the shower and walked on it maybe 3 times and my feet were black.  Also, the maid service was spotty.  One day they did not replenish my washcloths or the coffee for the coffee pot.  Also, the free breakfast consisted of a lot of carbohydrate junk - toast, cereal and donuts.  Not that I didn't expect it, but if you are looking for something with some fruit or something healthy this isn't it.

Summary Heading: room is good but lift is not working
Summary: Room is good but lift is not working for two days and hard to go to 3rd floor with luggage and kids.

My husband and I have stayed at this Super 8 twice, and we were very satisfied both times.  Since our first stay last year, the rooms seem to have been updated with new carpeting, wall decor, furniture, and bedding.  For our second visit this May, we had adjoining rooms with our son and his family on the top (third?) floor, and we couldn't have been happier.  The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast adequate.  Since this is a budget hotel, don't expect a Holiday Inn type of breakfast--there's basically just coffee, juice, and doughnuts, which are brought out every half hour.    If you're in good physical condition, you can walk about a mile to the Disneyland parking lot and take the tram from there.  We did that last year, but this time with our 5-year-old

Summary Heading: The breakfast was a bit average, however the service and...
Summary: The breakfast was a bit average, however the service and room were excellent. Location to Disneyland was an easy walk, which was great. Would definitely recommend.
Endgame charged me 3000 points to lower the cost of my stay...the super8 had no idea what the program was or how it worked..so I ended up paying $240 for one night at a lousy hotel

Summary Heading: Never stay on the bottom floor
Summary: Worst night sleep ever walls are paper thin. People up all hours of the night talking in front of our room...partying, lighting off fireworks ( not from the parks) first floor was horrible.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for. It isn't that close to walk to...
Summary: You get what you pay for. It isn't that close to walk to Disneyland especially with small children...which is why I had stayed there

We stayed at this property about 6 years ago and weren't terribly impressed. The room we had smelled of urine, though they did try to use air fresheners to help.  It was dated and just adequate.  This year, we were checking hotels and found that this one was getting better reviews. The price was right, and it was only going to be for one night, so we decided to try it again.  This time we were pleasantly surprised.  The rooms were updated, very clean and smelled good.  The price was right and it was convenient to Disneyland. (We ended up not going to Disney, as it was the 60th anniversary and the place was mobbed.) The staff was very friendly, helpful and seemed eager to please.  They do serve a continental breakfast, which is pretty carb-heavy. Lots of donuts, bagels, toast,
Stayed for a week. They were redoing rooms, so a little noisy.  Staff were friendly.  Only thing wrong, the carpets need to be cleaned, otherwise a great place to stay.

I recently booked 4 rooms for Grad Nite Disneyland for the bus drivers.  Roger Chen, the manager, was outstanding in communicating with me via email and phone about the booking.  It made handling the arrangements very easy.

Summary Heading: Check in and check customer service bad. Seems employees...
Summary: Check in and check customer service bad. Seems employees are unhappy because they don't seem genuine in helping. People hanging around which seems weird. Attitude  makes property and stay not as pleasant!
Everything was good. Staff was great and knew their stuff.  Everything was very clean, rooms, walking to the rooms, parking.  Beds are hard but most hotel beds are.

We visit Disneyland every year and Super 8 Disneyland Drive is always part of our experience and we tell everyone we know going to Disneyland to use it. This is a great family resort and exceptional value for money!

I traveled across country from Michigan to California to take my son to Disneyland for his 6th birthday. I called weeks prior to my trip to make reservations. I arrived at the hotel for the guy at the front desk to rip up my reservations and refuse to give us a room! All because he was trying to charge me an extra 100$ that I was not told about over the phone when I made the reservations. So not only did this guy try to rip us off because we were from out of town he also left us searching for a new hotel room last minute. To top it all off he kept my ID when I left to go find a new room. After arriving at the new hotel I realized he had my ID still so I had to turn back around to go get my identification. I would never recommend spending your money at this place I've never been

The room was great, no problems everything was clean and comfortable. The only problem is it has 3 stories and can have a lot of guests when full.The parking lot is limited, you can park in the back and then walk to the front so you can get to your room. When I left there were cars scattered all over.

Summary Heading: Love the location as it is close to family(and...
Summary: Love the location as it is close to family(and Disneyland).Rooms are good with comfortable beds but shower heads are miserable! Anyone shorter than me (5'9) will have water in their face while standing at the back of the tub Wish there was a little more variety for breakfast...add some fruit, yogurt, bagels etc.

Summary Heading: Great location comfortable beds. Not happy with the...
Summary: Great location comfortable beds. Not happy with the breakfast but staff was friendly and prompt. Not bad for the price. Close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Hotel was not close to Disneyland as stated.  When calling...
Summary: Hotel was not close to Disneyland as stated.  When calling to make the reservations we were told it was right across the street.  We had to ask every day for towels.  Four of us stayed in the hotel and they would only leave 2 towels everyday.  I asked for conditioner and they said they didn't provide it.  The rate was quite high for what we got and there was no parking.

I came here as a last minute time to Disneyland with my best friend. Considering there were a lot of hotels to choose from, I chose Super 8 because of their reviews. I was really hesitant at first but we decided that at their price and at so last minute to our trip, we had nothing to lose. We were very pleased with the inside of our place. It was very big. The guy at the customer service desk was also very helpful.   The only downside was that I wasn't very pleased at how I could hear the every movement from the upstairs room. It seems like although they had kids and every time they fell, ran, or jumped, we could hear it from our room. It was annoying trying to fall asleep after a long day at the park. Overall, I would come back.

Our stay with you was simply wonderful, and your excellent staff really went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. There is an amazing view of the Disneyland Fireworks from the parking lot, and they explode right over your head, which was really magical. The room was very comfortable, and we will stay with you again on our next trip.

Will never stay here again. Carpet is disgusting. Kids feet had to be washed before bed, even after a bath. Found a cockroach on the wall. Upon returning to our room, one pillow case had a dried blood stain. No hot water, warm if you were lucky. Beds hard. Continental breakfast was rolls only.

Summary Heading: The room was clean and quite.  Staff was friendly. If you...
Summary: The room was clean and quite.  Staff was friendly. If you are looking for a place to just sleep and go on your way then this is the place.  The only complaint I would have is that when booking the Motel through Wyndham I stated that I would like a breakfast available on premises, not just a Continental  with donuts and cereal.  I was told that this property also served waffles and fruit.  This Super 8 only has donuts and cereal.  I felt very mislead and would have stayed at anther property if I had known.  Other than that all was good.
Hotel was clean did not have alot of extra fees. The room was bigger than expected could move around. Little noise  because on ball road exit off  I 5 like two blocks from downtown Disney.

Came for weekend trip to Disneyland; actually booked this place on accident as there is another Super 8 on the other side of Disneyland that we stayed at last time that was pretty good.  This one unfortunately was in much further disrepair and was disappointing.  PRO: - Inexpensive - Close to Disneyland/Downtown Disney (15-20 min walk) - Friendly staff, good customer service overall - Close to freeway access - Free Wifi  CON: - Though close to Disneyland, the walk there is a liiiittle precarious given you're next to traffic onramps/offramps - Rooms felt a little more run down - Towels felt like sandpaper - Bed uncomfortable - Weak breakfast of stale donuts and cereal - Outside was being repaired/renovated, so multiple parking spots blocked off making a place to put our rental

this place was very clean close to Disney and would stay again if ever in the area. the only thing is the parking was a little narrow in some areas but there was parking in the back of hotel but I don't like parking there thankfully we didn't have to.
Always a nice stay here. Rooms are very spacious even with 2 queen beds. Staff is friendly and always accommodating. I really had a comfortable stay.

Great hotel....very limited parking....great staff....breakfast needs a little make over...donuts everyday a little tiring...very close to disney tram....large clean rooms...nice pool and great hot tub.....

Rooms are clean cheap and very close to Disneyland some say walking distance but after walking at Disneyland all day I think it's to far to walk. Only bad I can say is at peak Disney days parking here can get tight bring a small car

This time we stay at super 8 hotel in room 102, as I said before we just want a room to sleep, because during the day we take the kids to the universal studios Hollywood or disneyland park. The only thing we didn't like about this hotel was the parking garage is always full, the toilet paper which was really thin you got be carefully when you use it it looks like a spider web and the fridge it didn't work properly.  Other than that the hotel is okay come book a room and judge it is up to you.
Parking as always at this location is tough. Carpet in room was in need of cleaning, other wise room was clean and nice.

Summary Heading: Very nice room. We walked it to the Disneyland tram and it...
Summary: Very nice room. We walked it to the Disneyland tram and it did not feel like 15 min felt like less. I am very likely to return to this hotel .the only thing was breakfast was ehh but it's okay we just went to burger King .can't wait to go back again.

Thier was no parking and if you did find one you were right on top of the other car.  I asked for a room on the first floor which they gave me but it looked like a old storage room that they converted to a room. You open the bathroom door it was 2 inches from hitting the toilet. It was just nasty

Summary Heading: Good hotel, but breakfast & location info deceiving.
Summary: The room was clean & comfortable, but the breakfast did not include waffles, yogurt or fresh fruit as advertised!  They also advertise that they are right next door to Mickey & friends parking structure - No, they are not!!  It was at least a good five blocks that took fifteen to twenty minutes to walk !!

Summary Heading: My families stay at Super 8 Anaheim
Summary: Our stay was overall great with the room neatly taken care of by the staff while we were out and about on or vacation. I have no real complaints but wished that the coffee makers in the room were more like standard 4cup or 6cup coffee makers. My wife and I brought with us extra coffee and filters but couldn't use them with the coffee maker supplied in the room.

This hotel was cleaned every day and suitably comfortable.  They do need to work on their customer service, however as it was lacking.  Water was turned off for most of one day of my stay and no recompense was offered.

This is not a luxury hotel, but the prices are not luxury either. The rooms were comfortable and staff was friendly. Location was perfect for someone going to Disney. 5 min walk to park and lots of food.  Lots of tv channels for late night relaxing. Breakfast was good. Would stay there again.

had a room with a walk in shower cause my mother is disabled. While at Disneyland the hotel staff decided it was ok to tell a person to park on the handicap ramp in front of our room. Because of this we had to go all the way around the building to use the ramp in the back. Not very professional, and didn't make us very happy. After we made the note about it, the staff member just kept starring at me like we did something wrong.

This was unfortunately a terrible stay.  I would like to get a refund for the experience. My husband and I stayed under my name: Heather Eastin on 04/13/2015-04/14/2015.  The air conditioning was not working at all and we asked several times to be moved and were told the'd call us to change rooms but ever did!  Would like this stay to be refunded in full.  Please contact me at: 818-401-7707  or  heastin@gmail.com  Thank you,

Very close to Disneyland Tram Station which drops off at Downtown Disney. VERY clean with large rooms.  We spent little time in the rooms, but it was a nice , relaxing location for sleeping at the end of our long days. Best price in town for value and quality.

Summary Heading: Good thing Disneyland left me exhausted
Summary: I booked this room knowing it would be basic (and with limited option as a last minute Spring Break destination).  But the beds were SO firm I couldn't get comfortable.  The worst part is that there was not sufficient bedding.  It was a sheet, a thin thermal blanket that was old and worn and a silky topper.  We were freezing and even had to turn the heat on!  Breakfast options were very limited.  2 kinds of cereal.  Milk, coffee, juice and danish.  For the money I spent, I would have done far better being further from the park and having better amenities, a pool that wasn't in the middle of the parking lot and some blankets for crying out loud!

Summary Heading: No ESPN???  Cover sheets need to be replaced in 118. Also...
Summary: No ESPN???  Cover sheets need to be replaced in 118. Also, bathroom had the essence of a jail.  Luggage roll carts wheels were so loud @ 6 am every morning they woke me up while passing by room.  Also, large space between bottom of door and sash.

Summary Heading: The location was a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. The staff...
Summary: The location was a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating.  We were very pleased with the service we received.  There were no problems with the room.....everything worked.

We needed an budget hotel close to disney with free parking, wifi, and breakfast. On paper, this property met our needs!  The room was a good size for the four of us (2 teens, 2 parents) to spread out and the sink out of the bath/toilet room was helpful. The property is a little tired and old looking but if you want somewhere close to the parks at a budget price, this is your place. Staff were very friendly, efficient, and helpful.  Free Wifi was not reliable unfortunately but we made do without upgrading.
Very clean with nice big room and comfortable beds. OK Continental breakfast. Too far to walk to Disneyland, ended up using taxis!
Nice hotel. Clean. Affordable. Small pool. Not much in the way of the so called free breakfast. Not as close to Disneyland as they would have you believe. We took cabs back and forth.

We had a good experience, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable. The elevator was nice on the days after disneyland when our feet were to tired to walk up the stairs. The parking was tight but there were some school busses taking up a good deal of space. I was always able to get a spot. The breakfast was sufficient. One problem i had was with the keys, seemed as if they cancelled out each day, hated walking up the stairs to 3rd floor only to have to go back down to get the key reactivated. Also the teenage front desk staff gave my son an extra key to the room, no they did not know  who he was they asked him the room number, and gave him the key. What if he was not my son? Cleaning staff asked if we wanted room cleaned we said no removed dnd sign and left fo the day, when

The first room smelled of sewage. Asked for another room and it smelled of heavy deoterizing. Later when we returned it had a sewage odor. Later we saw that they were repairing the sewer behind the motel. We were not told of the problem. The next morning we were given another room after again complaining of the odor and the third room was in a different area and was fine. They never should have given us the first two rooms in the area of the problem.

While the hotel boasts that its close to Disneyland, the walk is unbearable.   My friends missed the parking structure and walked the whole way to the park.  Making the 1st day MISERABLE.  The staff is unattentive, seeing two parties in the lobby and ignoring one of them.  They yell out your room number- which is bad if you're a single person with your child.   The week we stayed, 5 tour buses choose this place and all the front parking was reserved for the buses (which of course beeped when they backed up and woke up a sleeping child).     The carpets are dirty. If you come, do not bring white socks.  Or bring slippers.  And it's not that we got a bum room.  We had 4.. and all of us had a family member with dirty socks.
Was disappointed when we found out there was no shuttle service from hotel to Disneyland. Even though website said so. Was a 15 min. Walk to tram station.

We stayed at Super 8 Anaheim Disneyland Drive once before and the experience was great. However, this visit we requested a handicap accessible room for our grandmother. The room size and space was great. But the air conditioning in the room blew air into the room that smelled like urine and the carpet was so dirty that when walking from the sink to the bed, the bottom of our white socks turned nearly black. It was a gross sticky black too. I know rolling wheelchairs and scooters around makes the floor dirty, but the hotel should take this into account and clean the carpets in the handicap rooms more often or just replace the carpet with a tile or wood flooring. There was also mold around the shower fixtures, which was pretty gross as well. Would we stay there again? Not with our
Pretty good overall everything was clean and in working order. Breakfast could use couple more variety like muffin or yogurt but other then that good fresh food every day.
This place accommodated my room requested and was very friendly. The location is right by disneyland so theres many things around. Nice spacious rooms.

We found hotel on line. Called to make reservations. Showed up at hotel pictured in the online pictures we used when we decided on this hotel. Found out we were at wrong hotel. We were booked at hotel further from Disneyland then we wanted. And definitely not the one pictured. Felt totally mislead. Went to the hotel we were supposed to be at. Hotel appeared decent. Until we got in elevator. It had a nasty odor. Room looked ok. Had to plug in fridge and microwave. Bedding thin as sheets. Bed had no support. Moldy spots in bathroom. Decided to leave after one night. Will never book at a super 8 again.
You can walk or drive to Disney easily from the Super 8. Breakfast is quick and tasty. Staff are very helpful.

Summary Heading: Decent place.  Good for the price.  Breakfast was always...
Summary: Decent place.  Good for the price.  Breakfast was always super crowded but other than that had a nice experience.  I would stay again.

Great stay and staff my kids didn't want to leave from here ,I also loved my stay as well. Will be booking with them in the future . My kids loved the free donuts and milk and juice in the morning ,I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel ,thanks super 8 for making my stay great !!! Thanks Amilia at the front desk for making our stay amazing !!!

This was the worst ever. They do not tell you that you can only park one vehicle on the property and that another has to be parked in the neighborhood 3 blocks away until you get there, It is not on the website or any other for that matter. The persons at the desk are very rude about this too and all other questions asked. The AC did not cool until near freezing and the beds were hard as a rock and the sheets and blankets scratchy. One person woke with a bug bite and rash on the face from the pillows. WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN AND RECOMMEND STAY AWAY.
This place was great, CLEAN and super close to Disneyland and the Downtown Disney District. We will definitely be staying there again! Great staff too!

It was A horrible experience..first of all the manager there is really rude his name is Erwin by the way... Our room was really dirty... Also came back and noticed my brand new purse full of grease!! Still waiting in the manager to call and fix it!!! Never again will I be staying here... Don't waste your money go else where!!!!

Summary Heading: You get for what you pay for
Summary: Can to Disney land on short notice so needed something fast this was the only available. Not that great! The floor is nasty my white socks where nasty and brown. It doesn't have a good clean smell.  It was cheap for a reason.

I was really happy with the service, room and price. The only thing I didn't like was the parking. We got there late at night and had to park behind another car that was supposed to leave latter that day. Also the breakfast didn't had a lot of variety but it was free right?
Free parking, disney tickets can be purchase at the hotel at a discount. 15 minutes walk to Disneyland. I was very happy with the service.
Close to Disneyland the only good thing. Filthy carpet!! Dim lighting ( what are the hiding?) old and in need of new furnishings. I wore shoes in the shower for fear of what I might get.

Summary Heading: Simple, budget hotel that is very close to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here at the Super 8 for three nights when i was visiting the Disneyland resort.  It is super simple with not a lot of bells and whistles but honestly, i was almost never there, off having fun at the parks.  The room was clean and well kept and my air unti worked just fine, once i plugged it in.  Now, while the hotel is within walking distance of the Mickey and friends tram, it is just far enough away that you might as well just walk the restbof the way.  I made the walk from my door to the park entrance in 20 mins each day and didnt bother crossing the street to back track to the tram to save a few moments.    They did offer a continental breakfast each morning, which consisted of donuts and pasteries, coffee, milk, oj, cereal and toast.  The items were fresh and

Summary Heading: Always stay here when we visit Disney which is quite a few...
Summary: Always stay here when we visit Disney which is quite a few times a year when you use your season pass . staff is always friendly and the walk to Disnryland is easy and close.  Like the new remodeling of the room!
Parking was a mess there weren't enough spaces and people had to park in driveways. Asked for a handicap room and parking and did not receive.did get a first floor room though.

Summary Heading: All was good. Had a hard time at checkin they said no one...
Summary: All was good. Had a hard time at checkin they said no one switched my check in date. Spent twenty minutes trying to resolve issue.  Breakfast had no fruits. I am not a donut eater or cereal both my son and I did not use the breakfast there. If you could add fruits and yogurt for a busy day at Disneyland that would be great
Hotel was clean. Reasonable price for location.  Staff was helpful. I would bring my own bar soap if I stayed here again.

This hotel claims to be directly next to and within only a short walking distance to the park. They have no shuttle and you have to walk across the street multiple times just to get to the parking structure for the tram. Our refrigerator didn't work the entire time we stayed there due to missing a prong but they claimed that it was working. The free wifi is God awfully slow compared to others like Laquinta. And they have extremely limited parking available and if you arrive late or come back late from the parks then you have to park elsewhere that isn't on the property. I understand that they charge their prices due to area but I think it's a little too high for the lack of amenities offered.

So what first comes to your mind when your say lets book at room at super 8?.. I know " cheap ".. "Not fancy enough".. Or "oh no I don't stay at those kind of hotels".. Well .. This hotel was one of the best ones I've EVER stayed at for the perfect price ! The staff AMAZING!! Rooms were big pillows were like clouds it was clean didn't smell.. You were right across the street from disneyland you had breakfast in the morning for you a shuttle ect! What more can you ask for ! Definitely will be staying here again! Thanks again SUPER 8!!

Customer service is outstanding stayed for 3nights and great service. Didn't get a chance to try the continental breakfast.  Close to Disneyland and downtown Disney I recommend walk the 15min to the tram because only bad part is finding parking space at hotel late at night.

After thoroughly reading reviews on TripAdvisor and other similar sites my husband and I decided to stay at the Super 8 in Anaheim off of Disneyland Drive. My initial impression was that it was a decent room for the area and the price. However, after a brief look around the room I noticed many things that left me feeling uncomfortable. First, there was hair everywhere! I tend not to be too picky about this because hair is hair, it gets everywhere and it's hard to find every little piece but this place had dark obvious hair everywhere! I found it entangled in the towels, in the tub, on the base of the toilet, and a rather large ball of it attached to the back of the hair dryer wall unit. Additionally, the bathtub didn't have the plug in it when we got there so I screwed it back

I stayed in a twin queen bed room. It was very spacious for three of my famliy. It's 15 minutes walk to Disneyland. So you can walk to if you don't have a car. When I first entered the room, the disinfectant smell was too strong, which did not give a good impression. For breakfast, only toast, donuts, coffee, milk, orange juice are provided. Whereas the Super8 in San Diego additionally provided waffle, apple. egg, and yogurt. So you need to reinforce breakfast. When you arrive late at night, there is a chance that you might not find a parking area. Besides above, it was not that bad.
We stay here regularly when we are in Anaheim. We love the convenience of it being close to Disneyland and they always have parking.

poor..The location is good since it is close to Disneyland but the service was terrible..when we got to the hotel everything seemed  nice and presentable but the bathroom was not equipped with all the supplies needed and i requested it from the front desk and i was told it is what it is ...that was the response i got ..i would not recommend this place to anyone else even if the location is good.
Although close to Disneyland, you have to cross a very dangerous intersection. Chose to take a cab back.

We were very happy with the motel.  It was clean.  A nice breakfast.  And very reasonable priced.   The bed covers aren't nice, kind of like a table cloth instead of a blanket, giving it a non cozy feeling.

This is a good hotel for the money. It is clean and comfortable, with good parking even for a big pickup. Good staff, great location. You can even watch the Disney fireworks from the pool if you time it right.

1 night stay before checking into the Paradise Pier hotel. The hotel was as expexted for the price nothing fancy. Room was clean only noise heard were the Disneyland firework which sounded like they were being fired from just outside the door. A lot of restaurants close by too.

Upon check in the clerk charged us the room number instead of the actual price. 233 dollars for one night. what a joke. she did refund it and said it would be back that day. but I knew better then that that refunds take up to 2-3 business days. this was on Saturday so the refund finally showed in my acct on Wednesday. also the room had this odd odor could not figure out what it was. during the stay as well there was 5 cop cars that showed up over something in another room that happened. we ended up not staying there and wasting our money. not worth any amount of dollars. the internet wifi only worked on one of my devices in the room.

Summary Heading: For the passed six years I've stayed at Super 8 Disneyland...
Summary: For the passed six years I've stayed at Super 8 Disneyland while attending the NAMM Show at the Anaheim Convention Center and it's always been a good experience.
We were impressed with this motel; a good value, clean, walking distance to Disneyland.  Breakfast could include a few healthier choices, but overall well worth staying.

Room is average but a good place to sleep after a day at Disneyland. The biggest problem is with parking. I drove from Arizona and met my friend there so we had two cars. Their parking is limited to one car per room. We had to park one of our cars on the residential street behind the motel. It ended up being fine but I was constantly worried about break-ins,

I would not stay at this hotel again. ANy place that has coachroaches and then you tell the front desk and they say the manager will call you and its been a week and I have not recieved a call back is certainly a hotal I will never stay in again or ever refer anyone to stay in.

This hotel must have had an issue with water damage right before we arrived. They were airing out several rooms with blowers on the lower floors that day. When we went to our room it smelled heavily like cleaning products as if they had to do some major cleaning to cover up the smell. It was musty and wet smelling. The walls are paper thin here as you can hear everything your neighbor is doing. I was disappointed in this Super 8 as I have stayed at others and they were great. The other problem is this place doesn't have enough parking. The spaces are for compact cars and so tight even with the smaller automobiles. The pool was really tiny so they should lose that for more parking.
Was a good place to stay as we were at the parks most of the time. Quick breakfast of doughs and ceral was good. Parking is limited it seemed but we found space behind the main area.

The location is great, within walking distance to Disneyland Resort. The staff was great, especially at the front desk.  Property and landscaping are well kept.  Rooms are simple but are a great value.  I have stayed at this property multiples times and always had great service.

It was cheaper to stay here and park at the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure than to stay anywhere else. It was pretty clean and didn't have any problems. The breakfast could always use some work. The free parking at the hotel was great.

Nicely kept, clean and comfortable. Located just outside the entrance to the Mickey & Friends parking structure, it was an easy drive (some may walk) into the park. The evening fireworks can be watched from the front street.

This motel has had a facelift which was badly needed. We have stayed here over the past 18 years on our trips to Disney. Front desk staff confident and friendly ,although when checking out female staffer was indifferent.  This motel is close to Disneyland,offers free Wifi, basic breakfast. Room service excellent. In room you have fridge, microwave, iron and ironing board, coffee making. While we were there in December new flat screen tv's were installed. It's not close to any stores so you will need a car if you like to shop. This is not like Harbor Boulevard, where you have a great variety of eating and shopping facilities, there is a gas station on the corner which offers some basics if needed.  One thing is don't break the cup in room, they charge $8.00. We did and it was the

We checked into our room and immediately knew we needed to move; the urine smell was overpowering, like several people had been peeing in the corner or something  The front desk quickly found us another room end all seemed well. But later that night when we turned on the air conditioner the smell of urine again filled the room. Decided to turn it off and wait until the next day to ask to move yet again.  By morning they said they would clean it really well and asked us to come back later to see how it smelled. We were back later that night and it did indeed smell better. We turned on the AC and again went to sleep.  Sometime in the early morning the AC again began to smell of urine (seemed to happen after it had been on for a while). We turned it off and sweat through the rest

The location is good for the price. You are about  a 15 minute walk it's not that bad. We did take a Taxi one time cause of the rain and we were so tired. The front desk was very nice and called one in for us. The cost was about $6 to down town Disney.   The customer service is really great here, nice team of people! The beds only had 2 pillows total and the pillows were super thick and hard. So we asked for soft ones and no problem. We needed a roll away and they brought one up in 5 minutes!  Fast during a busy time of year.  The only thing we didnt like was the free breakfast,  all carbs..only donuts and cereal..toast but nothing healthy all carbs and sugar. Not much to start your long day But I guess its free..
Every time our family goes to Disneyland we love staying at Super 8 since is so close, love the continental breakfast & staff is friendly

Hotel room is pretty clean although the insulation is not that good..you can actually hear the other person talking from the room next door.But overall,our stay here is good..there is one more thing,if you came back to the hotel so late at night,it will be hard to look for a parking spot!!

Room was clean - Staff friendly - BUT....No shuttle to Disney - Breakfast was just doughnuts and juice - No restaurants close to motel had to order delivery because we did not rent a car. Stay on Katella Drive if you want to be by the action in Disney. I did give it 3 out of 5. Last thing the pillows really sucked!! 1 per bed?

You could hear neighbors above, and on both sides, and the plumbing was only challenged in decibel level by the nightly fireworks show about 500 feet away in Toon Town!  The Continental breakfast consisted of donuts, cereal, and bananas.  And housekeeping left a dirty coffee cup on the nightstand.  Wouldn't want them to have to wash it and replace the coffee!  A very disappointing stay for our honeymoon, especially for the price!  We could have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for about $50 more, and at the Ayers Inn, which is very nice, for about $20 more, but with my Wyndham membership we tried.  I demand a FULL refund!  Bad, bad and BAD!

Summary Heading: Not Impressed Would Not Stay Or Recommend
Summary: One of the Gentleman at the check in desk was not customer service oriented. He was very Unfriendly Impatient and Uninformative during check in. Room Door would not latch completely to allow to lock securely and correctly. Parking was not convenient or friendly to anything bigger than a Mini Cooper. Beds made incorrectly, we had to remake the beds before getting in them. Room was clean. Pluming was very noisy when we used it, and other guests used it.  Checking out the lady was very friendly and customer service oriented. We did not know continental breakfast was available to guest, until during check out. That information was given to us at check in or any other time during our stay. Again "Not Impressed Would Not Recommend"

Front desk check in staff was unfriendly and unattentive. Room was old and in need of updates. Was not close to the Disney parks as was told, it was still a 15 min walk to the tram to then get to the park. I would've stayed somewhere closer and paid more.

Summary Heading: We were pleasantly surprised when we walked into our room...
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised when we walked into our room. The room was updated and even had a flat screen T.V. We couldn't get over how clean the room looked and smelled. It was a little hike to Disneyland. The breakfast would have been sufficient had the food been replenished.  Overall a nice place to stay but a pinch too far for this Mama.

If you're looking for a cheap place to stay while going to disneyland this is the spot. The shower heads were a bit crusty and we opted not to give our kid a bath in the tub but it was clean enough to shower. The beds were great and parking was a perk. They even let us keep our cars parked there while we spent the day at disneyland after checking out.  Breakfast was basic, donuts, juice, milk, oatmeal packets, frosted flakes and raisin bran but it did the trick. There's a gas station on the corner right by the hotel where we could go to get fruit to eat. The staff was nice and got us three rooms right next to each other even though we had family members who checked in on two different days. The walk to disneyland was short, we didn't bother with the Mickey and friends shuttle.
As always, the personal were most helpful in all aspects of our stay. We were comfortable and well taken care of.  We enjoyed our time at the motel and will return again.

The A/C and heating system did not work the first night. I found that the button was broken and was incorrectly installed so instead of running the heater it was actually running the A/C.  I fixed it and was warm for the following nights. Grout and mold can be found inside the bathroom. This is definitely an economical stay.  The continental breakfast was great. Doughnuts, toast, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, orange juice, apple juice, and milk was served until 9am.

every thing about this room #118 was A plus except the free wifi kept failing and i would have enjoyed a hot item on the breakfast bar, such as pancakes or waffles. stayed in decidedly lesser places with superior breakfast choices.  i will not fill in any info below.  they would all be top rated

We rent room 127 dec 8th thru 10th..the beds were sagging, carpets were dirty I had an issue with the hair dryer getting extremely  hot and could smell electrical  smell and burning smell come to find out my hair was burned from this hair dryer. I call and requested  a new hair dryer  they claimed they didn't  have one but I could got to room 125 and use that one  so I said no..then I noticed a big chunk of my hair had been burned and was falling out so I called them again and wanted to speak to a manager who wasn't there at the time so within less the 2 minutes  from my phone call  to them they were knocking at the door and saying we are so sorry..and got me a hair dryer from another room..this motel is not worth it stay away..pictures prove how NOT clean they are..

If you are wanting to stay somewhere affordable, & really close to Disneyland (less than 5 mins. away northbound fr: hotel), this place will do it! Again, it's affordable clean, the staff's cool/courteous & reliable.

This is the usual stopover for our annual Disneyland trip early December. No matter where our room is in the three story building, we have silence and comfort. An added benefit is a view of Disney's nighttime fireworks which can be see from the courtyard.

Summary Heading: Great Location, you get what you pay for
Summary: We come to Disneyland at least three times a year and this is usually where we stay. Its a perfect location for us. The rooms are decent. As I said you get what you pay for and its $90 a night next to Disneyland. The beds are comfortable enough, although I usually bring my own orthopedic pillow with me. Parking can be a problem. Their parking lot isn't big enough to serve the number of rooms they have. So they typically double park a lot of cars in the back lot. Sometimes they have to wake someone else up to get their car moved so you can get your out. Not a major inconvenience, but sometimes a little irritating. The breakfast is very very very basic. But it works to get you started for the day. Bathroom was fine. Ours didn't seem to have any noticeable issues. All in all we

You have to understand; you get what you pay for.  First, this is a Super8, not the Ritz.  It's close to one of the world's largest tourist attractions, and the nightly rate is less than $100.  We stayed in room 306 in October.  This room is located in a corner and was right on the street that runs parallel to the freeway.  When the windows were closed the noise was reasonable.  However, the fireworks sounded like they were being launched from our room.  We did enjoy the fireworks, but this would not be a room from someone with little ones that might be sleeping.  The fireworks rock the room.  We arrived early, like 10:00 and were accommodated without an additional charge or a roll of the eyes.  The room was a 2 queen non-smoking room.  It includes: a fridge and microwave, etc.

We love this motel it is convienent to disneyland we have stayed here 4 times now and would like to continue to do so. But this time when we had maid service our full water bottles went missing. If I cant trust a motel I cant continue to stay there.

I have stayed at this Super 8 for over ten years now...I feel safe and its clean and the personal is the best. Desk person Erwin is there whenever he is needed and has become a real friend. I will contiue to stay there for a long time to come, feeling safe, and well taken care of. My home away from home usually four or more times a year

Summary Heading: Second morning we were without water and electricity until...
Summary: Second morning we were without water and electricity until maintenance came to work after 10:00.  We asked about a price adjustment and were told to call the manager who never answered.  We never got an adjustment. Breakfast was horrible. Donuts were stale every day.

Summary Heading: Best Value for the Area and Price!
Summary: This hotel was perfect for our family. It had everything we were looking for in a hotel room. Parking was a little tough because the parking lot is so small for such a big hotel, but overall this hotel is the best price we could find for the area and had everything we needed. We will definitely make this our go-to hotel from now on.

This is the worst motel ever. The room was very stinky and moist, I found a cockroach in my room and told the front desk and she just shrug it off. Breakfast was until 9 am and they were out of everything including bread for toast, donuts, milk, and juice, and spoons. I asked for a spoon for the cereal at 8:30 and they said its too late to put anything out. I had to use a fork. Getting to the motel was hell too, u only have one way in and out on a busy road. Either get off the freeway or drive around several blocks to get there, it really took about 45 minutes to get 1/2 a block to them. I asked for help and they said no. The bathroom was moldy too. Very rude and not worth ever going to ANY other Super 8 again.

This hotel is a great place to stay with your family.  It is within walking distance to Disneyland, has a very friendly staff and tries hard to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The beds are comfortable, it is more roomy than most places I've stayed, and it has free internet and parking!  The manager, Erwin, is fantastic!  Highly recommend!

It was a budget motel. Nothing special. Drive to park garage less than 5 minutes. Breakfast- mediocre- the room has a musky smell, there is a bathroom in the eating area that brings an odor to area. Breakfast- donuts, generic cereal, coffee orange juice We brought our own breakfast Linens were poor- they really need to update linens. Service was good Not going again- would rather spend a little more money elsewhere

Clean and good service. It does need to be updated with lights and carpeting but all in all we were very pleased. I am now staying in a very expensive Marriott and had a better bed, internet, and parking at the Super 8 than I do here.

The staff of Super 8 were very nice and accommodated us and our needs.  I appreciated the fact that there were washer and dryer available at low cost and accessible location.  The rooms were stylish, roomy, clean, equipped with refrigerator, microwave, blow dryer, coffee maker, very nice steam iron, iron board, alarm clock/radio, a desk for computer and a table for accessories.   We enjoyed our stay and will return again and again each time we visit the Anaheim area.
Good, clean rooms. Convenient location.  Friendly staff.  Breakfast need improving compared to other locations where they have some fruit, yogurt, etc.

This Super8 was ideally located to Disneyland.  It required just a short 10-15 minute walk and as they say, location is everything.  The continental breakfast was adequate, but could use a better variety of pastries, like bagels or muffins in addition to toast and donuts.  There was never enough oatmeal packets for all the guests, so a less-sugary cereal would have been nice as well.  The room was very nice for the price with a dorm-type refrigerator and microwave, and very comfortable mattresses and pillows.  I've been at pricier hotels with less comfortable beds.  It was nice to have the hot tub and pool outside as well.  The only room criticism was that the windows didn't open enough to rely on them for airflow at night and the air conditioner never shut off even in "auto"
It was a Really nice surprise! Very convenient, clean, close to the Park! Would recommend it for sure
Lost two bags of clothes while at Disneyland. Staff uncooperative we were given the name Roger Chen as manager. After repeted attempts to contact our calls have gone unanswered.

The staff are friendly and helpful, had no interaction other than check in/out.  The hotel itself could use some repairs. The elevator is out of order and several broken ice machines are in the common area with caution tape around it. The phone in the room had bad reception to the office and the clock radio was semi functional. The room was clean and comfortable and came with two queen beds.
The hotel was clean and quiet.  The check in staff was not friendly or helpful.  The price was right.

Super 8 is always a great deal rooms are clean and location is about a 15 min walk to Disney Parks only complaint would be the bathrooms are small and need update but Not a big deal I have stayed here maybe 4 or 5 times and always a good experience

Summary Heading: Not a walk to the parks... a hike to the tram
Summary: After such wonderful reviews on Expedia, we booked the Super 8 Anaheim Disneyland Drive. In a phone call, they said it was "walking distance" to the parks.  It was not walking distance to the parks.  It was a long 15 minute walk with a whiney child in 90 degree heat to access a free Disney tram at their parking lot to the parks.  When we booked in, we were told there were rooms on the 3rd floor, but the elevator was not out of action.  "Will it be fixed tomorrow?" I asked.  "No, they have only just taken the door down." Was the answer.  The room appeared clean and neat, but had a smell that wavered between mustiness and urine.  We had to call the front desk to get towels.  After the second day of walking miles around one of the parks, walking back from the tram and up the three

Loved the fact that you could walk to the front gates and felt safe.  Wish someone would have warned us about the noise level when the fireworks were going off.  Thought there was a war going on around the corner.  Floors and and walls are very thin... heard the kids upstairs running around in their room at 5:00am.

When my husband and I arrived for checkin the staff was friendly and the lobby was clean. Once we checked in, I noticed that there were hairs in the bathroom and in the bed. The floor was sticky so I wore my shoes the entire time. There was mold growing in the corner of the bathroom. When we checked out, I told the front desk and he asked me how I knew it was mold, could I smell it? To which my reply was no, it is clearly visibil in the corners. He said that he would call maintenance to have it looked into. Also, it states that it is within walking distance, however I would not recommend walking (especially at night) due to it being dark and about a 20 minute walk.

Good place for budget conscious traveler. We got a good deal thru Hotwire. The room was nothing fancy but it met all our needs. Stayed 3 nights and we were only there to shower & sleep. We were in the back on the bottom floor. Room was quiet and the beds were comfortable enough. The parking was a bit tight and most of the spaces were filled. Rooms had a mini-fridge and microwave. The continental breakfast was so-so. About a mile walk to DL entry.

Summary Heading: The staff was very friendly, the room was nice except the...
Summary: The staff was very friendly, the room was nice except the bathroom was not as clean as the rest of the room. The beds were firm but uncomfortable..The parking was a bit cramped by our room and we kept getting blocked in by cars that were unloading. Loved the close access to Disneyland.
Your Review       It is a nice motel, especially considering reviews of other properties. It's in a good location and was her clean

I came with my son's marching band on their tour to compete and perform at Disneyland.  Very reasonably priced, we had a group rate of $60/night which you can't find anywhere decent near Disneyland.  The rooms are decent.  If you are expecting luxury, go somewhere else.  This is an adequate place to stay that is close to Disneyland.  Room was ok, but not super clean, plenty large though.  This hotel is old and showing its age.  Breakfast is stale donuts, pool is small.  No elevator so we had to climb to the third floor.  Just a place to sleep.

I have stayed at this property twice in the last 7 weeks. The elevator was out of order both times. It was an inconvenience for myself, consider I had shoulder surgery less than five months earlier. I did not appreciate the manager  charging my credit card two days prior to arrival. I ask them not too, they said they wouldn't, but the did it anyway. :(

Clean rooms. Friendly staff and polite cleaning crew. A little further from the tram then I expected, but overall a good stay at an affordable price. Only negative is the free breakfast could use an update.

My girlfriend and I booked the room at super 8 for a Saturday night. We planned on staying the night, after we had cone back from Disneyland. It was a clean hotel we loved the comfort and the free breakfast was good too! I have no complaints the only thing that I can say is keep up the good work and we will be back soon!

Simply put, a huge disappointment! We had two rooms and we had to change one of them because the room was in such shambles. The floors made our feet black because they haven't been washed in so long! The wifi didn't work almost the entire week we were there and the breakfast was literally just a box of donuts! We paid $70 a night for a $30 a night hotel! We Will NEVER stay there again!
My biggest problem was that the elevator was broken.  I was given a second floor room, the property was sold out, and I had to lug my large suitcase up the stairs.  I am a 4'11" female.
Good Rates Clean Rooms and great service! Only drawback was that the Elevator wasn't working so we had to lug all the luggage up to the top floor!

Summary Heading: If all you do is sleep here, you're fine
Summary: I stayed here many years ago under different management and the hotel was great. Now it's pretty awful! We are traveling with 2 babies, including strollers, car seats and all our luggage. They put us on the 3rd floor and the elevator is OUT OF SERVICE! That's 3 flights up and down with all our baby gear every day! We asked for a first floor room and they claim to be fully booked. Front desk guy was rude and said we were "lucky" to have a room at all. Rooms are decent size but bathrooms are a hideous brown color. Would be so much brighter if they were painted white!! Breakfast is not a breakfast...just stale doughnuts and watery coffee if you even get here in time to find any. Walk to disneyland is about 15-20 min which was nice. You get what you pay for though so if you're just

Summary Heading: Our stay was very nice. Enjoyed the spa. Enjoyed location...
Summary: Our stay was very nice. Enjoyed the spa. Enjoyed location. Only problem was the elevator was out of service. That made it difficult for luggage. Other then that our stay was excellent.

We had a nice stay overall.  The price is very good.  The pool and pool area is very small but satisfactory.  The parking is tight.  The location to Disneyland is great - within easy walking distance.  Which was good because we were told that there was a shuttle every 15 minutes but actually there was no shuttle from the motel.  The office staff was not very helpful in directions as to where to catch the nearest shuttle. We had to find out by asking passerby's (after waiting at a bus stop on Ball Ave. for quite some time) that the only shuttle was from a Disneyland parking garage - about a 10 minute walk.  It would have been nice to have been told in detail (when we asked at the front desk) exactly where to go and how to get there since we were not familiar with the area. The

The maid came to our room three times and then one of the staff members opened our door but we had it changed & I just got out of the shower. The breakfast was OK but was expecting more choices. (i.e.) Eggs & Bagels Parking was kind of an inconvenience. I had to give the staff 10 bottles of water & a one litter of Pepsi Max because i couldn't bring it with me on the plane.

For the price they charged this weekend, you think you wouldn't find a cockroach in your room :( You think the elevators would work!! Never been so disappointed in a hotel :( After I killed the cockroaches I wet down stairs to let them know and the response was ill let the manager know. I'm side they know already. :(

Summary Heading: Elevator was still broke (this is the 3rd year staying here...
Summary: Elevator was still broke (this is the 3rd year staying here and it's been broke every time) and the carpets were really dirty (causing black feet).  Other than that it was ok.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel for quick family trip
Summary: The super 8 motel on Disneyland drive was just a short 25 minute walk to Disneyland's main entrance. Convenient for a short 2-3 day family trip to Disney parks. Easy access to and from I-5 freeway.  The room we had was basic and clean.  Spacious bathroom due to being a wheelchair accessible room.  Staff was friendly and morning free breakfast was adequate.  Some things that could be improved were the pillows.  The pillows in our room were too thick and hard.  So it was difficult to get a good night sleep. Had to sleep without pillow as they were uncomfortable.  The electric outlets were few and hard to access as they were hidden behind the bed or tables.  Amenities are few. But for the time we were there, this was fine.  Parking is also a little tight and I'm not sure if there

This Super 8 was a great value considering what you pay. I paid $79 per night for two nights. I actually stayed at a more expensive hotel the following 2 days, and found it to be very underwhelming compared to this Super 8.  Room Theme: It's pretty bland and old looking, but that's really not a huge deal to me.  Beds: The beds weren't too firm (I didn't wake up with back ache), and the blankets were plenty soft and warm.  Amenities: Had a microwave and medium sized fridge. Both worked very well. The AC was good as well. No humidity.  Shower: The water pressure was perfect, and it took no time at all to heat up, and stayed hot long enough for both my boyfriend and I. No problems here.  Extra: Also had a make-up mirror by the sinks. Very convenient for me.  Breakfast: This was a

Stay away from this Super 8! Our recent family vacation was ruined due to false information on their website. They advertise premium cable channels includeing EPSN; we rented three rooms with the plan of watching a big college footbal game but there was no ESPN. Managment was not to concerned that they mis-represented their amenities.  There were several other issues with this hotel including bad location for walking to Disneyland; have to cross heavy traffic streets, not safe for children. Continental breakfast consistently late with stale food.
My room had roaches in it and the only thing they could say was they will let the Manger know about. No sorry or anything.  Still no phone call from manger.
We spend some good days there, staff is friendly and helpful. Pool is refreshing and not crowded.  Only cons, there is too less place to park your car during the week end.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for I guess
Summary: I was encouraged by the price, location and frankly, by the other reviews of the hotel.  Our experience was not good.  Upon arrival we were directed to a third floor room and told the the elevator was not working.  Once in our room i used the telephone which was not working and went downstairs to report this to the front desk.  About two hours later a maintenance person entered our room without knocking while my wife was changing clothes.  We then tried to deadbolt lock the door.  The deadbolt was not working.  There was mold in the bathroom.  When looking for a hotel, even an affordable one, you at least want clean and secure, and for things to work.  We were very disappointed.

It was triple digits when my friend and I stayed there and all appliances were unplugged and a/c was completely off it took till the next morning to get the room cool, the fridge since it had been unplugged was useless till arriving back at hotel after midnight the second full day because it took over a day to get cold to put our food/beverages in there. Also a huge annoyance was that the elevator was broken. My friend had just gotten out of the hospital and had a really hard time taking the stairs. It would have been one trip using the luggage rack if the elevator had been working, but it was multiple trips just me carrying everything up the stairs, ice chest included. I am booked at this same hotel in October and Dec/Jan I hope that these stays are much better however knowing

Summary Heading: The manager (Erwin) bent over backwards to make our stay as...
Summary: The manager (Erwin) bent over backwards to make our stay as nice as possible!  He makes us want to return because he treats us so well!

Summary Heading: Good for What It Is, But What It Is Is Not Great
Summary: So, this was literally the 2nd cheapest hotel at this general proximity to Disneyland. That being said, I was pleased enough with what we got going the cheap route. There was some confusion initially with my room price and a military discount, but that was sorted out, so kudos to Super 8 there for not trying to rip me off. I appreciated the fact that they did rectify the mistake, and mistakes happen, so, not a big deal. The staff was also generally friendly.  The 2 star knock-off is really for the quality of the room. While clean enough, it was still just not a comfortable room. The floor had zero padding- carpet? Haha, it was like walking on straight cement. The bed was rock hard. Our backs hurt SO bad the entire trip because of this. There was no tub, just a teeny tiny shower

Summary Heading: Double charged....not resolved til after checked out
Summary: I checked in with just enough money on my Amex card for Disneyland, hotel, etc. The very next day my Amex card was declined due to a double charge at the super 8! Not only did this hotel lack empathy, they offered no monetary consideration for this HUGE mistake! I will never patronize this hotel moving forward! Horrific customer service!!

Had a family vacation and got two rooms for a week here. The rooms were decent, nothing grand, but we just used it to sleep and shower. The location was great I loved how close it was to Disney, and its right off the highway so everything is just a short drive away. There was a walmart (5 min drive) and even Medieval Times was around the corner. The Mickey and Friends parking is literally down the street. We did walk once to the tram which in my opinion wasnt bad at all. Took maybe 15 min. But since we had a family member whom cant walk long distances we just drove there the rest of the days. Never had a chance to go to the pool, but there were alot of families there. Breakfast was basically donuts, cereal, juice, and coffee. I didnt mind though, its just something quick to grab
The room itself was neat and clean, it would of been nice if the frig had been plugged in so we could put cold drinks in it. The breakfast was poor, but over all our stay was pleasant

Summary Heading: Convenient for Disneyland park and lots of savings
Summary: Super 8 On Disneyland Dr - convenient location for Disneyland and lots of savings  My family (wife, 2 kids, and myself) stayed at the Super 8 on Disneyland Dr. from 6/7/14 to 6/13/14. Of course, the main reason we stayed here was because it's so close to the Disneyland Parks. We also liked the fact that there was a fridge & microwave in the room and a free continental breakfast. It allowed us to have lunch stuff to take into the parks (Disneyland allows guests to bring in a small cooler...large enough for a six pack). Packing lunches everyday was a huge money saver for us. (About $35/day x 5 days = $175 in savings)  To get to the parks, The front desk suggested that we walk from the hotel to the nearest Disneyland parking garage and take the tram to the parks. However, there

Nice place to stay, some of the rooms are a bit dated and sometimes fixtures leak slightly, carpet is worn but clean.  Good, safe and close to Mouseland. Excellent staff and service is 5/5.  would still recommend as a economical and a good place to stay on a budget.  Still clean and safe.

You can't get a better deal for your dollar.  Super 8 has been our "go-to" spot for several years.  The money you save each trip goes toward purchases in Disneyland.  The pool and hot tub are great!  The front desk is always helpful.

We were looking for an affordable hotel with an easy walk to Disneyland (save on parking) and found this hotel.  Room was clean.  Rates were reasonable and continental breakfast was decent.  Front desk supervisor Erwin Exequiel was personable, knowledgeable and extremely helpful!  Lots of space for parking and less than a 15 minute easy walk to Disneyland tram stop.  Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

Carpet was sticky and stained. TV remote was covered with some sort of sticky substance. Cigarette-smoke coming into bathroom of non-smoking room through the ventilation fan. Door was cracked and chipped. Curtains covered air conditioner, making it difficult to cool down room.

No shuttle service from the motel to Disney as indicated. The walk was more than 15 mins, we took the taxie back.   Elevator not working. Rooms clean. Receptionist polite and friendly. We watch the fireworks from our motel room. Awsome.

Summary Heading: Good Value for a Good Stay!
Summary: Overall a excellent hotel! Great location for going to Disneyland Resort without breaking the bank!
When I got there my room was ready and looked nice. The breakfast was okay. I feel there should be something hot served, not just donuts and surgar cereal. Otherwise very pleased with my stay

Summary Heading: Great Location, Good Rooms, Friendly Staff
Summary: Stayed for one night while on a road trip. I picked this hotel for me and my friends because it was on the way out of Greater LA, and we were headed to SD next. Just off the highway, and super close to Disney Land. Older interior - somewhat worn out furniture, old tube TV's. BUT you can watch the Disney fireworks right out of your window at 9:30pm! The Bad: 1. Traffic lights just past the hotel let only 1-2 cars through, so you see the hotel and it's 20 feet away, but it might take 10-15 minutes to get to the parking lot.  2. Older furniture and carpet, but no smell. 3. Breakfast needs better replenishment, by the time we got there at 8am, everything was gone! 4. Kids were up and screaming with excitement at 6am, had to get up earlier than planned.  The Good: 1. Convenient

The elevators are broken- was not aware at time of booking. Pillows are very hard. There are plenty of other budget hotels to choose from. The parking is odd. They cone off some spaces then un cone them for no apparent reason.

Hotel parking very limited and poorly managed. Internet too slow and regularly disconnect.  AC outlets are few and located in bad places.  Old TV.  One best feature was the ironing board and iron which were new.  Hotel seems to focus on quantity and not quality.  Great for college students but not family friendly.
It is very convenient and comfortable Super 8. I like to use it every time when I take trips. I willingly recommend to you who want to know which hotel available in economic rate.

Room was clean and the customer service was pretty good housekeeping was good only negative would be that the shower head in room 131 was moldy and barely worked but overall for the price was good the walk to Disney was about 15 min at most

Very clean in all areas. Beds, shower, etc were all in great condition. Location is perfect. It is extremely close to disney. We drive so it was only about 10 minutes. Saw people walking though.  The hotel has 3 floors and elevator doesn't work. That was the only setback. Parking is also limited in front, but provides more parking on back.  And breakfast is ver basic. ( cereal, donuts, toast, and coffee)

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a visit to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for two nights when visiting Disneyland. Perfect location for Disneyland, just a short walk. Room had good size, was clean and had good beds. A small pool and jazzuci. Breakfast more suitable for afternoon tea  - more like cakes than breakfast (but they where fresh and tasted Nice, just not for breakfast). Bought proper breakfast somewhere else instead. Nice People working here. In the evening we had a Perfect view to the firework. Would stay here again if we are going to the area.

Summary Heading: Decent and affordable right beside Disneyland
Summary: We booked through an online travel site so we weren't surprised to be on the third floor. There is no elevator which might be an issue for some. Also, parking is very limited near the rooms and you will likely have to park behind the motel and walk around to your room.  The room was ok, not wonderful, but ok.  I hated the hard pillows but otherwise it was a good sized room, adequately furnished and clean and the price was great. There was a microwave and small refrigerator.  Continental breakfast and a pool and a view of Disney's nightly fireworks from your room included  My complaint is that, despite California being in a horrible drought, it did rain just a little while we were there, and the roof leaked and soaked the things we had in the floor and the edge of one of the

Summary Heading: Fabulous Stay...Clean Room...Nice Pool, Nice Staff..Can See Fireworks from Room
Summary: Absolutely impressed with value,,cleanliness...space...accomidations.  Staff was all very nice.  They respected our DO NOT DISTURB sign that we placed on the door all day :)  Awesome value...a small walk to the Mickey and Friends shuttle into Disneyland.  Highly reccomend!  Don't spend a bunch of money on a pricey hotel....

I was very wary of staying at this Super 8 after reading some negative reviews, but I was VERY satisfied with our stay! My boyfriend and I stayed here 3 nights for a Disney trip. The hotel lobby was clean and welcoming, and the staff was great. We checked in with no problems. The pool was small, but well maintained. Our room was very clean, smelled clean, and I even felt comfortable sleeping on their sheets! (I'm a bit of a germ freak) The AC in the room worked amazing and the fridge and microwave came in very handy. The breakfast was simple: pastries, cereal, coffee, and juice. It was definitely within walking distance of disneyland, it took us between 10 and 15 minutes to get to the mickey and friends tram which drops you off at the front of the park for free, and there is

Stayed for 2 nights with 3 other friends while visiting Disneyland, it's a short walk to Disneyland, although may be a bit long for families with young children, rooms were clean and big, service was good, continental breakfast wasn't the best but you can always eat at Disneyland  Beds were comfortable and considering we only paid 100 for a room a night it was great value

Stayed here for a week and a half. The beds are very comfortable. They seem pretty clean. It is a lot further from Disneyland than you think, but you can see the Disneyland fireworks just outside your door. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only down side is continental breakfast ends at 9 am and the pool and hot tub are quite small.

Our family had 2 rooms for three nights at this hotel.  To start with, we had to cancel two of the days we'd reserved through Travelocity (due to my husband's injury).  Travelocity didn't do what they said they would do to take care of this.  I called the hotel and spoke with the manager.  He was so helpful and pleasant.  He took care of what Travelocity should have taken care of.  Somehow Travelocity had me down for a smoking room, and we wanted non smoking.  Travelocity said that couldn't be changed, but the manager changed it for me.  The rooms were a nice size, and everything was very clean.  The beds were comfortable.  There were a couple of things I didn't like.  The walk to the Mickey and Friends parking lot took longer than we expected, and we are fast walkers.  The

Stayed here for 3 night while on my vacation to disneyland and it was nice.  The room itself was very clean it was a little outdated but we didn't mind seeing as we only went to sleep. The room came with a small fridge and microwave that came in handy. The breakfast was good, perfect for the kids, not too heavy.  They had juices, milk, cereal, toast, oatmeal, donuts,  cinnamon rolls so you get a good variety of choices but it's better to go early towards the end of breakfast the table where the food is kept gets really crowded and you have to wait around to get food. The walk to disneyland was not too far but the second day we did end up taking the car because the kids would usually fall asleep by the end of the night. The beds are a  little stiff and so are the pillows but not

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel, Disney Walk a Bit Far
Summary: We recently spent a 10 day vacation here for an event at the Convention Center and a trip to Disney as well as some other attractions.  If you are looking for something along the line of a Homewood Suites or Courtyard by Marriott, you're not going to find it here.  However, if you are looking for an inexpensive place to simply crash for the night as we were, this will suit you just fine. If you want to walk to Disney, it's doable but it does take anywhere from 15 to 25 minutes depending on how long you have to wait for the crosswalks.  If you don't want to walk all the way to the park, you can catch a parking lot tram from the parking structure, but you are still looking at at least 10 minutes of walk time to get to the structure.  As the front desk and they can provide you with

The room had the WORST smell, almost like a urine smell.   It was very stuffy & the toilet/shower room was the worst, felt like a heater was on the whole time! The room was so dim, no lights just lamps except over the mirror by the sink area.  Floors made your feet look dirty and black! Shower walls and floor looked moldy.   We were on the ground floor, lock didn't work so we only had the keychain thing. Didn't feel very safe at all.   On the upside, we were able to walk to Disneyland, took about 15mins but next time I'd stay closer to the park.  There were laundry facilities, vending machines, free breakfast (not that I actually used it).

Summary Heading: old, smelly, not helpful staff, too far from disney
Summary: this place was not nice, the room smelt, it was grubby and old, it is not as close to disney as made out, I would advise people to pay a bit more and stay somewhere nicer and closer to disney, this was our last motel after two weeks travelling through the usa, we stayed at cheap motels all the way through and was really disappointed with this

Summary Heading: good place to spend the night
Summary: My overall experience was good. I received good customer service. It is walking distance to Disneyland like about 10 minutes. Saved me some money staying here..

Our room was non-smoking as advertised and was clean and in good working order. The front desk staff was courteous and check in went well. The breakfast seemed to consist of donuts purchased as day old the previous night and quickly vanished as families took piles of them. They were replaced with pre-packaged pastries that were not as good as day old. Lucky to have cereal. Nice to have parking and able to walk to DZL. It was a surprisingly quiet place to sleep.

Summary Heading: The good things I can say are it was walking distance to...
Summary: The good things I can say are it was walking distance to Disneyland and cheap.  The downsides...it was noisy and wasn't possible to set the AC to constant Fan for white noise,  breakfast was stale donuts, toast, or frosted flakes and the breakfast area was very crowded, the bathroom was dark which was probably good because it was old, dirty and moldy.

Summary Heading: The room was clean. When checking in the staff member...
Summary: The room was clean. When checking in the staff member wasn't very well trained to see that I had two rooms instead of one which made the check-in process lengthy. The location was very inconvenient in regards to Disneyland due to no accessible walk through to the trams. Overall it wasn't a terrible experience but I will not be going back to this hotel in the future.

Summary Heading: The motel was very clean, the staff was very friendly...
Summary: The motel was very clean, the staff was very friendly. Loved the pool and hot tub! Very close to Disneyland, about a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Lots of places to eat around the motel.

The hotel was okay; typical motel. Good pool and jacuzzi. Didn't like that there was no shuttle to theme parks; got ripped off by local taxis big time and didn't feel safe making the walk in Anaheim at midnight; ended up driving to parks and paid for parking. Next time will stay on the Ball Road side of things as there's lots more people and hotels.

Clean.  Fresh, crisp sheets and towels.  Updated features mixed with some outdated features.  But if getting a good nice sleep is all you need, the price is right.  Friendly staff.  Short breakfast house.
