Perfect if you are going to Disneyland, the entrance to the parking structure is right there, you couldn't get any closer so that was perfect! The room was clean and as expected. There was a musty smell so we left the window open for several hours and unfortunately the smell never left. You could see where they just used cocking over the mold in the bathroom but we didn't use the shower as we showered at home before we came. We just needed somewhere to sleep so we could wake up at 3 am to be at the parks for the open 24 hour event.I would bring a candle to kill the musty smell next time. All in all it was fine, would stay agin if it was a short stay!

This property is older than the other locations across the US I have stayed at. The housekeeper that cleaned the room before we arrived use way to much freshener and the room reaked! The floors in the bathroom were sticky and it just did not feel clean like I have experienced at other Super 8 locations. The bed was very uncomfortable and I did check out after the first night and went elsewhere!

Summary Heading: This place is a close location for Disney parks and parking...
Summary: This place is a close location for Disney parks and parking lot. The room size is great and the cleaning service has yet not failed us the lady's do a great job. Microwaves and fridge always work. The negative about this hotel is parking service there is not enough parking for everyone although they permit and supply for one car per room. They will guide you to a reserve parking space but be prepared to be either blocked in or woken up to move your car. Also the pool is nasty.
Super cloose to disney. Not a 4 star experiance but when visiting disneyland you're basically needing a place to sleep and shower. For this it was fine.

Went to Disneyland for a family vacation and to see a Baseball game, while attending the Angels game the day of check in I received a e mail from the hotel that my reservation had been canceled that was at noon, check in is not supposed to be tel 3pm I called right away and was told that the room had already been given away still 3 hours before check in, the manager at the time said that there was nothing he could do cause they had no rooms left. do not trust these guys
Overall good. Rooms were clean. WiFi was slow. Ram out of donuts at breakfast by 8. Was promised adjoining first floor rooms and received third floor and not asking but next door.

The locks were broken in our room making me feel unsafe to just any one walking in with a room key. I feel all rooms should have a second lock ours had been broken off. Our white socks were turned black from the carpet obvious a dirty floor.

Summary Heading: location very close to Disneyland  my family walked took 15...
Summary: location very close to Disneyland  my family walked took 15 min  compared to 25 mins waiting for tram. room were very clean the room did not have the hotel room smell.. i was taken by how clean the room and the grounds were.. housekeeper  very friendly.

Summary Heading: Counter staff went the extra mile.
Summary: Counter staff went the extra mile to provide us with directions, maps, getting us a more convenient parking space, and they did it with a cheerful approach.  They were friendly and polite.   The room was spacious, plenty of room to maneuver, with microwave, mini-fridge and coffeemaker, the provision of which is appreciated! Continental breakfast is a nice offering. Location is convenient; good value for the price.
Disgustingly filthy room, (turned our feet BLACK after walking on the carpet only ten minutes).

PLEASE clean carpet-RM 115, more TV channels, beds were WAY too uncomfortable!! With that said, the mini fridge & microwave saved us a few bucks in meals. Our kids were part of a dance competition at Disneyland Hotel. The drive time, door to door without traffic, was 3 minutes. Even during the busiest times we were less than 10 minutes from Disneyland Hotel/Downtown Disney.... Very, very convenient!!.... Bottom line, we usually spend $150-$200+/night for Residence Inn Maingate(which we love!!) However, $80/night on Memorial Day Holiday could not be beat for our particular needs for the weekend.... AAA+ to Roger for his assistance in getting us settled in for our stay... See you soon, Super 8!!!

Affordable and close by Disneyland. Room was clean and staff were accommodating. Not a four Star hotel but a decent place to rest your head..... Breakfast offered but very limited with choices and quality.

The staff was uniformed about area attractions (Disneyland) and how to get there and unable to answer questions about early or late checkout.  The floor of our room was disgusting; my feet where black on the bottom after walking from the bathroom to the bed.

Summary Heading: Noisy air-conditioning unit and no fitted sheet.
Summary: My family and I have stayed at other Super 8s in the past without any issues, but this one was a terrible experience.  We went to Disneyland/California Adventure during the day and just wanted a clean room we could sleep in before going back to the park the following morning.  I don't expect much from the Super 8 hotel chain, but I do expect a room that has all working amenities.  The first problem was that one of the beds did not have a fitted sheet on it.  I am sure everyone would agree that you want that sheet as at least a barrier from a mattress which has had who knows what take place on it.  This wasn't a huge problem, but when we turned on the air conditioning unit located under the window it worked ok for two hours and then started making a very loud rumbling noise which

Summary Heading: We were planning this trip for months and we thought this...
Summary: We were planning this trip for months and we thought this hotel had all the things we were looking for but no the service was horrible those people you have working are rude disrespectful and unprofessional like if they don't want to be there and does not our fault we just wanted a good service
Great value and convenient (10-15 minute walk to Disney). Complimentary breakfast. Good facilities in rooms.

This hotel is close to Disneyland, which is why we chose it for our stay. The rooms smell like strong old lady perfume, as does the elevator. The parking situation is terrible, as you have to park in such a way that you either have to move your car for other people or you have to ask them to move if you want to leave. Continental breakfast isn't good, and isn't really a benefit.
The hotel is 20 to 30 min walk to Disneyland. I recommend to take a taxi which cost aroun $7. Breakfast is better when serve with fresh fruits or rice.

Boyfriend and I wanted a cheap, quick, last minute Disneyland vacation. We opted for this hotel based on proximity and price, and had reasonably wary expectations when we arrived, but we were very pleased with the stay. The front desk staff were very accommodating and easygoing. The room was clean and spacious, and we had a fridge which was great. The bed was comfy and big, and we had plenty of pillows which were nice, too. The bathroom was fine, the shower was pretty good, breakfast had sparse options, messy tables and too many people all at once, but it was good to go grab a quick coffee and bowl of cereal just to start the day with. The pool and hot tub were small but clean and we were grateful for them. We sat in the hot tub on our last night and watched the fireworks at

I brought my daughter's washcloth and pillow with us which unfortunately had a white pillowcase and both were clearly better quality than what was provided, so I'm not sure why housekeeping took it. My husband said they're just doing their job but why would they take it if it's obviously not one of theirs? Otherwise, this hotel did it's job and it was convenient that it had a mini fridge and microwave. Just don't make the mistake of bringing your own white linens because they will get taken even though they are so obviously a different style and better quality than theirs.
Worth it for its location, easy walk to Disneyland. Old tv's, rooms smell and a sugary breakfast. Since you are not in your room much, it is adequate. Front desk is friendly.

Close to Disney.  It was kind of tough with a 2 yr old and 4 month old. Breakfast was simple, room was clean everyday. Parking is free and I had no issues.  Would definitely stay again and reccomend. 1 thing I would like to see, upgrade the tvs.

I wanted to save money on a Disneyland vacation, @ $66/night, what a steel. It is your basic Hotel. The rooms are small. Our T.V didn't function properly. The Elevator smelled like urine. After one night we changed hotels. Ended up paying for 2 since we left around 3pm on the second day. I am not a hotel snob and considerder the hotel just a place to sleep and freshen up, but even I would think twice about staying at a Super 8 again. Also it says that the Anaheim Transportation Shuttle is close. But fails to mention the times they run. They start at 8:20 am so if you have Magic Morning tickets to Disneyland Resort it will be of no use. You will either have to take a taxi or walk. This Hotel is not conviently located at all.

Prime location, 15 minute walk to the front gate of Disneyland.  Breakfast was a joke but it didn't make a difference.  The room was clean, bed was comfy, and the shower and toilet worked, which is all I really ask for.  Be super careful with the parking, though.  The cement blocks at the head of the space ripped my fender half off and I had to knock it back into place.  Wasn't a fun thing to do at 11pm.  Another note on parking: Get there early and don't move your car until you leave.  It's extremely limited availability.

I have never stayed at a such nice and excellent hotel. At San Diego hotel circle location the rooms was clean and comfortable. The heated pool was warm and great, even the hot spa was great. Not all hotels offer a warm pool, only the spas. The WIFI was slow in my room, and I called to front desk but thay could not fix it.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel, breakfast not as advertised
Summary: This is your average hotel at a great price within walking distance to Disneyland. The rooms are old, but ok. I like a filling breakfast before heading to the parks and was not impressed. Their website advertises waffles, fruit, and yogurt, none of which were at this location. Toast, two cereal choices, and donuts are your only options. There are other choices at the same price with a better breakfast that I would stay at instead.

Summary Heading: Why go expensive if there's a Super 8?
Summary: Hotels in this particular area/location are traditionally expensive and in view of the fees for the Disneyland experience it can easily sum up. We don't mind walking (max 15 minutes to the main entrance to Disneyland) so we did choose the Super 8. We first thought that it will be something like a Motel6 outfit but to our positive surprise it was a really nice, clean and conveniently located Hotel, offering even free WiFi, parking and a breakfast, not necessarily the standard in the higher priced hotels around Disneland. Reception staff is very friendly and helpful and room service thorough. By the way, we can't really share the 'breakfast' experience of other raters, quality and selection was definitely o.k. It is the egoistic 'first me' mentality of some guests that are a

This was our first time to Disneyland. We chose the Super 8 for location, price and convenience. I would recommend the Super 8 to anyone travelling  on a budget, with or without children and by car. The Super 8 offers free parking, an outdoor pool, hottub, a family friendly atmosphere and a free continental breakfast. It is in walking distance to the tram, which takes you to the front gates of Disneyland or you can walk to Disneyland in 15 minutes.

The Hotel room was acceptable. the cleaning staff probably should not have their morning "conference" chat outside the customer rooms in the morning. The absolutely disgraceful part however was the breakfast that was included. It consisted of mainly doughnuts, white bread for toast, sugary processed juice, Sugar Frosties for cereal. The only half decent thing was the sultana/rasin Bran cereal. There was no fruit, yoghurt or eggs as most other budget hotels have. If someone had a gluten intolerance there was absolutely nothing suitable. It is not surprising there is an obesity problem in these western countries when so little thought is given to basic healthy eating. An insult to be served such rubbish.
You get what you pay for! Go cheat and received cheat service and room quality. Will never stay here again in the future.

Staff was very nice, but carpet was really in need of cleaning in our room.  I would recommend for price.  Breakfast choices should have offered some kind of fresh fruit & yogurt.  Wi-fi was annoying having to re-join every time I tried to use it during the stay.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The hardwood floors were the best part, except for the hair and dirt on them. Dirty shower, hard bed and pillows. Nonsmoking room smelled like cigarettes. Room was not serviced at all during our 3 night stay. Only perk was the price and the proximity to the park.

This hotel is great for anyone going to Disneyland. It's a quick 20 minute walk to the front entrance of the parks. Breakfast is included, although it is not much (donuts, oatmeal, toast).  There is a small swimming pool and hot tub. Free parking. Rooms are big and comfortable, although not the cleanest I've seen. Still a great value!

a great place to stay and pirces very fair. the hotel is in walking distance to a disney train which will take you to the park for free. a nice little pool in the corner of the hotel also allows you to cool off after a busy day at the park

Summary Heading: I like that the hotel was in close distance to Disneyland...
Summary: I like that the hotel was in close distance to Disneyland. It was a reasonable price for two night. The room were clean and nice looking. I didn't like that the fridges were unpluged when not in use because it gave it a bad smell in the fridge. But other that that I was very satisfied with the hotel.

This is a well-maintained hotel, fairly near Disneyland, with friendly staff, a nice little pool, and clean rooms.  It is not a fancy hotel compared to some, but I have found each time I have stayed there that it is well worth the reasonable price.  You can easily walk to the park from the hotel.  It is a long walk for some, but I have not had complaints from my group.  There is a convenience store on the nearby corner.  The only properties closer are on the east side of the park, and usually cost quite a bit more.  This property is quieter, and really quite a nice place to stay.  I ordered pizza from Marri's in Anaheim then everybody enjoyed the pool in the evening.  The breakfast room is a bit busy at times in the morning.  The breakfast is pretty simple, cereals, juice, milk

Summary Heading: great place to stay if you are on a budget. close to...
Summary: great place to stay if you are on a budget. close to disneyland. parking lot is a little small. room was a little stuffy, might have been a smoking room at one point because it smelled stale. but my only real complaint is that there was fruit offered at breakfast. everything else was easily overlooked for the price and location. staff was very friendly and helpful.

We have stayed here every time we come to Disneyland. Reason, they are always trying to make the experience of staying very pleasant. Most motels will keep the same, just cleaning. This motel is always doing something. They have remodeled the rooms. They have painted the building, outside and in. Their landscaping is always neat and tidy. A small thing but they have replaced the windows. Most motels have the old aluminum frames which let outside noise in. Their new windows have made the rooms quieter. They have a good light breakfast of rolls, toast, coffee, juice, cereal. Not fancy but good. Prices on rooms are good. Biggest thing we like is close to Disneyland(entrance to parking 1-2 blocks) and quiet. Not the noise by motels on Harbor Blvd.

Being one of the last affordable in my price range, I selected this hotel believing it was within a reasonable walking distance to Disneyland. The hotel did not offer a shuttle and I will need to remember next time to check sites for shuttles. The walk was 2.5 miles to catch the Disney parking lot shuttle. The walk is not terribly long, however, when returning from Disney, we were quite tired.   Parking was free. A nice bonus.  The room was quiet, but the site needs to be renovated. The Wifi worked well.

Summary Heading: Our stay was pretty decent. the beds are comfortable and...
Summary: Our stay was pretty decent. the beds are comfortable and they clean very well however the tile floor got a bit sticky for some reason and its nice to have a mini microwave and fregerator in the room thats a plus. when we stayed the hotel was all booked and we didnt have any problem wiht noise or anything. the only really bad thing about this place is parking. literally hardley anywhere to park.

Summary Heading: Our room wasn't cleaned one day. When asked why the person...
Summary: Our room wasn't cleaned one day. When asked why the person indicated that upon checking the room there was a do not disturb sign on the door.  We left at noon and took the sign down.  The staff did give us clean towels after we asked.

I suggest improvement on your breakfast items. The main staple were donuts which are extremely high in fat. Not one fruit or yogurt or boiled eggs in sight. Pool was filthy. They finally shut it down for cleaning for a day. No iron provided and the mini fridge froze all our food no matter at what setting it was set to. The distance from the tram to motel was longer than expected. Very disappointing stay. Also, the jerk who stayed in the room prior to us set the alarm for 1 am.
This location would be a fantastic place for a family stay on a Disneyland trip, however the terrible rooms need a desparate upgrade and the site needs maintenance.

favorite place to stay not a 5star but clean and comfortable, large rooms and quiet doesn't seem like walking distance but parking pass makes that not a problem, all staff seem polite and accommodating.

Staying here is great because you can walk to and from the Disneyland Tram and not have to pay for parking. The rooms were clean and spacious. The jacuzzi and pool were nice, PLUS free breakfast. With all the money you spend at Disneyland, it's nice to get something free. The beds/pillows could be more comfortable.One of the soda machines didn't give me change froma $5 bill but I called the front desk and they reimbursed me. Would definitely recommend if you aren't someone who needs a luxury hotel room.

Very reasonable!  Twenty minute walk from Adventure Park or Disneyland which saved us $16 per day parking fees.  Our room included 2 queen size beds, microwave and refrigerator.  Beds were comfortable and room was clean.   Free breakfast was minimal but adequate consisting of cereal, oatmeal, rolls, toast, juice and coffee.  One does not linger over breakfast when Disney is calling!   Staff was friendly and helpful.   We parked in front of our room and walked our entire time there. We are in our late 60's.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Perfect low cost hotel near Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here last weekend and was very happy with the experience. I will definitely be staying here on my next trip to Disneyland. We got it for such a good price that I had pretty low expectations, but it really was great! It's definitely not fancy by any means, but the beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. The employees were super nice. Our room wasn't ready yet, when we arrived around 11am, but checkin is at 3. They did let us park in the lot, so we parked and walked to to the tram at the Mickey and Friends parking structure.This hotel is located a 10 minute walk to the tram. The second day, we ended up just walking straight to the park and skipping the tram because it seemed to be just as fast.  Maybe a 15-20 minute walk to Downtown Disney. The breakfast was super

The roof has a leak! My kid wake up wet in the middle of the night! Call the front desk and Treene the young guy that work there said "well has a leak"! There is nothing that we can do! Really what a joke! Never again stay in here!

Summary Heading: The building looked aged and the rooms we stayed in had a...
Summary: The building looked aged and the rooms we stayed in had a odor of mold and mildew. The breakfast was nothing compared to what was advertised on the Super 8 web site. Parking was inadequate. Parking spaces were reserved and not used. Location was good for the local amusement parks.

Summary Heading: Trip to Disney with my granddaughter was a success thanks...
Summary: Trip to Disney with my granddaughter was a success thanks to the location. We also enjoyed the fireworks from Disney outside our hotel room.

I am currently staying at this hotel but am checking out tomorrow and here are my reasons.   Parking is a joke. If you chose to stay at disneyland until they close you will come back to no parking spots available or you will have to double park.   Rooms are decent for the price except for the fact that you can hear each and every footstep the person above you makes and which keeps you up unless you have NyQuil. Beds are very stiff which is good if you like that     Location is pretty good as far as getting TO mickeys parking structure but as for getting back to the hotel you have to drive down ball and turn on to walnut and basically make a big u turn   Customer service is poor.  Breakfast consists of fresh doughnuts two cereals bread and juice which isn't that bad for free.
It was a good motel. My only complaint was the room smelled. We discovered that the refrigerator had been unplugged and that was making the smell otherwise, we were happy

The pool was cooler than i'd like..but its Mid March..otherwise close to restaurants and disneyland..a GREAT EXPERIENCE.. Super 8 gave a super deal on TICKETS..We were very pleased..will come back again..

Summary Heading: Clean, tidy facilities, close to amenities
Summary: The room was tidy, the staff were helpful, there was a good selection of food to choose from at the breakfast buffet and it was kept well-stocked.  Internet was a little slow, and there was noise for neighbouring rooms. It was so easy to get to Disneyland from here (25min walk at most), and it was also close to shops. Lighting was rather dull in the room, even with all the lights on. Would stay here again.

No real problems.  The room was clean.  Though the door was locked from the outside, it didn't feel like it could keep anyone out who really wanted to get in the room.  A Little further from Disneyland than I expected, but I had no problems with the property itself.

Super 8 Anaheim was easy to find and access, and it was so easy to get to Disneyland from there (20-30min walk each way - walked to the DL parking lot and got the free transport one day - just as quick to keep on walking).  The room was clean and tidy each day.  Buffet breakfast contained a reasonable selection of products.  Staff were helpful.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Pros: close to Mickey parking garage, clean, cheap, free "breakfast"  Cons: NO parking spots anywhere, hard to locate hotel, difficult to enter hotel from main road, "breakfast" consists of donuts and cereal, late night front desk was kind of rude with the parking situation.   There was absolutely no parking spots available for either nights I stayed. I was instructed to park in a loading zone. There were no signs that said parking was full. So I had to drive around the tiny lot until I had to go to the front desk to ask where to park my car. The front desk thought it was funny when I asked if it was safe to park in the loading zone, where I was instructed to park.  Also, you can't enter the hotel from the main road going to the hotel! You have to go through a residential area

Summary Heading: Room colours were rather drab.  Air conditioner emitted an...
Summary: Room colours were rather drab.  Air conditioner emitted an unpleasant odour for the first couple of days before it started to smell better.

I stayed at this hotel on March 18,2014. I can not check into my room when i arrived, had to come back to check in,(which i was coming from out of town). Once i got into my room 317, it smell like sewer really bad.There was no parking for all the rooms. Their staff are rude and not helpful. the beds didn't have fitted sheets on them. when i wanted to check in at 10:00am i was told that the house cleaners did not start til 11:00. i would not stay here again. please do not  book or go to this hotel.

This hotel has good rates and is clean.  It is 15 minute walk to Disneyland and 30 minute walk to convention center.  Not a lot of eating places in the area except at downtown disney.  But those are crowded.  Nice hotel and would stay again.   I wished they would use different cleaning supplies.  We had 5 rooms and they all smelled the same.  wierd cleaning odor. Needs to smell fresher.

Summary Heading: Favorite places to stay. Always helpful front desk. Variety...
Summary: Favorite places to stay. Always helpful front desk. Variety of breakfast could be better.  Rooms clean.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family.
Summary: This is a great place to stay with your family, especially if going to Disneyland, which is only a 16 minute walk away. The management is GREAT and do everything possible to make your stay a happy one!  We have stayed here several times and will definitely return!
The staff was very nice and helpful. My problem was the disgusting bathroom. The shower was dirty and moldy. I needed alot of work and attention.
Well-staffed hotel, well-stocked continental breakfast. The office let us park our vehicle there before check-in so we could walk to Disneyland and avoid parking fees. Very postive experience.

I've stayed here numerous times and have never been disappointed. I tyres a few others in the area and this place by far is one of my favourites!  The room is always clean, staff very nice and helpful, clean property, close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good location near Disneyland, clean rooms. Disappointed...
Summary: Good location near Disneyland, clean rooms. Disappointed about the breakfast, not as advertised(no waffles or yogurt).

Summary Heading: You truly get what you pay for here.
Summary: Filthy apartment - the blankets on both beds had multiple stains all over them and after taking a shower and walking around the apartment for just a few minutes bottom of feet were completely black from the horribly dirty carpet.  Sheets are not changed daily, who knows when they are changed - who knows when the blanket and comforter are ever cleaned.  Breakfast was a joke.  Staff was nice.  TV terrible.  This is a bottom of the barrel apartment and you truly do get what you pay for.
Hotel clean. Room large. Right next to where the Disneyland fireworks are launched & very very loud.

This hotel was very well located and better equipped than I had imagined for the price. My Aunt and I only needed to stay 1 night after a day at Disneyland so I took this bargain to save money and expected the worse. I was pleasantly surprised it was fine. The bed was comfortable and it had all the basics covered. It is not fancy by any means but at this price, a great deal. Ask for the iron at the front desk, if you need one.

Summary Heading: The hotel was very difficult to access. You could only get...
Summary: The hotel was very difficult to access. You could only get to it from one way. It seems close to Disney but quite a pain to drive to. It was clean but extremely dated, teeny pool area, very thin walls. About a 25 min walk to Disneyland entrance. Breakfast was doughnuts. Not enough parking for guests. On occasion had to double park.

Summary Heading: As an inexpensive way to go to Disneyland, Super 8...
Summary: As an inexpensive way to go to Disneyland, Super 8 functional.  The location was good; the rooms were decent; we all slept well.  The continental breakfast was full of unhealthy breakfast options; no protein or fruits, except juices.

The place is spacious, however, being right next to traffic, it's noisy.  It's also outdated, but I will say it was pretty clean. The front desk people were very nice offering directions and suggestions, etc. breakfast was quick toast, donuts, cereal...nothing great, but adequate to take you to lunch!

We enjoyed our stay,  found good restaurants close by, and the hotel was very convenient.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area, We are planning another trip next year, and would stay there again,  We will take our family and the hotel has adjoining rooms.

Don't expect much from this hotel, only good if you are looking for cheap price. Room smelled musty, they would take our towels and not return them until the evening. Breakfast was horrible, out of everything, and very dirty.

Very clean rooms, helpful folks at the front desk who assisted me with making reservations for local sights.  Food wasn't anything to write home about for breakfast, but I appreciated what was available.

Summary Heading: Great customer service but noisy and outdated
Summary: I wasn't expecting a whole lot from the hotel judging by the price. I knew to keep my expectations in check. The young woman at the front desk I spoke with several nights was very sweet and informative when I asked her questions. My biggest complaint is about the noise. The walls are very thin and you can hear every person, car and elevator ding. Disneyland is also a 10 minute walk to a bus stop, and then you take that tram to get to the actual entrance. Disneyland is not within a comfortable walking distance (and you have to cross some very busy roads too. The hotel got the job done and was good enough for my trip, but next time I would spend a little more cash and choose someplace nicer.

Summary Heading: We liked the room. It is an older hotel but the amenities...
Summary: We liked the room. It is an older hotel but the amenities were fine.  The staff was very nice and helpful. The parking is difficult with not enough spaces for the rooms.  The staff was helpful though trying to find a place for us to park. Parking was the only downfall for this hotel.

This hotel is basic, but it is a good location and has everything that you need.  The service was ok.  The breakfast was simple.  The room was clean.  Not sure that we would stay again as there are many other options.

Me and my family stayed for 3 nites to go to Disneyland Saturday and Sunday.  The room was clean and spacious, the front desk was friendly and helpful, and the walk to Disneyland was very short.  They can use a TV upgrade but for the price we payed for the room its no big deal.  We took a play pen for my 2 year old to sleep in and my wife was happy and surprised when we came back from the park to see the house keeper folded my babies blankets in the playpen which was unexpected.  Overall great experience and for under 100$ a nite I don't see how any one can complain being a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.

We have stayed at this Super8 many times before. It is as close to the parking Disney structure as we can get. Very convenient location. The room was clean and the staff accommodating. Parking is always an issue here, but as always, the staff took care to make sure no one was inconvenienced.

Pros: it's a decent budget hotel that's very close to Disneyland. Parking is free. Rooms are clean and come with both a microwave and mini fridge.  Cons: do not stay at this hotel unless you plan on spending all day everyday of your stay at Disneyland. They have a very inconvenient parking system where they double up the cars in each stall so that one car essentially blocks the other one in. If you happen to be the inside car you are trapped unless the other person is there to move their car. The hotel tries to coordinate this system based on when people say they plan on checking out, but the bottom line is they can't guarantee that the car will move/leave when they say they will. In the case of an emergency they say they can tow the car, but who knows how long that can end up

Walk to Disneyland is like 15-20 minutes, not ideal if you have small kids. Beds are way better than the pictures you see on the web, it's does not have that ugly looking old style comforter. Bring pillows 'coz they only have 2 per bed. Tub doesn't clog like other cheap hotels. Shower is just like holiday inn express, good pressure and very nice shower head. Fridge and microwave is a plus. A grocery/gas station was just right after another hotel. Did not really try the breakfast but my mom said is was just donut and coffee. Parking was very limited in the front but there's more room in the back. The trainee at the front dest was able to give us adjoining room. All in all this is a great location for the price. Will stay here again if we'll be in the area.

Summary Heading: Good clean lodging at a budget price.
Summary: We were looking for basic, economical lodging for one night, and we found it here.  The room was clean and comfortable (even if the color scheme was a bit dark), and the $59 price was hard to beat.  Comparable motels around Disneyland charge up to twice as much for the same amenities.  It is about a half mile to the Mickey and Friends tram, or a full mile to the park gates.  Prepare to do a little walking.  The staff was friendly and helpful, no problems there.  We would stay here again.

first there was so much confusion at the front the woman who work the desk didn't give accurate information on the phone therefore it was very difficult to check in since I had lost my credit card in the interim from where I started from tell him when I got there I had to beg borrow and steal to find another bad credit card and money in order to stay at the hotel because the woman said it was her policy not to allow anybody without a credit card. The room itself was old outdated smells just and the tv didn't work. overall yuck!
Disneyland and Convention Center is around the corner.  A little noisy due the nearby highway I5. Good service by maids and front desk.

Summary Heading: excellent customer service from the front desk employees.
Summary: Entire stay was very pleasant.  The front desk staff went out of their way to help me gather information that was needed from computer.  Thanks to your staff.

Every time I passed by a worker they would smile and say "good morning"!  And the front desk was ALWAYS super helpful!  I was really impressed with the happy atmosphere that seemed to radiate from the staff, and that means a lot to me!  I had an issue with my arrival date and they happily helped me.  The atmosphere really made this a nice place to stay!  The room was clean and quiet.  The counters were nice.  My only complaint is the linens were a little old and the pillows were unusually thick and hard.  BUT, it was the most affordable hotel in the area.  And the cont. breakfast was good for the price of the hotel and the staff was super happy! Thanks for the nice stay!

Summary Heading: Great stay for an excellent value
Summary: My stay here was great . It was not too far from the convention center that we had to attend for the weekend. Room was big enough and clean. I would recommend you guys anytime!
We had a great stay - our room was clean and tidy, with a comfy bed and a fridge. Staff helpful too.

Summary Heading: Hotel was good for a quick stay. Shuttle to the park would...
Summary: Hotel was good for a quick stay. Shuttle to the park would be nice but not too far of a walk if the weather is okay. Bed not too comfy and the continental breakfast was almost gone first thing in the morning.

Summary Heading: The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the...
Summary: The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and Disneyland.  The towels were like sandpaper- must have forgotten the fabric softner.  Second night they forgot to leave wash clothes.

Summary Heading: I often participate in the Run Disney run events. This...
Summary: I often participate in the Run Disney run events. This hotel's placement is very convienent with entry into the Mickey and Friends parking lot.  The bed is comfortable, which is very important to me.  The parking situation can be very tricky during big event weekends.
Elevator&bathroom smelled like urine.  Carpet&tiles were sticky.  Room smelled funky.  My nose itched..

Our stay at the Super 8 hotel was specifically so we could spend a couple of days in Disneyland. We found the hotel very satisfactory for our family though being from a small, rural town in New Zealand we found the traffic noise hard to get accustomed to.The hotel staff were very helpful and the free breakfast was good pus the hotel is only a short, straight forward walk from downtown Disney so we did not require extra transport. I would recommend this hotel especially for those on a tight budget as it is well worth the very reasonable charge. Thank you Super 8, Anaheim!

Summary Heading: We have stayed here a lot and this is the first time I was...
Summary: We have stayed here a lot and this is the first time I was disappointed in the room. It was kinda smelly and not clean. My friends blanket was not clean! GROSS! However they did give us a new blanket and an extra pillow too.

There was a mix up at the front desk with the charging of my card. This hotel does not do an pre authorization it is a hard post to your card at check in, I have stayed at Super 8 many time and this has never happened the front desk clerk stated that is the way they do it at this hotel be prepared for that. Parking is a nightmare. It is a 30 min walk to the front gate of Disneyland so be prepared for that as well. Rooms could use some updating and ours smelled a bit. Also being so close to where the fireworks are for the park you can hear them very loudly. Also the hotel itself in noisy. Beds are very uncomfortable. Also staying at Super 8 I am familiar with the breakfast they provide this hotel does not do well in this area old doughnuts, dry bread no fruits beagles or muffins.

The bed was comfy and employees very nice but that's where it ends. Room smelled strongly of bad air spray- way too much. Poor decorating and very old bathroom- worried about taking a shower. There wasn't enough vehicle parking for number of units. Would not stay again.

I loved this place for a quick getaway to Disney on a budget. Rooms are ample, you're 10 minute walk from downtown Disney and the employees are nice and helpful. Yes, the beds are hard and the mattresses have seen better days. What were you expecting for the price? If you are so picky pay the extra 100 bucks and stay at the Sheraton across the street.  Helpful tips: the road can be a little loud if you're a light sleeper, use the T.V. or A.C. to drown the little noise. The shampoo provided is not enough, bring your own. Overall, great experience and I loved the price tag considering everything else we had to pay for.

Excellent location. 15 mins walk to tram. able to watch fireworks in front of lobby. Basic breakfast. Parking is limited. Well kept older property. The room was spacious. Fridge and micro wave were bonuses.

The beds were horrible. The beds were so old that they bowed in the middle. Thankfully, we brought our own pillows, because the pillows were extremely old and worn out. When trying to move around on the bed we could hear the springs and feel some of them in our backs. The bathroom was terrible. There was mold growing up the sides of the wall, all the way to the ceiling. You could tell that they had attempted to cover the mold with paint, but it was growing through the paint. The water pressure was weak, and the drain was very slow. We wound up standing in several inches of water while trying to shower. We had two queen beds in our room. The television is very small, and the placement of the television only allowed for one bed to view the television. We were told breakfast was

Where to start?  There are more rooms than there are parking spots, so unless you are being dropped off, prepare to fight for a parking spot.  The continental breakfast is less than a joke.  When we got there between the hours stated, everything was empty except the cereal bins which we put in bowls only to pour milk foam in them because the milk was out!   All in all, I wished we had stayed across the street where they have a shuttle to Disneyland, instead of a 20 minute sketchy walk to a "tram stop"...
Comfortable beds and excellent staff. Room was clean and serviceable. We would definitely stay again.
Great place, excellent staff and food. Disney fireworks visible from location. Overall a good stay!

Check in and out was easy. The room was clean and the breakfast was ok, and the motel is a 2 minute drive to the Mickey and Friends Parking garage where we took the tram to the park. We had no problems late and night getting extra coffee for our room for the next day since we were going to be up and out of there before they started breakfast. A nice bonus was being able to see the park's fireworks from our hotel room.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, that's about it
Summary: Moldy outdated bathroom. The electrical outlets were in poor condition. Plugs just fell out of the walls. One elevator at the far end of the complex. The staff is friendly and the hotel is very close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great locations, cleans room staff very helpful, friendly...
Summary: Great locations, cleans room staff very helpful, friendly and efficiency. The only things I will change is the pillow there were kind of hard but other than that it was very comfortable to staying in this hotel.

Summary Heading: Good motel for the price.  Continental breakfast was pretty...
Summary: Good motel for the price.  Continental breakfast was pretty good.  Donuts, juice, cereal, toast, bagels.  Convenient to Disneyland parking structure tram.  10 minute walk to tram.
There were simply WAY too many cars in the parking lot. I don't know if there were a lot of rooms that had more than one vehicle, but it was extremely over crowded.

This was an amazing hotel to stay at. So close to Disneyland; definitely walking distance. Very affordable. Nice rooms. Complimentary breakfast, although it didn't have as big a selection as other Super 8's. Complimentary parking was nice. We had a great time!

For the price this was a reasonable place to stay the night.  We spent all of our time at Disney Land, and were just looking for a safe, quiet place to sleep each night.  Super 8 worked out just fine, the staff was friendly and the rooms were clean.

Summary Heading: Reviews must be at least 25 characters. Hotel entrance is...
Summary: Reviews must be at least 25 characters. Hotel entrance is inconvenient during many times of the day because of backed up traffic.
Economical way to stay near Disneyland. About a 20 minute walk to the park. Roll away available at extra cost. Plenty of towels etc. Comp internet.

I had a nice stay in this hotel.  I liked that it is walking distance to Disneyland.  The rooms were very clean.  The only bad thing was that the pillows were very hard but overall it was a great place to stay.

This is the best location ever to go to Disneyland by walking. It has always been clean and nice. The staff at the front (desk after arrival) we're not that helpful or friendly. First time this has happened here but, I would book this place again.

Was a great stay in Anaheim! Little bit of a walk to the disney tram but overall not bad. Hotel is nice a clean, pool area well kept and staff are great!! Breakfast could have used a bit of fruit but overall decent!

Was very unhappy with this hotel, I spoke in person with a lady at the hotel, she gave me the wrong information on just about everything I had asked. The help was rude, except housekeeping. Not an easy hotel to get into, small parking lot. Beds were very comfortable and it was clean.
Stayed here for Blizzcon 2013.  Only 1.2 miles from the Anaheim Conf Center...a nice stroll through Disneyland.  Clean place.

Stayed at this Super 8 while attending the Marine Ball at Disney. Was given our key, half hour after check in time, to be sent into a dirty room with our hands full of our belongings to get ready for the event. Returned to the front desk to be sent to the room next door (no apology about the dirty room) to open the next door and find large mechanical fans, showing an obvious unused room. Then, a 3rd time, went back to the front and told them we were on a time crunch and sent to a 3rd room, (still no apology) and was able to stay in that room but it smelt as though it had been wet. Beds were nothing to write home about, but you get what you pay for. Outdated and our room was very dark.  Went to breakfast, which was only 2 hours (never seen less than 3 hours at a hotel and I

Summary Heading: My stay at the super 8 hotel was excellent. The room was...
Summary: My stay at the super 8 hotel was excellent. The room was clean and the beds were comfy . The staff was friendly and made you feel welcome .

Summary Heading: Stayed at this hotel for a Disneyland trip with friends and...
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a Disneyland trip with friends and will not stay here again.  The staff was aloof and unfriendly, the beds were extremely uncomfortable and had lumpy pillows.  The lighting in the room/vanity area was awful and the continental breakfast was a joke.  It was the cheapest hotel in the area but we got what we paid for...a horrible stay.  Next time I will pay a bit extra to stay somewhere that at least has a comfortable bed.
The tub did not drain. The noise from the street was unbearable! The odor in the room was foul. The breakfast room ran out of food a half an hour before the time it ended.

Summary Heading: My Review Room 219 and stay 2013 Oct 28 to November 6
Summary: First: As soon as we got in there was a smell mildew or mold I don't know, but we went to the AM PM store and bought some Lysol spray. Two plugs on the East wall don't hold things well when things plugged in so the electrical outlets need replacing. The TV is a CRT and the picture tube is going. Yes you guys need to buy some nice flat screen TVS.  For breakfast it is advertised that waffles,yogurt, and fruit are part of the continental breakfast, but these items were not available. Toast, donuts, porridge to add water to in the microwave, cereal raisin bran and frosted flakes, hot chocolate add the water, coffee, orange and apple juice. They kept these items stocked during breakfast time. Pastries always fresh.  One thing staff and customer service. Customer friendliest is

15 years ago or more, I had reservations at another hotel. They overbooked and left my family stranded. We saw an ad for this Super 8 in a travel magazine at IHOP and gave it a try. It was great and has been our Disneyland place ever since. We've probably stayed here at least 10 times. We always book a room by the pool, love the free coffee and breakfasts and the free parking. The staff has always been friendly and helpful with anything we have ever needed. I have never seen a bug in the rooms and any super noisy guests are quieted down quickly. It is only 2 doors down from an AM PM for easy gas ups, junk food and supplies. It is a very clean place at a great price and a nice spot to watch Disneyland's nightly fireworks.

Has tight, limited parking. Close to Disneyland but probably to far to walk for most people. Location has no diner or restaurant close enough to walk to so must drive. Clean and bug-free and a great price close to the park gives it my high rating. I stayed for 5 nice days.

This hotel is actually more convenient than first thought. Arrived at 2:30 am to Anaheim after deciding to blow thru Sacramento. Pulled off the freeway, and three turns later pulled into this Super 8. Not much of a review since we checked in, and went immediately to sleep. Seemed quiet and the room was good sized with a seperated shower/toilet from sink which is great for getting ready in the mornings. Never made the breakfast; slept till 10am and checked out. Price is very reasonable, especially with AAA membership.

this was a good place to stay reasonable price, quiet and clean. only thing is they take your money twice!! when we first arrived there I payed the full amount immediately, ($242) then upon checkout I discovered that they had taken the full amount ($242) out again and we are still waiting to get the refund back (6 days later)!!Very strange and annoying system. Besides that not bad at all!

We enjoyed our stay here. I traveled with my son and was very pleased with the area the motel was in. In addition to the nice clean rooms and nice staff. It was so close to Disneyland and everything else we wanted to see in this area.

Summary Heading: Super 8 was quiet and very affordable. Breakfast could have...
Summary: Super 8 was quiet and very affordable. Breakfast could have been a little better but the stay was great.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time out to write a nice comment for us.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: The second night of our stay our room was filled with one inch of sewage water, the bathroom sink poured over into he bathroom and hallway of our room. We had to move rooms at ten o'clock at night with small children.  Many of our belongings were covered in this sewage and unusable. We were compensated by being given one nigh free. That sure didn't cover the expense of replacing our damaged items
Manager Response: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you had to go through.  Your sink had backed up and we took immediate action to correct this and offer you the appropriate compensation.  Issues like this do happen and even though it's out of hotel's control, we'll make every effort to correct this for the guest.  Please contact me directly so I may provide further resolution for you.  Thanks.

Summary: We where doubled charged for are room and talked to the manager Roger who said it wasn't his fault so we where stuck in Disneyland with no money to eat are get back home to AZ and the hotel manager would not take responsibility or help us in any way what ever happened to the costumer is always right ? he was rude unapologetic and needs not to be in a costumer service job it was the hotels fault for double charging
Manager Response: Your account was not double charged as we have explained that there is a pending authorization done for all the guest checked into the room.  The authorization will be released by your bank after the time of check out.  The amount of time depends on your card institution and we have no control over that.  Authorization one the guest's credit card is a standard hotel industry practice and we will assist the guest in getting the amount released sooner if they require us to do so.  We will in no way double charge our guest because that will violate any credit card company's customer policy and you may also dispute the charge if you believe mistake has occurred.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: A place to sleep, nothing more.
Summary: The front desk was rude, unhelpful and downright belligerent.  My credit card that I used to reserve the room was charged at midnight the night before I was going to check in.  I hoped to use a different card, but could not afford to have that much charging power locked up.  The room itself was clean and large...but very well worn.  My husband called the towels something from a bad romcom movie, there were a lot of holes in them.  Again it is very clean, no complaint on the housekeepers.  But the front line team of the front desk was very unhelpful...to the point of telling me to illegally park in the handicapped spots.  They don't have enough spots for room, even though parking is guaranteed.  That left me nervous to drive and leave the hotel because I felt we would not have a
Manager Response: I'm sorry if you did not have a positive experience with us.  Guest have a choice to pay with whatever credit card they wish upon check out.  However, the credit card on file may be pre-authorized on the day of arrival to ensure the reservation is valid.  This is done to ensure fairness to all of our guests because many guest simply make fake reservations that take up rooms they do not intent to show up for.  This is unfair for our other guests who have enjoyed staying with us. I'm sorry about the parking instruction you have received, I'll be sure front desk staff do a better job in explaining the parking policy.  Thanks for your feedback and I hope you'll give us another try in the future.

Summary: This hotel is a great choice for anyone on a budget. The walk to Disneyland is a little longer than some other hotels, but at HALF the price, the walk was worth it. If you are walking with children, take a stroller. The room had everything we needed, mini frig, coffee pot, microwave and plenty of towels (yes, more than 2). We were also able to watch the fireworks from our room. The front desk staff could not have been better.
Manager Response: Thanks for your nice comment, we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: good location to Disney. Parking was very tight at the hotel, seems not enough alloted spaces.
Staff was nice, but we had to change rooms, because doors were left open. Breakfast in the morning was not kept up and was constantly running out of items.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment, we'll certainly review our breakfast items and inventory.

Summary: Not within walking distance of Disney as claims. No tram service. No restaurants nearby. No parking. Horrible experience.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have a positive experience. Our property is walking distance to the Mickey and Friends parking structure where you can catch the tram service.  If you were under the impression that we are directly across the maingate (in which there are about 5 hotels that can really claim so) then I'm sorry for the miscommunication.  The closest restaurants are in Downtown Disney, again, you may have to walk to the Mickey and Friends parking lot if you do not wish to drive.   Thanks for your feedback, we'll do a better job informing our guests in the future.

Summary: No complaints, I was able to leave my vehicle at the hotel and walk to Disneyland. I didn't get to try the free breakfast but I'm sure it was probably good (as good as continental breakfast can be anyway). Great free wifi. Good part of town and close to most things you can need...Papa Johns, Panda Express, Wal-Mart and much more.
The room smelled like drugs ( burning Meth ), the heater/AC unit stank. Every night there was a party in the rooms next to us until the early hours of the morning.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had a negative experience.  We wash our AC units twice a year and I'm sorry if your room did not get serviced properly.  Please contact me directly so I may resolve the situation for you.  Thanks.

Summary Heading: The room smelled like urine the decor is very outdated and...
Summary: The room smelled like urine the decor is very outdated and the breakfasts was mediocre at best it is close to Disneyland but that's all it has going for it z
My room's AC and refrigerator didn't work. Also, the fridge had a terrible mildew smell creeping out of it.

Stayed: Thursday, Sept. 26- Friday, Oct. 4, 2013 (8 days) good points- very close to Disneyland - walked to the tram parking lot and rode the tram to Disney. Rooms were very spacious and clean.  I usually stay at Hilton family hotels and was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  The bathrooms were clean and in good order, too. Walmart is just down the freeway at the Euclid exit.  minor negative points - the parking on sold out dates was difficult.  Breakfast is limited to donuts, frosted flakes and raisin bran cereals, milk, juice, coffee, and packets of hot chocolate, packaged oatmeal, and bread for toast.  No fruit. Lastly, it was noisy with families and kiddos running around at all different times of the night and mornings on the weekend. (it's Disneyland!)  This Motel isn't

You can't beat the price, my room was quiet, clean and everything was in good working order, clean bed, hot shower, TV, microwave, fridge, hair dryer, the AC worked perfectly.  It was only a 15 minute nice and safe walk to the Disneyland tram. The California weather was perfect!  They also served a nice breakfast each morning, coffee, toast, donuts, cereal, oatmeal and juice.  I had plenty of towels each day and fresh sheets.  I'm not a high maintenance person when I travel, just happy with the basics, I came there for Disneyland, my first trip there. And this Super 8 helped make it a perfectly magical vacation. I'm staying here again on my next Disneyland trip!
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice comments, we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Stayed here with family and loved it, it was comfortable easy to get around, the staff where helpful and our rooms where clean. We could walk to most things and the car was safe outside our rooms would happily stay again
Manager Response: We're glad you had an enjoyable stay.  Thank you for the nice comment.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: Got there after hours. Had to stand at a window to do paperwork and pay for the room. A guys was walking around behind us and made me feel uncomfortable. Wish the lobby was open 24 hours. Loved the room very clean. Quite place. Small pool that we didn't use. Small parking lot and had to walk far to the room.
Manager Response: We hope you'll come back and see us again.  Thanks for your comment. We'll certainly keep the lobby open for as late as possible.

Summary: I have frequented the SUPER 8 chain before and am disappointed with the overall presentation and maintenance of this property.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us.  We'll continue to improve the overall appearance of our property.  Thanks for your comment.

Summary: Our room on the ground floor was great.  Had all amenities advertized.  Great value in that area near Disney.  Easy access to Disneyland, getting back is a little trickier, phone navigation got us right back, easy once you've done it.  Close to an AMPM with fuel, easy access to I-5.
Manager Response: Our location made it very accessible for all of our guests.  I'm glad you feel the same way too.  Thanks for taking the time out to provide your feedback!

Summary Heading: Very happy with our stay, now at a hotel in Santa Monica...
Summary: Very happy with our stay, now at a hotel in Santa Monica,  3 times as expensive and we don't have laundry, hair dryer, refrigerator and coffee making facilities all as promised,  should have stayed at Super 8 Anaheim for longer.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We do try to provide as many amenities to our guests as possible, that's what makes us different from our competitors.  Please do come back and see us again.

Summary: We visit Disneyland often, and this is our go-to hotel. Our group often includes a disabled member, so walking/shuttles just aren't conducive to our needs. This Super 8 is located just a block from the entrance to the Mickey and Friends parking structure, the main/biggest parking area for Disneyland, making entering and exiting easy and quick (at least as fast as walking would have been). Like all Anaheim hotels, it suffers from a painfully small parking lot, but at least they don't charge for parking! The breakfast is similarly small, and will almost certainly run out before the posted "end" time. It isn't within walking distance to any particular restaurant or fast food, but those are only a few blocks away (and the ones across from Disneyland are as over-priced as you'd
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We do still offer limited smoking rooms to accommodate every guest.  We're in the process of planning our next room renovation.  We hope with the new room design our guest will find our place even more inviting!

Summary: I asked my travel agent to book the super 8 on katella but they booked this one accidentally and we couldn't change the reservation. This hotel is FAR from Disneyland do not believe anyone who says you can walk. I am a walker and this was too far, it takes 35 mins to walk all the way there. There are no restaurants, shops or anything near the hotel. I asked at the front desk where the ART bus stop was and he knew nothing and was of zero help. I am currently at this hotel and am so upset that we aren't near anything and it has ruined our vacation. I wouldn't recommend saying here unless you have a car.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you feel our location is too far from everything.  We're right next to Mickey and Friends parking structure and Downtown Disney so there are shops and restaurant close by.  It's never easy to walk around the park so most of the guests do have a vehicle even though it's less than a 5 min drive.  We do not recommend ART shuttle simply because a day pass will cost you anywhere between $10 to $15 and do not provide the convenience that we feel that's worth the price.  Our guest end up having to wait for the shuttle for a long time and in our experience it's just not a good alternative.  I thank you for your comment and will advise the staff to provide ART shuttle info accordingly.

Summary: The room was clean but so out dated and smelled like mildew and what's worse is I will never be able to fragrance a Rose scent ever again without the reminder of this place because it was the scent of Roses that they tried to mask the mildew smell with, couldn't sleep because the building continually creeked as if it was going to crumble to nothing. The continental breakfast was good but they kept running out of supplies not to mention the bathroom facilities does not accommodate the amount of guest who show up to the breakfast.
Manager Response: I'm sorry for your experience.  We'll work harder to accommodate the breakfast crowd.  I appreciate your comment and hope you'll give us another try.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Best bang for your buck when going to disneyland
Summary: Stayed at Super 8 in Anaheim on 9/11/13 for my 2nd time. I would definitely stay at the Super 8 again.  PROS: Got the room for a great rate in comparison to others in the area. The room and bedding was clean. It's very close to Disneyland. If you stay for more than one night, you could essentially walk to Disneyland's Mickey and Friends Tram in 15 minutes. If you're looking for a late-night night cap and/or snack, Downtown Fullerton is a short 15 minute drive away.   CONS: The room had a weird stench, but the smell seemed to disappear once the A/C lowered the temperature in the room. I think the smell had something to do with the humidity in the room. Also, the shower floor could have been cleaner.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a comment for us.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: Easy walk to Disneyland. Clean rooms. Easy accessibility. Rooms were worth the price we paid. Staff was very helpful and nice. Property well kept and aesthetically pleasing.

It's a good price to pay if you're going to Disneyland! But don't expect much. First, the location is about a 10 minute walk from Disneyland, so that's easy if everyone in your party can walk after a day at the park. The room itself was clean and the air conditioner worked well, but there was a bad smell (we managed to air the room out, though), the bed was rock hard, and the building is a bit older. Despite being on a main street, there was no noise or traffic to keep us up. The other amenities are tiny, but there - free Wi-Fi, a small pool, and doughnuts/cereal/coffee in the morning. Overall, if this were anywhere else, it'd be ridiculously expensive, but the location makes it rather worth it.

This place was nice and clean. It is only 1 block from the Disneyland parking lot, which is good. When we got there it was after Midnight and there was absolutely no parking. But, the front desk person let me park behind the check in spot at a red curb and said it was fine and it was. I was glad of that. The room we stayed in had hardwood floors, which was different, but in a way good because you can if it's clean or dirty real easy. The TV was pretty bad. Not sure if I am so used to HD that I am spoiled or maybe the reception was bad. We were barely there, so it was fine. The only real problem were the beds and pillows. It was just so uncomfortable to sleep. The beds are really hard and I am a side sleeper and need a softer mattress and the pillows were really flat. But, what

Summary Heading: Convenient location...you get what you pay for.
Summary: The room was 84 bucks. It had an odd smell upon walking into the room. This lessened when the AC was turned on for a few hours. The door looked like it had been broken into, in that the door jam had been splintered and fixed. You definitely get what you pay for, but it did have a microwave and refrigerator, which was nice. It is less than 1/2 mile from the park trams, so you can walk there. Other locations (like the Disney hotels) were over $400 for the night. In that regard, we were very satisfied.

Summary Heading: Have stayed at this hotel in the past, staff has always...
Summary: Have stayed at this hotel in the past, staff has always been friendly & professional. This time however, housekeeping was a little "anxious" to clean our room before we checked out. The rooms have been quiet even being next to the street with Disney traffic. Great view of the fireworks show from Disneyland. Clean, comfortable rooms. Easy walk to Disneyland. Entering parking lot from the opposite direction is a little cumbersome but not that big a deal. Good value for the price.

Had the best time there the staff went out of there way for us, and  we were close to every place we wanted to go . The rooms were clean, and you had room to move. The staff help us fine cheap a rental car ,and told us about all the things we could do while there, it was lovely chatting with the

We need a place just to sleep and bath because we go to disney all day long, if you arrive late at night, they run out of parking which can accommodate you, they placed a car behind me and the next day the car would not let me out "because the owner had gone up and leave your car there" so I had to do a lot of maneuvering to get out of that place.      They have a slow free internet but works good, you can pay $10.00 + tax for a faster internet if you want.

My daughter and I felt the hotel was good value for the price we paid. Our room was more than big enough for the 2 of us, with a nice bathroom too.Housekeeping was prompt and our room cleaned each day. We found that having a fridge and a microwave in the room was a big help as we did not always have to go out to eat, but could keep many basic foodstuffs in our room to heat and eat when we wanted. Many of the local rerstaurants deliver to your room, so you can store and heat leftovers with ease.There is also a well-stocked convenience store located inside the petrol station on the corner.. My daughter also enjoyed using the pool at the end of a long day at Disneyland. Laundry facilites at the motel, also make travelling a lot easier. We could walk to Disneyland (it took us about

We spent five nights at this location in July 2013. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet.  The hotel is within walking distance to the parking structure at Disneyland. You can also easily walk to the parks within 15 minutes at a brisk pace. We left our rental car at the hotel and saved the daily parking fee charged by Disney.  We could also see the fireworks each night from the front of the hotel on Disneyland Drive.  Breakfast is provided free, but is limited to donuts, cereal and toast, with juices and coffee/tea. We opted to make out own breakfast using the fridge and microwave in all rooms.  We would stay there again on our next trip to Anaheim.
This was a nice stay for us it was close to Disneyland and the surroundings.  It was easy to find and right off of the freeway..
room was in excellent condition-I have a knee injury and they were very accomodating. I will definately stay again!

Summary Heading: This hotel is NOT walking distance from Disneyland
Summary: There were several things that were wrong with this stay.   1) They say that the hotel is walking distance from Disneyland, but it is clearly a few miles away, and that is as the crow flies.  To walk there would take way too long, and your feet are already tired! 2) Their "continental breakfast" consisted of dried cereal and a couple of hard doughnuts, but it was all gone when we came in to eat at 8am, and people were fighting like vultures for things like plastic spoons. Not a good experience. 3) There is NOT enough parking spots for the rooms they have, so they were double parking cars, which means you either have to leave before the person you parked in front of, or be blocked in by someone else.  One night they even parked us in the fire lane, which I know is not legal. 4)

It was clean and comfortable. The wi fi was not very good it was extremely slow. We were also disappointed that breakfast was 6-10am but on several days it was cleaned up by 9 am and so we didnt get breakfast at all.

Summary Heading: The S8 was what we imagined considering the cost-benefit...
Summary: The S8 was what we imagined considering the cost-benefit relation. Excellent localization (when thinkingin Disney) and price. Some problems with cleanliness and a small breakfast (not sufficient for all guests).
You can't beat the location, but the room smelled musty & needed major cleaning.  Carpets very dirty.

Summary Heading: Between Ontario, CA and Huntington Beach
Summary: Stayed here because its close to Disney, has good parking, fairly easy access from I-5, a pool and hot tub.  My wife went to Disney for the day while I had business meetings in Huntington Beach.  It was close enough for her to have a nice day at the park, and for me to get to my meetings without too much traffic hassle.  My wife has the Wyndham Rewards loyalty card so she could benefit from the rewards with us staying here.
The staff was really friendly, the rooms clean and roomy. Pool and Jacuzzi and about a 15-20 minute walk from the free Disney shuttle.

This motel is a nice and clean and well run spot. Although its situated right next to a busy road its quiet. Its very close ( walking distance ) to Disneyland. There is a little pool which is also very clean. We, a family of 4, stayed for 2 nights for 200 dollars and thats what I call good value for your money.
We loved our weekend get away stay at the Super 8. Wonderful customer service, really close to Disney

I would say you get what you pay for.  it's cheap. so no frills. but it was clean and everyone is friendly.  pool super small but my kids didn't care.  rooms are not the best. old. beds old too. but can't beat the price. parking is tight but staff will help you get situated.  you can turn air cooler but it will automatically go back to 70 and you can't adjust is lower. tv volume was also locked.  but overall the price is right!
clean, & convenient location to Disneyland, parking can be tough small lot, but they work well to control, continental  breakfast okay, could use some improvement, good value for the price.

Here is an option for those of us who can't afford what I call the Anaheim Strip! (Those hotels which are directly across from the main gates of Disneyland).  This hotel is a great option if you don't mind walking a couple of blocks to get to the Disneyland Tram.  The hotel offers a fee breakfast of the usual variety for Super 8 Hotels, a nice swimming pool and hot tub, and you can view the fireworks from the backside!  I've stayed a number of times here at this facility and I can always get a great value, they even printed out my boarding passes for me!!!!  Other places on the "strip" charge for this service, charge for breakfast, and even charge you additional charges.

Summary Heading: Good value motel for Disney trip
Summary: Although the free WiFi is a bit slow, the overall package is very good value (free parking, walking distance to Disney TRAM, free breakfast (very decent although not great)) and the staff are friendly.  The room has everything one may need (refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc).  Will stay here again if we ever return to Disney.

Summary Heading: -Did not like the fact that there is absolutely no parking...
Summary: -Did not like the fact that there is absolutely no parking. Every night when we would come back from the parks, we would have to go into the office to find a person to get us a parking spot because everything was full. They had us double parked a couple of the nights and we could not get our car out the next morning!  -Left my cosmetic bag in the hotel when I checked out; called the next day to see if it got turned into lost and found. It did not, and very disappointed.  -Neighbors were extremely noisy all nights and woke us up at 2-3 am each night.  -Pillows were terrible...those could be replaced.  -Location, however, is very nice. Super close to Disneyland and the Mickey and Friends parking structure.

Over the course of my life, I have stayed at lower star rated hotels many times while on road trips with my parents and grandparents. This was definitely one of my least favorites. I chose this hotel because of the price and proximity to Disneyland. Since we only were planning to visit Disney for one day, I saw no point in paying more than a hundred dollars a night for a hotel room. It is roughly a half mile walk to the entrance gate, which is great because then you don't have to pay to park there. The continental breakfast was a plus, but there were few selections available. If you plan to eat breakfast there, get downstairs as soon as they open, or all the good stuff will be gone. The pool was more like a large hot tub, and was grossly overcrowded. Our room was a nonsmoking

This hotel was a decent stay for a reasonable price near Disneyland. The walk takes about 15-20 minutes, I thought it was faster to just walk to Downtown Disney rather than take the tram from Mickey & Friends parking garage. The hotel really needs to update their towels and bedding. Some of the towels were stained so we had to get new ones. The downside was the free breakfast, they only had cereal and bread when we went down, not appetizing at all.  They should also start it at 6am versus 7am, especially if you're doing Magic Morning. We ended up eating elsewhere for the week we were there.

Nice hotel, front desk was helpful with everything we needed. Breakfast was meh but oh well, there is other options very close by. Room was clean, hotel was quiet and overall had a great experience. PF Changs is only 3 min walk and 7-11 is a nice 10 min stroll down the street.

Summary Heading: Creepy, a bit rude, not very clean
Summary: There was 2 guys at the front desk one of them was nice but the other older guy was not if you want great customer service they do not have it here I did not get a smile not once or a thank you. The room was creepy and I found hairs from whoever stayed there before us all over the towels and floors. We did not have breakfast there because we left at 5am and the breakfast is from 7am-9am.

This was the third time I have stayed at this property and plan to any time I am back in the Anaheim area. The front desk staff is not overly friendly but are always helpful and never rude. The rooms I have stayed in the last three times have been very clean and the rooms are always stocked with enough towels, soap, ect. This is not a luxury hotel but it meets all the basic needs at a great price. Beds are comfortable, water pressure is great, a mini fridge and microwave and ac. Can't beat the price and it is only about about a 15 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland or 5 minutes or so to the tram. My inlaws had a room next to us and they normally stay in Hiltons and they were very happy with their room and stay and said they would totally stay again. This hotel has also

Clean, decent. Loud traffic made it hard to sleep and very lumpy pillows. But, we spent such little time here, it was a great deal for the dollar. We rode Anaheim Resort Transit everywhere and so the location worked well.

We recently spend 3 nights in there and the rooms are of great size, we were two families with children and the area was safe.  The location is great because you are able to go to the disney parks with a short walk (15-20 min).  The only thing about the rooms is the cleaning.  It appears to be ok but after my baby was crawling you cold see his pjs all dirty, it seemed greasy like cars grease and not sure why but the carpet was also sticky, not only in our room but in our friends too.

Stayed here and overall impression that it was well kept and tidy. Unfortunately ceilings are not sound proof  thus you can hear every movement from above. Pillows in desperate need of updating as the towels. Airconditioning noisy. On the Plus side it had an elevator.and rooms were clean with fridge & coffee machine and sufficient car parking space. Very basic breakfast failed to cater for the numbers and needed to be kept topped up and tables cleaned. Location  is great price was right  15 min walk to Disneyland  - generally a 2 1/2 star rating
it was ok, its close to Disney so they seem to herd a lot of people thru the rooms fast, and it shows....

Summary Heading: Thank you for a nice place to stay.The kids enjoed the...
Summary: Thank you for a nice place to stay. The kids enjoed the pool very much to see the firework at night !

the first 5 minutes I was there, I had checked my linens and found several hairs on the sheet, called the office and had housekeeping change them right away. the only negative thing about that, is the housekeeper did not undersand one word in english. towels can be of better quality.otherwise, hotel met our needs as we visited Disney...if I had to stay again..I would.:) oh, there were police there also, looking in cars,.otherwise okay.
The location of the Super 8 is very good for visiting Disneyland, we can just walk over there, and we like that.
rooms were of fair size---the rugs were down right dirt- my great grand children played barefooted on the floor and their feet were. not just dirty but black in color as if there was oil on the rugs

Run down. Extremely noisey. Unsecure and just an overall embarrasment to the super 8. Staff is uncaring and rude and after talking to the owner I see why, he is worse. 1800 customer service line no help either.

I loved this hotel, the location is perfect. The room was very comfortable and it had all the amenities I needed: fridge, microwave, coffee maker, T.V., internet, etc. Breakfast was great, though, in my opinion, it should be extended till 10 am (after a long day in the day in the parks, you need to rest a bit). The staff was very friendly and welcoming. All in all, a great experience.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but too far from Disneland
Summary: The rooms are nice and the staff is very helpful.  We checked out after 4 nights instead of the 5 nights that we had reserved.  Even though we notified the front staff until the night before our departure, they didn't charge us for the 5th night.
