This hotel is a mile from the Disneyland front gate and half a mile from the nearest tram.  Super8 should have it's own dedicated shuttle.  Guests shouldn't have to walk a mile to the park or pay $16 to park in the parking lot next to the nearest tram.

Summary Heading: The location was great and everything looked nice in and...
Summary: The location was great and everything looked nice in and out.  Generally the staff were really good and the price wasn't too steep.  The bed was a little uncomfortable but clean and the room was great.  Maybe also the breakfast could use either more options or the things present could be healthier.  Other than that I loved it and was grateful its so close to Disneyland, thanks.

Summary Heading: This was our first time there. The rooms were spacious and...
Summary: This was our first time there. The rooms were spacious and clean. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Thin walls and Parking were the only negatives.

This hotel was the cheapest in the Disneyland area. It gave me a place to rest my head at the end of the long days of Disney.   PRO: You can watch some/most of the fireworks from Disney from the pool, and the street out front. Cheapest in the area when we looked. Fairly clean, no bugs, or any signs of 'dirtiness'. A/C blows cold. Fridge and Microwave in room. Free WI-FI.  CONS: The hotel appeared to be well worn down over the years. The general maintenance and repairs done to the room were definitely chosen as the cheapest option. The wall paint looked like it wasn't done by a 'professional'. The bathtub had repair tape in multiple places. This is not something you'd expect to see in a hotel. The closet rack was held in with multiple types of screws, as if they used whatever was

Summary Heading: clean rooms, great personal service, excellent location
Summary: 10 min walk to Disneyland park and Downtown Disney (3 min drive) make this hotel a great choice for your family vacation. Also not far from Knott's Berry Farm, Universal Studios and some outlet malls so you're just minutes away from most tourist places. Probably the "not so good" about it is the average Continental breakfast, could do better.

A small pool, free wi-fi, free breakfast, and a short walk to Disneyland. This was an excellent motel for a three night no frills stay. Comfortable beds, but fairly basic furnishing. Very conveniently located close to the I-5

I never have any problems with any Super 8 motel before except for this one.  The sewage smell from the sink and bath room was so bad that  I could not sleep at all the whole night.  I contacted the front desk at 12:00 AM and was given a bottle of spray to eliminate the odor by myself.  At 3:00 AM, I called again but since there is no room to change, I have to move my family to my friend's room to sleep.  How's that for getting ready to go to Disney Land in the morning.  So all of us three family move to Holiday Inn in the morning.

Everything was as expected, no surprises and the price is the best part. I will stay here next trip to Disney as long as they don't hike up the prices because of the good ratings! The only bad part was a hard bed and an overpowering smell of old lady rose perfume, I think they tried to cover someone who had smoked in room. You got used to smell in a little bit. Overall the room was well worth the money.

We checked in at 9:00 pm after a 16 hour drive and the guy at the front desk and manager, Kevin, could not have been nicer or more helpful. They gave us a parking spot to fit our large vehicle and although the pool is small, the kids were happy it was open until 11 and we could watch the fireworks perfectly from the pool. I bought my park tickets on line and they were happy to print them for me. They also have an IPad station guests can use. The room does smell a little bit like a bad air freshener but it is a good size and very clean. We are on the first floor by the parking lot and the motel is full but it isn't too loud. Don't know about the breakfast yet but the breakfast room is big. I am aware the parks are a mile or more own the road so we plan to take a cab for $6. I am

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disneyland stay!!
Summary: We honestly were not expecting much but we were very pleasantly surprised! This hotel is very clean, quiet and in a great location. We could see the fireworks better right in front of the hotel than we could at Disneyland.  The free breakfast offered a good variety.  We recommend this hotel and will stay again!!
The room was clean, slightly outdated but it serves the reason I was there... to sleep.  The front desk clerk was very helpful with my questions, overall I would stay there again.

we love staying at this hotel especially since it is so close to the disneyland park entrance. I would give it 5 stars but the continental breakfast needs a lot of help. You need more options than cereal and toast. Especially since i am lactose intolerant i could not even have what was offered. Otherwise great place friendly staff will stay again.
It was ok need air fresher on the rooms rug and rooms get a smell that need air fresher it would b nice!!!

Rooms smelled and things seemed outdated. The wifi was good when it wanted to be. The location is pretty good from Disney land but the breakfast was not so good. I guess this is the definition of getting what you pay for.

The only good thing about this motel is that the walk to Disneyland is 20 minutes.  The room was dirty and smelled horrible.  The continental breakfast was out of everything when we got there and the staff said too bad.  Do not stay here.

This hotel is pretty close to Disneyland so you can reach Disneyland gate (with skipping Tram lines) after 15-20 minutes of walking. Rooms show their age but is not terribly bad. We got third floor room so we were away from the first floor noise.   They have limited car parking so if you arrive after Disneyland shows at night, there will be a guy standing in parking lot asking about your room # and when you'll use the car in the morning. Accordingly he'll have you park in first or second row of double parked cars. They've free Wi-Fi with reasonable speed but can be upgraded for $10 to premium one which is quite reasonable.  Overall I'll highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland.
Good budget hotel. You get what you paid for. I stayed here during my trip to disneyland and found it very good.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel for the price and location. Right next to...
Summary: Very good hotel for the price and location. Right next to Disneyland and the freeway. I will definitely stay here again next year.

Summary Heading: Great hotel not area we needed but for price great. Rooms...
Summary: Great hotel not area we needed but for price great. Rooms are very clean. Beds comfortable. Breakfast not good. Would stay there again but not eat breakfast.

Summary Heading: The location of the hotel is great. You could also see the...
Summary: The location of the hotel is great. You could also see the fireworks from Disneyland every night. However, the floors needs to be moped and carpet needs to be shampooed. Our feet/socks were BLACK after walking barefoot. Otherwise, affordable and good location.

Summary Heading: The location is excellent, breakfast is very poor & the...
Summary: The location is excellent, breakfast is very poor & the rooms are not clean enough. Good option if you are looking for a hotel that fits your budget.

Summary Heading: It was excellent! We got a room with two queen bed, the...
Summary: It was excellent! We got a room with two queen bed, the room was big and CLEAN. I am a mother and I am very picky with where I stay to sleep. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were very clean. I would definitely take my family again to this hotel. The plus side of this was also that we were very close to Amusement Parks, it was at a walking distance, probably a 20 minute walk.

We recently went to Disneyland and was very pleased with this hotel.  Nothing fancy but an inexpensive place to rest our heads after a long day of amusement parks.  Breakfast was my only complaint, carbs only!  Good location for the parks, you could walk to the trams in about 10 mins. or drive to the parking garages in 1-2 mins.  Thank you super 8 for keeping me within my budget.

This hotel was a good one as far as being in a good location, if you're not needing top of the line hotel, this is the pick of the day! Clean room, clean, comfortable beds, hot shower with a separate prep area and plenty of counter top space. Refrigerator & microwave in room, which is helpful. My friend and I spent the weekend at Disneyland and while this hotel is within reasonable walking distance, it is pretty far at the end of the day when you are tired and your feet/legs are killing you! We ended up driving the 1/2 mile to the parking garage and catching the tram from there....so worth the cost of parking to us! The first night we arrived in time to catch the fireworks at Disneyland from our hotel room! Sweet!!   Things this hotel could change:     ~ add some fruit and/or
Hotel was just ok. They had doughnuts and cereal on the morning but the doughnuts had mold on them and they were out of everything every time we checked. Staff was friendly for the most part.

The amenities are fine. The customer service is the worst I've ever seen in America. I had just arrived from an overseas flight with my family. To find out my reservation was cancelled. The front desk Philippino guy said it was because my credit card was from Canada. So what.? I Ask if he even bothered to call me. He said no. Bottom line I was stuck with no room. He was giving all the facials attitude as well. He did not even propose any solution.

The room looks like they hired a handyman fresh from rehab to do the finish work as the flooring and trim had major gaps which were filled with dirt and hair. The wall paper was peeling in places right off the walls and the bathroom had hair all over the tub and floor. Place had a musty smell, only thing missing were the bugs. We stayed for four days....too long. Fine for a couple staying a day or two, but spend some extra money and find  something better if you are doing d-land with a family for several nights.  Staff was friendly and it was close to the park for a short walk.

Pls ad protein to the breakfast and get rid of the stink in the room. I have got a heavy headache after sleeping there. Your free internet also sucks. And yes, pillows were uncomfortable. Mattress are good though

Summary Heading: Pretty good location with competitive prices.
Summary: We had 3 Southwest Airlines awards tickets to use and my son had just finished 8th Grade, so we decided it was time for a Disneyland trip! Being just a little over 50 years of age, I was pleased to find an AARP discount that gave us 17% off the daily price (plus I booked through my Wyndham Rewards account which offers rewards), and since we went before most of the schools in Southern California were finished for the Summer, this was considered an "off-season" booking. In other words, pretty fine deal at under $70/night!  We stayed at Super 8 for 4 nights, and because we were wanting to get the most out of our Disney 3-day Parkhopper tickets, we didn't leave Disney until the parks closed each night (we were there on Saturday June 8 through Monday, June 10. For the 4 days

Summary Heading: Carpets need to be cleaned badly and bathroom floor cleaner...
Summary: Carpets need to be cleaned badly and bathroom floor cleaner and more sanitary.  Disney channel would have been nice for small children.

We had 3 rooms for family to visit Disney- It was a 15 minute safe walk to the Mickey and Minnie shuttle- the pool and breakfast room were very clean and we were able to store our luggage before train back to Santa Barbara

Summary Heading: Try to use a much more product to keep the room smelling...
Summary: Try to use a much more product to keep the room smelling fresh .. get rid of the tub mat which has a mold smell to it and internet service was not great..

Summary Heading: I like the place just the bed sheet had an odor and the...
Summary: I like the place just the bed sheet had an odor and the carpet left sock very dirty. The breakfast wasn't really anything. The Internet connection is very slow. Overall I did enjoy my stay
Overall it was just 1 day of stay. It was a nice hotel overall. Everyone seemed genuine. The price and service is the reason to return in the future. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Horrible don't stay here Cleaning people stold stuff from our room!!!!
Summary: This place is horrible don't stay here!!!! The cleaning people stold my $ 500 pair of Ray Bans!!!!. The service was horrible and ruined my stay and trip to Disney land. The people at the front desk were especially unfriendly and rude! Save urself the trouble and don't stay here.
We've stayed here before and have no major complaints. Proximity to Disneyland and DCA are our main reasons why we stay here and the price is right.
we stayed there for 6 days..we loved it ..15 min walk to Disney..staff very friendly and very helpful..comfortable bedding always had hot showers..great stay for the money...will stay them again...
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words and we're glad you had a nice stay.  Please come back and see us again!

Summary: We stay at this hotel sll the time! The rooms are very clean and quiet. The beds are a little stiff but thats not a huge problem. The hotel is very close to the Disneyland parking structure, which makes for an easy drive. I recommend staying at this hotel!
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you for taking the time out to write a nice review for us.

Summary: The staff seemed accommodating but the room seemed dark and dingy. The carpet was disgusting and need to be replaced, please?!  The air conditioner cooled the room but smelled horrid like something died and turned moldy inside of it. If anything, we should've been paid to stay there. The only thing great about it was the location. I hope my family and children never have to stay in such a dirty Motel 8 again!
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not enjoy your stay.  Please contact me directly so I may assist you further.  Thank you.

Summary: The location of this hotel is about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Room was clean and breakfast provided. We found this to be a great budget friendly place to stay whilst visiting the theme parks. There is a service station 2 doors down. Great view of the Disneyland fireworks as well, was quite loud though.
Manager Response: Yes we're right next door to the park so the fireworks can be overwhelming at times.  I'm glad you enjoyed the stay.  Thanks for the review and please do come back and see us again.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the motel.We were there for a whole week we checked in with no problem, found the room as described on the inter-net, we asked for a room on the third floor pretty centered in the middle. It turned out to be a very good spot for watching the fire works from Disneyland and they start at 9:30 each night and a .good spot to watch the kid in the pool which is just in front of the rooms. Yes parking can be a small problem but it's not that bad just try and get back to your room early  It;s true about walking distance to disneyland .You save $16 in parking fee's. The free breakfast is good .We had no complains. I guess you could go across the street to the Shereton an pay double the price. The A C worked great. we would stay there again and again.....May/
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed the trip.  We always try to provide the best value for our guests.  Thanks for taking the time to write a nice review for us.

Summary: I booked this room for myself and granddaughters.  The gentleman behind the desk was kind and friendly.  He accommodated my request for a room on 3rd floor because I didn't want to have people above me.  The pool was clean as was the parking lot.  The room was of nice size, and appeared to be relatively clean.  But, it, like the elevator, had a terrible odor. It reminded me of a cat that was locked in a room and urinated all over the carpet.  As I walked past other rooms, I noticed the smell as well.  It was definitely not in the linens, but in the carpet itself.  Although I won't stay here again because of this, some people may not mind it. The location is perfect for Disneyland, and the breakfast items were fresh.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had unpleasant experience with the smell.  We shampoo our carpet every day during summer season to make sure we keep up with the flow of guest traffic.  It's certainly a challenge but we'll do everything we can to make sure your room smells nice and fresh upon arrival.

Summary: The room was clean, the beds were okay. The Fridge was not plugged in prior to check in?? Fireworks from Disneyland at 9:00-9:30 pm were loud and annoying while trying to sleep. Access to the hotel was a little inconvenient.
Manager Response: We unplug the fridge after each cleaning because oftentimes the incoming guests would find the freezer frozen.  It's a small step to curb inconvenience for all of our guests.  Thanks for your comment and we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Very nice clean and close to disneyland. There was not an...
Summary: Very nice clean and close to disneyland. There was not an anaheim shuttle available causing us to pay high parking price
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment.  Most of our guests walk to Mickey and Friend parking lot so they do not have to deal with Anaheim Resort transit.  I'm glad you enjoyed the stay, please come back and see us again soon.

Summary Heading: An iPhone Charger More Valuable Then Their Customers
Summary: We were having a girlfriends getaway to Disney California Adventure.  I requested a room not near the elevator or ice machine.  When we arrived to check in, I had to remind the woman at the check in counter about that, she was kind enough to follow through.  As the evening got later, there was a number of other guests who proceeded to stand near our room (319).  There was a rail which overlooked the parking lot on the third floor.  Their presence of loud voices, music, smoking and constant walking back and forth by our room was annoying and quite disturbing.... It was difficult to have peace and relaxation, not until after midnight when things finally quite down.  I would not recommend this room at the end due to the noise factor from other rude guests.  We checked out early
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had an unpleasant experience.  Everyday we have guests left items, big or small, behind upon check out.  It really is impossible to ship everything with different rates so we implemented a standard charge of $25 to send back all items regardless of where you live.  We use standard USPS envelope and if it fits then we ship it back without having to concern the guest about the rates.  Room 319 is a very corner room and many guests enjoy that because it does overlook the back area.  If at anytime our guests inform us of the noise from other hotel guests, we will inform the guests and ask them to keep it down.  I'm sorry if that did not happen in your case.  We hope you'll give us another chance should you visit Anaheim in the future.

Summary Heading: Always Clean and a Good Value
Summary: We are annual pass holders at Disneyland, so we have stayed here 16 nights this year alone.  The mini fridge and microwave make breakfast easy.  There is a room we prefer to stay in that I requested at booking, but we did not get.  The service is always fair, but the rooms are clean and well appointed for the price.
Manager Response: Thanks for your nice comment and continuous business.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Does not respect reservation plus 50 min wait to get a room
Summary: I was disappointed,  i reserved my room, when I got there I wait 50 minutes beacuese you did not respect the reservation. In adddition, the hotel does not have any service to hold our luggage while we were at Disney. I was a customer of Super 8 for many years, not anymore...
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had a bad experience, that does not sound like our standard procedure.  We do have a luggage holding areas for incoming guests.  I believe your guests had different issues that may have caused the delay in checking in.  Please contact me directly so I may assist you further.  Thank you.

Summary: The staff was nice and location within walking distance to disneyland. It was hard to get to hotel if going north on Disneyland Drive. The beds were a little stiff. The free breakfast was nice but if a customer got to breakfast room after 815am some of good donuts were gone. The rooms were clean. The staff answered any question we asked. Good rates. Nice pool.
Manager Response: Thanks for the nice comment.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: For the low cost of this room so close to Disneyland, it is...
Summary: For the low cost of this room so close to Disneyland, it is great.  LOCATION - LOCATION - LOCATION!  Did not expect the great view of the fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback and we're glad you had an enjoyable stay.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: Ok hotel, I loved the location and the room for the most part was pretty clean but the carpets were filthy.  When my kids walked around the room with no shoes their feet were black, not just dirty but literally black.  I thought the breakfast could have been better.  For the price it was a good hotel.  We did have a special teddy bear that we know for certain was in the room and we thought after we got home it might show up in the dirty laundry, or tucked in a sleeping bag or something but it's nowhere to be found.  I'm not certain and I hope our cleaning lady wouldn't take it but i'm beginning to wonder cause I know it was there and I know we searched everywhere for it??

Summary Heading: Always excellent experience every time I stay here.
Summary: After bad experiences at other hotels.Since then I always stay at this hotel when Im traveling to aneheim on vacation. It has always been a great experience the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and the price is very affortable, for a clean, quiet room close to disneyland with free parking. I will pick this hotel above any others.
Manager Response: Thanks for the nice comment.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: this hotel was worth the price.real close to Disneyland.we drove to mickey and friends parking tower which is literally a 30 second drive away.probably a 15 minute walk.breakfast was not bad but not much of a selection and gets busy quick,the free wi-fi sucked so i paid the 10$ extra for premium and it was well worth it. for the price and proximity to Disneyland I would stay here again if on  budget

Clean and tidy rooms. Perfect viewing of the Disneyland fireworks! Staff was very helpful. Breakfast doesn't have much selection though... But regardless, it's a great value. Quick access to the freeway also.

We were traveling with our four semi adult children.  All we needed was a clean bed and hot shower after we closed down Disneyland every day.  Staff was excellent and friendly.  Our advice is to ask for a room away from the freeway and if you are a healthy eater - there aren't many healthy choices for breakfast.

Summary Heading: Overall stay was great! I do think that the continental...
Summary: Overall stay was great! I do think that the continental breakfast should have more options...not much there.
Great location and convenient when visiting Disneyland.  Staff is always very friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable.  We have stayed at this location many times and will continue to do so.

Summary Heading: Our room was clean and tidy, the employees were very nice...
Summary: Our room was clean and tidy, the employees were very nice and accommodating.  The continental breakfast was lacking.

Overall great.  Location was perfect.  The only down fall on this hotel was the choice for the breakfast.  It was limited to toast, cereal and stale donuts.  If breakfast is not a selling point than this is the place to stay.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: This hotel had a low price & availability on short notice (on a holiday weekend).  My wife & I were attending the Disney 24 hour event.  So we didn't want to pay a lot for a hotel.  When we arrived, it looked fine from the outside.  But the moment we opened the door to the room, it was obvious why they had rooms available.   The dank odor was overwhelming & the room was dingy and worn.  It was neat.  But the towels & bath mat were soo disgusting that we never used any of them.  My wife & I used our shirts to lay over the pillow cases & slept on top of the sheets.  To say we "slept" would be an exageration.  The walls were so thin & the walkways so noisy, that you could hear everything any moving guest was doing.  The staff was friendly & the cost was low.  But I would not call

The room was clean, quiet and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our only issue was the Wi-Fi connection‚Ä¶it was a bit slow even when we paid the $10 upgrade. But that was minor. There was some molding at the base of the tub but that did not interfere with the pleasant bath/shower. Overall, we had a wonderful time. Thank you

Summary Heading: Great location very clean . Looked like the breakfast was...
Summary: Great location very clean . Looked like the breakfast was good didin't get any only because there was a school bus of kids eating. Would recomend
Overall very good, but the WiFi did not work in my room and when I tryed to call the desk noone answered. It was late so I just went tp bed.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, no hassle hotel near Disneyland
Summary: Clean, a bit dated, but nice and comfortable.  Friendly staff; allowed us to check in early on the day we arrived.  Free breakfast, however it was all breads and cereals.  A bit of a walk, but not much further than the Disneyland parking structure.  In room microwave and fridge which allowed us to purchase food at the am/pm on the corner and have a little after park snack.  We also stopped and got big bottles of water at the am/pm every morning for half the price of what they were in the park.

The value for money is excellent. Very close to Disneyland. I travel with my family and we had no objection. The only detail is that the towels are already very worn and soiled sheets. Generally meets the goal of sleeping and bathing and you're not much time in the hotel.

This super 8 on disneyland drive was clean , comfortable and had a great view of disneys fireworks. within walking distance to the resort to save 15 $ on parking per day. great budget/ price since you stay all day at DL moreso a place to catch sleep for the adventure the next day..beds were comfe. Maid service was pretty good but 1/2 the time she didnt know what was trash and didnt take it out..empty pizza boxes, soda cans.

Although you did have to cross 2 really busy roads which I didn't like, the walk to Disneyland wasn't too bad, about 15 minutes.  the swimming pool was smaller, but we didn't go there to swim, and my small boys liked it anyways.  The breakfast is as continental as it gets, toast, coffee, milk, 2 kinds of cereal, and stale donuts.  Overall, this hotel fit us perfectly.  It was clean and affordable within walking distance to Disney, it had free wireless and parking, and since we don't care too much for breakfast, and spent most of our day out of the hotel, it suited us.  If you just need a place to sleep and are ok with a bowl of Raisin Bran for breakfast like we were, basically if you aren't high maintenance at all, this is the place for you!  We'd stay there again for sure!

We did not have a reservation and arrived early in the day.  We were planning on staying 2 or 3 nights.  We were able to obtain a room.  The room we received was near an elevator (noisy) so the next day we asked for a different room.  This room was better and we decided to stay the 3rd night.

Good Location, continental breakfast is cereal and maybe a donut, soap is cheap and one time shampoo packet, pool doesn't open early enough, unfriendly staff, not enough parking spots, and when we reported that someone was breaking into a room window the staff did nothing.

Summary Heading: don't ever stay at this super 8
Summary: room smelled like dogs urination. room smelled horrible. no bath shower consisted of a wall no real shower head, sewer smell coming out of the shower,had to leave the air conditioner all night it reaked so bad.I'd rather walk 10 miles to disneyland and pay more for better quality. we called for the iron we were told we had to go get it ourselves same for the towels

Basic but very clean. Soap and shampoo are on the skimpy side, but there are plenty of stores nearby where you can buy travel/sample size products. Front desk was very courteous and accommodating. Located within about a10 minute walking distance from Downtown Disney,  this place is a very good value. Parking was tight.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay if going to Disneyland
Summary: We discovered this hotel number of years ago and keep coming back. First off it is clean, comfortable and quiet. Oh sometimes inconsiderate guests become noisy but any hotel around Disneyland have that. As I have said, we keep coming back They are constantly doing things to make your stay as best possible. There only shortcoming is the parking if they are busy but they are now issuing parking labels when you check in. I think in the past unauthorized parking was occurring due to the park being close. And if you have problems, the manager is more than helpful. Overall, for the money we feel this is an excellent value.

I read in some of the reviews that parking was an issue. For us there was no problem, and in fact we had two cars two our one room. At other hotels this has been an issue...  My boyfriend and I frequently meet up in different cities where he is working in seperate cars...  They gave us a parking spot in the back where we could park end to end.  The jacuzzi was hot and sparkling clean and I didn't use the pool but it was absolutely beautiful..  We were in room 126, and it was as clean as I've seen any room that I've checked into. And I can't even believe how large the room was..  We had two queen beds and there was enough room to have put in a double blow up bed and a crib or a playpen and still have room to walk around!!   I was very pleasantly surprised as the size of this room

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but we had a bad experience
Summary: We made the mistake of checking in mega early.  They allowed us to check in four hours before the official check in time and I think they gave us the worst room!  The elevator did not work, the mattresses were stained, there was black hair all over the room (including the bed) and the toilet flooded.  I honestly think that this was a one off experience, but I felt compelled to share with my fellow travellers.  Breaky was donuts and cereal and the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  We stayed in this really dingy room on the third floor.  There was no natural light - maybe make sure you get the rooms with the natural light!!  I was very grateful for the laundry.  Huge help when you have kids.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at. Clean & affordable. Very close to...
Summary: Great place to stay at. Clean & affordable. Very close to Disneyland's parking lot that has a tram that takes you to parks. This is my second time staying here & will stay here many more

This is the first time I have stayed in a Super 8 since a really BAD stay in San Diego where I swore I would never stay in one again. But my friend was like this is a good one so I tried it and other than sitting on the toilet paper while trying to use it and having to put your luggage to hold the curtains closed cause we faced the main street, it was an o.k trip.
Great location, perfectly fine value motel. Facilities worn out but clean, comfortable and service was friendly and efficient.

Great experience!!! The only bad thing I might have to say is to consider changing the type of deodorant. It was a bit offensive. Other than that, great place to stay. Very convienient if you are going to Disneyland. My family and I will be returning. Thanks guys!

The location of the hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland and is convenient. The rooms look like they are kept clean. Are stay was relaxing and quiet. Honestly, we spent little time in the rooms so it was worth the low price. I did not like how close the door is to the toilet and the very dim lighting. I like a brighter room without having to open windows.

The room stunk lke sewage so we asked to be moved and the second room had a bath tub with a hole in it covered in a peeling germ ridden rubber patch. We rented 2 rooms, were told we could walk to Disneyland in 10 minutes and it took over 30 minutes and we do not walk slow. The continental breakfast ran out several times. Hard doughnuts, no fruit, just a mess. We will not ever go back or recommend this hotel to anyone! Did I mention we turned on the heat and the smoke alarm went off or that iin order to use the hair dryer you had to hole the on button the whole time?

Summary Heading: I'd go back to this location when we go back to Disneyland...
Summary: I'd go back to this location when we go back to Disneyland. Rates were grate and it's really close to the park. The hotel staff are all friendly and helpful. The only disappointment were the other hotel guests. We tried to get breakfast but the other guests were packing up "To go" packages and leaving half donuts out. Not cool. Other than that everything was fine.

When we made our reservation through the 800 number we were very specific in stating that AT LEAST one of these rooms needed to be a Disabled/ Handicap Room and they verified that they had one available.  I also notified them that we would be bring in a toy hauler trailer due to having three people in Electric Wheelchairs/ scooters due to disability. When we arrived NOT ONLY did we NOT have a handicap room, we were on the 3rd floor. How horrible to haul three wheelchairs up an elevator one at a time, especially when two of them were children (ages 12-15) both with developmental delays.  Then, we could not park the trailer because they had BOTH front parking lots blocked off for Buses. We had to argue with the person at the front desk to allow us to park in the front parking

Summary Heading: ITS NOT RIGHT NEXT DOOR TO THE PARKING FOR DISNEY.  ITS A...
Summary: Its not right that you are not given pass code for the free WiFi when you check in. Also its not right next to the parking structure of Disneyland.. Almost a 15-20 min walk to Downtown Disney.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have a pleasant experience.  Our wifi system is free for all guests and we inform the log in info upon guest checks in.  I apologize if this wasn't the case for you.  We're right next to Mickey and Friends parking structure where it's literally a 3 minute drive after you cross Ball Road.

Summary: it's one of the closest and cheapest hotel near to Disney It is similar to all other Super 8 hotels. its total value for money. Hotel Mgmt can add more light to rooms.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We do have plans to add more light fixture to the room to provide better lighting for our guests.  I appreciate your comment.  Thank you.

Summary: Parking was tight, but the staff was accomadating.  Some guests were loud, but after all it is a vacation destination!  Over all good experiance and will stay again.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a nice comment for us.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: This hotel had minimal parking and it was all in the back of the hotel. This left the whole front lot for school buses which ran exhaust into the rooms and created late night noise from students. The double parking was an issue as well. The location was convenient and the staff was friendly. I realize most of the issues were not in their control. Breakfast was ok. Bed was pretty comfy. Room was clean. Wouldn't stay here again because of the noise and parking though.
Manager Response: I apologize for the parking situation you experienced.  We had a few groups so parking with buses was a challenge.  We were able to accommodate all of our guests and again I apologize for your experience.

Summary Heading: We picked this location for a family trip to Disneyland. It...
Summary: We picked this location for a family trip to Disneyland. It is close to Disneyland.  There were numerous busses parked directly outside of our room around midnight with backup beepers going for 30+ minutes.  Parking was difficult.  Microwave did not work.  Shower floor was sticky and gross, plumbing was clogged.  Tried to connect to "Complimentary" wifi but it would not connect unless we paid a fee.
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience.  We have upgraded our free guest wifi in accordance to the needs of everyone.  Please contact me directly so I can further resolve the issue for you.

Summary Heading: NICE PLACE TO STAY IF GOING TO BE AT PARK ALL DAY, CLOSE TO...
Summary: nice place to stay if going to park all day, close to parking structure & can walk also,not the fanciest but if your going to be gone all day not bad for the price.

We stayed for a quick vacation to disneyland.  The location was great, its right across the street from the parking garage.  One guest was in a whellchair and they were very accomidating in giving us a downstairs room.  The inside was very spacious and wide enough for the wheelchair to get through with no problems.  There was 4 of us in the room and when we asked for extra towels the staff was very friendly and brought them right over.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice comments.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: The room was clean, nothing special, but for the price it was ok. It smelled of very strong chemicals though. Its very close to the tram entrance and since we were spending our days at Disneyland, it wasn't like we were going to be spending massive amounts of time at the hotel. I was with a disabled person, they honored our request for a bottom floor. You can not walk to the tram though, you have to drive in $15 per car and there is no shuttle from the hotel.
The parking is super tight and it needs to be remodel .the microwave in the room was nice and it was very close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good value for money.  Close to Disneyland.  Staff not...
Summary: Good value for money.  Close to Disneyland.  Staff not particularly helpful, and little things go missing from your room.
Manager Response: I apologize if you did not have a good experience with us.  We take the safety of guest's belonging very seriously.  Please contact me directly if you have any concerns.

Summary: Friendly staff, clean rooms and great location! This is where I stay everytime I visit Disneyland =]
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a nice comment for us.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: The GM Kevin is GREAT! He helped our group plan a great...
Summary: The GM Kevin is GREAT! He helped our group plan a great trip at a great rate. We had 8 rooms for 4 nights and they whole team worked to make it great. My only suggestion would be to offer bagels at breakfast.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a nice comment for us.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Everything was ok, our experience was good and the services...
Summary: Everything was ok, our experience was good and the services of the hotel were enough for our needs..

Summary Heading: family trip.  Hotels stay was great.  Would choose this...
Summary: family trip.  Hotels stay was great.  Would choose this place again.  Walls are somewhat thin but no other complaints.  Hotel staff were very helpful.  See you soon...

we like to stay there for location and price seems they have let hotel go down in quality they always have front parking blocked for buses they do not have the room for that makes it awful to get back to room after long day and try to find parking the elevator wasnt working which is uncalled for we were there in dec 2012 wasnt working then either please fix the problems maybe we would reconsider staying there again thank you for taking time to state our opion

I have taken my family to stay at this hotel 3 prior times and have always had a good experience. This time was a little different. It wasn't terrible but wasn't the best. We got to the hotel a little after noon and asked if it were possible to check in early. My sons mom had just driven them and her daughter from New Mexico and met my daughter and I at the hotel. My daughter and I had just driven 4 1/2 hours from Fresno. They did say they had a room available but it was on the 3rd floor. We accepted the room. Once we parked and grabbed our luggage we go to the elevator only to find it was inoperable. We stayed 3 nights, Monday-Wednesday during spring break, and it was down the whole time.  Once we got into our room it had a musty moldy mildewish smell to it. We thought it

All in all my stay was very enjoyable. It is a short walk to Disneyland. The rooms are nothing special but a good value for the price. The beds were better than I expected, since I have a sleep number bed at home I am rather spoiled, The parking lot is a war zone my car never left the parking lot and got door dinged on both sides.  None of the above would stop me from staying here agian.

Clean, decent beds - great location near Disneyland parking lot .  Not enough towels but great coffee and real coffee mugs.  staff were helpful  good deal for the price! Need to replace burned out light bulbs.  bathroom remodeled - very nice!

Summary Heading: Nice friendly staff and great clean room
Summary: Staff was great.  They honored the $10 quote from the live chat for a roll away bed.  Room seemed to be painted and bathroom tiled for a new clean look.  We are annual passholders to Disneyland and will stay there for future visits.

Summary Heading: The motel is farther away from Disneyland than is...
Summary: The motel is farther away from Disneyland than is advertized. There is no shuttle to Disney you either walk a mile or drive. The outside walk ways to the rooms are very noisy if you are wanting relaxing time after a full day at Disney. Breakfast should be longer to give guests a chance to not be all rushing to come during the short time given.

Summary Heading: Very Quiet Stay but very dirty (messy and dusty)dusty
Summary: I would recommend this hotel to someone who doesn't mind dirtyness and dustyness. Very quiet and great customer service!

We stayed here while we went to Disneyland and it was great! The service was great and it was plenty clean. It was a bit of a walk but it wasn't to bad, about 10-15 minutes to walk to the park so not bad. They let us park there all 3 days even after we checked out so that was awesome. I would highly recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Reasonable value. Good size room. Friendly atmosphere. Room...
Summary: Reasonable value. Good size room. Friendly atmosphere. Room service not always grat. The coffee maker and mugs weren't cleaned one day. One day, there were no wash cloths left. Breakfast had little to choose from; improvement there would be a boost.

had a great  comfortable stay area was good, that entrance is something else watch out be ready for that sharp left turn to go into the street where the hotel is at when you are at the other side of the street ,besides that all went well ,I thank you and my family thanks your staff as well.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback, I'm glad you enjoyed the stay.  Please come back and see us again.

Summary Heading: Great location with clean and spacious rooms. The hotel is...
Summary: Great location with clean and spacious rooms. The hotel is kid and family friendly but we had a loud family near us that made it difficult to sleep both nights.

Summary Heading: Found hotel to be clean and neat. Grounds were well...
Summary: Found hotel to be clean and neat. Grounds were well maintained.  A working elevator would have been nice, but I only had to go to 2nd floor.  I did over hear staff offer totake bags up to 3rd floor for someone.  All request for aditional items were accepted with courtesy,  and fullfill promptly ( i.e. addtl towels, blankets and pillows.  Overall a wonderfull stay.
The room was pretty average for the price paid.  It was clean & good for sleeping, showering & Disney

Summary Heading: Good distance for the theme parks. Custumer services was...
Summary: Good distance for the theme parks. Custumer services was not that great, elevators was not working and we stay in the third floor with small children, continental breakfast was super. Not enough parking for the guess, and bathroom were durty.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland but older hotel
Summary: We recently stayed at Super 8 Anaheim Disneyland Drive Motel for 2 nights (March 22 - 23rd).  We arrived quite early and full credit to the staff, they were accomodating and found us a room by 11:00 am on the 2nd floor.  The room itself was quite big (two queens) which included a fridge & microwave.  It was fairly clean but you can tell that it's an older motel and has seen better days.  The elevator wasn't working so if you're on the 3rd floor, I can see people struggling to get their larger suitcases up the outside stairs.  The biggest issue I had with the Motel were the walls & ceilings.  You could hear every step above you and when kids are running around next door, it was like they were in your room.  Very thin walled construction & when families are up early, it can be a

I would highly recommend staying elsewhere. I chose this hotel based on the price an location but it was awful. For starters there is literally no parking... There is an extreme shortage on parking, cars were double and triple parked and they would call you in the morning to go and move your vehicle. I paid to have a place to sleep and wasn't even able to do that.  The beds are rock hard and the pillows are horrible... when I requested extra pillows I was told there weren't any. Every time I would ask for anything the staff failed to follow through.. Also when we were checking out in the morning I saw the maids had tossed pillows from the rooms out on the dirty bushes

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at very close to Disneyland walking...
Summary: Great place to stay at very close to Disneyland walking distance which I liked I will be staying here again

Ti would never stay at this hotel again. First of all the room we were in had a very bad smell right when we walked in the door, we left the door open for about an hour to her some fresh air in. Second the sheets and pillow cases had hair on them. The parking was also bad, and the toilet paper was the worse I ever used no joke. I'm not really that picky but everything at this hotel was done the cheap way. I stayed here with my family and everyone complained we would of left but it was already 11:00 pm and we were tired from walking all day at Disney.

We have stayed at this hotel several times over the past 2 years and typically, we can deal with the terrible parking situation and the sometimes short customer service... but this time was different. There was apparently a group of high school students from out of state staying there, 4 charter buses full. Not really a big deal, except that the chaperons for the group were completely incapable of doing their job and the hotel staff didn't seem to care. When we came back from a day in the park at 1030pm we figured they would be out of the parking lot by then... nope, infact it was worse at night than it was during the day. There were kids in the back parking lot blocking the road and the parking spaces. When we tried to park, they wouldn't move... it was a complete and utter

Summary Heading: One elevator that does not work
Summary: My family and I did not expect a Four Seasons experience, however, a few items did keep this hotel from being even average. The first issue was that the hotel has just one elevator, and it was down for maintenance. kind of a pain when your room is on the 3rd floor. While the sign on the elevator said to ask to assistance with luggage, the staff was too overwhelmed by all the teenagers staying for some competition finals in the area. The second item was that we found a dirty sock on the floor just below one of the beds from the previous occupant.  That is a first for me and my family. I was also a little supprised that a shuttle was not availible from the hotel to Disneyland. While not a deal breaker this trip, the walk (about 15 minutes) to and from the parks may be cause for me

Summary Heading: OUTSTANDING SERVICE from ANNAHEIM SUPER 8 for Olympus High School Choir Stay and Feedback
Summary: Kevin Chen and his team are unsurpassed in my book. We have stayed at MANY locations A(including 8 different hotel chains) over the past 18 years. The service rendered at this Super 8 is superior.  MANY THANKS, Vicki Belnap and staff

Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Both managers were very accommodating for the needs of a large group. We will definitely choose this establishment as a stay on the next school trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind comment.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: Good value within comfortable walk to Disney Land. Amenities such as soap and shampoo were not good.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind comment.  We will definitely review our soap/shampoo amenity and make improvement for our future guests.  Thank you for the feedback.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Price was right if you plan on using this hotel for somewhere to lay your head. Parking was terrible, with a large truck blocking most cars on one side of parking lot. Walls are super thin, with a lot of street traffic noise. Great location to walk to Disneyland. Continental breakfast could have some more options. Oh, and they precharged my card before we even checked in( two days prior).
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind comment.  I'm sorry you did not have a pleasant experience.  I assure your card was not 'pre-charged' but rather, an authorization was done prior to the guest arrival to ensure the validity of the reservation.  I understand parking can be challenging but rest assured our staff is trained to handle parking for everyone of our guests.  Thanks.

Summary Heading: Hotel was nice overall. Bed was rock hard and screaming...
Summary: Hotel was nice overall. Bed was rock hard and screaming children woke me up, but that's pretty much to be expected.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment.  I'm sorry the beds did not meet your standard.  Super 8 standard calls for Simmonds Beauty sleep as the brand standard for our beds.  I'll be sure to pass on your comment.  Thanks.

Summary Heading: Good cheap hotel, but plan walking all the way to Disneyland
Summary: They claim to be only a 10 minute walk from the parking tram. It may be, but not worth it. You have to cross two major busy streets, that alone can be what seems 10 minutes. Then the walk and another cross the street if you go to parking lot tram. If you do then you have pass it, cross the street and back track to the tram. Once there you get to wait in a long line for the ride over. Much easier once you're to that street crossing to the parking lot then it's easier to just keep walking to the park and every time was faster.  The room was a large size and had fridge and microwave so  you can have something to eat and drink when back from the park. Pillows SUCK. Sleep on two of their towels and it may be softer. They have broken elevators that seem not to be in the process of
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have a pleasant experience.  We are also very frustrated with our elevator company but rest assured we're doing everything we can to resolve the issue.  State of California is very strict on elevator operation and we do not want to jeopardize the safety of our guests in any way.  Thank you for your understanding and we hope to have this resolved as soon as possible.

Summary Heading: We had a very nice stay.  The employees were very helpful...
Summary: We had a very nice stay.  The employees were very helpful.  We kept having to go back to the breakfast room to get rolls and donuts because as soon as they put some out, they were gone.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words, we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Near Disneyland Parks. Just 15 minutes walking distance...
Summary: Near Disneyland Parks. Just 15 minutes walking distance from Disney tram. Basic hotel but in good conditions. Free breakfast, parking and wifi included
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words, we take pride in the amount of effort we put in to maintain our property.  Thank you for noticing it.

Summary: I received excellent service and friendliness before, during, and after my stay.  Thank you for  being very helpful and accommodating.
Manager Response: I'm glad you had a nice stay, thanks for taking the time out to give us a nice review.

Summary Heading: Possibly the worst hotel I have stayed in
Summary: My wife and I stayed here the night before a Disneyland trip to get an early start in the park the next day.  The second we walked into the room, I could tell it was not well maintained at all.  The carpet was dirty, and the room smelled bad.  There was a DIRTY TOWEL with BROWN SMEARS in the bathroom.  There was noise and yelling and slamming doors until 2am, and the management did nothing about it.  They double and triple park cars in the parking lot because it is way too small.  If you are unlucky enough to park in the back, there is no way to get your car out.  This can cause some serious delays when you are trying to get to Disneyland on time.  The bathroom was horribly designed.  There was only a shower, and it was at ground level with no separation from the rest of the
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have a pleasant stay.  Please contact me directly so I can resolve the issues for you.  Thank you. .

Summary: Everything was just easy. No problems with helping us with any issues. Great location. Price was great. The breakfast included wasn't the best I've had at a Super 8, but you have to remember its not a Hilton or anything.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment, we hope to see you again.

Summary: The best thing about this place is the price. The staff is friendly and helpful but the parking is horrible and the free WiFi is super slow. My 3g is almost as fast. Its $10 extra per reservation to get a usable speed. Like I said, it just passes

Summary Heading: I feel the super 8 hotel in other places are better than...
Summary: I feel the super 8 hotel in other places are better than this one. Need to have more variety in breakfast items.
Right by the parking garage for the parks. Good value for the money. If you are on a budget, this is the place.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words.  I appreciate you taking the time out to write a nice review for us.

Summary: This is a great little hotel. We have stayed here over 15 times and have never had an problems with the hotel or the staff. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. If you are going to be spending all day at Disneyland and are just looking for a nice place to rest before starting over again at the park tomorrow, I would recommend this hotel. They do offer a little something for breakfast and it is enough to get you going. If you don't like the breakfast provided don't eat there, but also don't complain about it. It is a very short drive to the Disney parking structure. One of the main reasons we have stayed here so my times is their rates. Compaired to other hotels in the area they are very reasonable.

Overall, my stay was very nice-staff was quite helpful and informative.  Breakfast was so-so-not one for donuts.Would have liked some fresh fruit.  Also wish they had a shuttle to the park entrance-It wasnt that far but being older,it was too far for us to walk.

Summary Heading: This hotel was much better than I expected. WE will...
Summary: This hotel was much better than I expected. WE will diffinitely stay again. So many of the hotels close to Disneyland charge a parking fee. Super 8 does not. It was cleaner and more up to date than I thought it would be.

This is excellent Hotel , very near to Disney land, just walk 8 min to Disney - micy and friend park and get the tram from there directly to Disney land  Seems this hotel part of Disneyland  Thanks to Alex :-)

Summary Heading: This hotel needs to be remodel, it looks kind of old inside...
Summary: This hotel needs to be remodel, it looks kind of old inside the rooms and the location is very confusing to get in. it wasn't the worts experience but it wasn't the greaters either.

Checked in on 02/18 - checked out: 02/25/2013, Room 118. Close to all venues around Disneyland, room is clean, bed and bedsheet were great with a long day wandering around for both work and pleasure. Friendly staffs with heaps of smile on everyone's face. Breakfast is good as bonuses. Will return once we're in the area.

Summary Heading: Need to get gluten free options. I could eat none of the...
Summary: Need to get gluten free options. I could eat none of the items provided with the continental breakfast, but that was included with my price for the room. Even something as simple as boiled eggs. I have no complaints with anything else.

Summary Heading: STAINED SHEETS!  Sunken Bed.  Dirty floor.  Smoke Detector laying on shelf without battery.
Summary: Horrible.  Scary.  Disgusting.  There was a huge stain on one of the beds on both the top and bottom sheets.  Our bed was totally sunken in the middle with no support.  The floor was dirty with a white footprint, the refridgerator was unplugged and the door left open and the smoke detector was sitting on a shelf with the battery OUT.  I had to take pictures because it was so unbelievable.  We were offered new sheets.  That was all.

Summary Heading: Service was good, room was clean, breakfast was decent, and...
Summary: Service was good, room was clean, breakfast was decent, and location was great. Walking distance to DisneyLand.

Summary Heading: Room was spacious & clean but walls were thin/could hear...
Summary: Room was spacious & clean but walls were thin/could hear next door clearly.  Outlets did not hold cord.

Summary Heading: The girl at the counter was great.  The guy that brought us...
Summary: The girl at the counter was great.  The guy that brought us the TV remote was very helpful, he went back and forth to the front desk for us three times until he made sure the TV worked for us.  Overall my stay was good.  I just think you might want to add some diabetic options to the breakfast.

easy to find out it what i need about prices.., services. v..v. I hope to share all informations i get to my friends.that is great Most likely you're looking at this hotel because you want to do the all things, and this is perfect for that. It's about a 20 or 25 minute walk to around. A note about...  more exciting
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time out to write us a nice feedback.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: You're not going there for the hotel, so this will be just fine.
Summary: Absolutely unbeatable was the price midweek. We paid about 80 dollars for a room that held four people comfortably.  Good is: the location. Most likely you're looking at this hotel because you want to do the Disney thing, and this is perfect for that. It's about a 20 or 25 minute walk to the entrance plaza. A note about this - the map that the hotel gives you is a bit difficult to understand. It's more of a walk to the tram than it seems on the map. From the point where you would turn right onto Magic Way to get the tram, it's about another 5 or 8 minutes' walk to the plaza, and if you take the tram you'll have to walk 3 or 4 minutes from the intersection, then wait and then there's another short walk from the tram to the ticket booths and gates, so don't bother. Just keep going
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us the feedbacks.  Guest service is important to us and I appreciate your comment and make everyone aware of it.  Thank you.

Summary: We were  overall pleased with the motel...except this: It was noticed almost from the moment we stepped into the office and then from then on...these folks were either foreigners or just suffered from personality problems! I mean, the word "smile" I don't believe was in their normal vocabulary! I finally mentioned it to one of those who apparently may have been weened on lemons..."It's hard to believe that so many of you don't smile or show signs of happiness or friendliness when you work right next door to, "The Happiest Place On Earth - Disneyland!" Then I continued by inviting them to visit the park and see what I meant...so they could learn. Part of vacation is being excited about being there - espcially D.L These folks, your employees were pretty much taking any excitement
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment.  I understand good guest service is an important part of our business.  We will certainly try harder to accommodate everyone and their needs.  Thank you.

Summary: We viewed fireworks of Disneyland in the parking lot of Super 8 Anaheim! We walked for 20 minutes to Disneyland. Reception had up-dated Disneyland event calendar and maps which helped us a lot. Thanks!
Manager Response: I'm glad you enjoyed your trip here.  Please come back and see us again.  =)

Summary Heading: Honestly I loved the hotel, I was a bit disappointed with...
Summary: Honestly I loved the hotel, I was a bit disappointed with breakfast. No fruit. Very little bread.. The guests above my room started making a lot of noise at 5 am this continued until 8:30 am I called to let the front desk know and they said they would look into it this was at 6 am and nothing changed it seemed like they kept walking back and fourth.. I stayed at ur hotel a few years back and I love the renovations.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the comment.  We do encounter guests (especially with little ones) that tend to keep others awake at night.  We do make courtesy calls and ask them to keep it down right away.  If the situation doesn't improve, we will call again and try our best to accommodate everyone.  While this is not an easy task most of the times it's very effective.  I'm sorry if this did not turn out well for you.  We suggest guests who are light sleepers to request 3rd floor rooms as this will help avoid as much noise as possible.   Thank you for taking note of all the renovations we have done.

Summary: OK, so I was traveling with students and they wanted a cheap hotel, and that is what we got. The rooms were adequate - no more no less. Clean enough, beds average, bath just OK. The biggest issue I had was with the paper thin walls and doors. If you have people next to you, above you, or below you, expect a lot of noise. Also, if you stay there, be sure to be in your room for the Disney fireworks. The way they rattle the hotel is much more entertaining than the show...seriously - it is loud and the walls rock.   Oh, and I will just add....the lobby does not open until 7am, so don't even think of standing inside if you are waiting for a shuttle early in the morning and it is cold and raining...that seemed a little off, especially since the clerk was stationed at the desk...
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment. We're so close that yes, fireworks can literally sound like gun shots.  Almost every time we will receive calls at the front desk from guests who are not aware what's going on outside.  =)

Summary: I have been generous at 4 simply because it was very good for the price I paid.  Its an old-style external-balcony-door Super 8 so you know to expect basic accommodation. Very spacious but rather gloomy room with adequate beds, budget bedding and tired pillows, tiny towels but an otherwise OK bathroom. My room had hairdryer, fridge and microwave plus an OK old-style TV.  The free breakfast was basic even by Super 8 standards with no fruit or healthy options, just sugar-loaded products, white and brown bread. The location was great as it was only 15 mins walk to the parking area tram stop or 20 mins to the tram drop-off outside the park entrace.  If you don't mind walking it saves the stiff $15 Disney charges to park your car.  I would stay here again at the saving I made
Manager Response: Thanks for your review.  We strive to give our guests the best value possible.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: The location is a bit further to the enrance of Disney than it appears on map.  And bring your own shampoo/conitioner.  But the staff at this hotel were very helpful.  Comfortable beds but bring earplugs as the insulation between floors is not sufficient.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment, we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Poor motel topped by even poorer handling of private info.
Summary: We stayed here last weekend for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon. We just needed a bed and a shower, nothing fancy, but even our lowest expectations were not met. The room was dank and moldy smelling. The mini fridge was unplugged. The only elevator wasn't working. One of the ice machines was running water nonstop. There was a clump of hair in the sheets. The knobs on the AC were broken.   And having said all that, we're not the type to flame a motel on TripAdvisor... but here is the kicker. OUR PARKING PASS WAS PRINTED ON THE BACK OF THEIR CREDIT CARD TRANSACTION LOG. Our section displayed names and phone numbers of previous customers! I would be so furious if my private info was disrespected like this!  I contacted the mgmt. and they did let me know that they would be speaking to
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment.  I sincerely apologize for the issue you experienced and have assured you none of your personal information have been exposed.  We have already corrected this situation, I appreciate the feedback

Summary Heading: A great motel for visitors to Disneyland
Summary: Having stayed at this motel in 2010, I rebooked for our latest trip and I am happy to say that it was as good this time as it had been in 2010. While it is not the most expensive (nor luxurious) accommodation in the area, as we spent all day at Disneyland, all we were looking for was a clean and comfortable room to sleep in, Super8 delivered exactly what we wanted. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean and well presented.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  I will return to this motel, if I am in Anaheim again.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time out to write a nice response.  We're glad you had a pleasant stay.  Please do come back and visit us again.  Thank you.

Summary: The hotle was in a great location at a great price. It is older, but has been updated some and the rooms were very large; our family of 4 were not cramped at all.  The pool and hot top were OK, and the kids enjoyed them, but we stayed here to go to Disneyland and spent all day at the park and slept here.  The breakfast is just OK, but better than trying to go out and get breakfast everyday; just some donuts, cereal, and toast. Apples or bananas would have been nice. Walls were a bit thin and parking is terrible, but other than that it was all good.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time out to write a nice response. We understand parking can be a bit challenging at our property, please be assured that our staff is trained to assist every guest with their parking request.  Thank you.

Summary: Great Location. Walking distance was super short.  Staff was very sweet, and helpful.   A little disappointed to hear the elevator has been broken since October, our room was on the third floor and it would have been nice to have known prior to my arrival.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment.  We have just completed a safety upgrade for our elevator.  I apologize if this had caused inconvenience to your party.  It has in deed been a long process and we're eager to put the elevator back in service for everyone.  Please do consider us again for your future trips.

Summary: Checked in at 1am in the morning and while after falling asleep an employee enter the room at 530am opened the door realized we were there then slammed the door shut. We didn't know at the time who or what just happened children started crying and husband went to look who enter out room. I called front desk and it rang for 10 minutes. Finally the desk picked up and I told them someone entered our room he said it was him and that the room on their paper work shows it was empty. I then said he didn't knock before he entered or I would have heard it. He said he would tell his supervisor and I said I would discuss it after my trip. After our trip I called the Main manager Roger and he said no one told him of the issue. So I explained and he said their was nothing he could do. So I

We have stayed at Super 8s before and since we were going to be visiting Disneyland for 4 days and figured we would only sleep in the rooms. A Super 8 should be fine.  In other words we didn't need all the bells and whistles a 4-5 star hotel would have provided.  When we got there we were told that they only had rooms on the third floor.  I asked if there was an elevator and they said it was broken.  When we got into the room the strong smell of some kind of chemical or soap or something hit us.  We figured well at least it must be clean. Boy were we wrong.  The towels were so disgusting that they were almost greyish in color and hard.  In addition the water from the shower had an odor that we later realized was mold.  I am very allergic to mold and I was sick the whole time we
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience which of course does not meet our standard.  If the guest does not find their room satisfactory we will offer a different room or alternate solutions to accommodate.  Please contact me directly at 714-778-0350  and I'll be more than happy to find out exactly why your requests weren't taken care of.  Thank you.

Summary: The motel is much worse than we expected.    The rooms is big but looks tired and old.  The lights in the room are very minimum which makes the place even looked more shabby.    My mom-in-law, being a rather sensitive person, actually thought that she heard someone singing inside her room in the middle of the nite.  That really kept her awake the whole nite.  Really disappointed about this motel and this is definitely the worst motel we stayed during our 2 weeks holiday in the US. And we stayed in other Super 8 as well as other similar chain motels.
Manager Response: I'm sorry your family did not have a good stay.  Please contact me directly and I will absolutely do my best to resolve your issue.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: good bed and roof over your head
Summary: If you want a basic place to sleep and not spend too much time at the motel and cheap. This is the place. Walking distance to Disneyland tram (ask at the front desk for the shortest route). The room was semi clean. Good Service.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We strive to give our guest the most value for their money.  Please do come back and see us again.

Summary: It was great for the price the people thatwork there are nice and helpful. pretty clean and great for the price. we went on short notice and changed our plans 3 times and they were really nice about it.
Manager Response: We're glad you had an awesome stay.  Thanks for taking the time to write a nice review for us.

Summary: great hotel, super close to disneyland, walked to the mickey and friends parking structure each day and took the tram to the park entrance from there.  it was only a 5-10 minute walk.   there was a safety problem with the elevator and it was closed because of it.  Fixing the issue and having the elevator working is the only improvement I would like to see.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a nice review for us.

Summary: Rooms not clean at all, very old, towels were very worn and stained. When we first arrived no towels in the room. Thought the breakfast would be more than just donuts, etc.elevators broken all we hear all night was people rolling the luggage upstairs. I've stayed at other super 8 and they were nothing like this. staff not friendly at all.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have a good experience.  Please do reach out to me directly so I can better assist you with the issues you experienced.  We have just completed the required safety upgrade for our elevator and currently we are waiting for State inspector to give us the final clearance so we may put it back in service.

Summary: First off, this wasn't even the Super 8 I had booked my reservation for. I had booked an online reservation for a different Anaheim super 8, and upon arriving at that location (by taxi), was told it was this location. I had to pay for ANOTHER taxi to get there. Upon arriving, the attitude of the person behind the desk seemed to be "take your stuff and go" Our room seemed to be situated as far away from everything as possible.   Upon entering the room, everything was unplugged, the lights didn't even want to turn on, as if the knobs to turn them on had been stripped. Finally figured out that they had to be turned SLIGHTLY. Turning them until they clicked turned them back off, however not turning them far enough would cause them to turn off again as soon as the hand was taken
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had booked at the wrong location.  There are many venues in which Super 8 can be booked and we always remind the guest to take extra caution when booking the reservation.  Please contact me directly so I may resolve your issues for you.  Thanks.

Summary: Clean, fast service, walking distance to Disneyland.... The only con was that the elevator was not working; being 37 weeks pregnant and having a room in the last floor.... Not fun, but This will definitely be my first choice when taking another Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: Amazing location at a great value
Summary: This place is right beside Disney Land. At night you can hear and see the fireworks. I found the rooms to be acceptably priced and clean. Overall it was a great place to stay. The pool and hot tub are small but reasonable, and there is an elevator.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words and we're so glad you had an enjoyable stay.  Please come back and see us again!

Summary Heading: Great value, good service, nice rooms and CLOSE to Disneyland!
Summary: Great value hotel located close to Disneyland! We walked to Disneyland with our two-year old ( yes she walked too) ! Rooms were nice, staff great! Just make sure you don't sleep In and miss the continental breakfast served from 7-9. At night you can see the fireworks from your room!

Not a high class resort but if you want a room right up from Disneyland it's hard to beat.  Breakfast selection was pretty good. Great value for the price. Got off the freeway and it was right there on the way to the park on the Main Street.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review for us.  I'm sorry if we did not inform you  on how to get to the park properly.  We have a detailed walking map the guest may request.  I will be sure to pass down your comment.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: This motel was just right for our needs, as we were planning to stay the majority of our time at Disneyland. Close enough to walk, but they could have given us better details on how to get there on foot. All the ameneties were fine, everything clean. I'd stay there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review for us.  I'm sorry if we did not inform you  on how to get to the park properly.  We have a detailed walking map the guest may request.  I will be sure to pass down your comment.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The hotel is convienently located next to Disneyalnd and the Mickey and Friends Parking Garage. Rooms were clean and roomy. Hotel is located next to offramp of I-5 so can be a bit noisy at times. Great Value for visiting park but i would not on extended stay
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment.  Unfortunately and fortunately we are right off the I-5 exit so we tend to get lots of traffic.  Our guest can request a corner room in order to minimize the noise.  Thanks for taking the time to write a review for us.  Happy Holidays.

Summary Heading: Good price - you get what you pay for!
Summary: A decent night's sleep for the price.  A little scary area, I thought - especially when arriving at night.  My son and myself have Celiac Disease, so there was really nothing available for us to eat for breakfast besides juice.  A banana or something would have been nice.  Also - the internet access was a joke - might as well not advertise it.  We could rarely get it to work.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comment.  I'm sorry the internet wasn't working well for you.  We pride ourselves for providing good wifi service because we spent an enormous amount of time and effort in order to make sure our guests can serf the net freely.  I'll certainly look into this issue.  We also have plans to upgrade our current broadband speed very soon.  Nowadays everyone travels with a wifi-ready device so we want to be ready to accommodate our guests.  Happy Holidays.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disney trip.
Summary: This hotel is great bang for you buck. Room was only needed for place to stay for the weekend trip to Disney. 10-12 min walk to Disney Resort. Rooms were spacious and comfy. The staff was greeting and very polite. Will plan to stay here again on my next trip back to Disney.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a nice review for us.  I'm glad you had an enjoyable stay.  Please do consider us next time you're in town again.  Happy Holidays.

Summary Heading: Everything would be perfect... but there was a lot of noise...
Summary: Everything would be perfect... but there was a lot of noise the second nite and the waitress opened our luggage, she didn't stole anything... but that could be one of the things to consider the staying in the hotel again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback.  I understand you believe your luggage was opened during your stay.  We take guest's privacy very seriously even if it was just a misunderstanding, please contact me (Kevin Chen) at the hotel directly so I may investigate this matter further for you.

Summary: Bath towels were not available and the towels left in the room were never enough for the number of people in it. The donut selection was minimal when there were any at all. Sheets were seriously overbleached.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback.  I apologize if you did not have a pleasant stay.  I will inform the breakfast staff to ensure all items are available to everyone.  Please do let me know personally if you will be visiting the area again, I will personally make sure your stay is as pleasant as we can make it.  Thank you.
