Summary: We had stayed at the other Super 8 on the southeast side of Disneyland so we decided to try this one. This super 8 was more expensive so we thought it would be a better stay. We were wrong. It was terrible trying to get to by car and we had to make several U turns. The staff treated us rudely and when we were checking in we waited a good 20 minutes while two staff members were finishing their conversation about the club they went to. After I checked in, I walked upstairs to check out our room. The bathroom was disgusting and their was hair on the pillows and sheets. I immediately went to the front desk and asked for a different room. They said they were all booked and could not accommodate us. When I looked out in the parking lot there were no more than 4 cars in the parking
Manager Response: I'm greatly appreciative that you gave us a try but I'm truly sorry you had a bad experience.  That is certainly the experience we want you to have.  There is no reason why we cannot offer you a different room immediately if we're not sold out or if we have rooms available at the time.  Please contact me directly and I will research this incident for you further.  Thank you.

Summary: My wife, son, and myself stayed here on our latest visit to Disneyland for Mickey's not so scary Halloween party. It has everything we needed for our stay. Comfortable clean rooms, with fairly comfortable beds. The continental breakfast was filling, but the addition of fruit, yogurt or some thing with some protein would be nice. But you can't complain when its free.. The parking wasn't an issue this time, because we visited in the off time, so the motel wasn't full. The pool was clean but cold, but the spa was nice and hot. We will most likely stay again on our next visit. For the location, price, and friendly customer service I don't think you can really beat this place.....
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and the continuous support.  I love to hear our returning guests always have a pleasant stay, that's what we aim for.  Please come back to see us again!

Summary: For a budget motel this was very nice with a comfortable bed.  Being close to Disneyland and walking to the Disney parking and able to take their tram was a bonus.  An excellent value, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review for us.  We know there are many economical lodging choices in Anaheim and we certainly appreciate you gave us a try and had a pleasant stay.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The room appeared clean and tidy.  Furnishings were cheaper quality but for this budget scale I would not have expected more. Bathroom seemed like a handicap it was very large with a shower that had no rim on it - though it seemed too narrow for a wheel chair. It was clean and basic.  Just oddly sized.  Bed was average - everything in the room worked. We could park at the door of the room.  Property seemed well maintained.   Our only real complaints were that the room was pretty dim -luckily we were just resting and getting right back on the road this would not be a good room to work in despite the free internet.  Also there was a very strong disinfectant smell. Glad the room was cleaned but perhaps they need to cut back on that.  Lastly there was a visible gap under the door
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review.  We try to provide the best value for our guests.  I will certainly take a look at the 'gap' under the door you mentioned.  That's something we certainly will not have noticed had it not for guests like you.  We want to make everyone as comfortable as possible so I appreciate your feedback on the lights as well.  We have plans to upgrade the wattage in the upcoming future so our guest rooms are more brightly lit.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for Families, close to Disneyland
Summary: pillows are horrible....arrived for continental breakfast at 8:40 and there was absolutely nothing left....I guess it's first come first serve....not sure if the guest are at fault for taking more than needed or if the hotel is not supplying enough...either way, we were turned away and ended up at IHOP.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We're currently rolling out a new pillow type for all of our guest rooms because we realize a good night's sleep starts with the pillow.  Once we have finished testing the pillows we will announce it on our Super Blog so stay tuned.  Regarding breakfast sometimes it does get really hectic in the morning.  We always have enough items, if you do not see an item you want feel free to ask the staff for additional replenishment.  Thanks and we hope to see you again.

Summary: We booked last minute and the Super 8 was a great choice; continental breakfast was donuts, juice, coffee, toast, and cereal which is more than you can rationally expect for sixty dollars a night and we were very content.  The staff wasn't a shining beacon of friendly warmth but they were helpful when they needed to be, and parking even when we thought it would be an issue never was.  The only, and rather large, complaint I have is with our arrival home.  I noticed my husband had forgotten a charger and wall adapter for one of our devices, he called and was told that he couldn't be helped until housekeeping returned in the morning.  When he called again the adapter had been found but the charger had not, and the adapter would require a twenty-five dollar fee to be shipped.  The
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback.  I'm sorry about your lost charger.  The truth is that we have literally hundreds of items that need to be shipped back every month.  Chargers and pillows being the top items everyone seems to leave behind.  I understand a simple USPS envelope may do the job but we choose to ship back items via UPS because of reliability and protection of our guest items.  We have encountered items mailed end up lost or guest simply never received it.  We do not want to have found your item and then lose it again.  That is the reason for the $25 fee for a more reliable UPS shipping.  Thank you for your understanding.

Summary Heading: If you just need a bed
Summary: This is an okay place if you just need a bed.  The elevator is broken (and it looks like it's been for some time).  The parking is tight (do not bring an rv or large truck).  The rooms have been painted, and they did a pretty bad job in the bathroom.  There is mold on the walls of the shower and the little all in one shampoo/soap packets are yucky so bring your own shampoo.  Also the smokers like to sit on the stairwells and smoke since they cant in their room so be prepared to dodge a few people trying to get up and down each day.   The breakfast room is crowded.  We stayed for 4 days and only went once; all they had was some toast, donuts, coffee, and tang.  It is a longer walk then staying in one of the hotels on the east side of Disneyland. Overall, there are better choices
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  I'm sorry you had an unpleasant stay.  The conditions you described in the bathroom is certainly not acceptable.  I will definitely look into this and correct the issue.  Our elevator is scheduled to be back in operation in January due to safety concern.  We are working as quickly as we can to restore this service to our guests.  I apologize for any inconvenience this might have caused you.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but needs improvement
Summary: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean enough however the noise level was not acceptable. The beds were very uncomfortable, but I need a firm mattress.  The elevator was out of service and a workman was on the job around 7am talking loudly in the hall way with many of us still in bed.   The parking is limited for the number of rooms at the site.
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience.  The elevator technician and myself were outside your room at about 7:30am to perform minor repairs and we did our best to keep our noise to a minimal.  I apologize for the oversight and should not have placed you in that particular room.  We did offer additional discount to you afterward and I hope you will give us another try in the future.  Thank you.

Summary: This hotel was a great value for what we got. Close to Disneyland, clean rooms, microwave and fridge. The only complaint I have is the guests that stayed above us, they sounded like a pack of elephants running back and forth all night long. And I asked for extra pillows and they could only give me 2, but next time ill just bring my own. =)
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  I'm glad you had a pleasant stay. You may request a top floor room because many of our guests do not want little kids running above them and we certainly understand and will accommodate their requests.

Summary: close to disneyland with affordable rates and clean rooms. very friendly staff and good continental breakfast. well worth the money!
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words, we hope to see you again!

Summary: It was nice except the heater alerted the fire alarm other then that it was good. It would be nice if they had a shuttle that would drop you off at Disneyland ..

I've stayed at this hotel before, and I really enjoy it. It's not on the front side of Disney so it is cheaper to stay at and the walk is roughly the same when you consider you can ride the tram to the parks. My one complaint for this stay was at night there would be dozens of little ant like bugs in the sink. I filled the sink with water and still found more in the sink later. It wasn't bad or gross but it wasn't something I'd like to see. Other than that the hotel is great, the pool and hot tub are enjoyable, you are able to see the fireworks from the hot tub and it's continental breakfast was pretty good.

Nothing fancy, but excellent price.  About a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.  Don't expect a fancy breakfast, but there are a fair number of options.  The walls are a bit thin, so one hears neighbors/parking lot noise.

I got a really good rate on this hotel. For what I paid it was great. The customer service was fair and the free breakfast was just donuts, cereal and coffee. There isn't a shuttle from the hotel to Disneyland, so if you can't walk about 5-7 minutes with your group on sidewalks, this might not be the hotel for you.
We have stayed here many times and will continue to stay here in the future. The location to Disney is wonderful and the motel staff are very nice and extremely helpful.

Had some problems with our first room, but the staff got us into another one pretty quickly. Fairly clean and convenient. Only complaint is that the pillows are VERY uncomfortable. I'd bring my own next time.

I have stayed at several different motels and hotels in Anaheim over the past 10 years and in my opinion staying here was the best value for the money.  I had no problems with parking.  With the money we saved we were able to eat dinner at Disneyland every day. We only ate the breakfast one day. We had doughnuts and they were fine. We drove to Disneyland it only took a couple of minutes.  We could see and hear the fireworks while sitting in the hot tub. Wifi worked great. I really think this motel is the best bang for your buck. I will definately stay again next time we go to Disneyland.  Also it's not very far from knots Berry Farm. I am a pretty picky person so I was worried about the mixed reviews.  All I wanted was a clean room with a microwave, fridge, laundry facilities,
we had a great time as it was so close to our destinatiion of Disneyland an all of our chilkdren the room was great and the staff was efficient

I reserved with one card and we pay the rooms at the lobby with other cards, double charging the payment. It is more than a week and I cant see my money back.. I am really mad with this situation, for me this is a robery

The room was clean and tasteful.  The microwave and mini fridge really helped us with in between meals and late night eating near Disneyland.  The breakfast offered by the hotel was a sad and lean selection of corn flakes and donuts, although I did not expect much more.  My only true complaint was that our room was pie shaped, meaning that our only ventilation was through a 1 foot by 2 foot window opening that looked into a dank hallway.  This made the room stuffy.  Most of the other rooms looked great though.

Wasn't really crazy about the continental breakfast, would of liked to see some fruit, muffins and bagels, some people can't eat donuts, I am a diabetic, like to stay where a continental breakfast is offer cause it saves on money for breakfast, but we had to go out and eat, so didn't save, spend more, so it might be beneficial to stay some where else that charges alittle more and offers more in a continental breakfast, other than that all was great!

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfortable close to Disney
Summary: We booked a room at this Super 8 on short notice when another property in Anaheim proved unacceptable. The staff was helpful and competent. We didn't find any more problem with noise here than any other urban motel where we've stayed. Their rates were excellent. They promise a continental breakfast, which is what you get, cereal, toast, pastries, coffee and juice.  They don't charge extra for parking, while a lot of other places surprise you with a hefty parking fee at checkout. It took us 12 minutes to walk to the tram loading area at the Disney parking garage. It's an easy walk, just go down West/Flore street from Ball Rd, one block west of Disney Drive. All in all, a good value for the price, with no extravagances or surprises.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.   We understand there are many choices when it comes to hotel stays in Anaheim and I'm glad it worked out for you.  We'll continue to provide our guest with the best value when it comes to affordability and a comfortable place to stay.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Erwin provided excellent customer service and was able to find me a better price for our five day stay than on the internet. We had a great time at Disneyland and a great stay! Since I have a season pass for Disneyland will be staying here more often. Very close to Disney Garage.
Manager Response: We're so glad you had a great time.  I appreciate you taking the time to write a nice review for us.  I'll be sure to forward your compliment to Erwin.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great room for people on a budget
Summary: I would recommend Super 8 on Disneyland Dr. The rooms are clean. Disneyland is within walking distance and the bonus is we could see the fireworks right from our balcony! we could here people upstairs when they walked around and others showers running, but all and all a great value.
Manager Response: Thanks for your recommendation.  One tip we have for our future guests is that if you're a light sleeper, you're welcome to request a top floor room so no other guests will be running on top of you.  If our guests inform us the noise we'll always give a courtesy call to the guests above.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The reviews I read where misleading.I read one that said hot breakfast.Toast was the hot item.The doughnuts where stale.My room wasn't ready when I arrived.The front office smelled like B.O. for hours.My wife read the reviews.YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry we did not meet your expectation.  Super 8 does not provide hot breakfast, however, we'll be rolling out a new breakfast menu that'll include oat meal, hot chocolate and cinnamon rolls.  We hope you'll consider us again in the future.  Thank You.

Summary: bad attitude of staff and poor service.  door keys had to be reissussed after every use to work correctly. VERY VERY noisy

Very nice hotel looks good kn the outside and just as nice inside love the fridg and microwave . Staff was great and very nice, very close to disneyland and the I-5. The room was very clean the bed was comfy and you can step out of your room and see the disneyland fireworks at nite.
Manager Response: Fridge and microwave is always a favorite with our guests.  Yes you'll hear the fireworks loud and clear just outside of your room.  We're so glad you enjoyed your trip, please come back and see us again!

Summary: The breakfast was a joke... And the tram was non-existent. The room was not the cleanest and it stunk. I will not be coming back.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had an unpleasant experience.  Please contact me directly so I may further assist you.  Thank you.

Summary: Headed to Disneyland a day earlier on our trip and this was close to Disneyland.  When I checked in the clerk gave a great rate and my kids swam in the pool to relax for from the afternoon at Disneyland.  The room was clean.  Breakfast was doughnuts and juice.  Hurry early though the good ones go fast.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words.  I'm glad your children had a chance to use the pool.  Please come back and see us again!

Summary: Great Price! We found this hotel just right for our needs. We only slept/showered there. We were in the parks the rest of the time. Clean rooms, hot water, remodeled bathrooms with new tile and new color on the room's walls. Used the hot tub once and it was nice and hot. Breakfast is basic cereal, toast, pastries, juice. But I had read the reviews and brought fruit to add to it. We walked to the Mickey and Friends parking garage and caught the tram both ways. Some people we met at breakfast drove to the parking garage and we met at the bag check at the parks at the same time. There is no computer available but the staff was very friendly and helped me check in for our return flight. For a great price it fitted our needs perfectly. We would rather save our money for the Parks
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and taking the time out to make many recommendations for our future guests.  It is in deed true that walking 15 min to catch the free tram is faster than driving in and pay for parking.  Thus we always recommend this option to our guests if they don't mind the walk. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: Everything was finr but the hotel location hsd on right lsne access which caused us to make several uturns during the stay to get in and out of the property.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.  Beginning next week we'll be rolling out new breakfast program that'll have additional choices.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for almost a week and were thankful to have a pleasant, clean and comfortable room. The large fridge and microwave were very helpful on our budget. I wish they had more than just toast and donuts for breakfast but it seemed typical fair for a budget motel. The pool water was too cold to swim in but the jacuzzi was great! We loved that it was so close to Disney - my kids are young but they were fine walking to the parks - it only took us about 15-20 minutes. Close to a gas station and food mart. We would stay again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  I'm glad you enjoyed your trip.  Please come back and see us again!

Summary: This hotel was a great selection for the nominal cost per night.  I would highly recommend this hotel as a place to crash at the end of the night.  This hotel is no frills, so if you're looking for more in the hotel, this would not be a good choice.  However, it was just what we were looking for, so it worked excellent for us.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words, we always try to provide the best value for what our guest pays for.  I'm glad you had a positive experience!  We're constantly listening to our guest inputs so we can provide better amenities in the future.  Thanks for your feedback.

Summary: Close to parks... Clean, Friendly staff. Not alot of parking. Room was comfy and quiet. Would definately stay again. Price was great for what we got. We had a fridge in the room which is hard to find, especially for the price we paid. Wish we could walk to Disney but on back end not front end of park so we had to take the tram. Overall it was very good for what we got.
Manager Response: I'm glad you had a positive experience.  We do know parking here can get challenging.  We'll soon be implementing a new parking permit program that'll help our guests out even more by eliminating vehicles that do not belong to us.  Our standard amenity of fridge and microwave is always a guest favorite.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: We had a dead bird in our room & the manager acted like it wasn't a big deal!
Summary: This motel was discusting to say the least. Our first night there we found a DEAD BIRD under the headboard!!!! In the morning when my husband called the front desk about what we at first thought was a rat, they didn't know what to say and offered another room. We packed up and went to the new room only to not sleep very well because the people above us were up until 3am yelling and stomping around. You can hear people go to the bathroom, flush, use microwave, wash hands, walk around, and talking for rooms next to you, above you and underneath you. The manager finally called 10 hours after we asked for him to contact us about the dead animal and when he did he told my husband, " First of all Sir, it wasn't a rat it was a dead bird..." Like that makes it better?! He was trying to
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had an unpleasant experience.  This is the first time we discover a dead bird in the room and for that I offer my apology.  We have tall palm trees all over our property and we're suspecting the one of the birds that nest from the tree next to your room  accidentally flew into your room.  Unfortunately we did not discover this and we certainly should have.  It's a very weird coincidence that, again, my apology will not go enough to resolve this issue.  Please contact us directly so I can assist you further.

Summary: Super great trip for me and my girlfriend . The room was clean and we haven't had any complain about it. Next time we sure to be stay at the same place again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  I'm glad you enjoyed the stay. We certainly hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The price is affordable and the location to where we wanted to go was close to Disneyland. At night I could see light all the way around the entry door.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  I'm glad you enjoyed the stay. We certainly hope to see you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Broken chair, no in room safe, bad parking, NOT ON SHUTTLE LINE for Disneyland
Summary: 1. Hotel is NOT on the shuttle line to Disneyland. It's about a 20 minute walk, too far with a toddler when you will already be walking all day. Paid $15 per day to park in the Mickey and Friends parking, then took the tram to the gates. Next time will pay extra to stay within walking distance. 2. The parking situation is a NIGHTMARE. There isn't enough parking for all guests. About 3 spots in the front on at least one side can't even really be used because the spots are so tightly crammed into a corner. People were parking against the curb, making it difficult for people to back out of a spot and leave. 3.One chair had a bolt so lose that it fell out while I was sitting in it. The entire chair collapsed and I fell on the floor. Staff was completely unconcerned with my safety
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had an unpleasant experience.  We'll certainly take all your points into consideration.  If I may elaborate on a few points: 1.  We not advertised as being on the ART shuttle line.  There is a shuttle pick up less than 5 min walk but we do not encourage the guests to take it because for the price you paid we do not feel it's worth for the guest.  2.  We do not advertise in room safe and have never been.  If there is an ad showing so please let us know so we can ask the advertiser to remove the false information.   3.  Fridge and microwave are unplugged because some guests do not need them.  Instead they'd like the extra outlets so we leave it up to each individual guest to decide what they prefer.

Summary: Clean, very quiet, friendly helpful staff, great value. Much better experience than we were expecting. The problems with towels and parking we had read about from past reviews turned out to be very minor problems. The staff will make sure you have a place to park. We brought our own towels just in case but theirs were not that bad. great Jacuzzi and pool. My advice, as when you travel anywhere, patience and common courtesy is key. P.S. The walk to disneyland trams was only about 15 min, the parking garage 2 min.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words and I appreciate your advice to other travelers.  We try our best to accommodate everyone and once in a while it gets quite hectic around here.  We encourage the guest to walk to the tram service instead of parking because oftentimes you wait longer in the parking garage when the parks are busy.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Had a good restful night. Got a late checkout which worked out well. Much closer to the park than I thought.
Manager Response: I'm glad you had a pleasant experience.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: Room was quiet which was nice.  Bathtub wasn't real clean.  Hair and residue in it.  Sheets on bed were really thin and comforter was stained.
Manager Response: I apologize if the room did not meet your expectation.  A clean and comfortable room is what we aim for everyday.  Please contact me directly so I can assist you further.  Thank you.

Summary: Strangest shaped room I have ever been in. It was shaped like a pizza slice. The entrance wall was the width of the door and the room spread out in triange shape. So very strange...
Manager Response: I chuckle every time a guest feels our room has a funny shape.  The truth is yes it does but many of our guests actually request this room because of its privacy.  Now that you mentioned it does seem to be similar to a slice of pizza shape.  Fortunately we only have 2 of these rooms and you're welcome to change room if you were not comfortable.  Simply let the front desk know and we'll take care of it for you.

Summary: I always enjoy my stay here in the US coming form Australia , the hotel was comfortable and clean . Had trouble with the Internet even with premium up grade, all in all would stay again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive comment.  Please by all means let us know if the internet speed was not up to your standard.  We have invested in a good system and we'd like everyone to be able to have great surfing experience.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Breakfast needs more options with some fruit added to the menu. Information on how to use the WIFI would have been helpful.
Manager Response: Thanks for your suggestions, we'll definitely look into having a written instruction for our Wifi system.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Great rooms for price spent! They took great care of me, even gave me my room early, one night I got in so late I couldn't find a parking space, they saved one for me.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you had a good time.  Thanks for taking the time out to write a nice review for us, we really appreciate it.  Please come back and see us again.

Summary: Contenital breakfast was poor compared to past visits at this location.  staff was friendly.  parking was poor.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have a good experience while staying with us.  Please contact me directly so I can resolve your issue.  Thank you.

Summary: We usually have great stays, but this time was horrible. When our son was going to bed, he was stung by something in the covers of one of the beds (we never found it, but the mark was there). Then, when we checked the covers, there was a huge stain on the sheets, which appeared to be body fluids. We requested to be moved, which they promptly did, but the room we moved to had ants, and the walls were so cheap, the Disneyland fireworks were so loud, they woke me and my wife up. We were very disappointed, and we won't be staying at this Super 8 location again.

Summary Heading: Cute hotel and cheap in price!!!
Summary: We were tired and decided to stay at this hotel thinking that it would be super expensive becuase its very cute and in a great location and it ended up being cheaper then the other funky hotels that we have stayed at in the past.  Breakfast was pretty good.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  We painted our exterior with bright colors so our guests will feel happier when they arrive.  I'm glad it works for you. Thanks for taking the time out to write a nice comment, we really appreciate your feedback.

Summary: Excellent service, cleanliness, the only point I would improve is the parking lot, is not very comfortable, but everything else was great
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time out to submit a nice review for us.  We really appreciate it.  I know parking can be a little tight but we'll always get everyone a space.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: good value, clean quiet, safe hotel can't beat the discounts
Summary: Nice hotel room, best to book on line, will save 8-9%, staff is friendly, room was immaculately clean and smelled good, excellent choice for non-smoker.  Internet is a little slow, but everything else was super!
Manager Response: Thanks for pointing out the importance of making the reservation online.  Some of our best deals are only available online.  We're glad you enjoyed the stay with us. Thanks for the review!

Summary: Our family has stayed at this motel several times while vacationing at Disneyland and we have been pleasantly surprised at the quality of this budget motel.  It is withing walking distance to Disneyland (about a 20 minute walk) and is close driving distance to a variety of eating places as well as shopping options like Walmart, Target, etc.  The staff has always been friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and probably the largest rooms we have found in the budget range.  Parking is sometimes an issue but they have parking in the back that you can use.  Overall, we enjoy staying here!
Manager Response: Great to hear that we have consistently met your expectations!  Thank you for taking the time out to write a nice review for us, we really do appreciate it.  Please come back and see us again.

Summary: I had a great stay here.  Nice rooms, Big Beds.  my only complaint is that the breakfast lounge or the lobby is not open before 7am.  as some of you visitors may know, Both Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure opens up at 8 am.  to get to the best rides, one would have to be in line at the entrance gate by 0730.  That means an early breakfast.  We checked out at 7am to head over to the Disney parking next door to be in line at the gate by 0730.  Highly recommend bringing flip flops for the room if you do not want your socks to turn black.  Otherwise, it was a great stay.  We just stayed overnight since we only live a couple hours away.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We have now increased the number of times we perform deep cleaning for our guest room carpet.  This will ensure our guests don't have black socks by the end of their stay!  We look forward to see you again in the future.

Summary: We booked this place for 2 reasons. First the price for each night was good and the second was they advertised they had a shuttle close by to take you  to Disneyalnd. It was 4 blocks away, if you were willing to walk  2 more blocks you were in Disneyland.The staff were nice and helpful. The free morning breakfast was okay, not much to choose from. The place was kind of old, but nice and clean. The swimming pool was relaxing after a long day. The worst thing is you could hear everything from your neighbors.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback, we hope you'll consider us again.

Summary: Our family of 4 just spent a full week at this Super 8.  We were extremely happy with this motel and would definitely stay here again.  The front desk staff was VERY helpful and friendly.  The room was spotless and the beds were very comfortable. Upon checking in, the girl at the front desk even helped us find a room with newer beds.  For the price, we couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay.  We read a lot of the reviews posted about the walk to Disneyland.  The walk to the parking lot tram is 15 minutes as posted on the motel website.  There is an AM/PM a couple of doors down, free wi fi, clean pool, and a nice simple breakfast provided.  A lot of the reviews we read complained about the breakfast but last year we stayed at a Disneyland Good Neighbor hotel that didn't
Manager Response: Thanks for a great review! I'm glad you and your family had an enjoyable stay.  Please come back and see us again!

Summary Heading: Good place for a budget stay
Summary: We found the Hotel rooms to be clean and comfortable - The breakfast was a choice of donuts, cereal or  toast with juice, tea and coffee.The breakfast room was a little crowded at times with excited kids and adults but for a quick fill before a full day  - it was alright. We were surprised at the use of disposable cups and plates - but soon found that this is commonplace throughout the area. You can get a cup of tea or coffee at any time throughout the day from the breakfast room.Realistically - this is a budget hotel,very close to the heart of Disney - you can watch the fireworks every night and you can wash your clothes in the communal laundry (great for families that don't want to pay for laundry bills)..It was a bit of a walk to Disney , easy for adults but in the heat it

The rooms were pretty good and the indication is very close to the parks.  BUT it was crowded with Beatles and we have to leave the room.  When we told the girl at the reception she said nothing.  Stay away

Summary Heading: Super 8 Anaheim/Disneyland Drive, Not a great Experience
Summary: Let me start by saying I visit the Disneyland Resort once a year for over 30 years now and I have stayed at most of the motels/hotels in the area. Super 8 was very disappointing. We got a good rate and that was about the extent of our good experience. I carefully review all places of interest and base my decisions on others experiences. I was kind of surprised of the amount of good reviews now that I have stayed there myself.  First off upon our arrival, we did arrive earlier than check in, so we checked in and went to get a bite to eat and come back at 3:00 which was fine as that is check in time. So we go and come back and the rooms werent ready. We had a large group of 12 and had 3 rooms.  When we finally got in to the rooms, the appearance of the room was not nice. Very dark
Manager Response: I'm very sorry to hear you did not have a pleasant stay with us.  There may be many reasons that attribute to your rooms not being cleaned.  It's important to us that we respond to all of our guests concerns appropriately and it seems we didn't do that for you.  Please give me a call personally so I may assist you further.  -Kevin Chen, GM-

Summary: First night there, I wake up and turn the light on above the night stand,and what do I find? Roaches! I could not sleep all night we left the light on to keep them away I was terrified.I knew I got what I paid for as far as esthetics but I didn't expect pests. For the remainded of the trip we did not leave any trash in the room. If you can fork out more money  go elsewhere for your family to sleep in comfort without worrying about keeping a light on to scare roaches away.Second, the refrigerator takes about 3 days to get cold once you plug it in. No instructions on how to use so turn it to "7" when you get in the room if you intend to use it. If you are a light sleeper keep in mind pool hours are til 11pm, so it is very active with people running up and down the halls and will
Manager Response: I apologize you did not have a positive experience with us.  We have already contacted our regular pest control company for them to do a deep inspection of the property to keep the unwanted pests away from our guests.  We regularly undergo pest control inspection twice a month as we take this very seriously.  We suspect the continuous hot weather in the last few weeks may have attribute to the issue.  Please call me directly so I may take care of your reservation.  Thank you.  -Kevin Chen, GM-

Summary: Im actually writing this review at 3am 08/5/12. My family and I stay here every time we visit Disney (all the way from TX). We stayed 7/29/12-08/05/12. Where shall I began, were a group of seven..four adults 3 kids, so we ended up getting two rooms 312-314 which included two queen beds in each room on the third floor.. all amenities worked which included a small fridge which will need to be plug in at arrival because hotel is trying to be electic conscience.. It will freeze whatever is on top which is awesome for water bottles for Disney.. A microwave..A Coffee Pot.. A TV..And the air conditioner all worked great we love it super cold and it did its job. Rooms were clean and housekeeping was amazing so much so we tipped everyday. There's a free breakfast which has a small
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  I'm glad you and your guests had a pleasant stay and enjoyed your time at the park.  Please do come back and visit us again!

Summary: For one, it's very difficult to even get into the parking lot if your coming from anywhere south of the location.  After many attempts to get in there we discovered that there are more rooms than parking spots so several people had to park behind other vehicles causing a hassle the next morning.  I had to wait in the parking lot for someone to leave so I can take their spot.  And even then the person leaving gave me a dirty look so obviously he knew he was doomed when he got back.  The staff there was really helpful.  It was miserable not being able to leave the hotel comfortably knowing all those problems were waiting for us when we came back.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you feel this way.  During peak summer season many of our guests often travel with more than 1 vehicles.  In order to accommodate everyone we have a stack parking system that has worked very well for us.  Due to the physical limitation of our property (and many properties in Anaheim), we have to work around this and thus the reason for trained staff who'll assist the guest with parking.  We understand everyone wants their own space but at the same time we assure everyone will have a space.  We appreciater your understanding.

Summary Heading: Great Price for location and time of year
Summary: the price quoted for 7/2012 was great and the location near disneyland was very good and able to watch the fireworks done by Disneyland @ 9:30 PM ea nite was just too cool. room was great for 4 of us and the pool was oh so welcome by the 2 grandchildren and fun. Breakfast was nothing to brag about-too many people @ one time and what food there was ran out oh so quickly and not replaced in a timely manner-coffee in room was lousy but would stay there again in a couple of years
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback, we're glad you and your guests had an enjoyable stay.  Please come back and visit us soon!

Summary Heading: Definitely not a good option for families...
Summary: Bad, bad, bad.  Booked online for quick and easy place to sleep while visiting Disneyland.  Mistake! Never made it past check in.  Filthy, no air conditioning in lobby, drunk guests hanging over the railings.  Guests asked desk clerk for towels while we were checking in- "sorry, they're in the dryer."  Despite what their website says, it is not an easy walk to the Disneyland parking garage/ shuttle stop- it is over 20 minutes on city streets to get there.  That seems like fun at midnight with little kids.  Bottom line- place may have been serviceable once but it isn't now.  I would consider it unsafe for families with small children.  Also, AAA should definitely revise their rating.    We travel a lot, usually don't stay at Super 8s, now we know why. This particular property is
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not have an enjoyable experience at our property.  I can assure you this area is safe for all of our guests.  If some guests become excessively rowdy the front desk staff will have no problem asking the guest to vacate the property the property because we want everyone to feel safe here.  If you'd like to contact me directly I'll be more than happy to review the issues you've encountered during your stay. Thank you.

Summary: Overall, i hated the faux-hard wood floors, semi musty smell in room, bed lines. Liked the micro/fridge in room. No disney channel on tv. Pool was ok, but the jaquizzi was nice and small. Parking tight up front, but when getting back from disney at night, was nice to have an attendant guide u to a parking spot. Hated the road back to the hotel. Their is an illegal reverse Uturn thay u have to do, unless u come from i-5.  Front  desk was nice.  This is a budget hotel! Dont expect new or top if the line amenities. I think housekeeping takrs a break at 1 pm. That is when i tried to check in and took the kids to the pool. I did notice they were in the breakfast room. Many of them. I believe check in is at 2pm. While at pool, i didnt see their carts move.  Wifi came in and out but
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback, we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: I felt it was a good experience for the price we paid. The hotel is clean and well situated. It is about one mile from Disneyland's main gate and there are side walks the entire walk there. The room is fine - nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable. It is a good size. The breakfast is pretty meager. Unless you are really desperate, you will probably want to eat elsewhere. The parking is included which saves you the $15 parking charge at Disneyland if you are willing to walk.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Perfect for long days at Disney - I'll be back...
Summary: I was initially hesitant because we've always stayed on property or at another chain (not close to the park) but it was a last minute trip and we couldn't really beat the rate with "a 10 minute walk to Disney" ($49.00 a night). The night Manager was more than helpful and we were checked in in less than 15 minutes of pulling into the parking lot. The one downside to the property is no elevator. Lugging all the bags and my 4 year old asleep up the stairs was a little rough but not a deal breaker for me, after all you‚Äôre going to be walking miles and miles at the parks so an extra 18 steps at the beginning or end of the day, no big deal! The rooms: simple, clean, and provides all the necessities that a couple or family needs if you‚Äôre planning on spending long days at Disney. Rooms

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Since we were flying in late and going to disneyland all the next day we did not want to pay a fourtune for a place to sleep. The room smelled bad. It was cleaner than I expected too. there was a pool area and hot tub that my 6 year old enjoyed each night. The pool is outdoors so was far to cold for me to swim but tons of kids did. The front desk was nice and they were helpful with questions of were to eat and Disneyland.the room was very noisey also. busses pulling in very early in the morning. The hotel is a little walk from Disneyland.  The breafast was a joke! By far the worst in all the hotels that I have stayed in. They had bread, cereal, milk, juice and a toaster. after a while they would bring out two small trays of donuts. once a large crowd left... they would put more
Manager Response: I'm sorry you did not enjoy your stay and find the room to be unsatisfactory.  We did have a group in house during your stay so I apologize for the bus pulling in too early in the morning.  We're in the process of updating our breakfast menu to meet everyone's needs.  If you have a chance to visit the park again pls contact me directly and I'll be sure to personally oversee your reservation to ensure a better stay.  Thanks!

Summary: This was our first time at this property.  We chose this place based on price (about 58.00 per night) and we were not disappointed. This hotel is in a pretty good area, located behind Disneyland about a half mile from the Mickey & Friends parking structure.  We stayed 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. The property is very clean and professionally managed.  Check-in took about 5 minutes. Our room was on the bottom floor and it was large.  Two queen beds (pillows were plump. Bed was hard), a refrigerator, microwave, and a coffee pot. The rooms do not have an iron/ironing board and the hotel has very few to go around. It took us 3 days to get an iron. So, I would suggest bringing your own iron. The bathroom was also very clean.  Though, the bath towels are very small and thin.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback.  We're really glad you and your guests had a great time.  We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: We've visited Anaheim several times over the years and stayed in varying places. This was the best deal we've ever found within walking distance of Disneyland. It was just over $50 per night. The room was immaculate. The beds, pillows and linens were amazingly comfortable and great quality. We skipped the free breakfast which was mostly sweets because we wanted to be there for the opening of the parks. Just a half block away is a mall with tons of restaurants and shops where we ate great food at great prices. There's also a Subway, taqueria and mini mart just a half a block the other direction. We will be loyal customers to Super 8 for all of our future trips to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  We're so glad you had a great stay!  It sounds like you and your guests are regulars to Anaheim and Disneyland.  We certainly look forward to your next visit!  Take care!

Summary: The motel was clean which made up for the location.  Area was a tad scary and parking was difficult.  Again the room was clean which is a huge priority to me and a great size.  We didn't bother with the free breakfast, since it was not really anything.  We just did our own thing.
Manager Response: Thanks for your response.  I'm sorry if you felt the area was scary but rest assured Anaheim Resort area is a very safe area. I understand parking can be difficult at our property especially during busy season.  We always have staff out at the parking lot to assist our guests in finding a space.  I apologize for any convenience this might have caused you.  I hope you will consider us again in the future.  Take care.

Summary: My best friend and I were booked at the Super 8 for a race event at Disneyland. We arrived and checked in - and it was lovely!  But due to an unforeseen medical condition (not life threatening) we had to change our plans and check out the same day.  Though under no obligation to do so, the front desk supervisor, Erwin, went out of his way to explain our situation to the owner of the hotel so that we would not have to pay for the night.  Without giving any notice we could have been obliged to pay for that night; yet the hotel folks were so kind they had compassion on us and went against standard policy.  This is the kind of hotel we all want to stay in, isn't it?  That level of service is rare these days.  We won't forget it and will recommend the Super 8 Anaheim to anyone headed
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  We try our best to accommodate everyone as much as possible.  Especially when there is last minute or emergencies which of course no one can foresee.  I'm glad you had a pleasant experience and will certainly pass on your kind words to Erwin.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: For the great nightly rate, I was really nervous.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Our 3rd floor connecting rooms were clean, with clean and comfortable beds but thin pillows.  Fridge and microwave were clean and worked well.  No issues with a/c or heat with multiple settings.  Not many TV channels. Complimentary wi-fi worked well (our room was 2 floors above office).  No need to pay an extra $10 for the premium wi-fi.  The walls could be thicker.  I was awakened each of the 4 nights by kids next door jumping on the beds (unless there was ‚Äúsomething else‚Äù going on with 3 kids in the room.)  I‚Äôm told the other of our 2 rooms was very quiet as I was the only neighbor. I could see how parking would be tight.  We managed by limiting our in/out and always found a space. Daily breakfast
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  I'm glad you and your family had an enjoyable time at the park.  We will continue seek way to improve our breakfast and provide the best value for our guests.  I know it can be difficult to rest when there are kids all over the hotel.  Next time you may also request a corner room where it's more quiet and away from the general public.  Take care and we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The room was clean and there was plenty of space! Breakfast could be better but was just okay. Parking lot is a bit tight. We were super close to Disneyland which is awesome. Overall I would definitely use this place again!
Manager Response: I appreciate your positive feedback and I apologize if the parking was tight during your stay.  Rest assured we'll be able to accommodate every vehicle that's staying with us.  We will continue to find new breakfast items in order to provide the best value for all of our guests.  Take care and we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: We satyed here in January. The staff was very nice,courteous and helpful to us. We had a little 7 mos baby and they allowed us to check in early so our little one could take a nap. The rooms were very clean and tidy.This was our third time visiting this location because we always are comfortable and enjoy our stay. Stay here
Manager Response: I appreciate your positive feedback and hope you had a wonderful honeymoon.  Very often guests will get confused between the two Super 8 locations in Anaheim so we try to distinguish ourselves whenever we can.  If you are ever back to visit Anaheim again we certainly hope you will consider us for your next stay!  Take care.

Summary Heading: Stay Here Instead of the One "Near Disneyland"
Summary: I stayed here on the last night of my honeymoon after the one I had stayed at for the whole rest of the honeymoon, the one "near Disneyland" would not extend my stay or offer any other solution since they were all booked up.  This is so much a superior hotel.  The beds were nicer, customer service was better, the walls weren't nearly so thin, there was a refrigerator and a microwave, and there were actually blankets on the bed....if you're choosing between the two, definitely choose this one.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind words.  We're glad to hear that you decided to stay with us and had a good experience.  While there are two Super 8 locations in Anaheim, we strive to provide the best service and amenity.  Thanks for your vote of confidence and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here twice this past year (July of 2011 and January 2012) and it's a really great motel that is super close to Disneyland.  We were skeptical at first because it's so affordable we assumed there had to be something wrong with the place, but there's really not!  Our family of four enjoyed the convenience of a Disneyland day without having to pay the outrageous fee's of the luxury resorts that are on site at both parks.  Basically we slept in the room and spent the entire day(s) at both parks, so in  my opinion it's money well spent when you have a tight budget.  The staff is very nice, the free continental breakfast is good for kids and the tiny pool was fun to escape the heat.   The parking lot is really the biggest challenge as it's a tight lot with not a lot of turn
Manager Response: I'm glad you and your family had a great stay.  I agree parking can be challenging but like I've told all of our guests please do not worry because we'll be able to accommodate everyone.  We have just recently updated our pool so it looks very inviting, especially during a hot breezy day.  Thanks for your business and we look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel 12/20-12/27/11 and it was WONDERFUL! I booked our stay at this location back in March after reading reviews to many locations and this location had many positive things to say and the price was great! As our trip was approaching I read reviews and more of them seemed to be negative. I was concerned since prices and availability go up around the Holidays and we were weeks away from our trip. I contacted the Manager, Kevin Chen with my concern and he assured me our stay would be pleasant. I told him all we want is a clean room and decent beds to sleep on after long days at the park. We arrived and I was so happy. The staff that greeted us were so nice, the room & beds were clean, the area is safe, the walk to the parks or tram is only about 10-15 minutes,
Manager Response: First of all THANK YOU for taking the time to contact us directly and express your concerns.  It means so much to us that our guests will spend the extra time and allow us to make everything as smooth as possible for them.  When I receive your phone call I understand the concern you might have because for someone who has never been to Anaheim or our location, you put your trust in us to provide a nice, decent accommodation for your and your family.  I, too, would do the same if I was travelling with family and expect the place I'm staying at to adequately address my concerns.  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay and took the time out to write a nice review for us.  I hope everyone enjoyed their experience at the park because Disneyland truly is a magical place that we all need to visit once in a while to get rid of our everyday stress!  Take care.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: This was our second stay at this motel. We had 2 connecting rooms, they were both clean with fairly comfortable beds. The location is great it is only a short walk to the Disney parking lot tram, We went with my wife's parents, and they would tire out before we would , so we gave them the car to go back to the motel then we would walk back later. The parking lot is small but they do the best they can with what they have. The continental breakfast was decent, to all those other reviewers who complain about free continental breakfasts look up the definition of it. We plan on staying here again the next time we visit Disneyland...

Summary Heading: Hotel is great- don't complain for the price!
Summary: Before going to this hotel I read all the reviews, and I can't believe the things people complain about... we paid about $280 for 4 nights, and that provided us with a clean room, a pool and a location close to Disneyland.   I'll admit, at first I was confused on how to walk to Disneyland, and I'm sure we took an odd way, but we would walk about 10 minutes, then get on the Mickey and Friends tram to get us there. Not sure if this is the best way, but it suited us fine.  Breakfast was some free juice and donuts etc, nothing we personally wanted, but I think when something is free, you should appreciate the gesture :)  Pool was cute and had a little spa (or hot tub) as well. We were the only ones in it when we dropped by, and I liked that it didn't close until 10pm, most hotel
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback.  I'm glad you guys had an enjoyable stay.  I appreciate the feedback about the car service and taxi cab.  I have actually never thought of it this way until you brought it up.  The car service you received is one of our trusted cab service partner.  The reason why we call this company is because:  they're very prompt; their vehicles are nicer; drivers are usually more easy going as you experienced they had no problem making an extra trip to the grocery.  We also call Yellow cab but our experience with the company is somewhat mixed.   I can certainly understand the assurance of a metered cab feels in terms of pricing.  My experience is that regardless if it's a short trip or long trip, the car service company we use is competitive to the cab company.  However, I will let the front desk staff know in the future to let the guest know which company we'll be calling so you'll have an option to choose.  Thanks again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Clean, cheap Accommodation close to Disneyland!
Summary: Me and a friend stayed here for a few nights in December in a room with two queen beds. It was really good value for money! The staff were very professional, and our room was impeccable! I could not fault one thing, it was just so clean!. being from New Zealand we didn't know how to work American showers, so we phoned reception and they sent someone up. It got hot at night so I turned the A/C on however, it was a little noisy so I had to turn it off. The staff were friendly and were more than happy at giving directions to Disneyland and advice about the area.The hotel itself was quite close to Disneyland, about a 10 minute walk to the free shuttle.. but what felt like a 20 minute walk back after a busy day at Disneyland. There was a free breakfast each morning, however we had
Manager Response: Great to know you enjoyed your stay!  Wow we have many guests from New Zealand that I didn't even know about.  Our shower is simple, just turn counterclock wise from 6'o clock position to 9'o clock and it'll work just fine.  I'm familiar because I personally supervised the installation of these shower handles just a few years ago during our renovation.   Thanks for the recommendation and we hope to see you in the future!  -Kevin-

Summary: A friend of mine and I stayed here for a few nights early December and we loved it. The staff were friendly and helpful. We couldn't figure out how to work the shower and they sent someone to show us how. It was easy to get to and only a short walk to Disneyland and was cheap!   I would reccomend this place to anyone for cheap close accommodation to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Overall, not bad, especially for the $
Summary: We had two rooms that were adjacent, which was nice and we had a door between them.  One of the rooms had a very nice restroom, while the other was nice, but not as nice.  It had a granite counter top, but really tight bathroom.  The staff was professional and helpful, but not overly friendly.  We stayed for several nights and were pleased with the noise level and the cleanliness of the hotel.  It looked like they were cleaning the carpets in quite a few rooms and doing some other work as well.  I had read the reviews, so I knew that the refrigerator needed to be plugged in, but I would've figured that out pretty quickly.  The front of the room is tile and there is a little bit of a gap around the door, so it was a bit cold up near the door area and it was nicer to have your

Summary Heading: Well, if warmth and safety aren't your top priorities.....
Summary: We made a last minute reservation after planning to give Disneyland a second day. We had an early breakfast planned in the park and wanted to stay nearby. The motel was a great price, and I fully understand that "you get what you pay for". But, every room should be provided with a door that locks, not just the slide lock, and with a heating unit that turns on!!  We stayed because the 5 year old had already fallen asleep, using blankets that we had brought for extra warmth.  When the desk was informed in the morning, the simply referred us to their 800 number.

I was really surprised at the negative reviews of this Super 8 in Anaheim.  It seems some people want Hilton quality for Super 8 prices.  You do get thin towels, but they were fresh and clean.  The walls were a little thin, but again not that bad where I could not sleep.  I found the staff to be perfectly nice and pleasant.  They were not talkative, but they helped me receive a fax and guided me with a timeline to Hollywood.  The fridge was not plugged in, but as the operation of a bar fridge does not take the knowledge of rocket science, i would hope patrons could piece it together.  The parking is definitely an issue, if it busy be prepared not to park at their lot.  The proximity of the Super 8 to Disneyland and the Honda Center/Angels Stadium makes it an ideal location for a
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind comments.  Our guests have repeatedly told us we have provided a great value for the price they paid.  We're glad you've enjoyed your stay and we will look for more ways to provide a variety of breakfast items.  I understand parking is an issue, if we can 'make' more land in our lot I would, but unfortunately we deal with it like many hotels in Anaheim.  Rest assured we will get you a place to park!  -Kevin-

Summary Heading: Breakfast not like it use to be....
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times now...the breakfast was one of the reasons we stayed there.  When we got up early the morning after we drove in from Las Vegas, there was no coffee made or available, no fruit, no oatmeal packets, and no sweet rolls.  People were seated at the tables with empty plates...after finally getting some coffee and the room was half empty, the employees brought in more items for comsumption.  Next time we will make sure not to worry over the breakfast.  For the hotel itself, we have always enjoyed the rooms we have stayed in with a refridgerator and microwave.  Always clean and comfortable. We had checked out on day 3 of our trip, but called around 9 pm to see if they still had rooms available that night (Wednesday before Thanksgiving) and they

Summary Heading: A place to sleep.... Expect no more, no less.
Summary: We stayed 5 nights and had adjoining rooms with family.  Pros for this hotel.... close to Disneyland, WiFi, and economical.  Cons.... Refrigerators in BOTH rooms froze everything in them.  They were ere not plugged in when we arrived.  We plugged them in, only to discover the next morning they were NOT turned on either!  Would have been nice if the front desk had advised us of this tidbit of information BEFORE we had to throw away food left in them overnight! Coffee maker brewed ONE cup of coffee @ a time.  Went to Target and purchased a REAL coffee maker.  Breakfast of champions you will not find here!  Corn flakes, one fruit flavored cereal for kids, STALE donuts, bread for toast, milk, coffee, juice and that's it.  Beds are not the best, but falling into them after an

All in all, the room is OK. Everything else is not good. While I was there, they blocked half of the parking space for two days because they had 2 busses downloading and loading students twice a day. the lack of sufficient parking space was felt. They had some maintenance activity involving continuous operation of a noisy bolwer from morning to 6PM !!!  Breakfast is poor (in Super 8 standards) and there's very little space in the dining room, considering the number of gusts. They start breakfast at 7AM rather than 6AM in other Super 8 motels. My recommendation, look for a place with better management.

We love this hotel. You do get what you pay for in the fact that the breakfast isn't "amazing" and it's not this luxurious place to stay, but it is a great place to come home to after a long day at Disney. We visit come to Disneyland every year and we always stay at this hotel. We have never had a problem with the hotel or it's service. It's a great way to save on money when you'd rather have some extra spending money for the park :) We always bring our own food with us, that way if we don't feel like eating a donut we can have a healthy and hearty breakfast! We love this place and they can always expect our business for years to come!

Summary Heading: Great if the parking was better!
Summary: It is a good choice on a budget. I paid 53$ a night on the weekend and thought that was reasonable. My room was outdated...but clean. Not in the room long enough to worry about decor. My BIGGEST complaint like others is parking. Late night there is no parking left and the spaces in front are extremely small. Getting out onto the main road can be challenging during high traffic times and you do have to go up and make a u-turn to get on the hotel side of the road. Utimately you get what you pay for, it was worth the little inconveniences to me to save a few dollars.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when going to Disneyland!
Summary: Very reasonable price for such a nice place. The parking is free! The pool and hottub were clean. The rooms are a great size. Very close to Disneyland Resort. It's a beautiful walk but you can also drive right into the Disneyland parking structure right down the street or you can take the hotels shuttle there. Very convienant location. Definitely a great place to stay if you're on vacation to Disneyland Resort and are on a budget.

Summary Heading: Got what we paid for  I guess
Summary: We paid stuff all so we got stuff all... but what else can you expect from $55 a night? VERY thin towels, thin walls, very noisy but it was a bed to sleep in. The staff were really unhelpful and unenthused... really if you can't put a smile on your face don't work in a customer service based role. 15 min walk to Downtown Disney.

Although the price was great for a couple on a budge it was a HORRIBLE hotel. The staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful. The "free breakfast" was doughnuts and sugar cereals..nothing healthy! The rooms were dirty and dark and the noise was unbearable, and it wasn't from the cars on the street! It was from other hotel guest screaming and yelling at 2-3am! It was a horrible experience and we would NEVER go back or tell anyone about this place!!!

then it would be this hotel.  The parking lot is fine, the hot tub is decent, but that 's about where it ends.  We walked into our room and it smelled like something was rotting inside - the smell slightly dissipated after 3 days of airing it out, but it was BAD.  We got a disabled room, which was a good size and decent layout, but did not come with a shower chair - I have a bad leg that doesn't necessarily support me, so i "can" stand for a shower if I have something to hold on to, otherwise we would have had to go elsewhere.  I called the front desk and asked for a shower chair - "We don't have those."   "You have wheelchair accessible rooms, but people in wheelchairs can't shower here?"  "No.  Oh wait, is that one of those white things?"  "Yes, probably."   "Oh, you can just

Nice swimming pool/ hottub. Easy location off I-5. No problems parking. Walking distance to Disneyland shuttles (ask front desk for map!!), can get tiring carrying sleeping kids. Housekeeping....We were shorted towels twice, were woke up early accidently because she had wrong room, and the next day she knocked on the door to tell us our "do not disturb" sign had fallen. Hmmm, not sure if that was necessary. Bedding was very thin. Great view of Disneyland fireworks from the swimming pool/ hottub. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best air conditioning in LA area
Summary: We stayed 3 nights for our trip to Disneyland.  The AC in our room worked to perfection.  Set it at 70 degrees on the digital and it stayed pefect all three days and nights.  The room was large with a shower only, our choice.  King size bed was lacking extra pillows but the more than helpful front desk staff sorted that out for us.  There is a small outdoor pool we didn't use.  The breakfast was a little lacking in healty choices.  Assorted donuts are not a way to start your day. Sugar cereals, coffee , milk and some kind of juice.  No yogurt or fruit.  We found a good selection of restaurants and grocery stores less than a 2 mile drive. The internet only worked for us the first night. Parking was a bit of a challenge if you came home late.  You would have to check in at the

We stayed for 4 nights and went to Disneyland for 3 days while staying here.  We wanted something close to Disneyland so we could walk and not worry about parking or shuttles.  We walked to and from each day.  It was a little farther than I had envisioned.  We walked to the tram and took the tram the rest of the way.  It took about 10 minutes to walk to the tram.  In the future I may pay for parking or take a shuttle.  The bed was ok, but we were really tired after spending all day at Disneyland, so I am sure anything would have been fine.  The first day when we returned to our room, the air conditioner was turned off, so it was really hot.  The next day, we turned it off in the morning and opened our windows.  When we returned they were closed.  We were not happy about this.

Summary Heading: Good value, great location, family friendly.
Summary: Not the newest hotel on the block, but excellent value and location.  Free Wi-Fi, cont. Breakfast and two queen beds along with being within walking distance of Disney, make this hotel a good family value.  As long as you aren't looking for luxury accomidations, I recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: in a good spot for disneland
Summary: we chose to stay here because it seemed like a good location close to disneyland. the service we recieved was quite helpful we were given a room on the ground floor which was good for us. the room was not in the best spot though as it was near the elevator which made loud noises all hours of the night. and woke us up on numerous occasions, the room was spacious enough, good cleaning and the bed was comfy enough. although there is free car parking there is not much of it compared to the rooms so make sure that you are early! it says that you can walk to mickey and friends car park and catch the bus to disneyland, if you have already walked that far then you are better of to just walk the whole way in to disneyland.it is a good spot for watchin the fireworks at disneyland every

Summary Heading: Good value for the price & location!
Summary: We stayed here on Memorial Day weekend, found it online and the rates were very good. It's about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and most of  the path is not very well lighted and kind of spooky at night, but it is only a 3 minute drive to the park.  The room had 2  Queen beds, both were clean and had fresh linens.  The front desk staff was knowledgable and friendly.  This isn't a palace but definitely good value for the price. The 'breakfast'  is skimpy but overall, a decent place to stay.

Summary Heading: Not safe & discusting... try the Quality Inn on Ketella Blvd
Summary: My daughter and I arrived at 11:30pm. The front dest was clean and up dated with friendly staff... very promising. We signed in and headed to our room after along filght. Upon entering you would notice the badley worn blankets, sheets & matress and then the peeling wall paper. The floors were updated with laminate which were not cleaned for quite some time dead bugs, dust and hair. But we were tired, so my daughter went to have a shower only a trickle came out. While she was in the shower I went to make a call and the phone didn't work could not even call the front desk. Then the worst part was that the locks on the outside door and the joining room door had been previously broken and then a bad patch job ..... that was the finnal straw!!!! We phoned "Quality Inn on Ketella"!

Summary Heading: Not as close as it seems to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here after booking online. It was reasonable money and was very clean. We looked at maps and consulted the reception staff as to how far away it was from Downtown Disney. You could walk there they told us or get a Disney shuttle from the carpark down the road. Being two healthy people we walked there but it took at least 20 mins. It is fine to walk to D.L. but after a whole day there it is a big hike back. The tram was ok but still a reasonable walk away. No restaurants close by. Service station and downtown D.L. were the nearest places for food. Breakfast was reasonable. good place to stay but beware of the distance you have to walk if you have kids or older people.

We wanted a cheap hotel within walking distance to Disneyland and this hotel certainly fitted the bill. Large clean room on third floor with great view of the nightly fireworks. Staff were friendly and helpful, no problem parking our large car and good to have a fridge and microwave in the room. For the price really can't beat this - don't understand why there are any negative reviews, would highly recommend this hotel if you want somewhere close to the park and very good for the price. Would definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Too much perfume stuff Allergies beware
Summary: The smell in the room was so bad made it so all of us could hardly breathe had to go to walmart to get a room purifier left the window cracked open and we still couldn't breath.  caused my mom asthma attacks, everything that touched the bed or the floor smells so strong three days later that I may have to throw away a down pillow asked to get a better smelling room they didn't have any.  Walking by rooms with open doors they all smelled the same.  If you even have just a little allergies STAY AWAY,  I would not recommend to anyone.  and the continental breakfast was a joke dry donuts and bread no fruit just two kinds of cereal and dried donuts and bread.

This hotel is clean, great location to the convention center and eating places.   It has a reasonable price.     I would recommend that you don't stay on the side of the parking garage next door.  It can get noisy on weekend nights with honking and car alarms.    I also wish they had better cable.  Most super 8's that I have stayed at have over 70 channels.  But this one has maybe 20.   The breakfast is very simple but good.    I would recommend this if you want simplicity, close to convention center and good price.   It is clean.

Summary Heading: It was okay, but wouldn't stay there again.
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland and we were looking for a hotel that was close to Disneyland. We were hoping that this was within walking distance but found out that it would be quite a walk to do so from this hotel. We read reviews that were posted about this hotel and based on what we read we thought it was worth a chance to stay here. We wanted a hotel with a pool and hot tub but were very disappointed with what they had. The hot tub wasn't the cleanest (lots of floaties in it) and the pool wasn't heated, so we found it too cold to be in. The rooms are definately in need of upgrades. We did find the rooms and bedding were clean, however, it bothered us that the bedding had numerous stain spots on them. The beds weren't the most comfortable so we had troubles getting a

Summary Heading: WILL NEVER STAY AT A SUPER 8 EVER AGAIN!
Summary: I don't know what these other reviews are saying, but this has to be the worst hotel I've ever stayed at.  The only other reason we decided to stay here (other than the price) was because of the good reviews.  I agree with the term "you get what you pay for" but our stay was ridiculous!  We checked in a bit later than usual because we went to Disneyland as soon as we arrived in Anaheim. That was no problem. We inquired about a shuttle service to bring us to the airport on the day we were leaving, and the guy at the front desk said he would take care of it and immediately got on the phone to make the reservation. Sounds okay, right?  Here's where it goes downhill.  We open the door to our room and we get whiff of a stuffy odor that smells like the walls were just painted.

Summary Heading: I'll stay here every time I go to Disneyland
Summary: Some friends and I planned a trip to Disneyland, but we didn't have money to spare on a nice hotel. So, we reserved a room at this Super 8. Expecting it to be old and dirty we brought air mattresses and towels, but we ended up not needing them at all!  Pros: - Free Breakfast - Great Price - Clean - Nice front desk people - Free and fast WiFi  Cons: - If there is no vacancy then there isn't enough parking, however the employees are accommodating and try to help with this problem. - If you are walking to Disneyland, then it is quite a walk for little ones

Well I am here right now and what a joke the parking is! Having stayed in this area many times I realize now I should've paid a tiny bit more for the Travelodge a block up so I could have parking! When you pay for a room you should be able to have a parking spot- and one that doesn't require you to move your car in the morning! What's the point in paying for a hotel in walking distance to Disneyland if you have to be bothered with moving your car every morning anyway??  Walls are paper thin. I can literally hear every word of conversation in the room next door and they aren't even loud. Definitely not the place for a couple looking to get away if you know what I mean. Thank goodness we are on the top floor at least! Toilet has a sign saying that toilet paper needs to be thrown

Summary Heading: Great Deal for Overseas Guests doing the Theme Parks
Summary: We were at first uncertain but were glad to have booked and stayed at this Super 8 Motel for 10 Days so that we could get our children to Disneyland and California Adventure. We found it a tremendous benefit that the theme parks were just a 15 minutes' stroll away to the Mickey and Friends Tram Station that everyone boards to get to the Front Gates. The walkway from the Hotel is well lit and we felt safe walking back and forth from the theme parks. This is a good motel for most of us who are from overseas (on a budget) and may not be comfortable renting and driving a car. The staff were most helpful and especially those in the front office/reception. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the curved-rod shower/bath is definitely a positive as the shower curtain is far away from

Summary Heading: great value hotel 10 minutes from myckeys parking structure
Summary: great value near the disneyland resort, 10 minute walk to the mickeys friends parking structure there you get the tram to the parks,,also you have a am pm convinience store, gret hotdogs and cheap snaks and beer very good choice,free fast wifi,large room with mini fridge and microwave,3 big beds,nice shower,very great deal,70 dlls with tax,dont be fool if its looks old, the rooms are great,almost all the hotels near disneyland look old, but the other guys charge 150 bucks.rent a car at  enterprise en the web for 10 dll a day, food inside the parks is very expensive 50 dlls for a large pizza and drinks,trust me the car will pay for itself eat outside and bring snacks and sodas,,,,happy traveling

Summary Heading: Good value and close to Disneyland
Summary: A 15 minute walk to Disneyland, cheap, good value. The room was clean and quiet for sleep. We asked for a room on the top floor facing Disneyland so we could watch the fireworks from the walkway in front of the room. (Ask for 3rd floor and a room number 330 or higher to get the best view). A gas station 50 yards away provided cheap snacks and water. Plenty of other hotels in the vacinity if you want to pay more, but if you only need a hotel for sleeping in - this one works well.
