Super 8 is a 10 minute walk to the Disney Parks. It was comfortable and clean and the staff were very helpful. For the price ( I think we paid $44 a night for a quad room) it was amazing considering this included basic breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and location but parking was BAD!
Summary: Very clean hotel and very close to Disneyland. Parking is really bad late at night. If you're leaving the hotel to Disneyland, mind as well leave your car at the hotel parking lot or else you'll never get a parking at night.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel for a great price
Summary: I will be the first to admit, I was a little hesitant to book here, simply because it is a Super 8.  However, my sister in law told me she had previously stayed here, and enjoyed it, so I booked our rooms for a 3 night stay.  Was definitely pleasantly surprised.  Hotel and rooms were very nice and clean (and I am VERY picky and I check in ALL corners, under beds, etc. to look for anything "funky" or out of place -couldn't find anything!).  Beds were decently comfortable, and I did not have the usual back problems that I typically do when sleeping in hotel beds.  Most of the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Parking at first appears to be difficult, but staff is there to instantly assist you in finding a spot anytime - day or night (we arrive at 2:30am).  Staff was very

Summary Heading: It is older but it is clean and very budget friendly
Summary: Our room was ready right when we arrived at 2:15 PM. The hotel is older and it is small. The rooms are clean and it was comfortable. It is basic but you can't expect more when you pay $50 a night that close to Disneyland. It was a great value for a short Disneyland trip. We came for 3 days to take our 6 year old and 14 year old to the Disney Halloween Party, The walk is long a good 15 minutes to the parking lot tram, but if you are wiliing to walk an extra 5 minutes you can be in downtown Disney and not have to wait for the tram, they fill up fast and you don't always get on one right away. The free breakfast was not much donuts and some cereal, it goes fast. That's not what we came for anyway if I was concerned about a great breakfast I would have stayed elsewhere. There is an

We stayed at this Motel for 8 nights in August/September 2010. I wasn't sure what it would be like for the price but was very pleasantly suprised. The property was very clean, parking wasn't a problem and we didn't have any issues with noise. It was a little further from Disneyland than I had thought but it was within walking distance. The kids loved watching the fireworks from the spa on the nights we weren't at Disneyland. The only negative was that the beds were a bit too firm.  In short yes I would definitely recommend this property as a great value option when staying in Anaheim.

We already stayed at both Super 8 motels in anheim , and by far this one is the best , my family found this motel very clean , very comfortable , and very convienent . This is actually closer to Disneyland than the other Super 8 claims to be , my kids really enjoyed the swimming pool , as my wife and I enjoyed our comfortable accomadations , their was actually a microwave and minature fridge , In our room unlike that other Super 8 motel did not supply ?   Very clean very friendly Very Nice :)
Manager Response: Thanks for your response.  Over the years we have strive to differentiate ourself from the other location since our guests often don't see the difference.  I'm glad to hear that this effort has paid off.  Not only are we at two different locations, we also offer different amenities and continue to improve and upgrade whenever we can.  Thank you.

Summary: we tried to turn on the heater the smoke alarm went off, the second night we stayed they were booked full and did not have enough parking we complained and the next morning someone had let the air out of one of our tires.
Manager Response: I'm sorry this guest had a bad experience.  I believe we have been informed about her comment after she has checked out.  The guest stayed with us sometime in early July.  During the summer guests use AC instead of heater, thus when the guest turned on the heater then the unit will initially smell like burning.  This is normal in any air conditioner unit.  We were not aware of someone let the air out of their vehicle, if we did and did not respond then I apologize.  It is my experience that from time to time there will be occasional pranks and I'm sorry she had such an experience.

Summary: You could not ask for better hotel staff. Front desk was super helpful and always pleasant.  The rooms are clean and well cared for. Expect noise from Disneyland at 9:30 everynight from the fireworks, other than that the rooms are very quiet.  We had neighbors most of the 6 nights we  stayed and never heard anything. Beds are hard but in good shape. Carpets are clean as was the room.  Beware of the fridge, it freezes everything! I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly be a return guest.  Breakfast was provided but donuts every morning was not our thing. Nothing bad to say about this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you.  I'll only focus on the one thing you mentioned that we need to improve:  donuts.  We've come to realize that most of our guests nowadays do not like donuts so we're in the process of selecting more varities.  At the same time we also have to keep our costs in mind because if we have the best breakfast in the area we'll not be able to provide the most competitive rates to our guests.  This is something that we always contemplate and give a lot of thoughts before making the changes.  Thanks for your kind words.

Summary Heading: Outstanding service and super location for Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed 6 nights -- had the top floor which has a great view of the fireworks every night.  We bought a 3 day park hopper pass which gave us plenty of time to see everything and do all of the rides, several times if we wanted to.  We walked from the hotel to downtown disney for dinner on the first day we arrived.  It's a nice easy walk, although it is a busy road.   You can also walk to the shuttle area and this will take you right to the 2 main gates.  It's very fast and efficient -- maybe a 5 minute wait at the most.  We did Disney on day one, then went sightseeing and to the Anaheim Mall the second day (reallly great prices and TONS of little stores).  The third day was back to Disney and then the fourth day we went to Surf City.  We took the public buses there, but it's
Manager Response: Thanks for this guest's kind words.  Again we're aware of the changing guest taste in our breakfast items and will be introducing new selections this Fall.  Hopefully our guests will enjoy their breakfast not because it's just 'free' but rather, it's a good selection and they like it.   Let me also address another concern which I've seen from time to time:  the musky smell.  From my experience as a hotel manager I've experienced this annoyance and addressed it with Housekeeping Manager therefore we always leave the guest room door open after a check out room has been serviced.  I believe now we have to do more to curb this issue.  I'll look into this but thanks for this guest to bring up the concern to my attention.

Summary: This place is a dump!  The only people writing favorable remarks are the owners, families and their friends. Don't say, "I didn't warn you"! The ONLY, ONLY, ONLY positive thing is that it's a good location.
Manager Response: Whenever I see people so upset about their stay here I do take it personally, especially when they feel our property is a 'dump'.  First of all I apologize for the place making the guest feel this way.  There are a lot of lodging choices in Anaheim and for the guest to feel this way is benefitial to neither the property or him/her.  I'd invite the guest to contact myself directly and let me know why exactly went wrong and I'll try my best to clear things up.  Thank You.

Summary: My daughter & I just stayed here & I must admit that I was impressed with the property. We stayed for four days and spent under $200 for the room, which had 2 queen beds, fridge & micro. The room was freshly painted, had granite counters, and was clean with very comfortable beds. The breakfast that was offered was basic, consisting of cereal, doughnuts, coffee, juice, and milk. Parking was tight and we couldn't always park close to the room, but we always got a spot. Coming back to the hotel from Disney was a challenge as you have to go past the hotel and then turn around a few blocks down to get into the parking lot, but once we figured it out it wasn't an issue. The pool was clean and the spa was just what the doctor ordered after a long day at Disney! All in all, for the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  We are currently working on the breakfast update for our guests.  This upcoming fall we also have plans to upgrade our pool/spa facility.

Summary: Like i always say about Vegas.  You don't go there to stay in the room for long periods of time...  It's a good place to sleep and then get back to the park.  The "contenental breakfast" is a joke.  Cereal, bread, milk.   Makes you feel like your in prison, though I think they eat better.  We had two busses take up the entire front area.  That really pissed me off.  Parking in the back has to be arranged with the staff so that they don't tow you away for parking in the two spot area.  Which is always the only parking left after a long day at the park.  Getting into the parking lot is a pain in the ars.  Hope that Anaheim police don't decide to camp out and ticket people for making U turns.  I have stayed here a couple of times in the past and for the money it's ok.  My wife
Manager Response: I'll be frank that parking at our location has never been easy.  Here's why:  When the property was built back in the 70's, it was clearly that the rules and regulations back then did not address the parking issue properly.  Our property has 111 guest rooms but only about 85 spaces.  When we first started managing the property I thought: "which genius designed this place with not enough parking".  Having said that, we dohave to work around this issue as do many Anaheim hotels.  Everyone has their own solution and ours is to assist the guest to stack park whenever we've reached full capacity.  Granted it's not the best solution when it's midnight, you're tired, your kids are tired, your wife's yelling at you...on and on.  But we've worked out this solution over the years and it's the best we can do to accommodate every guest.  Every guest who stacked parked will be given a permit and the front desk staff will make sure we have the car information.  We'll do our best to make sure by the time you're leaving, the car behind you will already have left.  9 out of 10 times this works out smoothly because we have been very diligent in training our front desk staff.  In fact, I can honestly say if our front desk staff did not pass how to assist guest in parking, they're not going to be working here.  Unless we can buy up a piece of land in the back parking lot and turn it into parking this is the best we'll probably be able to do.  I always thank the guest who understand this situation and apologize to those who this has caused inconvenience to.  Same situation goes with bus parking.  We have a way to resolve it, it's just that not everyone's going to like it and I understand that completely.

Summary Heading: To close to main rd to expensive, try orange count Radisson.
Summary: Yes very close to disneyland accross rd but still takes a klm to get to gate very busy rd every day. Expensive. Try Radisson Inn and Suites Beuna Park Orange County. Fantastic.
Manager Response: I'm sorry the location is not close enough.  The route we adivse the guest to walk is the shortest distance we can map out.

Summary Heading: Great staff service... Above and beyond.
Summary: We stayed at the Super 8 last Oct and had a wonderfull experience there. When we arrived we were quite anxious as we bought disneyland tix off ebay which were meant to be there for us, it soon appeared that we were scammed, but the staff there were awesome, letting us use their personal computers, telephones etc.. for us to get in contact with the seller. It turned out he had got many people from this scam, but u love and learn. The location is good, only a short 10 min walk to Disneyland. Would stay there again, well priced too.
Super 8 Motel was a very good place to stay. It was very affordable, and it was in walking distance to DisneyLand.  They offered continental breakfast, laundry facilities, jacuzzi/pool.

Summary Heading: Splurge if you have little kids
Summary: This place is a basic, no frills kinda motel at a decent price (paid USD70) that is within walking distance from Disneyland. A very basic breakfast is provided for the rate and there is a swimming pool in the compound - out front, near the entrance to the hotel. We arrive at around 10-11pm (side note: Disneyland fireworks were going off while we were still driving about a few miles from the resort and we could see it  - its beautiful and awesome!) and got the room on the 3rd floor (highest floor). The room had a musty weird smell and we have to leave the door open for an hour for the smell to go away. The walk to Disneyland in the morning is not the easiest. I won't recommend it for families with young children in strollers or with babies as you have to cross quite a major road
I was nervous after reading the review people have given the Super 8. it was excellent. the staff was quick to assist and it was within walking distance of Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for budget travelers - Excellent location!
Summary: This hotel was in a perfect place to visit Disney; the room was very spacious but quite warm and stuffy. The air-conditioner solved that problem but I know some people can‚Äôt sleep with these things running all night. It was about a 15min walk to the Disneyland entrance in pretty much a straight-line which will save you around $15 parking per day. The hotel was clean and seemed well managed and breakfast was good for a super8. I would definitely stay here again if I came back to visit Disney as the price is just unbeatable.

We where scared after reading reviews on this hotel ,but it was GREAT! We stayed here for a Cheer Comp. probley 50 of us, and we usally stay at 4 star Hotels , I read the reviews and this Hotel was great you guys! The rooms BIG with a fridg, and microwave, coffee maker, close enough to Disney you can walk, Great pool and hot tub! Great Staff there is a am/pm on the corner 3 min walk that has everything.....free parking at Hotel, nice little big breakfast area table , chairs..... we would stay here again ...no problems at all.... and no one from our group of 50 was disappionted either! WE ALL GIVE IT  thumbs up!!!!!!

Summary Heading: I became very ill from the fumes
Summary: We stayed here for a week.  We reserved two rooms.We arrived on Thursday February 19,2009.  When we checked in we were informed there was no working water but it would be repaired in a couple of hours .   This was at 10:00 am and at 6:00pm there was still no water, therefore we could not shower, wash hands, use the bathroom.  We went to the front desk and talked to the front desk manager who was extremely rude.  He said we should have gone to another motel when we were told there was no water and now there was NO refund for the rest of the week if we choose to leave. The room I was assigned and a terrible sour smell as well as the smell of paint.  The workers were hammering until late at night and started again early in the morning.  If I needed a nap or the children needed a

"It's so bad, it's funny."  That was my daughter's initial take on room 314 at the Super 8 Motel on Disneyland Drive.  We usually stay at the Hampton Inn Anaheim, and this place, my friend, is no Hampton Inn Anaheim.  I took great pains in researching cheap Disneyland area hotels on Trip Advisor, and the one recurring complaint about this Super 8 was the 'chemical' smell in the rooms.  I can confirm that complaint.  What is that smell?!?  It's like they just gassed the Kurds before we showed up.  OK, besides the smell, this place really isnt that bad.  It's what you'd expect for around $50/night.  One note of curiosity for Room 314.  There are no irons in the room, yet no less than 6 feet from the door is an iron burn in the carpet.  Some idiot must have brought one, and then

Summary Heading: what you pay for is what you get...
Summary: This is nothing special - not a very pleasant place to stay. However, it is located very well, if yoy want to go to Disneyland, and we got a very good rate. So if you are looking for a budget option close to Disneyland, this is a good offer.

My husband and I stayed three nights at this motel on our honeymoon, in 2 different rooms. Overall it was a pretty pleasant stay, and their complimentary breakfast was quite good, especially if you like donuts!     It was definitely in a good location and the noise level was relatively low....however, if you are on the lower level...be prepared to hear many doors slamming.      My only issue was the smell of the cleaners, or something like that, in the rooms, so I would recommend bringing a candle to help diminish the scent.

Stayed here end Oct 08. Scheduled to arrive late evening, so we sent an email informing them beforehand. Reply was very prompt. First impression on arrival was good. Friendly staff. Clean premises as well as clean rooms. Room size was big with extra space for 2 luggages. Check in was as per the website description.   Room had some kind of smell after housekeeping which we suspect was because of cleaning chemicals. Otherwise no complaints. They do a good job.   Didn't try out the included breakfast but the area looks adequate in size.   Location is good with Disneyland nearby(walking distance to Disney tram stop). Fireworks display can be seen form here. Everything about the location is also as per the website. Otherwise a car is needed for everything else. Plenty of food and

Summary Heading: Great Value- Very Clean & Friendly Staff!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel from October 13th to the 18th.  The hotel was absolutely spotless and the staff were GREAT! Anything we needed they were very quick to help with and even went over and beyond in securing our shuttle van back to the airport for us. We did have a small drainage problem with our shower and when we reported this to the front desk it was immediately solved. The bed was very comfortable. We did have very noisy neighbours- but this is not the hotels problem. As far as the breakfast goes- it is free so you can't complain. There is donuts, toast and two choices of cereal- frosted flakes and fruit loops. We found that the breakfast kept us full enough to make it to lunch time at the park.  The stuff at the breakfast was filled up constantly and if you needed

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfy, and Worth the Price
Summary: From the very first the hotel staff was excellent.  When we were checking in they were friendly and VERY helpful! Our room was right on the ground floor, walking in we noticed it was super clean, just like some of the pictures show, even the corners were SPOTLESS! We thought that we were in for a loud night from the traffic having our window RIGHT on Disneyland drive.  Not only could we not hear the traffic, the curtains kept out the light too. The beds were comfortable and very clean, I actually thought it was more comfortable than my own bed at home! The fridge and the micro were super handy, as well as the AM PM Gas station right down the street (5 min walk) if you need some soda, sandwiches, etc.  The vending machines were fairly well stocked with Asprins, snacks, sodas,

We stayed at the Super 8 on Disneyland Drive from Aug 20 to Aug 31 2008.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We needed to use the internet and their internet cord was broken.  When we asked they had it fixed within a couple of hours and contacted us to let us know it was ready.  They accomodated all of our requests and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job.  Our room was clean as was the pool area and breakfast room.  We would stay there again for sure,  especially with the value that it offers.  The continental breakfast leaves something to be desired, as it is only toast, cereal and day old donuts, but other than that, we have no complaints.

Summary Heading: Awful. Smelly, Wet, Sticky Floors. Chemical Stench. Inconvenient. Scary area.
Summary: AVOID!  When we got there, the room was so smelly that it was utterly disgusting.  The carpets (the ENTIRE FLOOR) were soaking wet with chemicals and water. They obviously just throw down some solution by the bucket load and use a shop vac to try to get most of the liquid up. It didn't work.  The room felt muggy, sweaty, and smelled like a dirty dog the entire time we were there.   The bathroom was also utterly disgusting. Dirt around toilet. Shower was gross.  The A/C worked, sort of. But no matter how cool it got in the room, the stench was so stifling that nothing could fix the atmosphere. It was always there, which was quite depressing and distracting.  Now for the walk... they say "conveniently located 10 minutes from the main gate". NOT TRUE. It's a 15-minute walk to the

This motel is close to Disneyland, but you will want to have a rental car.  It would not be an easy walk with little ones late at night.  This is a cheap motel and you get what you pay for.  A very basic room/pool area.  The pool area is in the parking lot, so it's not a nice setting.  It is also quite small.  The breakfast is complimentary and adequate.  Cereal, donuts, breads, juice, coffee.  This motel will do the trick if you are just looking for a place to crash after visiting the theme parks.  Don't expect anything special and look for online discounts.

Summary Heading: Value Matches the Cost ... Reasonable Stay Overall
Summary: We booked two adjoining rooms for an a 7-night stay through an online site and obtained each room for less than $60 a night (before taxes).  The value we received matched the cost.  The rooms (on the second story) were clean, spacious and comfortable, the refrigerator worked, the microwave (although small) worked, linens and beds and carpets were clean, the AC/Heater worked very well, the pool (albeit small) was clean, well-lighted and well-kept, and the maid service and staff were very good.  The property is located near enough to Disneyland to  to easily walk to the Mickey and Friends Tram within 10-15 minutes, and also to view the nightly fireworks without much walking effort.  Also, although Disneyland Drive - on which the hotel is located - is divided by a high wall

Our family of 5 stayed here in April and were content with our room. We thought the towels were very thin and they just kept giving us 3 bath towels, so that was a little irritating. The microwave is so small - couldn't properly pop our popcorn, no coffee pot either.   You have to be fast for the continental breakfast. Seemed like when the food was put out, everyone would take it so quickly. The food was not the greatest, but can't complain since their hotel price is so low.  We did walk to Disneyland, but seemed like we were the only ones doing it! It didn't take us that long - about 10 minutes with our 3 kids. It was nice in the morning, except you are close to a busy highway. One night (at 8 pm) we drove to the parking lot which is near and - we didn't get charged for parking

I was having such a hard time choosing a hotel after reading so many negative reviews and finally decided to just "Go for it".  I was pleasantly surprised when we checked in.  The room was spacious and we actually got a handicapped room, which we didn't need,but it was fine.  The Continental Breakfast left a little to be desired.  It was toast, cold cereal, donuts, milk & juice and coffee.  Thought they could at least have some fruit (this is CALIFORNIA) or something.  It is a little hard to get to due to a big barrier down the middle of the road, so you have to go past it going one direction and do a U-turn, but it is very close to Disneyland.  I wouldn't walk-it because you already walk so much at Disneyland, but if you're a glutton for punishment go for it.  Staff was very

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We stayed at the Super 8 for three nights in October 2007.  For less than $60 / night what right have I to complain?  Besides, you don't go to Anaheim to hang out at your hotel, right?  Having said that, the Super 8 Disneyland Drive is old and tired.  Our room smelt a little funny, was quite loud (next to a busy street), and a little depressing.  The coin laundry is in a dark little corner that's half outside, allowing one of Mickey's rodent relatives to come visit me as I switched a load.  Now for the positives.  Less than $60 / night for starters.  The location is good, within walking distance of Disneyland, and the staff were friendly and helpful.  Although we didn't use it, the pool looked small but nice.  Would I stay here again? Maybe, but I wouldn't be excited about it.

Summary Heading: Best hotel service I have ever received
Summary: I would say this was the best hotel I've ever stayed in. I have traveled a lot and I found the best service in this hotel. The rooms were very clean and big. We stayed there for 2 days and the room was cleaned each day. There was absolutely no problem with the maintenance. The breakfast was good. Walking to Disneyland was not a problem because we were 3 adults. We walked to Disney tram station which is like half to quarter mile away. There is a gas station with an am/pm store that was very helpful to buy little necessities.  The front desk person was very helpful in letting us know about the hotel food delivery services nearby. The room delivery was very helpful after a long tired day at Disney.  I really thank one of the front desk person Mr.Erwin for helping me in getting a

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland for 3 days. The room were not very clean and they had a real bad smell. The bathroom wasn't clean and we had to call maintenance when we arrived to fix a light above the sink. We ended up removing the bedding and using our sleeping bags. The air-conditioning unit was hard to operate since the plastic knobs were stripped. Overall it wasn't a good experience especially considering how expensive it is.   My suggestion is to stay outside of the Disneyland area and save lots of money. Parking at Disneyland is much cheaper than the "premium" you pay for staying close.

We always stay at this Super 8. The last stay wasn't as good as always, we stayed in an old smoking room so the carpet was yucky. Next time I will stay in the rooms where we normally stay. But we have never had any problems with reservations/payment. Rooms were always ready and clean. It is an older motel, as most are in that area, but well maintained. The owner is there a lot and very nice. Decent continental breakfast and front desk crew is pretty nice. All and all, good place to stay. Close to the park and the parking garage!

The location is good. OK to walk to Disneyland if NO children are in your party. We drove to the theme park parking lot. The room was spacious enough for our party (three adults and a 9 and 2 year old children). Coffee was available late at night and early in the morning. Although it was kind of cold for the swimming pool we saw people enjoying the Jacuzzi. The room was spotless, the small refrigerator and microwave were very helpful.. After a long day in the theme park the kids were too tired to take them to a place to eat so, we headed to places with food to go. We drove around town and found a Pollo Loco restaurant with delicious chicken in the corner of Ball and Euclid. The pizza place on Harbor and Katella was also delicious. Again, it was nice to have the fridge and

Summary Heading: Okay for what you pay for
Summary: We showed up after nine hours of driving and we had a fast check in so we were pleased at how easy it was without reservations and the price was pretty low at the time.  The spa and pool were very nice after a long day at Disneyland and the walk to the tram wasn't bad at all.  The sheets weren't very clean but we brought our own so we were fine with it.  The water wasn't very hot, but there seemed to be plenty of it.  The staff was very helpful and generous when we needed assistance.    We pretty much got what we paid for.

Summary Heading: We will stay here again! Not a bad experience.
Summary: We drove to Disneyland from Washington State in August of 2004. Staying at the Super 8 was affordable and accomidated us very well. We had a basic room on the second floor and experienced no problems with cleanliness or bugs. We thought that the continental breakfast was basic, but better than nothing! Just providing 'somthing' in the morning is better than providing nothing at all, like a lot of other hotels.    The transportation to Disneyland was close, fast, cheap and convenient. (boarding a trolly at the corner by the mini mart) It was clean and ran every few minutes back and forth from the hotels nearby to Disneyland.  The staff did seem unhappy and irratated at times, but we will definatly stay here when we go to Disneyland again.

Summary Heading: A great basic place to stay
Summary: We just had a great stay here. We are a family of 4 looking for a cheap clean hotel that was close to Disney. The staff were friendly. the rooms were clean. Furnishings were nothing special. The microwave and fridge worked great. Breakfast is very basic as well. It seemed noisy at first but it really quieted down afer 10. We requested a newly refurbished room. We are all in good shape so the 15 minute walk was not a stretch for us to disney. Parking is out of site of the room but it is monitored, I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a no frills clean, safe place to stay.

We checked in at 2AM after a 6 hour drive.  Check-in was easy.  We found parking on the other side of the building, but it resulted in us being blocked in by their unique double-parking system.  Either way, we hiked across the parking lot and up some stairs to room 305 on the third floor.  We didn't take the elevator because it was scary looking, although the stairs were rickety.  One bed had six long black hairs in it and on the pillowcases, so we slept in the other bed because it seemed cleaner and we were too tired to complain.  The floor was dirty, and there were shells from sunflower seeds under the bed.    We were awakened at 6:45 AM by an alarm clock we never set.  It blared Spanish language radio very very loudly.  The toilet was wrapped with something that said

gave me wrong room. room has strong mildew. front desk was rude while I was checking in and was rude to international travelers all while I was experiencing my bad experience! I would have cancelled on the spot, but they would keep my money! television had terrible reception too!

Read all the comments before we went but was pleasantly surprised. Location wise could not have been better, only a short walk 10 minutes to the tram which put us out at the entrance to Disneyland at no cost. The room was clean and suited our purposes as we were out every day. Breakfast did have cereal and toast beside the doughnuts with juice and coffee. Found the staff pleasant and helpful. Public phone was right outside our room and a service station only 3 minutes away which sold food, water and chemist supplies with an ATM. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again. I forgot, we could see the fireworks every night from our room quite easily.

Honestly, the stay wasn't that bad. But the sheets were not clean, that much was evident. When I woke up the next morning, I found a coupon for a pack of cigarrettes in the sheets. And I don't smoke. I was completely disgusted, knowing full well that the coupon had been there since the last customer stayed the night. Ick.

We just got back from our trip and this was a nice super 8.  Clean, relatively quiet and extremely close to disney.  When you are leaving disney a little hard to get into the parking lot.  Staff was nice helpful with directions and places to eat.  We would definately stay here again

My Boyfriend And I travelled to Disneyland in August 22/05.  We were planning our trip on a budget and decided to stay at this Super 8.  We arrived at our hotel, checked in and entered our room to find our TV remote didnt even work.  We asked for someone to come and fix it, and they sent someone who didnt even speak english.  Needless to say it did not get fixed. Not to long after the maintanence person left we noticed about 6-7 large bugs throughout our room.  At that point I knew I didnt want to stay there.  We went back to the front desk and confronted them with our problem and they acted like it was no big deal and that we shouldnt care that we were staying in a bug infested room.  We managed to get a room on the second floor for that night and we checked out ASAP the next

We stayed there for 12 Nights Staff were very nice and friendly (including house maids) rooms were always CLEAN  The only problem I had was the hot water!!!!! but they were onto that as soon as I told them I couldnt get cold water. It was Very very cheap my family (Party of 8) will definatly go Back. I only have one tip for the motel .... Change your breakfast menu ..donuts are toooo Fattening

We were hesitant to stay in a motel on our recent trip to Los Angeles to visit Disneyland. We were accompanied by friends from Argentina and since it was their first trip to our country we wanted to make sure they had a great Disneyland experience.  The last thing we wanted was for them to have a bad experience with lodging. The Super 8 motel exceeded our expectations. It was exceptionally clean and well maintained. As you can see from the pictures, the pool was crystal clear and I could not find any evidence of poor housekeeping anywhere.  Although we were overlooking the on-ramp to the freeway, it was very quiet and we had no trouble sleeping.  The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked almost too well!  The breakfast provided was adequate if you like cereals,
Okay for the price but a three  block walk for the shuttle to Disney. Rude staff and old rooms. There are better places to stay nearby.

Read a couple of other reviewers, decided to give it a try.  The place is fine, price is reasonable.  The best part is it's really close to Disneyland, you can just walk through the parking lot and catch the tram.  Saved us the cost of parking.  The staff were nice and since I'm on the road with my laptop, it's got a little laptop station where i can connect to check my e-mails, that's really useful, and it's FREE.  Would stay here again, the best time to visit is during winter break when the price is low and not that many guests are visitng the area.

Summary Heading: Would stay again with conditions improved
Summary: Well, this is a pretty budget place so you can't expect too much. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean...pleasant enough decor and the staff although not too fluent in English were always polite and were always busy cleaning something on the grounds. There were some mis-givings though, and here they are in no particular order...the telephone didn't work....you could hear people but they couldn't hear you. The staff replaced the handset which solved the problem although the cord was crackly. The remote control was cracked along the bottom and only worked when you squeezed it a certain way..the staff never did replace that which was annoying...probably no spares. The TV when turned on would come on at FULL volume which I have seen before in other hotels but it's pretty

Summary Heading: Awful stay, low price, lower service.
Summary: Not that Super 8 is a high quality chain, but this is the worst of those motels I have been. Dirty rugs, poor service, old matresses and the worst: they advertise for free breakfast, but the doughnuts might be remains from some other place and maybe three days old. Bad coffee. Definitively, not coming back.

Summary Heading: Don't get deceived by the low rate. Worst place to stay around disney.
Summary: -Worst service -No hot water -Parking Shortage -Calim they have HBO, CNN. Never plays on TV though. -No bath towels in the room -No iron, no hair dryer -Be really careful about the bill. They give you one rate but charge you with another. -no elevator access to the rooms on the far side. -Not even a courtsey shuttle to disney.  -No coffeemaker in the room.  Don't get deceived by the rate. Pay 20 bucks extra but never stay at this hotel.
